review_body: I had a great stay at Wake up, the room and the bathrooms were very clean. The reception staff were helpful when I needed help with anything. A very special shoutout to Jordy and Nicole the promoters aswell. As a solo backpacker I was quite nervous with meeting new people but they came to the room and managed to convince me to come down for the free pizza. When I was down they constantly came to talk and see how I was doing and they introduced me to some people who i now consider great frineds! Only bad thing I could say is you could hear the music from the rooms but they offer free ear plugs and eye masks so it cancels it out. Would deffo recommend
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very nice place, clean and well stocked! the staff is very kind and organizes events for guests, they also offer discounts! I also met many nice people. highly recommended.Posto pulito, personale gentile! Lo raccomando
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a brilliant stay at wake up, very clean and sociable hostel for solo travel. I met new friends at the evening activities - thanks to rebecca and nicole for being so energetic and friendly and I'll definitely stay here next time in Sydney!
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice clean hostel, amazing reps and really good food and can’t thank the rep Rebecca can’t thank her enough for making my stay amazing, gets you in interacting with everyone and help you make new friends thankyou Rebecca!
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a nice stay at this hostel, its a very clean and welcoming place.The staff is cool and friendly, the daily events are fun. Special thanks to Clara who brightened my day despite the bad weather.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came here 2 weeks ago. My plans were to stay until i was ready to do the East Coast tour. Wake up is a great hostel, good service, friendly staff (especially Maartje;). Lots of social people but also great if you want to be on your own. Its cheap for what you get, also great high speed wifi. Realy recommend to stay here!
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Where do I start? Thus hostel is the best I have ever stayed at. I stayed for a long time in this hostel and I was never bored. They host great events every night where you can meet a lot of people. Had some fun nights there. Another plus is the location. It's central so you can walk everywhere.A big shoutout to Amy and Sophie for motivating me to go out. And to cédric who always greets you with a smile at the door. And a huge thank you too Maartje and Liam at the reception for always making me feel welcome!!
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best bakpacker house ever, i never expect it to be so clean, organise and well equipped, we are so satisfied with our stay. Roys cafe serve awesome coffee and food! They even have complimentary daily activities, check on their website for more updates.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wake Up is a great hostel. It’s clean with a perfect central location. There’s so many bonuses to staying here compared to most hostels and the price per room justifies this. Side bar downstairs always has events going on such as free pizza and $1000 bar tab on a Wednesday just for wake up guests. So what you pay in extra rent compared to other hostels you probably make up from the free dinner/alcohol. There are many reception staff, all of who have been incredibly friendly and accommodating to my man requests. Also, the friendly evening staff who run the activities such as beer pong and the pub crawl are lot of fun and know everyone so are always introducing people to eachother. A great place to make life long friends.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I went to Sidney to spend a week and I ended up staying two because of Alba. Not only she was very helpful with plans and directions but she also made sure that my stay was perfect at every time. She always had a smile in her face and even organized some plans with some of us staying there, Make sure you talk to her in your stay, she is the cute spanish girl by reception, you will instantly recognize her.The facilites of the hostel are nice, with a great social are downstairs. The rooms are big and clean and the location is right by the center, also very convenient for travellers.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Wake up for a month and I had an amazing stay. The facilities were always clean and tidy and the staff was super friendly! The location was also a big bonus since you’re right in the CBD so you can walk anywhere. There was always something going on to have fun and meet other travelers, but also the peace and quiet to relax and get a good nights rest. Special shout out to Cedric, Sophie and Amy for making everyone feel welcome and for always spreading good vibes to ensure you never get bored ! Overall great stay and will definitely come here again when I’m in Sydney again
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay at Wake Up overall. It’s incredibly clean, even the bathrooms and it’s great for solo travellers. The first night I arrived I took part in the Pub Crawl and the girls who ran it (Wilma Sophie and Amy) introduced me to a few people and now I’m travelling with one of those friends! Will definitely be staying again in the summer.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want somewhere to make friends and socialise this is the best hostel ever! There's activities on every morning and night and they're pretty much all free. Beds are comfy and the whole place is so clean and a SUPER big shout out to the promo girls Sophie, Amy & Wilma - they really made my stay and got me so involved and were so genuine they'd stop and chat with you any time of day.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed my stay. The rooms were quite spacious and really tidy. The rooms got cleaned everyday and the bins emptied. The hostel was super social and I've met awesome people here. Three girls from the staff came around on the floor every evening to tell whats going on in the bar downstairs. Special thanks to amy who was super friendly and motivating
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great space for all your stuff in the rooms and cleaned daily. if you've just moved to city this is place to start, a girl called amy made alot of effort to get us out for events ran by the hostel, thanks to this we've met some awesome people and had so great nights out! THANKYOU SO MUCH!!
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wake Up is the best hostel in Sydney !!! Good localisation (central Station) ! Rooms, kitchen, bathroom, everything is clean ! Very nice atmosphere and caring staff :)A nice bar and a nice cafe downstairs. I spent few days with pleasure !!!
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in the hostel for a month and the staff was always helpful and kind! Especially Cedric, the french guy who checks the door at night! every night it monitors the security of the entrances to the hostel!
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for three nights; wish I'd had the time to stay longer. The room was clean and the location quite convenient.All the staff were very helpful and friendly. An extra shout out to Tess and Angelica, who did a great job leading the Bondi beach tour!
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hostel with clean and tidy rooms. I visited them with some other friends and we had a private room, which was great. Our room was clean, what is very important. The service from the staff was great, very hospitable. Shout out to the lovely Carlijn, Tyrza and Meehna who made our stay perfect, thanks for that!! Would really recommend the hostel.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at wake up for the month of April, constantly extending because it was too good to leave! Everything is clean and all staff are so friendly. Big shout out to the promo girls, especially Sophie who always went out of her way to get me involved and socialise!! Also Tess was so helpful with places to go and things to do, definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First arrived at wake up the beginning of April for 10 nights and loved every second of it. Loved it that much I returned for another 6 nights at the end of the month. Nothing bad to say about the hostel at all. Special mention to Sophie who does promo for dragging (not literally) everyone out their rooms for some fun. Cedric on the door - my favourite person to see and chat to after a night out, always happy! And lovely Meehna at reception for just being a little gem (and VERY helpful.) Thank you for making it a blast x
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything a hostel should be. Clean, affordable, sociable, fun, close to almost everything, and right across from the main train station. Daily group activities which make it easy to meet others. Staff is a big part of why I stayed for over a month. Cedric took the time to tell me non touristy things to do and places to go escape the crowds. Sofie and Wilma led us on a few fun nights out. Laura, Alba, Mena, and Ana were always beyond helpful at the front.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are someone, who wants to go out at night almost every day, this hostel is great. They offer many activities. If you get the right times without too much people around, the kitchen and bathroom are also very good. When you don't want to go out at night, then you can chill out at the 1st floor next to the kitchen.All in all a good hostel.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a nice stay to the wake up, the rooms are clean, there is a big kitchen, activities of the hostel are nice, very good vibe and atmosphere! The staff is always smiling, searching to make you enjoy your stay, like so much the guy from the security Cédric, always nice to have a talk with him!
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice, clean, friendly hostel with a lot going on. Staff are friendly and the promo team Amy, Wilma and Sophie always keep us up to date with the evening activities so if you’re a solo traveller you’ll never be alone!
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent over a month in wake up and couldn’t rate it more! Big shout out to the promo girls Amy, Sophie and Wilma for making every night a big deal and always making people feel welcome! Super clean and all staff were so friendly.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in wakeup for 2 weeks in April. Highly recommend the hostel, great activities and really helpful staff especially the kitchen staff Caroline and sina who were always there to help. Will stay here again.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean, daily organized events, skilled staff, and people from everywhere.I stayed there for 2 weeks and never got bored. Plus you have 50% discount to go to the gym. By the way, Cedric Folly, don't skip legday!
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'd been in lot of hostel during my travel in Australia and wakeup is the best hostel I could stay. Every part of the hostel is clean, quiet when you needed and you can make party when you want with side Bar just behind wake up. I met most of my Australian friends here thanks the staff who is very friendly. A special mention for Sammy who is the best, I could have lot of fun thanks to him !
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: WakeUp was a great first hostel for me to stay at, with friendly staff that made my first week in Sydney a delight. In particular, Sammy was always happy to help with a smile on his face. Will definitely be staying there again when I return to Sydney!!
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Been here 3 months now , all staff are amazing and rooms are clean. Bathrooms get cleaned twice a day. Was in the room today and a nice guy called Sammy came in and cleaned out the air con. Lots of good activities on in the evenings, so you never feel left out if traveling solo.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The atmosphere is great and the staff is always friendly and helpful. Especially Lena was very nice. If you’re looking for a clean party hostel you should go wake up!I had a great time and I would definitely come back.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my mates stayed here a couple of days over Easter and it was absolutely amazing. Meehna In paticular made sure we enjoyed our stay and we have indeed! Wake Up, we will be back for sure. Thanks Meehna for everything!
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister and I spent 4 nights in Wake Up and couldn’t have experienced a better time. Alba was the friendliest and most helpful staff member I have ever met. She made our trip so much more enjoyable and can’t thank her enough. The rooms were also very clean and pretty big. Best hostel I ever stayed at and would recommend it to anyone.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean and organised hostel. Nice big rooms and bathrooms with hairdryers in. Great location right opposite the train station and coach station. Only minus is the ridiculously tight security, as two young girls trying to get back into the hostel at around midnight with one key between us we got questioned a lot and got a very cold reception for not bringing two keys out. Definitely go to side bar next door!
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at the wake up hostel is super friendly and even though they chat with lots of people and come across as really welcoming and friendly people they’re still focused on their work. They seem like a good fit for the hostel and their guests as they appear as helping, welcoming, fun and outgoing people.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were pleased with our stay overall. We had a private en suite room which was spacious, clean and comfortable. The room was cool and well air conditioned. Towels and basic toiletries were available in the room. I sleep with ear plugs and was not disturbed by noise. The walls are quite thin however and my partner was woken up by noise from the bar on the ground floor. Bring ear plugs and you will not have a problem. We loved the location of the hostel, right by the station and in walking distance of great bars and restaurants. 24 hour reception service was also helpful as we needed to check out at 4.30am.It was a good hostel experience overall with no complaints.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hostel and top located!Close to all sights, supermarkets, trainstation and shopping centers. Definitely coming back :-)Comfy beds and everything is clean! Thanks for the stay and the great service.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: please let the world know about why that hostel is the best in sydneyafter staying for 3 weeks i had the feeling to be at home, why? there was not only the clean environment what made me feel good about that place but also the staff members were super friendly and would probably do anything if you ask nicelyspecial thanks to josh and the black guy who opened the kitchen at 5 am for me every dayspecial thank you so much to lena and tyrza who helped me with emergencies such as giving ear plugs, turning on the air conditioner, changing rooms for me and friends they will just help u with literally ANYTHING all in all together its a 5 out of 5 i loved itvery soon i will come back and id be happy if wake up keeps being the same lovely regards cuong
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean rooms/bathrooms. Great cafe and bar/restaurant, quality food very reasonably priced. Excellent extras like free coffee and drink vouchers. Quality of service from all staff was 5 star, even when I rolled in the door at 5.30am! Very happy with upgrade to private room, was a big bonus after a long train trip. Location also great for the weary traveller. I will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I like this hostel very much. This hostel has good location, clean, friendly staff, lots of activities and comfortable bed. I will definitely come to this hostel again if I travel Sydney in the future. Staffs are very nice and kind to explains very details and trips recommendations.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing tour with Tess Guide even if it was raining !!!She was full of bean and took lot of pictures for us. I highly recommend!We finish our trip at Bavarian bar to share a beer!!!!!!!!! Thank you tess
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Attended the bar crawl. Met jess and Lara who were so friendly and made the night a great one for me and my mates. 10/10 would recommend!! Rooms are nice and clean and so are the bathrooms. Chill vibe and lots of people that are up for a good time.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came down to Sydney from Phoenix, AZ for Mardi Gras weekend and had a very positive first-time hostel experience at Wake Up! Sydney. I really like how my room had a locker that was big enough to fit my rollerboard and backpack. It gave me a piece of mind knowing that my stuff was locked away while I was out exploring the city. The men's bathroom was clean and the showers were very spacious. The water got hot enough where I could shave my beard. Beds were comfy and I was able to sleep (luckily because no one in my room snored) and I did not think it was too hot to sleep at night. Special shoutout to Alba at the front desk for leading the city tour guide on Thursday AM. She took us to some really cool spots like the botanic gardens and Darling Harbor. I like how she took us to a food court for lunch that gave a discount for Wake Up! guests. I think it was 8.50 AUD for any sandwich and a drink. I had the chicken snitzel and it was so good. Also, thank you Alba for checking me out and giving me a coupon for a free cup of coffee at the cafe since I had an early AM flight back to LAX. I would def. come again. Love the night club in the basement and how the hostel is right near the central station. The entire staff was very kind and helpful. I also like how the hostel had a lot of freebies and events to mingle with other backpackers every day of the week. Wi-Fi could be faster. -Walter
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel was super easy to find, just outside of the central station a very short walk! The location is also great for getting anywhere in Sydney (walking distance) there was good wifi all throughout the hostel reaching the rooms. Daily house keeping also came to empty bins and give the rooms a quick clean which was great. They always had some plans organised in the evenings such as wine and cheese nights, pizza nights and also organised events in the side bar such as silent discos etc so there was always something to do and great opportunities to meet people. The rooms were nice and big, quiet at night, lockers were a bit of an odd shape but still big enough for most important things. The kitchen also had lots of utensils and equipment for cooking (would recommend just giving them a rinse before use as some people didnt wash up properly) and plenty of fridges for food. The bathrooms were clean although the sinks were a bit loose. Good strong shower which i loved. There was also a laundry room with a dryer which was useful (one machine was broken but the cycles dont take long) lift was a bit slow but stairs also available. Had the most wonderful time in this hostel, staff were friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend!! Thank you Wake up!! :))
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying in Wake up was really nice ! Staff members (especially Harry and Nicolas) were really nice and helpful ! The hostel is clean and has a lot of activities, definitely recommend it :) I stayed there more than 2 weeks
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed two nights in a double room. Long way to the bathrooms and showers, but rooms were ok. Very basic but clean. Very party atmosphere, that were not really our thing, but with ear plugs it was all good.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel is in a great location couple of mins from train station and 10-15 min walk to Darling harbour and shops. I stayed in private dorm which wasn't cheap but guaranteed a good night's sleep! Staff are super friendly and daily activities are good, particularly the walking tour. The only downside is breakfast isn't included so factor this in to your budget. Ideal for solo visitor as very easy to make friends and hostel is very safe and secure.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, social and fun. The hostel is really cleaned with bathrooms been cleaned 3 times a day. The staff are so great, from reception, to travel desk to the activities staff. There is so much on every day at the hostel it makes it so easy to make friends if you are travelling solo. Shout out to Alba who gives the best city and beach walk tours. The hostel is in a great location with access to everything. You get so much more for your money at this hostel, it's definitely worth the extra few quid compare to others. Would stay again
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just needed an overnight stay near Central Station. My room was quiet, clean and comfortable. Highly recommended! Dinner in the resturant was good, the kitchen is well equiped if you want to cook your own meals.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good atmosphere, good facilities, great bar and great staff (especially Alba, who is extremely nice, helpful, and runs great tours!)Normally guests are younger 18-21, so maybe not the best place if you're older and prefer to meet people your age.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Definitely aimed at 18-20 year olds on their first trip away, but an extremely fun hostel if you’re looking to party. I met some lovely people, had an issue with somebody sleeping in my bed one night but the man at reception was very friendly and sorted it straight away. I had a room on the first floor which was very noisy so not ideal if you’re looking to have an early night - the music can be heard until around 3am. Alba was great, she made an effort to learn my name and provided great service throughout my stay. Sometimes, staff at reception were slow with no apology given, but I understand that there’s a lot of people staying here so to be expected I suppose. The pub crawl on a Sunday was my favourite activity. Although the bars we were taken to were not great, it was good value for money with 3 drinks for $10. A good way to meet people. I would stay again.
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Wake up as my first hostel from getting off the plane and was extremely surprised as to how clean and tidy it was!The staff at check in were very friendly and it is a 24hr reception which always helps.I stayed in an 8 man mixed dorm and it was spacious with decent sized lockers to secure pretty much all your belongings if you wish.The bathroom and toilet facilities were shared but these were in fantastic condition and cleaned regularly.There was also an on-site club (in the basement) which was great to meet people with the daily activities. Despite reading reviews beforehand of excessive noise coming from the club at nights, I was staying on the 3rd floor and didn’t hear a single bass or song so no complaints there.My only negative was the size of the kitchen which services the whole hostel! It often got extremely busy and you end up waiting around to cook for ages if you get there at the wrong time. It was clean though!Overall, it was a great first hostel, well kept and worth while for the slightly dearer price! Also a great city centre location (Right next to the main train station)
hotelName:
4    Wake Up! Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just for a one night stay at the start of our Australia trip this worked out fine. Modernized room in an old building, good bed and bathroom, friendly staff. Booking via the internet was no problem at all. Recommended.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I only chose the hotel at the last minute due to its proximity to where I needed to be. And I’m glad i did. The staff where very friendly, eager to please and all my requests where granted with a smile, breakfast was also very good, Definitely on my list next time I’m in Sydney
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was very good, clean and the receptionist was very helpful and carried my large case up the stair. I had breakfast the next morning, the poached eggs were perfect on toast. Chef and server were excellent. Would definitely stay here again. One word of caution I booked this through Trip Adviser then Omoma, do not ever book through Omoma, the cost was $144, then they sent me an invoice for $288,I did not pay the extra $144 and the booking came up as a hotel in Paris which my bank said my card was used fraudulently, so then I had to get a new card. I have read other stories of this through Omoma.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Relatively close from Central station, this hotel is nestled in the heart of the CBD. Very quiet hotel. The staff at reception were great and very helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. Did I mention quiet? Pleasant stay, no complaints.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable and quiet location. Good breakfast menu. Easy access to tram and downtown. Friendly and helpful staff. It is more of a boutique hotel, but bedrooms and bathrooms were clean and spacious. Didn't notice anything off on the quality compared to larger hotels. Definitely would recommend especially if traveling for business.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I recently stayed at The Vulcan Hotel, which was recommended to us by a friend. After our overnight stay I will definitely be recommending The Vulcan to others.The staff were amazing. So friendly, very professional and extremely helpful. Check in/out was made so easy by the staff. The room was very clean and tidy, very spacious and everything within the room was easy to find/use. It was only a very short walk to Darling Harbour which was very convenient.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Travelled solo. Stayed in a single room on the 3rd floor. Room was adequate for Central Sydney. Close walking distance to Broadway and bus. Also walkable to Chinatown, Paddy's market, and Sydney Fish Market
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had two rooms for 5 nights. Found two cockroaches in ground floor room. Upon check out we had two accounting errors-extra night charged, which I caught. Then was wrongly charged an extra $300 on my credit card later. With so many great places to stay in Sydney I would go elsewhere!
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed in various apartments and hotels near the University but the Vulcan Hotel is by far the nicest. A 15-20 minute walk from main Quadrangle. It's a family-run hotel and feels like it. My room was small but blissfully quiet and the bed was comfortable. Good wifi; and pretty good lights for reading and working. Breakfast options were excellent and the coffee was very good. Chief asset were the staff: super helpful, friendly, warm and cheerful. I'll definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The front desk lady Sarah was exceptionally helpful, patient and friendly. As we were arriving to Sydney an hour earlier from the standard check in time, she managed to arrange a room ready for us upon our arrival. As we arrived, as my 6 year old son went to collect the key from her with me, she realised the presence of little children, and rearranged another room for us as the one she had ready for us was right next to the lift, so may be a little dangerous for him. We ended up with a very quiet room in the end of the hall. We did not mind having to wait for another 20 min or so. She was also very patient with my millions of questions about everything with the car park, costs, internet and everything else. Always with a smile too! And she’s awesome with kids! Amazing staff they have! Their other staff members were lovely too.We were able to park our car at UTS car park securely, within walking distance for $20 per night. Not directly next to the hotel though.The room was neat and clean. All the basics were available. The choice of brand of shampoo, hand wash and soap was great, and they all had lovely scent.Their small bar fridge was filled with quite a range of drinks, which did filled up most of the space already before we were able to put more stuff in it.The laundry service was about $24 per load of their provided laundry bag, which was quite a good price compared to another hotel. We didn’t end up using this service though.The location of this hotel was great, walking distance to China town and Darling Harbour.Definitely will stay at this place again if we come to Sydney again.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve stayed in several hotels in Sydney, but Vulcan Hotel was the best. It has a beautiful interior, spacious rooms and delicious breakfast (not included in the price, not cheap but top quality and in a pleasant laid back atmosphere). If you want to have breakfast out, the nearby Fork & Grind is commendable. The hotel itself has everything you need, is close to UTS and at a walkable distance from Central station and Darling Harbour.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: PROS:- With current exchange rates, we paid about $160 USD per night, which is not bad for a centrally-located hotel in a large city. - The room was quiet — I appreciated management’s admonition that they have a zero-tolerance noise policy. - Location was excellent and a good distance from the areas overrun with tourists to the north. A good spot for exploring Sydney, close to the restaurants in the Waterloo/Surry Hills/Darlinghurst area, and within walking distance of the Central train station and Circular Quay. - Restaurant was good for breakfast, staff was friendly. CONS:- For $160 USD per night, I expected it to be nicer. I don’t worry much about how a hotel room looks, but things like a chair with a seat cushion that didn’t match, a cheap wire cart in the bathroom, etc. made it look shabby. - The room had zero dresser drawers — a mini-bar and fridge took up the space where they should have been, which made it challenging to unpack. - The chain lock on the door was installed backwards, which made it useless. There was no other safety measure — the door didn’t even have a deadbolt, just a push-button lock. - On another security note, when we stored our luggage prior to checking in, they just gave us a key to a closet down the hall that had everyone’s luggage in it. We could easily have stolen items from someone else’s bags.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a couple nights while visiting Sydney. Upon reservation we did not know Sydney, but we soon found out that the location was great! 10 minutes walk to Central Station, walking distance to Darling Harbor as well as to CBD. The room was clean and well equipped, staff was nice, cosy interior etc. Good value for money! I would definitely recommend Vulcan Hotel for your trip to Sydney.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in room 302; was very spacious . Located on a great view of the Ultimo street. Had great evening walks to keep physically fit. They served good meals. The staff were very good and professional. It was a great experience after a 21hr flight from the Pearl of Africa.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Vulcan Hotel for 3 nights in room 303 which was very spacious with no outside noise at all while attending a conference at UTS. The staff were very helpful and friendly. They greeted everyone like a friend and took the time out of their busy day to have a quick chat. I had the pleasure of meeting the owners who are amazing. They are very dedicated to ensuring everyone has exceptional service and a memorable stay at the hotel.I agree with everyone else the breakfast were amazing and the coffee exquisite (high praise coming from a self confessed coffee snob)I was introduced to the dumpling/noodle restaurant the next block over that were handmade and very delicious. They are open late too.I would strongly recommend them as they are very central and it was easy for the Uber drivers to pickup/drop off right outside the hotel due to the loading bay on Mary Ann St.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for one night upon arrival in Sydney. Such a wonderful greeting to the city. I arrived in the morning after a 16 hour flight and they managed to get me into my room within a few minutes. Very kind. I wasn’t there ling enough to try the breakfast but the cafe looked lovely. My room was small but clean and convenient. Everything you would need. Good location I walked everywhere. Would recommend. Really would like to emphasize how friendly and helpful the front desk people were. Thanks for a great stay. Good wifi too.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little boutique hotel with terrific staff. Rooms differ so ask for specific details if you want something special - at least one room has a jacuzzi tub. Try the great breakfast and delicious coffee. Thanks to Carol, Harvey and Christine and all the other great staff for making our visit special
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: a reasonable hotel in a convenient location a short walk away from Central station, then a couple of stops to Circular quay for all ferries.Hotel itself was clean, staff friendly, facilities good comfortable bed, good dining area for breakfast, nice shower, tea/coffee facilities.Close to UTS, so easy to find when returning from trips
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at " Vulcan Hotel " during my stay in Sydney ( from 13th - 17th.Sep.'18 ). It's really a wonderful hotel which exceeded my expectations and I can recommend this hotel to all the people who would like to visit Sydney. The reasons as follows. (1).The hotel is conveniently located near the Central Station where is about a fifteen minutes' walk to the station. (2).The hotel is convenient place for shightseeing because their location is close to the heart of city. (3).The area of the room is not so large, however, it's large enough for almost all of the people. The structure of the room is very functional and a quiet desigh. The room has been always kept clean condition and I could enjoy relaxed atmosphere. (4).The staff of hotel are very friendly and capable persons, therefore, they responded quickly and appropriate ato my requirement. (5).The breakfast is absolutely delicious. Possibly someone think the price of the breakfast is a little bit high, however, I think that it is very reasonable, considering its excellent quality. (6).On the whole, it was so quiet in the hotel that I could enjoy a relaxed atmosphere. My main purpose of visiting Sydney in this time was to participate in the " Sydney Marathon 2018 " (42.195km) which was held on 16th.Sep.'18 and I finished a race ; besids, I broke my previous best record for the full marathon. Thanks to their support, I achived my objective which I finished the Sydney Marathon. I would like to stay Vulcan Hotel again if I have an opportunity to visit Sydney in the future.I wish to express my deep gratitude to " Vulcan Hotel " for their kindness and hospitality.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went for a weekend in early August. Staff were very friendly during check in/out. Room was small but was perfect for me as I just needed a place to sleep and get ready between adventures. Room and bathroom were super clean! Bathroom seemed like it was pretty new, the shower had great water pressure which isn’t the case in some other places I’ve stayed in Sydney. Room had mini bar and Foxtel. Location was nice, about a 12-15 min walk to central which I could handle. Overall happy with the experience and value for money. Thanks guys
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an overnight stay here in this quaint motel. Good location. A 15 minute walk from Central Station via The Devonshire tunnel almost all the way so not dealing with traffic lights and cars. We had a very warm welcome. Our room was spotless and the bathroom had a 3 tier trolley as well as 2 decent sized shelves. Very thoughtful. We were on the bottom floor with a window into a beautiful seating area. Our room was very dark, which meant we slept in, and we needed to have the light on the whole time but we weren’t there during the day, and the big window overlooking the lush green garden area made up for it. Very good value for money in Central Sydney. Didn’t have time to try Happy hour or breakfast. Next time.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room 402 on the top floor was extremely spacious and fantastic value for money. We found the hotel clean and well appointed. The highlight for us was the convenience of the location so close to Darling Harbour without the noise. Customer service was flawless with friendly multilingual staff. The hotel manager Gonzague was especially helpful on arrival at solving promptly a booking mistake we had made. Breakfast was tasty and reasonably priced with lovely table service from Anais. We will be back next time we stay in Sydney.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Vulcan Hotel's accessibility to Darling Harbour just a few minutes walk away was very convenient. It is a lovely Boutique Hotel with a distinct feel of 'no rush' together with personalised intimacy. This was typified with family hotel owners providing one on one service for check in/ check out, and offering local travel advice. The Breakfast selection was lovely and simple located in an informal setting. While it did not provide the views and features that larger hotels spruik, I found value for money was very good.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely little hotel just behind UTS in Sydney. Very reasonably priced and great to have the option of a single room. And you can open the window! Highly recommend the poached pears for breakfast. Thank you for a very pleasant stay.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I did research on best place to stay within walking distance of city and public transport and Sydney Uni. The Vulcan was best value and had positive reviews. The room was small with two single beds but was adequate for what we wanted during a conference. I'd definitely recommend it to others as I arranged an Opal card for the week (from interstate) but only used the card once. Walked up to Circular Quay via Hyde Park and onto the oversea ship terminal on the first day. Then home to The Vulcan again down George Street. an easy walk. That afternoon walked to Sydney University which was just under 1.5 kms. Good flat walking, well lit at night. Loved the café in the hotel. Good breakfast menu. Delicious pizzas at night. Order beforehand is best. Bed and pillow comfy, rooms cleaned well each day. Best of all the whole place was so friendly and welcoming, a distinct contrast to the big hotel chains. Staff were so friendly and so efficient. I expected a cold room in an older building but was so cosy, only put heater on a couple of times for short period of time.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed few days at the Vulcan for a special occasion to celebrate in Sydney. The hotel is charming and the room we had was calm and cosy. Not far from the city center so we mostly walk as the weather was beautiful. The staff was lovely friendly and very helpful. Unfortunately no pictures to share I’m sorry..
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second stay at the Vulcan Hotel. Another friendly welcome at reception. Clean, comfortable room and bathroom - especially the cosy aircon on such a chilly Sydney night.Got there in time for happy hour - nice to sit with a glass of wine in front of the fire. Very convenient location - I chose to catch a cab from train station - but bus is also close by. Walked over to Darling Harbour. Delicious breakfast - at a great price! This is a great find!
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have to say that our experience at the Vulcan Hotel was outstanding!!We were greeted very warmly by your lovely concierge (I can’t remember the gentleman’s name) but he was lovelyand very professional.Our room was fabulous. Wonderfully presented, and we were delighted it had a window and fronted the courtyard and we could get fresh air. The bed was super comfy and the bathroom huge.Breakfast in the morning was perfect eggs and equally good coffee. I ordered a simple meal but it was one of the best I’d had in ages. The owners (I’m guessing) presided over breakfast and were so friendly and accommodating. Without a doubt what sets the Vulcan apart was all the little thoughtful touches and friendly, professionalism. Not to mention, the Vulcan was SO affordable and amazing value!!! It was above and beyond anything I’d expected in this price range.I will definitely be back and am just sad we didn’t discover this gem sooner. Can’t wait for another excuse to visit the city.Thank you to all the staff and those who run the ship at the Vulcan.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great mid range hotel small but clean and tidy room Great breakfast venue Close to darling harbour and central Sydney Great soundproofing from trafficClose to TAFE and UTS Easy access and walking distance Nothing flashy but comfortable and friendly
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff who are so helpful! Neat, clean facilities. I was only booked for one night but I ended up staying for three! Close to all of the main Sydney attractions.A beautiful hotel and I’ll definitely be back!
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Got to love a hotel which advertises its rooms for single travellers as 'shoe box'! It was just that, a thee-quarter bed, quite a bit of roaming around room, a spacious bathroom, a wardrobe, a TV ... what more do you want? I checked in quite late on a Saturday night, and found a terrifically helpful front desk person who sold me a very reasonably priced drink to take to my room. My room had lovely high ceilings, a very comfy bed, all the doings in the bathroom, and quick and efficient check-out. For the price ($145 a night, in Sydney - amazing), I can totally recommend this quirky little hotel. It is in fact walking distance to Central Station, and a bit of a long stroll to the CBD, but doable. I wake up if a sparrow farts, truly, and on a busy Sydney road, I slept like a baby, heard nothing. The bathroom could do with a bit of spruce up, the tiles a little bit grotty, but hey, so are mine at home! I'll be back!
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in a loft room which was ideal for 2 adults and 2 children. Nice, quiet and spacious. Our room had a microwave and enough crockery that we didn't need to eat out every meal. The beds were of a good size and very comfortable.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in Vulcan Hotel from 28 March to 3 April. About a half hour taxi ride from the airport. Upgraded to a queen (looks more like a king) size room with additional AUD180. Location of the hotel is excellent as we can walk (15-20 minutes) to Chinatown where there are plenty of food to choose from. Paddy's Market for those who wants to buy souvenir (cheap fridge magnets etc) for folks back home. There is also a café round the corner of the hotel that serves good coffee and yummy breakfast.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great little place with lots of character. Close to Darling Harbour and things to explore.  Clean.Staff was very friendly and helpful Had a refurbished cafe that seemed a bit out of character with the ambiance. Get a room away from the shaft that brings noise up from the enclosed courtyard at night.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Vulcan Hotel is a colonial style small hotel located in the Ultimo neigbourhood of Sydney very close to light rail stops and the central bus and train station. If you are fairly fit this cozy hotel is also within walking distance of everything in downtown Sydney...Darling Harbour, Sydney Fish Market, Hyde Park, the Art Gallery, Circular Quay and the Opera House.Our room was well equipped and clean, and the hotel has a lovely little restaurant for breakfast and a coffee during the day.The staff at the counter is very obliging, most helpful and chatty which makes one feel very welcome. At the counter Gonzague also provided concierge service and actually arranged two full day tours for us. Thank you so much Gonzague!
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were attending a conference at the nearby UTS for a week and the Vulcan is a great location within easy walking distance of UTS along with Paddy's markets etc.Our room was a little odd with a restricted height wardrobe, but a terrific bed and bathroom. Breakfast was excellent those days we used their cafe and the team very helpful.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little boutique hotel. Rose was super friendly from the time I checked in, and rest of the staff are attentive and straight on queue. Room is comfy and great. Bathrooms little quirky but are practical and clean.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff excellent , made the guests feel very welcome and cared for. the staff lifted the hotel to a couple of stars higher than the average hotel.Hotel very clean and all facilities up to date , everything you need in a room . No iron in room but one in hall that youcould use in room or ask for your own . I was near road and I am a light sleeper but the room was very quit could not hear any noise. Also bring photo ID when checking in as this is required. The only thing I would have liked is a brighter light in the bathroom.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights and loved the hotel. Very spacious room and bathroom. Very clean and comfortable and quiet. The front reception staff were always cheery and happy and ready to offer advise on where to visit. Breakfast in the hotel café was excellent. It is in such a great location to walk anywhere, as well as plenty of eating options close by. We had a great stay and will certainly be back here on our next visit to Sydney. Thanks
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel with awesome staff. They took care of everything for us. Room was spacious and very clean. Would definitely stay there next time in Sydney. Upside courtyard was very pleasant. Front desk made fresh pizza for us the first night. Very convenient after traveling all day.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location, very close to Central station so getting around Sydney was a breeze. Also, there are many great cafes and restaurants around, so you're spoilt for choice for food! Staff were very friendly and helpful and made my stay even better. Certainly recommend!
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Locate in a central location this boutique hotel has everything you need for a stay in Sydney.We had a twin room with single beds. The high ceilings make the room seem more spacious. It was pretty compact but was fine for our needs.The staff were extremely helpful and friendly which made our stay even more enjoyable.One little negative thing is that it's about 15 minutes from the station but we used Taxify from the airport so that wasn't a problem for us. Would stay there again :)
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 4 nights here, room was clean and comfortable. Staff were great, extremely helpful. Location is great and the area is quiet, Coles express just across the road too. 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour and 10inute walk to central station! Room had air con, free WiFi, TV and a minibar.Certainly would recommend!
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On a positive note, this boutique hotel is an 8-10 min walk to the central train station and about the same walking distance to the Broadway shopping centre. Reception staff Christine and Rose were very pleasant. We saw more of Rose during our stay and she was always smiling and friendly. The rooms are small which isn’t an issue for 1-2 nights but we stayed there for 5 nights which was a stretch. We arrived the day before New Years Eve, prices all over Sydney were inflated due to NYE celebrations. We found this hotel overpriced for the value. It does have an on-site cafe that served breakfast. The food was decent, the waiter seemed disinterested and could use some PR skills.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Train from Airport to Central, 10 minutes walk past UTS & TAFE. Quiet as a mouse. Friendly and easy welcome, quality breakfast, fully refurbished, spacious, spotless room and bathroom. Absolutely loved it. Lovely old pub restored in and out.Fantastic value, thanks. Sorry we could only stay one night :)
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with my partner for New Year’s Eve, very clean and staff were friendly and helpful. We paid for breakfast the morning we were leaving and it was absolutely amazing (gutted we only had it the once). The staff left us a little note wishing us a happy new year and left us a bottle of fizz to celebrate which I thought as a lovely touch. The mini bar prices were cheap with good variety of drinks and snacks. Only thing I will say is that the hotel is at least a 20-25 min walk to darling harbour (I would suggest getting an opal card to get around on the bus and train). Central station is only a 5 min walk which we used to get around to places like Bondi Beach. Very pleasant stay.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 2 nights as a stopover before Christmas. Had a single room with a comfy bed and attached bathroom. Room was on the ground floor and next to the street (if opened window) but was quiet at night with little traffic. Contain in the UTS neighbourhood, there were numerous eateries for meals of good budget and quality. Walking distance to most tourist spots (wear good walking shoes though). 10min walk to Central Station. Staff service was excellent, mostly friendly and helpful. Definitely return to stay again.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a week while attending a conference at university of Sydney. Good location in terms of walking to university, train station, other parts of the city and local food. Overall not bad, no real complaints. Allowed me an early check in without advance notice for no charge. Breakfasts were yummy. But room was quite small for the price compared with others in the area. As a single traveler it didn't bother me much, room had everything I needed. Would probably stay again, depending on the price.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, tidy and well kept. Staff friendly and helpful. Excellent facilities, plenty of hot water and modern bathroom facilities. Stayed four nights. Booked early and got excellent price. Close to city centre and railway station. Would stay again.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed at this hotel in Sydney and can only assume that the location must be why it has a significantly high price considering the hotels standard. Was lead to believe they provided room service, however this was not the case. Extremely small rooms and bathrooms. Very small single beds. Old and noisy air conditioning. Extreme noise from traffic as the hotel is situated on main road. TV is loactwd high and to the side so almoat impossible to watch. At 255.00 a night excluding breakfast, I would have expected better. Asked for an ironing board and I was directed to the communal one in the corridor. I could have stayed 5 star in the City for the same price. Would not recommend.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On the Sydney leg of our Australian yoga retreat with Flo, we checked into the Vulcan Hotel on 11/09/17. It is a boutique hotel that is approximately 3-5 blocks to restaurants.A gas station/convenience store with just about everything is a block away. A liquor/wine store is less than 2 blocks. Law & I stayed in rooms 103 & 210. I prefer #103 due to it's larger bathroom.Pros: 1) Possibly the BEST breakfast in ALL of SYDNEY!!!!!! 2) an AMAZING international staff that was patient, pleasant & kind. ** A special "thank you" to Rose-Croatian lady at the front desk who was extremely pleasant & always with a smile, Livia is also at the front desk, she is half Brit/half Romania was helpful and polite, Raj-the Nepalese chef & Yves-the French waiter who patiently took our breakfast orders and didn't need reminders of my favs.3) They allowed us to use the courtyard for our daily yoga classes4) Wifi5) Hot water (for showers)6) iron & ironing board was availableCons: 1) restaurant/kitchen closed for dinner/drinks2) no gym3) unable to get currency exchanged (unless the owner is present)4) no door/step down to shower (in room 103), prevent a flood with 2 bath mats5) no towels were given for our beach visit*** If you're staying elsewhere in Sydney, please consider the breakfast at the Vulcan and try the cauliflower fritters, sautéed kale, avocado, mushrooms, tomatoes. The banana bread was good too (big slices).
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Extremely friendly and courteous staff, clean hotel rooms and conveniently located near university of Sydney and urbanest student housing. The hotel also has a nice adjoining cafe with great food and wonderful coffee
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited the Vulcan Hotel on a short trip to Sydney. As per previous reviews the location is quite good for trains, Darling Harbour and Chinatown. However, this is where any positive experience ends. We paid a high price in advance specifically for a twin room. On arrival we were told there was none available and on asking if there was any way this could be resolved we were informed that a rollout bed would be available at a significant extra cost. The room itself was tiny despite booking a superior twin. We had to move the armchair into the corridor to have any room to move around the bed.see pics attached. We found the staff to be extremely unhelpful, uninterested in customer service and patronising. Despite this extremely poor hotel and attitude Sydney is well worth a visit just don't stay in #Vulcan Hotel if you want any customer care.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in October 2017. Hotel is noisy. Attempts have been made to sound proof but you hear road noise, adjoining bathroom and corridor noise. No duvets on beds in direct contradiction to management provided photos. For over $200 a night not really good value. You don’t get much either. Cheap towels, cheap toiletries. Nothing is particularly good. Location is really the only thing and that’s only good if you’re visiting the university. Tries to give a family feel but the reality is it’s just a bit crummy and overpriced. Heritage hotel is code for ‘noisy and old’. Bathroom is so small you can hardly move. Overall not good.
hotelName:
5    Vulcan Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked in after a long haul flight and found everything to be very clean. We had 2 double beds a good view of the city and it was just what we needed after our 26 hour flight. We found everything to be within walking distance ie Darling harbour, Sydney opera house and cocklebay wharf. The reason we choose this hotel was the closeness to central station about 100 yds away so we could walk to the train for our onward trip to Richmond. The breakfast was very good if a little caoutic we found to go down about 9.15 am was a lot quieter. The staff were very helpful and remembered us each morning which was nice. There was plenty of everything both hot and cold buffet.would highly recommend.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location right at Central Station, south end of the city. This area has undergone a fair bit of development, and has lots of great pubs and restaurants (try Spice Alley for great Asian options). Only 10 mins walk to Darling Harbour precinct, Sydney Uni and Broadway shopping. Kings St Wharf and Barangaroo 20 mins walk. Rooms are quiet and clean (Std Queen), basic but fine for short stays. Good buffet breakfast. Parking on-site $45/night.Overall a bargain for a Sydney Hotel.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is just a walkway away from the airport trains in one direction, and has a direct route to Darling Harbour in the other direction. It is also located at the top of George St. Centre of everything! First room they put me in was a bit noisy, but this was instantly fixed. Anything that didn't go quite right the first time was immediately addressed. Great staff, especially in the dining area. Would happily stay again.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There is no such thing as a reasonably priced high quality hotel room in Sydney's CBD...or so I thought. I stayed at the Mercure Sydney in George St. recently for 4 nights on a business trip. This hotel has been recently refurbished and it was done to a really good standard.The bed was comfortable, everything in the room worked (no - this is not a strange thing to say here - I often find hotel fittings that don't work!); and my No. 1 quality test - the iron and ironing board were all of good quality.The location in George St. is directly adjacent to Central Station, so access to both the domestic and international airport is really easy. There is plenty of eateries nearby - the small Doner Kebab place over the road does a wonderful selection of eats. If you need a quick cheap breakfast, there is a McDonalds over the road too.Friendly staff, nice surroundings and surprisingly good value for Sydney. Well done Mercure team. I'll be back!
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I couldn’t be more impressed with my stay at this hotel. The staff were polite, professional and made me feel very welcome. Close to the central station so basically your close to anywhere, pool was beautiful and warm with a terrific view. Dinning area looked new and the food was reasonably priced and tasted great. I will be back and highly recommended for others.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A handy location close to Central Station, suburban and long distance trains, Airport, Chinatown. The hotel is comfortable with friendly and helpful staff. The restaurant is modern with elegantly presented food that is tasty as well
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed here (both for business and leisure) many times and I keep going back.The location is right next to Central Station and is really convenient with lots of shops and restaurants close by. It is a 10 minute walk up George St into the city, but that's fine. You're a little out of the hustle and bustle here and you get great views of the city.The restaurants have a great buffet and I've always found the hotel nice and clean, tidy and great staff.You can hire cars as well which is very convenient.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: stayed for about a week, and didn't have much complaints. very close to the central train station. several food joints and shopping options close by. the morning buffet breakfast is pretty sumptuous.found the room size a bit small for my preference though. early check-in requests might be difficult, given the fact that it is usually well booked. worth a try though.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time to Australia, spent seven days in Sydney at the Mercure. We had two rooms. Rooms are very clean and tidy. No clutter or anything overly done. We did use the sauna and pool one night. They were fine and not necessarily anything fancy about them. Son used the exercise room and he said it was adequate. Again we spent more time sightseeing then being in our room. But when we were, it was perfect. Hot showers, clean and comfortable.The staff are wonderful, I mean wonderful. They are attentive, helpful, friendly and will go the extra mile for you. Cannot praise them enough and that goes along long ways with me. That tells me they care and enjoy working at The Mercure.Restaurant for breakfast was good food, but a bit pricey. Otherwise a wide variety to choose from as it a buffet only. Bar was great. Quiet in the sense of being able to carry on a conversation and being heard by at our table. Drinks were great and the staff talked about local brews and made a great Gin and Tonic. That’s my drink. Local gin, Tom’s something. Was very good. Location was perfect. Next to Central Station for the train and bus depot. You couldn’t ask for anything better. Walking distance to Chinatown and Darling Harbour. Very convenient to all the sites we were set to see.Certainly would highly recommend to anyone going to Sydney.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 5 nights and was impressed with the quality service provided by all the staff. Great central location and easy access to from the hotel to the airport train. Buffet breakfast was very good. Definitely recommend.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here business. It was a short trip from the airport and a handy spot for the conference I was attending. My room was comfortable and spacious. I ordered from the room service menu and was impressed by the speed and quality of my meal. Also, the concierge was lovely and helpful. I’ll be back.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Like the other reviews the location of this hotel makes it perfect for a business traveler, especially one like myself who likes to eat new and different foods.Convenient walking distance to so many of the key business spots as well as located near the Central train station so getting just about anywhere in NSW is a breeze.The primary purpose of my review after my most recent trip is the staff. They are incredibly helpful and welcoming. Esther as the front desk was fabulous for my multiple check ins and different charge types that I was dealing with (due to travel in and out of the city as well as different charges to different companies). Esther was helpful with my multiple bookings and arrival and departure dates.Extra Special mention for Katrina in the newly renovated 818 Restaurant on the first level. She along with the other team members were great to see each morning at breakfast. Always happy and always more than willing to assist. This team made my day each and every morning during my stay. Always greeting me with a smile and treating me as if I were a family member.The rooms are spacious and comfortable even for a long stay.....this of course is a matter of perspective. I have stayed in European style hotels in this area of Sydney...Mercure tops them all.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Mercure for 2 nights recently, lovely hotel, very comfy rooms and very reasonably priced,The rooms were large, very comfy large beds, very clean. The hotel pool was great to relax. The restaurant did a great breakfast and a good selection of meals.Also, very close to central station which is 15 mins train from the airport.Tip, ask at checkin for a free welcome drink at Eve's bar by reception and their special breakfast deals.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our one night stay was great! Location was fantastic! Given Hotel was full service was excellent and we were checked in and out with minimum of time spent. Having 2 rooms together made our stay with the family easy! Thank you Mercure Sydney
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is located in a busy part of CBD adjacent to the Central Train Station-----convenient location. But there wasn't any proper place designed for putting one's suitcase. Also, there was no window inside the hotel room, so one cannot get any fresh air. However, the staff were friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was very lucky to win a 2 night stay at the Mercure in Central. I upgraded to the 12th floor and took advantage of a bigger room with some single lounge chairs. It was a lovely view of Central and suprisingly quite sound proof. The carpet was lovely, TV a good size, the bed was quite comfortable. A variety of pillows. I had the best sleep in a very long time. The curtains provided blockout. There was a safe, kettle, room for luggage, an office table, a cupboard for hanging up some clothes. Walking distance to the city centre, right next to a variety of buses to other locations and near Central train station which is the hub of all train destinations. The bathroom was just fine. The only small negative would be that there wasn't enough light for me. There were a couple tall lamps, some spotlights near the bed on each side as well as another light. Light in the hallway but actually not in the actual room itself. It was a bit too dark for me. The breakfast buffet had a variety to choose from and the ordered lattes were lovely. Newspapers were also available. Staff were very friendly and the parking onsight was great. Overall, this is a perfect affordable family stay in a city that can be top dollar expensive as you get closer to the harbour. I also think that the pastry chef must be very experienced because the croissants and the other breakfast desserts were amazing!
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Despite being in a great location near Central station, this place was just average, and does not meet expectations for the price. The bed is uncomfortable and there is mot enough warm linen, only a thin doona and a blanket. The mattress is hard and the sheets scratchy. I could not turn on the heater as it only blew out dust and it affected my asthma badly. And the room was cold overnight. I am usually very hot in hotels but I actually went out to buy warmer clothes and flanelette pajamas. The "energy saving" lightglobes were useless and meant that I turned every light (and I mean every light) just to see clearly. The TV advertises that you can screen mirror from your device but that didn't work. Again, i was disappointed that another Australian hotel did not offer free wifi for guests. Seriously, i can get free wifi on a plane but have to pay $10 a day in a hotel on the ground!! Although the room was very clean, I accidentally broke a glass and called housekeeping to warn their staff of the hazard and was met with a very disinterested staff member. Breakfast was chaotic with staff insisting on "seating" guests leaving a line of people waiting, which was unnecessary. Staff seemed overwhelmed despite it catering for travel groups, air crews and conference guests. The food was adequate, the barista made coffee poor and there wasn't a cup nor tea available. I did like the ice tea and the fruit flavoured water. The bar staff were accommodating once you got their attention from cleaning. The dinner staff seemed to just manage. Do venture out to find "Spice Alley", just a block or so away for dinner!!
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a good hotel for easy access to public transportation around town. Nestled in the heart of the city, it was located in a very busy part of town, close to Spice Alley which is a hidden gem of the area for Asia cuisine. However, we found there was a lot of Asian cuisine around, and we’re glad when we finally found an absolutely fantastic Italian restaurant near the Spice Alley area, and I wish I could remember the name because it was the best food we ate there. Our room was kind of disappointing with nothing but a wall for a view, and WiFi was mediocre, but I’ve heard that’s an issue allover Sydney so I won’t fault the hotel. They had the traditional showers that have a small glass portion toward the shower head and a half glass shower door that swings inward and leaves the back half open. While traditional in most U.K. and British areas, I’m just not a fan of the open/drafty way these work. This is my personal opinion and I am sure will be just fine to most.The store was perfect for snacks and other amenities, and the restaurant had a good breakfast (I’m sure it had other good items for lunch and dinner but we only had breakfast). The best part of this hotel is its great location to the central station railway. It was easy to get all over town from Darling Harbor to the Opera House and the Harbor Bridge. It was fun to be around the hustle and bustle of the city.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very well appointed twin room. We were expecting 2 single beds, which is the norm for Australia, tut to our amazement, 2 double beds greeted us! Very happy! Very close to central station where you could easily take the train to circular quay (and other destinations)
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wifey and I need a stopover close to the Railway. What better than 200 metres from Central. Accor can be relied upon every time. We strolled everywhere with chinatown, Darling Harbour and Pitt St Mall just up the road; so convenient
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I found staff extremely helpful and friendly. My room had a view of Sydney tower. Location was excellent - quick walk to central station and paddy’s market. It was my second time staying here and I would definitely stay again
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check in was efficient and very pleasant, with the Front Office Manager coming out specifically to welcome me to the Hotel. The staff continued the awesome service, as I walked to the lift the Concierge offered to assist as my hands were quite full, then another employee raced to the lift and held one open for me..... what a start to my stay!!!The room was fantastic, modern and clean. The bed very comfy, a pillow menu, a HUGE TV, coffee pod machine and extra amenities. Nice view of bustling Sydney as well. Bathroom clean and functional.Location is perfect, next to Central Station, loads of restaurants, fast food, pubs, Woolies, Cinema all literally at the doorstep, and a nice 7 min stroll to Chinatown.I’m sincerely impressed, and will be making this my go-to Hotel for Sydney stays.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: simple clean and received what was promised. room was nice with city views. we were with the staff surprise gifts of champagne with chocolates for my wife's birthday. great buffet breakfast. staff were very pleasant.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A pleasant stay in a well appointed hotel in an excellent location made even better by excellent staff. This is our usual Sydney home away from home which we would recommend to any one Can't wait till our next stay
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From reception, bar, restaurant and through to breakfast the staff were very welcoming and helpful. This visit far outweighed any previous ones we had here. The breakfast bar was among the best evr experienced, catering for all tastes. WE will be back here again
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have stayed here a few times and expecting same old ordinary service. Must have had a change in staff as things have changed. Service good and room was clean and tidy. Had breakfast and although buffet style was very good. Will stay again.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is rated at 4 1/2 stars and I must at meet I was a little disappointed The location is great being right next to Central Station and walking distance to Chinatown but I little bit far from the CBD shopping of the high-end stores featuring Gucci Louie time deal and how must Having said that is easy override for only a few dollars to the top and of town First impression was sufficiently pleasant with a nice fire from efficient service although that difficulty finding our reservations as dad picked my wife's middle name as a surname but thank goodness they were alert enough to search brought enough to find a booking Rebel boy service is non-existent and older we had a big bag and I was clearly using my walking frame being a disabled person there was no assistance from anybody to take the bag for the family luckily the bag was on wheels Even after checking in and seeing that I was disabled there was no effort to make and take our bags to the room. Even after checking in and seeing that I was disabled there was no effort to make and take our bags to the roomThis is truly a non-for an half star ranking service This is truly a non-for an half star ranking service The rooms are adequate in size with I was being a double room with two double beds that all the basic amenities however the four of us there was insufficient soaps shampoos for us to use I requested more from the front desk but it took for ever to get up here and take it took almost 3 hours to get the toothbrushes which we also requested I had forgotten my shaving kit and requested that and it arrived just past midnight Room service was very apologetic and after the reminders the able to eventually organise themselves to bring up the shampoos shaving kit's  Located near the central railway station is the McCure hotel part of the equal chain which holes also the Sofitel Ibis Novatel Pullman hotels So there is no doubt there is great pedigree but this hotel for me it is 4 1/2 star rating was a bit disappointing  Chicken was pleasant and sufficiently efficient although they had difficulty finding the reservation as they have made the reservation under my wife's middle name rather than surname There is no concierge service and although it was clear that I was disabled using my walking frame nobody came to help with regards to the baggage we had Even after checking in and observing that I was disabled nobody made any effort to help take the bags from the reception to our rooms This is not what I expect from a 4 1/2 star hotel.  TWhat do you pay is what you gethe rooms are utilitarian and definitely are not of a high level of sophistication but is more than adequate and the double beds are really really comfortable with matching pillows being just as comfortable However the air conditioning in the room is really noisy but very efficient and cool the room down pleasantly fast Although the hotel has been in existence for some time and has been kept well and is pleasantly clean with no hint of Mustiness. The rate includes breakfast which is a buff a breakfast served at 818 platform restaurant on the first floor It's a buff a breakfast with all the usual scrambled eggs baked beans hashbrowns bacon and a large array of fruits she's in breads There is no egg cooking station and is available on order an extra cost Two fried eggs on omelette cost six dollars however you can get to post eggs for free a very strange system The bread to a fresh but the pastries had seen better days and a crumpet because available for toasting was really old and hard.
