Tea and coffee available on a help yourself bases from the automated machine The quality is adequate but my wife did not agree with the quality of the coffee as the milk was not fresh but of a process variety.  Service was pleasant and professional and the floor manager took attention to my disability and provided us a table closer to the Buffy That was very kind of them but the waiting staff were a bit lazy and a branch and made very little effort to clear away the use plates from our table  Food quality was adequate with nothing to re-form about and quantity was sufficient but you have to be patient as it took their time to refill the dishes When I first went to the buffet The grilled tomato and sausage trees were empty and it took them at least half an hour to have them refilled again I ordered poached eggs and that also took forever for it to be served I suppose it was a Sunday and it was a full restaurant and they must've been very busy but the time it took for them to deliver the food was disappointingly slow  Rating at 4 1/2 stars I would've expected a higher quality and better fit out for the rooms and restaurant but the room rate including breakfast was just over $150 per night for the weekend which is really very cheap for Sydney and its location Like I Said what you pay is what you getsaid what you pay is what you get but this is more than adequate if all you want is accommodation
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We needed a night near the railway station to recover from an international flight. This hotel was a great choice and is clean, serviced well and comfortable - perfect for what we needed. It is located near the Central Railway Station, but is quiet enough to enjoy your stay. We will be using it again when next we travel to Sydney as is is good value and close to everything we needed.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here on our way overseas , was greeted by Maria (trainee) who was so friendly and so warm in her personality, an asset to The Mercure . Our room 1426 was very well appointed and very clean , bed was a little Firm but to most people’s liking, bathroom was no thrills but clean and everything you need, the view was very good. We had breakfast included and it was outstanding, the location is brilliant so many options to eat at, I highly recommend this hotel so close to central station for a night before leaving the country, you don’t need an airport hotel with the airport train being so regular and a short trip. I will now stay here every time
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our most recent stay at the Mercure Sydney. We have stayed there many times and the staff just seem to be getting better and better from Sara who attended to us at reception to Anna in the restaurant to Riley and Katharine at breakfast to Tyler in maintenancs. We are looking forward to our next visit.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exceeded our expectations. Very friendly greeting on arrival, helpful check-in, an upgrade for being a returning client. An extremely comfortable room and very comfortable bed. A quick and easy check out.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here whilst attending a conference at the Novotel Sydney Central. The two nights I stayed here, I woke up at 1.00am and 2.00am respectively due to noise. The walls seem to be very thin here and it is very easy for people in rooms next door to unintentionally wake you. Also, if someone is smoking nearby, the smell drifts into your room. (This is a no smoking hotel so I understand this is the guests fault, not the hotels). The location is very close to Central train station. If you are a heavy sleeper, this may be the place for you. Staff were friendly and attentive.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Right in the CBD, great for business or leisure. With public transport straight out the door you are anywhere in the city with no effort. Staff and location make this a great place to stay. I always stay here if I need to be in the city.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a very short but very special trip away. My sons 13th birthday was approaching and we decided to take him to a concert in Sydney. To sweeten the deal we searched for somewhere to stay overnight. The Mercure ticked the boxes, being central to everything, having a pool and offering breakfast. It had been some time since we had visited a larger chain motel, so I was hesitant, but so glad we did. I was blown away with the service and the entire exprience. From check in to check out, the friendliness professionalism from staff was exceptional. By request, we were upgraded to a slightly larger room which, I am certain that given the two teenagers, made the trip so much more enjoyable. We enjoyed a lovely pre-dinner drink in the Level 1 Bar and headed out to the concert. On returning, my son walked in to the room to find the sweetest card from reception, some slices of cake and an orange juice to help welcome him to the teenage years.We all experienced a sensational nights sleep and then enjoyed a delicious breakfast. Again the customer service and genuine friendliness was enough to make us want to return very soon (this time with all the kids).I highly recommend this for anyone needing a place to stay that is central, welcoming and worth the money. It is a fantastic spot to enjoy the city and all it has to offer and is well set up for children. Thank you Mercure.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having arrived early in the morning after 30hr travel time from Budapest we expected to drop off our bags till afternoon check in. No said the conceirge your room is ready waiting for you. Being Accor members we were treated to the largest hotel room we've ever seen! Pure luxury! We also received 4 bottles of craft beer with compliments on our 10th visit to Mecure Ultimo.So jet lagged we used room service that night and enjoyed a yummy margarita pizza along with our beer.Nice to feel special!
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were so friendly and extremely helpful. Great location, close to public transport and great breakfasts, would stay there again on next trip to Sydney.One little problem bed sheets did not fit bed properly.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have used this property numbers of time, for transit when travelling on and for visits to Sydney to take in a show. For us, it is convenient to Central rail, enabling us to travel to Sydney by rail, thus eliminating traffic and parking concerns. We are perfectly happy with Mercure Sydney.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely stay, and our room was great. The staff were exceptional, with Juileta Caitlin on the breakfast and many more but just didn't get their names.. Thanks again will definitely stay again.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stsyed in balcony room on 13th floor great views. Very close to transport ce tral station and george st bus interchange. Room king size bed comfortable. Bathroom big and adequate lacks space to put your cosmetics etc. But good range of free shampoo etc. Location good to get around sydney and breakfsst adewuate. Staff good. Would recommend for short stays.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got a simple double room on the 6th floor. Our room was facing the Railway Square. Awesome view!We had a hard time figuring out where to exit from the Central Station during our arrival from the airport. But on succeeding days, we pretty much know how to get around. Overall, our stay was good. Daily breakfast comes with our room accommodations. My kids thoroughly enjoyed what is served at breakfast everyday. Not too much variety though, but enough to fuel you for the day. Quality of food is okay.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Close to a central station so access to anywhere is easy from here. Rooms are a good size and comfortable and dining options are good. Easy check in and check out. Have stayed with the family a couple of times before and will certainly be back.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a business hotel, this is a good option in central Sydney. Close to transport, fast checkin, friendly staff and onsite bar and restaurant. Rooms are dated but relatively comfortable. The rooms seem clean, however I had to move the bed to retrieve an item I had dropped and the space under the bed was really filthy. My biggest criticism is the utter lack of any decent lighting. There are some bedside lamps and a desk lamp as well as a wall light; however the lack of overhead lighting means the rooms are extremely dim and the lighting very poor. Perhaps not a huge criticism but significant for someone with vision needs. Anyway, my company continues to use this hotel and I appreciate the friendly staff, excellent buffet breakfast and central location.I suspect I will be back!
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great experience staying at the Mercure in Sydney. The staff was amazing from the minute we arrived. We arrived early and they did everything they could to get our rooms ready. We had a bit of time until the rooms were available so we talked to the concierge about things to do and transportation in the city. They were so helpful and descriptive we had no problems with transportation after spending a few minutes with them. They made us feel like we were their only customers by the time they gave us and how we were treated.We had breakfast each morning while staying at the Mercure and the food was fabulous. Very good selection and quite delicious.Overall it was a very nice place to stay. I hope to stay there again.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My niece and I stayed at the Mercure Sydney for a couple of days.The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful.As an Accor Gold member I was fortunate to be upgraded to the 13th floor so we also had great views.Our room was clean and everything as it should be.We ate breakfast each day in the hotel. The breakfast buffet had enough choice and plenty of food.We had dinner at Eves Bar on Saturday but unfortunately they didn’t serve meals on Sunday evening although the restaurant in the hotel was open but we didn’t eat dinner there.The location of the hotel is great. Very close to Central Station so we were able to catch the train from he airport and then walk around to the hotel.Each day we just caught the train. We went to Circular Quay and Manly from there and we were also able to catch the train to Bondi Junction and connect to a bus to Bondi Beach. So if you don’t have your own transport, this location is perfect.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reception area was busy at check in and check out, allow extra time if you are in a rush. The staff were very friendly and greeted you with a smile. The car park is very tight, if you have a bigger car than a RAV4 you will have trouble, would suggest calling the hotel first to see if the can help with parking. The room was clean and tidy had all the standard amenities, the bathroom had a shower/bath combination, shower head had excellent water pressure. My room looked towards central station, there was no road noise. The new restaurant is great, the service was very nice and the food was delicious. They had a buffet breakfast each morning with all the standard choices and proper freshly made barista coffee. Allow time for breakfast it can get very busy. Had lunch at the bar once and dinner twice in the restaurant, reasonably priced, the food was very nice and the service by the staff was friendly and spot on.Great first stay will be back next time I am in the area.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of four arrived early at the hotel hoping to perhaps leave our bags safely somewhere until we could check into our room. To our surprise we were warmly welcomed and advised we could enter our room immediately.We included the buffet breakfast as part of our package and on each of the four mornings we dined there it was fabulous.Our room was adequate for what we needed, clean and serviced daily.The location near Central station was ideal.Staff were extremely welcoming, helpful and friendly.We would definitely return and recommend.Thank you for an enjoyable family break.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Busy foyer but orderly Served quickly Some check in issues with my agency booking vs hotel records but sorted eventually and politely Room was large enough with plenty of storage , kettle and tea/coffeeNo view Step in bathtub in well lit clean bathroomWater pressure temp greatDidn’t use tv WiFi greatBed and pillows fineSome noise from outside & could hear people talk from street on 5th floorAnd some neighbors noise and housekeeping vacuuming at 630am!!So light sleepers bring ear plugsClock radio blue tooth and USB ports bonusGym and pool decent but doesn’t scream welcomingBuffet breakfast very busy but restocked quickly food fine but couldn’t taste the love and was $31Should of tried a local cafe insteadClose to trainsRemember use south end for less walkDidn’t loveDidn’t hateBeige
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was clean and big. I stayed 3 nights and enjoyed the free internet. Right out side the door was the buses or the train. The breakfast was excellent and the staff were like family. A hassle free place to stay. KFC across the road
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is so convenient to the central train station & the Hop on Hop off bus it was truly fantastic. We also were amazed by the dining we experienced with our complimentary breakfasts every morning! The rooms were more than adequate to suite our needs as well.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we walked the reception of all staff we encountered was a welcoming experience!The Concierge, Mohammed greeted us an offered to assist us in our exploring Sydney. The staff at the morning breakfast helped us start the day, smiling and offering great customer service.This was a great find and I highly recommend it. The hotel is clean, efficient and ideally situated to tour the city.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 3 days, next to central station very handy if you are catching train to and from the airport. Lots of shops nearby. Staff are great express check in check out. Offered unlimited Wifi. Will stay again. Rooms clean.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect position... 2 minutes walking distance from Central station.Regarding room as usual for this chain, bed and pillows were very good, unfortunately my room was old stile with a little bathroom and a not very good smelling carpet on floor(maybe full of dust). If you are hungry the restaurant doesn't give you food after 21.30pm and this is very strange for a four stars hotel.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney

review_body: Overall the room was clean and tidy but in the bathroom next to the soap holder there twas mould between the tiles and on the tiles outside the bath there was black mould for full of the tilesThis gave me the impression that this room had not been cleaned properly cleaned in a long time..
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we have stayed a few times here. great location .good restaurant. nice clean rooms especially the carpets. so many chains lack this. gosh what else do you want me to say. will always stay here when in the city . keep up the good work.
hotelName:
6    Mercure Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose the hotel due to proximity to central station and Darling Harbor and we were really impressed by what we got for our money. Very helpful staff and whilst we didn’t use it, catering looked good too.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location and staff, rooms clean and easy parking,friendly staff, very quiet even though built up area.However need warmer blankets, quilts.Also wider choice of tea, only had earl grey not everyone's favourite.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean and spacious room. Staff were very friendly and helpful and had no problems with us leaving our bag at the premises for a few hours on the day of check out. Great location, would recommend this hotel to everyone. Will definitely use the hotel again.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nothing to fault . renovation has freshened the rooms nicely staff were as helpful as usual with nothing a problem bit not in the way at all .. nice handy location near UTS quiet and spacious and very clean
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great two night's stay in quiet location within easy walking distance to Central Station and Darling Harbour. Can not fault the stay. Staff were friendly and helpful. Will certainly stay again.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice, clean and comfortable hotel walking distance from city center. Good value for the price. Reception works 24 hours so there are no issues with arrival and departure. Hotel has a restaurant, our room had nice balcony
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great overall service and cleanses top class staff remember us and made us feel welcome. Service was top as we were called when we left behind a iPad so we were able to return and collect it. Could not ask for better service.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Outstanding service from staff and absolutely stunning rooms, so roomy and clean. Will be our first choice of stay next time we come to Sydney. So affordable and in such a great location along a quiet street
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poor experience with a female receptionist not providing that exceptional, above and beyond customer service. And the fact my car was parked there all weekend, it ends up being vandalised. Definitely won’t be recommending this place.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just loved this place. The rooms were spacious and very clean, and the bed very comfortable. Thoroughly recommend it based on value, location and price. Close to Darling Harbour and the Sydney International Convention Centre (ICC) - perfect place to stay when attending conferences at the ICC.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here while in Sydney for an event. Was pleasantly surprised that the room and the bar and restaurant looked even better than the photos online! That never happens! The team were so welcoming and professional. The room was very clean, spacious and modern! Parking onsite for only $25! Will only stay here when visiting Sydney!
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A good value hotel near the city but easier to navigate to than some other hotels with friendly staff that were helpful and assisted without issue. Recommend for a person that needs to be near the city but not in the city quite location with off street parking.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I will come back again if I go to sydney with my fam or doing business because this hotel very2 good for the location,service,cleanliness,value,room.not far from hotel there is a very good Chinese restaurant
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location so easy to get into central Sydney and to and from the station. One of the few places where a family of five can stay, and great value for money. Very clean and tidy, decor looks new, couldn't have asked for more.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this motel is a hidden gem its tucked away in a leafy area and quite, it was a lovely short walk to darling harbour I'm happy i had chosen this motel the bar was nice and cosy and the staff wonderful the room was clean and glad there was no smoking
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good value, clean room, friendly and helpful staff. Quiet street but 10 minuets walking for restaurants. Airbus is easy to arriving in hotel and airport.It’s walking distance to Darling Harbour, China town and Pitt Steet shopping mall.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are clean and cosy. I much prefer a shower cubicle than a bath tub which can be quite dangerous for elderly customers otherwise I have no complaints with Aspire Metro. Will surely visit it again.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thankyou for a nice stay in this neighbourhood of Ultimo. Friendly staff and comfortable beds, very clean and great location. Easy walk to china town, central, darling harbour and Glebe cafes. See you again.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was clean and cozy! Staff is really helpful and nice. I will stay in this hotel if I visit city in the future. It is not far from central station. Many restaurants nearby. Chinese food, Japanese food, Thai Food.....even bubble tea shop .... I have spent good time in this hotel.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is incredible bang for your buck. They recently upgraded the whole hotel, so now all the furniture, bathroom fixtures and finishes in your room (and the whole hotel) are very modern, clean, and elegant. The bathroom is large and very clean. The bed is super comfy and massive (king size). The room comes with a large closet, iron, extra bedding, refrigerator, and a large HD smart TV that you can watch your Netflix on. Very comfortable. And the service here is excellent. Truly lovely employees. And way less expensive than their neighbors for a much newer and cleaner room.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable, modern and spacious room that we loved. But poor noise cancellation and unfriendly staff will make us hesitate to recommend this to friends. Hotel was about 15 min walk from Central station, not bad in cool weather.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Big room and friendly staff. Arrived in the early morning and room was made ready within an hour of arrival which was great service. Close proximity to public transportation and capital theatre which was greta
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, spacious and clean rooms, good value of money. Omar at the gumtree restaurant was so helpful to us. I was looking for the toothbrush and toothpaste but it was not included in their vanity kit.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From booking via email direct to the hotel to get the best price to friendly staff at the front counter, rooms so spacious, clean and well appointed you won't be disappointed with your stay at the Metro Aspire at Ultimo. Very easy to access from the Harbour Bridge and then car parking is directly under the hotel with easy access to reception via a lift. You are then situated within walking distance to Darling Harbour, the ICC and Chinatown, Captiol Theatre, Paddys Markets and Central Train Station. The hotel has an onsite restaurant and bar and serves delicous breakfasts with daily dinner specials. Once again thank you to the Mietro Aspire at Ultimo for looking after us again when staying in Sydney.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall is good. The area is quite and the bed is very comfortable. The room is clean. Located near china town, But not too close to tram station or bus station. Would highly recommended this place to my friends.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here as attending a concert at Darling Harbour. Excellent clean hotel. Bed comfortable, linen of good quality. Room had a balcony and view. Parking available at very reasonable cost- just a short walk to Central station or Darling Harbour. Leafy quiet street- cafes close by. loved it.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stafff . Good location close to central station, paddy market and China town. Also Glebe markets. clean and quiet. Breakfast was great. Very helpful and accomodating.What else can I say. I would recommend this hotel
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was very conveniently located, with nice refreshed rooms and very helpful staff. No problems checking in or out. It was very cost-friendly and we'll very probably stay there again next time we're in Sydney.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Metro Aspire is not only wonderfully located, just a quiet stroll to the busiest part of town, close to a myriad of dining experiences, shopping, the light rail, Central railway station and Darling Harbour. It's tucked away on a quiet little street that you don't even hear the traffic or bustle of city life. It has everything you need including a restaurant, a bar, and laundromat services. The staff are all great and happy and helpful, and the place is clean and orderly with no unnecessary clutter. This is my 4th stay and definitely not my last. Thanks Metro Aspire!!
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My second stay, and still very happy. The Rooms are clean and bed comfortable. The good food and diner deals makes it a great place to stay at night when your tired. Staff is friendly and helpful. Strongly recommend
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Aspire is a great motel very clean large rooms. Great staff and so close to the CBD without the hustle and bustle of the city. Rooms are very quiet and the beds are very comfortable. Would not hesitate recommendong The Aspire is a great stay
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent Room and Staff. The restaurant at the hotel is great as well. Great Experience.The only issue I faced was walking 1.5 km from station post work hours! Minus that everything was great. But, if you're find with walking, then all is great.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 21 nights and couldn't fault it at all. Lovely room which was just a perfect base for our holiday. All the staff were very friendly and helpful at every opportunity. The buffet breakfast was delicious as well as the dinner we ate a couple of times. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Was the perfect location as well, very central
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was fantastic, location was perfect. Hotel staff were really great. I even left an item by accident when checking out, and they managed to locate it and hold it for me while I came back to get it. Definitely above the call of duty.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good experience, nice and clean rooms with comfortable sized beds. Especially Thursday night's special Dinner offer (Penne with Meatballs) was awesome but unfortunately not available on regular menu on other nights.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my first trip to Australia and this property made it all worth it. Talk about going above and beyond. I came down as a birthday present to myself and Elaine and Jakesh (sorry if I butchered the spelling) are OUTSTANDING. They went a very and beyond in every way. I never expected what I saw when I walked in my room. Everything was crisp and clean and they made me feel really valued. Well done!
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: booked a family room for 5 and it was superb - 2 large doubles and a good single. clean, modern, good temperature, excellent staff, and great value for the location v other hotels we looked at. Very impressed.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent in all respects. Staff friendly, diligent and helpful. Good local knowledge of area by staff. Room was quiet, clean, spacious and well appointed. Very comfortable bed. Naturally ventilated, a big bonus in a big city.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed five nights at the Metro Aspire Sydney and I found the location convenient, in a quiet area not far from Darling Harbour. The room was big size with 2 large comfy beds, and a full bathroom with plenty of beauty and shower products. Sadly, even if the area is quiet, I cannot say the same with the hotel. We could hear the people and families from other rooms, when they went to bathrooms or were chatting, at every hours of the nights. It was not easy to sleep which is for me the most essential thing to do in a hotel. The cleaning was done every day but was far from being spotless, they really should improve that. Staff at the reception are very friendly and helpful though.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for three nights, the room was clean, larger than expected and the hotel was in a good location about 6 minutes walk from Paddies Markets and Darling Harbour. The staff were friendly and accommodating when we asked for breakfast bowls and spoons etc.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very well located , quite location for us , helpfull staff and value for money ,for us the full size bath was a real bonus , third visit for us ,and when we next visit sydney we would probably stay again
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For location that is out of the city but within walking distance this is your place. A short walk to China Town then onto the city! Bedding was top notch. Rooms were very clean. Parking was very reasonable $35 per day
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location which located near central station. The staff are very helpful the room is tidy and clean. The restaturant is good with reasonable price. I am willing to come back again！The food is good at restaurant！
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wall too thin. Noises from neighboring rooms, talking guests and television .Room not vacuumed daily, sheets also not changed daily. I myself work in the hotel industry, I noticed. Good service though.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights in first week April 2019. Rooms are spacious and have balcony for some fresh air and view.Really impressed with the location which is walking distance to central station, china town, shopping mall, gardens.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Couldn't fault this place, stayed 4 nights, VERY clean and rooms are very roomy, we ate at the restaurant it was quite good with great daily specials the pizza was not the greatest but it was ok. The location is good, close to China town and Darling Harbour, we walked every where only caught a taxi at night. Well done, keep up the great work!! Thank you for a comfortable stay
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had such a peasant stay here! The staff were friendly and the rooms were spacious to enjoy. It’s a pity that the rooms were fully booked when we wanted to extend our stay. Thank you for your hospitality!
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel in quiet street, great for central attractions like darling harbour and fish market, yet away from traffic noise. Great to see and hear birds in small nearby parks from hotel room. Hotel small enough to feel caring and personal.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location (we had never stayed at that end of Sydney before), easy walking distance to Darling Harbour and Chinatown. Highly recommend staying here if visiting the Powerhouse Museum, or seeing a show at ICC or Capitol Theatre. Staff are super helpful and friendly. Only issue we had, when we arrived the hotel carpark was full (a bit annoying when i had prepaid for parking), however, the reception staff let us park our car at the front of the hotel and called me a bit later on to advise that there were free parks in the underground carpark and we could move our car.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Metro Aspire Sydney exceeded my expectations. Well-located, well-equipped rooms, and friendly staff, all made my experience well worth it. It wasn’t my first choice when booking initially, but I’m glad I ended up there. Small touches like smart TVs, rapid toiletry replacement, etc., make a diffeeence, and, while I can’t recall her name, the Irish receptionist at both my check in and out was extremely friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The property is set on a quiet street next to a park. The restaurant has a beautiful garden atmosphere with live plants and running water. Staff were very accommodating and friendly, the room was large with comfortable beds, and a large bathroom with plenty of counter space and lighting. We also found the price was reasonable for the type of accommodation
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent but quiet location in Darling Harbour and only minutes walk from Sydney CBD. Many great restaurants and entertainment places all within walking distance. And, all these for a surprisingly great value for money to stay. What more can one ask for?
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is amazing value and so close to the city. The restaurant is surprisingly good, given that other hotel restaurants can be bland. Service was great. Room was excellent. Fresh milk in the in-roomfridge rather than UHT would have been nice.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So happy we selected this motel for our recent two night stay in Sydney. I was attending a course at UTS and it was a close walk to the building as well as Paddy's Markets. Darling Harbour was a comfortable ten minute walk. It was surprisingly quiet and the beds and pillows were very comfortable. Staff were welcoming and friendly and the restaurant had a calm and tranquil atmosphere.
hotelName:
7    Metro Aspire Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not just another city hotel - the service provided felt very personal; staff were warm and helpful (reception, concierge, bar staff and cleaner). Our room was quiet and comfortable. I'd happily return again to this hotel.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We luv this location close to Chinatown food heaven and great for shopping and whizzing about the city. Parking price is good too. Central station short walk for trains and down to ferries for getting around the harbor. Nice room with a pleasant garden area on pool floor. Couldn't fault any of it.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed here a few times on business and it was my goto again for this trip, which was more pleasure, than business. The location is excellent, a short walk from Central Station under a mostly covered walkway/tunnel - and I just happened to be going to the ABC studios across the road that evening - even better! The welcome is so lovely - and the complimentary, freshly baked cookies and green apple were yum and most appreciated. The room is bright and roomy (2 king beds) and very comfortable. All the amenities you need. My only gripe is that the bar was closed when I came back at around 10:30 - which seems very early for a hotel bar? I got a glass of wine from room service but not the same (& not the best drop tbh!). It's a shame as there is a really nice wee bar area for socialising - they do great coffees too. As an add-on note, I attended a client event here last year (they had the Love is Love stiletto in the foyer which was superb!) and it was excellent too - the staff were so great - canapés and drinks very good. Highly recommended for events (1st floor).
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in central Sydney this Novotel is more of a business hotel.Rooms were average.No special upgrades were offered as a premium gold Accor member however the staff & service was good. Breakfast range is good and service prompt.In case one is travelling for holiday would suggest to stay closer to Darling Harbour.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A comfortable hotel with great facilities, friendly and efficient staff, nice large rooms , great toiletries. The hotel as a heart buffet breakfast with good choices plenty of newspapers for guests. Check in was quick and easy and my accor membership was recognised with complimentary water , a drink voucher for use during stay and a sweet treat waiting in the room.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited the hotel in May 2019 along with family and friends (40 pax). Wifi is unlimited and free. Rooms have fridge, tv, iron, locker, teamaker, hair dryer. Breakfast is good, swimming pool and gym on the 9th floor. Walking distance from Darling harbour and Casino. Nearest Indian restaurant Jaipur. Woolworths next door. Next to Technology institute. good service. 3 key operated elevators. Temperatures around 15 degree celsius. Is more than 20 years old and has more than 200 rooms.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for a quick weekend getaway. Location was great close to everything we needed. We were greeted by friendly staff and check in was a breeze. It was a special weekend for us and the staff left us a gift and a hand written card. Buffet breakfast was awesome. Will definitely be back.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location near the city central and the central station.Lots of shop and restaurants nearby.Includes small gym with very basic set of equipment. Good quality breakfast.Rooms clean, nice view at least from highest floor executive room.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very pleasant stay, the staff was friendly, breakfast was very good, central location, easy to find, little touches in the room were much appreciated.- would recommend staying here and we will certainly be back
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here last Friday night as our Flight had been cancelled. The staff were so lovely and friendly and OMG the room was spacious and the mattress was the most comfortable mattress we had ever slept on! ( I'd love to know what kind please) our meal was nice and the breakfast next morning was also great.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed at this hotel several times and I cannot say enough about the fabulous staff! They are friendly, helpful and thoughtful. This is a well organised, clean and well managed hotel. The rooms are spacious and the beds are comfortable. Breakfast is varied and the coffee is great!
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have stayed at this Hotel many times, the location is excellent, close to transport, shops and restaurants. The Hotel’s rooms are clean and spacious and the restaurant is great. The staff are friendly and welcoming, very helpful and obliging. Returning to this Hotel is a pleasure when the service is so outstanding.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is good, if you want to be close to the station. The hotel looks old, but updated. The room was not very clean as when we move the bed towards the wall we saw some dirt below. But the best was staff. From reception till restaurant staff were very kind and helpful
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I upgraded to a balcony room on level 8 after seeing the website photos. On entry to my particular room it was apparent their interpretation of a balcony and mine (and the dictionary's) are quite different. This was more of a tiny patio looking out to a plain non-descript terrace with a sad grass field and a few bushes. There was no view to speak of. To even get to the 'balcony' from the room one had to step over a fair ledge. If when booking this hotel and requesting a balcony room check if its on level 8 and if yes, then politely decline.The room size was however generous but the bathroom was tiny and if one has any balance or mobility issues or is on the larger side, give these rooms a miss as it requires some contortions to get into the shower stepping across the toilet and over the bathtub and twisting to get to the shower. A couple of handrails should be mandatory to assist guests.The lobby and the staff is where the hotel makes up lost ground. The happy hour specials in both food and drinks were fabulous. Jess behind the bar was brilliant.One point does require a special mention. At front of house the hotel has employed a young lady with an intellectual disability to welcome people through the doors into the hotel. She was immaculately presented and did a great job. To give someone with a disability an opportunity to be the face of caring humanity in a modern workplace deserves high praise. Well done Novotel.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently had 3 wonderful nights at the Novotel Sydney Central.Super impressed with the friendly service here - from the minute we arrive - even the doorman was super friendly and even offered my children cookies!Love the spacious family rooms and kids area in the foyer. The kids also couldn't get enough of the pool.Whilst not in the heart of the city centre, we could still walk to all the attractions or catch the train or bus when we were too tired to walk.Definitely would stay again.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed here for the weekend and found the hotel very comfortable. We dined in tne restaurant for dinner and our meal was very enjoyable. We found breakfast was very limited, however we only paid $1 each for it so cant really complain, the coffee was great. Hotel is in a great location and close to so mamy attractions, Capitol Theatre, Darling Harbour , Paddys markets, Chinatown.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 2 nights here for business. Property located close to Central Station, handy to trains & also within easy walking distance (10 mins) of Darling Harbour precinct. Property is appointed & equiipped to a fairly basic level, but consistent with the Novotel brand. Menus are limited in choice & servings were quite small, but quality was quite acceptable. Value for $ was stretching it with $32 mains & then optional 'sides' making a steak & vegetables a $40 plate. There are many other options, particularly Asian restaurants, nearby which I would explore if I go back again.Room was clean & comfortable. Bed provided a good nights sleep & bathrooms were adequate.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great hotel option if you are catching a bus or train into sydney and want to be close to central station. Easy to find with fast check in. Rooms are lacking personality but were clean enough. No complaints
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I will start with the only advantage, that is hotel staff. They are really helpful and friendly. The hotel rooms are ok, but toilet and bathtub are very small. While washing hands in bowl your body touches the lavatory. There is electric kettle in the room. But not enough choice of tea or coffee.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a couple of days before a cruise and fiund this hotel to be lacking any soul and needing a good paint job all over. Not of usual 4 star quality for Accor hotels. Not one picture in any hallway or room which highlighted the dings and scuffs on all walls everywhere. Bathroom ridiculously small ut room was a good size which makes me think why didnt they give just a little more room in bathroom. Toilet is hard up against the bathtub/shower and water leaks all over it and floor as glass barrier on bath shower not large enough to stop water going everywhere. Staff were nice and helpful but for a hotel over $250 a night this was very disappointing.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived after 8pm 3 staff in foyer putting decorations up for Gay parade - we were completely ignored by them had to make 3 trips to take suitcases up stairs as there was no ramp and no assistance by staff.Very bad customer greeting
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a two night stay in the Novotel Sydney Central and it was excellent. It was convenient to everything in Sydney central including walking distance to Darling Harbour, and the ferries at circular Quay, nice staff and nice accommodation, with an excellent breakfast .
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well appointed very large rooms with a modern gym and pool. Rooms on the 8th floor open onto a large roof top court yard. Close to Central Station, a five minute walk with an abundance of cafes and restaurants nearby.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Made very welcome our room was ready for us on arrival and also had late check out and that was great. Room was large and comfortable The Hotel is very well situated close to Central Station, Darling Harbor and Paddies Markets and China Town
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Handy hotel lovely staff but worst room ever in Novotel hotel small bathroom shower over bath very hard to get into nice big beg close to bedroom wall that left about 20 feet of room with one chair and no lighting except 2 over bed when sitting in chair at night could not see to undo shoe laces and no chance of reading. .Ot.her Novatel we have stayed at have had a sofa and standard lamp in the room.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For a quick business trip needing to be close to the University of Technology Sydney, this hotel is reasonably easy access from the airport on the train. It’s a basic 3 star hotel, reasonably comfortable bed and adequate room amenities. The breakfast buffet was average, although service quite good, good coffee (always a winner) with eggs cooked to order, not always available.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The friendly service right from reception to breakfast the next morning was excellent. All staff greeted you and were very helpful. Great breakfast,perfect location for us as we were going to a concert by nearby train. Upon entering our room we also had a lovely card,balloon, lamington to celebrate Australia Day with. It’s these little touches that made my day and will definitely book with the Novotel again.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visiting Sydney there's an abundance of hotels to select from. The Novotel Sydney Central had a few strengths that made us select it. First of all the location was good, central but not too busy. Compared to some other hotels it also offered pretty decent value for money while offering the necessities.The common areas appear to have been fairly recently renovated or at least "refreshed". The rooms and the corridors do have show that it is perhaps not the most modern. We were still satisfied with the room as it was clean, everything worked well and the beds were comfortable. The rooms also had enough space for it to not feel cramped. The views from the upper floors were also pretty nice.The pool was pretty small so not for swimming laps in but it served its purpose for us and we liked that it was also warm enough. The fitness center also had everything that was needed.Breakfast at the hotel was pretty good, they had a good mix of both hot and cold food. There were fresh juices and some of the hot dishes were rotated every other day. Still it would have gotten a bit boring if it would not have been for the option to order some omelette or other egg dishes. Overall still a good breakfast.One of the main strengths of the hotel was also the service. We constantly felt that everyone we interacted with were helpful, friendly and genuinely seemed to like working there. When it also feels genuine it really makes the stay so much better.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location for transport was excellent and the staff warm and welcoming. We had a very comfortable stay with a great breakfast. We would definitely stay there again when next we visit Sydney and have recommended it to friends.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Being a Novotel, the standard is assured, but this Site delighted me for I well remember the meat company that occupied the site. Indeed the historic facade has been utilised for the hotel’s restaurant “FieldHouse” entrance. I was impressed by the view from the restaurant through the expansive lobby to the front entrance steps.I was greeted by a uniformed doorman who never failed to notice my approaching entrances and exits throughout my stay.Checking in was most friendly, as indeed were all the staff I met. A real positive for this hotel is the staff who displayed an enthusiasm that is not always seen.During my stay I ate in the hotel restaurant and found there was always a table available. For my first meal, I chose the rump and medium rare was exactly medium rare. The menu was adequate in choice.My room had a Nespresso pod machine - just like home!The room was a good size but I felt the bathroom was on the small side. Not much room for a larger person! Also the shower was over a bath with a glass screen. With a cramped bathroom, it could have been a safety issue I felt.The room however was in the Novotel vogue, very clean and well-presented even though there were a couple of chips in the doors and fittings. Some guests must be quite careless in their stay.Would I stay again? You bet! It was a real treat.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent service - always a pleasure!We have stayed quite a few times and have always enjoyed our stay.The staff at check-in and check-out are always helpful.Great accommodation for families - location is perfect - not too busy.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is always very pleasant and the staff member on the front Brado (I think that's what his name is) is a true asset to your hotel. Everything is always lovely, however this time I was left disappointed at breakfast. Firstly the lady who was seating everyone actually forgot about us and then once we were seated we had to walk around the coffee and drink counter to get to the food because the pancake machine is in the most inconvenient spot and no one could get through if there were people waiting there or at the cereal station. This was especially difficult as there were many people seated in the breakfast area and we couldn't walk between the tables. I had to ask for plates to be brought out and then had to ask for bowls to be brought out also even after I waited in case they were on their way. The hotel though is great and like I said the staff are always amazing. Will certainly return :-)
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay, wonderful staff and amenities. Hotel is walking distance to public transport which is very convenient and the hotel also has excellent car parking. Thanks to Nicolette for the warm welcome.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Walked into the Novotel Sydney Central for breakfast. Loved the buffet, best $32 spent with barista made coffee, freshly made juice and eggs cooked to your liking. Great food and excellent service. Belinda was wonderful. She made a delicious hot chocolate, the best I’ve ever had. Definitely coming back again.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked last minute and were very happy with paying just over $200 a night in an excellent location in the city during peak season. We had a standard room which was nicely presented, although the colour scheme was very dated and the bathroom extremely compact. Staff in reception were fine, not overly friendly, though the housekeeping and bellboys we encountered were lovely. Wi-Fi is at a charge, which I find ridiculous given it's not a premium service and is free in most motels and hostels these days. Would definitely stay again if we found the right deal.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights over New Year’s eve.The hotel is 5 minutes walk from Central station so that is convenient. Its 30minutes walk to the Opera House. I stayed over New Year’s eve so the price of the stay was quite high, however when I arrived, I was offered an upgrade to an Executive suite for free (I had paid for a standard room). This was a nice surprise. So I ended up with a very spacious room and a balcony. The room was simple but comfortable and clean. Plenty of water bottles left in the room everyday. On New Years eve they also left a bottle of champagne in the room!The staff were all very helpful.The breakfast selection was more limited than other hotels I have stayed in Sydney but that was ok.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Xmas present to watch BBL cricket also handy to Darling Harbour, Accorplus member, Nicolette looked after us well with upgrade and extra refreshments.Lovely high floor room with good view, tasty well priced dinner, breakfast very popular would stay again for sure.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean hotel with friendly, helpful staff. Pool a little small and can become congested. Breakfast has a good variety. Happy hour pleasant at the end of a day of sightseeing. Extended check out appreciated with kids.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed at this hotel multiple times as a family and had another great stay. The staff are very accommodating and always welcoming. The hotel is well located to china town and central and walking distance to the great things Sydney has to offer. The hotel has a nice pool that the kids enjoyed and a great buffet breakfast that the whole family enjoyed.Thanks Kevin for looking after us on our return stay, we will return again :-)
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location. Superb breakfast. Friendly staff. Very quiet. Could not find fault!! Would definitely stay in this hotel again. Central station is approximately 10 minutes walk away. Dinner very nice, no good restaurants within walking distance.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hi, Stayed at the hotel for 15 nights as part of Corporate , and really loved the services. The location is near to Central station, and not too far from Darling Harbour, which is good.There are a few unique facilities which I loved about this hotel are:> The fresh fruit juicer is an awesome thing, where guests who don't want to have added sugar with canned juices can prepare fresh juices, with wide variety of fruits.> The microwave facility in the room for long staying guests really helps the vegetarians who want to prepare some food on their own in the room.> The washing machine at 9th floor is great for those who don't want to spend huge amounts in laundry.> Special Mention: Breakfast staff Hannah, who helped to arrange vegetarian options for me, even when they were not part of the menu, which was a breather for me, as I had limited options in the menu.Overall, it was a great place to stay, and would recommend this hotel to everyone.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family of 4. Staying 3 nights with teenage children. I was honestly sceptical about whether I made the right decision to stay all together in one room. Our stay was very pleasant. Plenty of room we had 2 queen size beds with a balcony. The staff smartly placed us on the same floor as the pool. Terrific for the kids but also terrific for us parents. Food options in the area are endless. Take your pick everything in short walking distance. Went to a great market in Chinatown on Friday night kids loved trying all the different foods. Myself and my husband enjoyed a wine in the bar area on two occasions. Lovely friendly staff. Supermarket and bottle shop for essentials 2 mins walk away. Breaky was nice, barista made coffee and eggs anyway order takin as you are seated. Buffet was all the normal breaky options. Loved the addition of juicer. Our room was serviced to an exceptional level everyday whilst we were out exploring. Parking was also easy and cheaper than most other hotels in the city. Great stay would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 4 nights for business, have stayed here a few times. Convenient to darling precinct for work without the crowds you get closer to the George st area. Also stacks of food options, mainly Asian but darling harbour only 10 mins walk. I emailed the hotel a room request a few days before my stay. The request was met and exceeded (thank you nicollete) and all staff through my stay provided outstanding service. The rooms are slightly dated but completely clean. Great stay, will certainly stay again and recommend.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for five nights and loved it. We had a room on the 17th floor. Quiet, clean and spacious. No complaints at all. The hotel is well located within walking distance to Central train station, Paddy's Markets and George Street.The lounge/foyer area is good for a relaxing drink taking advantage of the happy hour specials. If you have kids there is a kids corner in the lobby area too, with toys and a TV playing kids' movies. There are plenty of places to eat in the area and a Woolworths Metro just a few minutes walk away.The staff were excellent, all very welcoming and friendly. Special mention to Lydia the Assistant Manager. We would definitely recommend Novotel Sydney Central.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I took my grand daughter to Sydney for her 16th birthday present and before we booked in I did speak to staff at Novotel Central and told them my reason for going to Sydney. Staff told me they would have a little surprise for my grand daughter and I just expected an A4 typed sign welcoming my grand daughter. But No. Matt, the concierge welcomed us with "You must be Madeline, happy birthday!" The lady who booked us in wished my grand daughter happy birthday and that it was lovely to have us. When we got to our room, we were delighted to find a birthday cake, card, a number 16 balloon and a happy birthday balloon as well. My grand daughter was so surprised and happy. So thank you so much Novotel Central, our stay was wonderful and yes, the staff and cleanliness of the hotel was excellent. Close to Central railway station, Paddy's Market and George Street. Thank you again, you made my grand daughter so happy. It was a pity we could not take the balloons home on the plane!
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great 4-star hotel, large rooms, fully equipped, with lots of amenities. Welcome fresh fruit plate.Impressive buffet breakfast, with choice eggs cooked at the moment. Employees are extremely kind and helpful.But all that has a price.. I don't know Sydney standards, but the city did not struck me as more expensive that any European capital. I have been in similar hotels for 60% the price.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice stay. I booked for breakfast but was unable to have breakfast due to flights being booked after the Hotel. The hotel was unable to reimburse me for the breakfasts. I suppose better planning on my behalf next time.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we have just spent two nights in Sydney for a couple of shows,we stayed at the Novotel syd/ceetral what a great decision. the staff EXCELLENT location EXCELLENT restaurant VERY GOOD if you need to stay in town for a show this is the place, close to light rail,Sydney markets fish markets china town and central station only had one problem the bathroom was very small the room was a good size and parking available at a reasonable price
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed many times at the Novotel Sydney Central. I stay there whenever I'm in Sydney for business or fun. I keep going back for so many reasons. It all started with the location. Close enough to Chinatown, Paddys Markets, Darling Harbour and QVB but just far enough away (about a block) from the hustle and bustle. Unless I have questions I usually book online. Check in is never a problem. The Staff are wonderful. Such pleasant folk. Nothing is a problem and they always assure my keys and room are ready. They even know my favorite rooms (I recommend the Eighth Floor. Overlooking the garden) Thanks to lovely Housekeeping staff My room is always comfortable and clean. If I request extra tea and milk it's there waiting. I always feel looked after and valued. I'm never really ready to check out and go home so when that time comes Reception are always happy to extend my parking until I've popped into Chinatown to do some last minute shopping at Paddy's Markets or pick up some local delicacies. All in all a booking at Novotel Sydney Central assures me I'll enjoy my stay in Sydney.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly staff in all departments, check in and out, room housekeeping, bar and breakfast area. Good room with a comfortable bed and a walk in shower as requested. Good breakfast with a lot of variety.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Attentive, friendly and helpful staff that came from all walks of life and all levels of ability. We stayed in a King Executive Suite - spacious open plan style room. Comfortable soft king bed, plus a sofa bed, and an extra king single was brought in so that my teenage daughters didn’t have to share a bed. Missed having power points on both sides of the bed. Was greeted with a lovely fruit platter and bottle of wine on arrival. A good buffet breakfast was included in our package but limited gluten free options noted on the breakfast and particularly lunch/dinner/room service menus. Quick lifts a bonus! Handy CBD location with short walk (7 mins) to Central train station (which takes you everywhere around Sydney at reasonable prices) and also only a short walk (12min) to Darling Harbour.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in a King Suite with balcony. Unfortunately, the room amenities are very basic. For the price I would expect bath robes, something more than sachets of blend 43 and perhaps a biscuit or two. Mini bar items are crazy expensive. Bathroom is very pokey with the climb out of the shower over the bath and around the toilet quite an obstacle course. Paid the extra at the time of booking for the breakfast but would not have done this in hindsight. This option is not good value considering what is available including if you just ordered off the restaurant's own breakfast menu and paid the set cost per item.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exceptional staff at the Novotel Central – on arrival was a a little concerned about the steps but one of the staff was there to help immediately with my bag. Friendly check-in – nice to find I was allocated a most comfortable room with a balcony on a high floor. Room was large, well appointed with all that is required including nice toiletries.The hotels location doesn't allow for brilliant views but isn't boxed in as some city hotelsThe hotels central location is brilliant for Chinatown, Central Station or a short walk to George Street for buses or walk the other way and light rail to Darling Harbour and Sydneys famous Paddy's Market. Easy walk from here to the Capital Theatre, amazing Jersey Boys on while we were there.Great happy hour drink prices – didn’t get to try the restaurant but appeared to be nice menu.Breakfast was very hectic while I was there but I coincided with a large tour group, not an enormous food selection but appreciated barista coffee.As stated earlier I found staff throughout the hotel to be exceptionally friendly & helpful, a big plus for a city hotel and most certainly wouldn’t hesitate to stay again.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff looked after me from my arrival to departure.Phillip made my checking in very easy. I asked to borrow cutlery and he suggested that I call reception and they will send it to my room. I called reception the following morning and they sent a plate and cutlery to my room within minutes.Mi tip for convenience and to save money on meals. There is a Woolworths supermarket close by if you want to buy food.
hotelName:
8    Novotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hubby and I thoroughly enjoyed our 4 nights stay on Level 31 - Harbour bridge viewThe Horizon Club staff are very friendly and we always experienced first class service from Sheikh. Sheikh was always approachable and ensured our every need was metI will highly recommend anyone in staying here, many thanks
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: With all the hype and hoopla surrounding the London shangrila at the iconic ‘shard’, the anticipation and expectations from this shangrila at Sydney were in ‘high octave’ mode! The reception was modest — not opulent- London shangrila standard; first impressions matter and this one was pretty insipid lacking oomph !We were checked in early at 8.30 - it was courteous, professional but without a smile and a bit clinical We had booked the harbour and opera house view ( paid a bomb!) and the views were peerless and spectacular - unrivalled! Phil at the concierge was quick, receptive and personalised the 4 day trip for us - shangrila standards! The breakfast however was chaotic — with stressful waiters running around like headless chickens, sweat on their brow , fidgety and skittish with little attention to customer needs — this was the most underwhelming segment of the stay —- worse than a ‘ best western ‘ experience You pay for those panoramic - behemoth views; rest of the shangrila is passable as a 4 star
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Second time I’ve stayed here just for a one night stay in Sydney and while it’s nice, there’s nothing remotely unique or special to set it apart from any of the other similar range hotels in Sydney. We stayed purely for the location as it is walking distance to the Opera House and The Four Seasons was not available. If you don’t need the location I would shop around. Definitely not worth the price.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 1 night (on a Sunday) and it was pretty quiet. Room and bathroom are very big, views are amazing (Harbour Bridge upgraded view) and service quite friendly.I would definitely recommend this hotel for the room size and excellent view.The location is alright, but it's a steep uphill walk from Circular Quay, and the entrance is not so prominent.There were some minor issues - a pillow was uneven (I have a sensitive neck), the shower leaked (and made a puddle), and the time on the clock was wrong (and couldn't be fixed). These are common, but annoying issues.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with my family. I love the location and the view of the Harbour Bridge. Great location because you can walk to the opera house, shopping malls and many restaurants. Fantastic hotel, and I love the indoor pool.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The central booking staff lied about the location of our suite. We were sold on a suite that was between level 18 to 29. We explained it was for my partners birthday celebration and we wanted the highest suite available. We booked 3 weeks ahead and I was told that because it was a special occasion that they would ensure the highest level available for the suite we booked. When we arrived we were give the suite on level 10 and dismissed by the staff when we explained we had booked the higher floor. After making us wait 1.5hours and numerous calls from our suite on level 10 we were moved to level 20. The service was disgusting and not to the level expected. We had to buzz room service 3 times to get a bucket of ice which took about 40mins. I had organised to have the room decorated and a birthday cake for my partner which they had committed to have ready for us on arrival. The room was decorated but no cake to be seen. It would be one of my worst experience staying at a hotel. They did (after some pressure from my partner) provide us with a bottle of nice champagne and several small desserts. I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for one night and can't complain about anything. Valet parking and check in quick with polite and friendly staff who were eager to help. Huge room with a great view, comfy bed and fantastic pillows. Afternoon cakes delicious and a great breakfast. Check out was again smooth and efficient. We'll definitely be back. Thanks Shangri La!
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here a few times.Our favourite hotel in Sydney,staff are always great and very welcoming.The club lounge has some of the best views in Sydney.A bit pricey but great if you can do it. Bar 36 is well worth a visit even if your not staying at the hotel.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel room and service was outstanding. The pool was everyone’s dream and the gym had so much variety and made me feel so energetic. Cheap and worth it. Amazing food and room view. The staff was so friendly and will definitely be coming back. I recommend.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had been so excited to stay here, but in the end found my stay underwhelming, given my high expectations. Many little things just didn’t come together: the conditioner bottles in the room I was staying in were empty, the elevators were under repair and so those still in service were very slow, there was some mildew in the shower, and my “harbor view” room in fact overlooked a noisy highway over which you could partially see Darling Harbor.Overall, the facilities were clean and the staff were professional. However, given the price, I wouldn’t stay here again.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked through Expedia for 2 nights mid May 2019. Checked in at 2 pm, was given a room on the 13th floor with beds exactly as requested and water view (not the opera house / harbour view). This view is beautiful as well though, no worries if you're on that side of the hotel. The room was spotless with a big flat screen tv, mini bar, kettle, fridge, coffee/tea maker, everything was fully stocked. The bathroom was trimmed in marble and stone with a large solid wood vanity, big sink, huge vanity mirror, big bathtub where you could easily bath and drink champagne (I did of course) & separate shower. I really enjoyed primping in there for my nights out on the town. The location is walking distance to opera house and Circular Quay and many restaurants. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub but the chemicals in the hot tub were so strong even the steam burned my eyes and I didn't stay in for long. Still, did enjoy the facilities, the gym is well equipped and not many people using it. Now, to my favourite feature of this hotel, the bar on the 34th floor. We went up there both nights and enjoyed the view and the ambiance immensely. It isn't as expensive as you'd expect for a bar with this kind of drop dead gorgeous view. The cost of the room for 2 nights was around the $500 US and it was worth it just for the view from the bar. You can, of course, enjoy the bar without staying in the hotel. But for the fact that I could get ready in my beautiful room, put on my stilettos and go up in the elevator to that bar with that killer view for my cocktails was worth every penny. Because you can't walk around Sydney in stilettos unless you want to end up with a broken leg (cobble stone sidewalks, etc, ha ha). We didn't have much contact with the staff, only a couple of buckets of ice brought up, 1st time took 5 minutes, 2nd time took 30 minutes. The check-in and check-out agents were perfunctory, courteous and everything went smoothly. I would likely stay at this hotel again when travelling to Sydney.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying here currently and though the property is nice there do seem to be quite a few issues with services..Went for breakfast.. and had a first with my sister being told that she could not come into the restaurant wearing room slippers.. we've stayed at top notch hotels and never had this complaint to us. After which she changed into her own slippers..We ordered eggs at our table, after sitting for like 25 mins.we got up to leave and then they arrived.. we were quite infuriated by this time as we were waiting with my 3 and 5 year old sons.. and waiting to feed them too..I have complimentary breakfast with my room stay but I'm definitely not eating here again. The service is very poor though the staff do try hard.. they just seem to be understaffed or just too many orders. The best option would be to have table nos. And a live egg station so that people order their eggs at one place.. and everyone gets their order in the serial no. Which they have ordered.We had to wait for like 10 mins for our turn at check in.. when we arrived after 4 PM. I had made the reservation through the fine hotels program of amex platinum so did get the upgrade offer. Which was fine.The 36th floor bar keeps the lifts so busy most of the times that I was frustrated half the time waiting for the lift or waiting for one with some room in it.Over all I'm not going to be coming back here on a business or family trip ever again. Rather I'd try a new hotel.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here nights 19/20th June. On arrival we were greeted with lovely, attentive concierge. Our toddler was given a little koala and was happily distracted during check-in. All the staff we met were friendly and kind. The room was a very good size and bed comfortable. Beautiful views. Very clean. Location was ten minutes walk to inner CBD. Would definitely recommend staying here for business or for family trips away. Or for any reason really- it’s a great place to stay :-) Thank you to the wonderful staff. Very helpful and certainly an asset to the hotel. The customer service could not be faulted. Definitely will be back next time we head up to Sydney.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I returned here after many years and it was not a lot changed, and still quite expensive. It’s location is wonderful for views but not for those who may be challenged with mobility. Staff were young and I don’t think we saw an Australian for our 3 night stay. The beds were unbelievable. Not really a place for families but very comfy.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were left disappointed after paying just shy of 1k for a two night stay. On arrival the queues at reception were terrible and check in was an extremely lengthy process.
