Elevators were terrible! (Yes, I know you’re upgrading them but a bit late!). The room was clean but dated and view was very good. Later that night we arrived at the blu bar where there were lots of empty tables and a sign saying reservations only. When I asked I was shocked to be informed of a minimum spend policy: “Those tables along there are $150 and over there $200”. Whoever decided that this would be a good idea needs to be fired. Weeks earlier I had emailed the hotel asking if there was a requirement to reserve these tables and I did not receive a response. Anyway, knowing that I was going to spend in excess of the minimum spend I took a table and ordered a bottle of champagne and afterwards some additional drinks. The service was too slow. The following night we went to Blu for a drink in advance of going out for dinner and sat across from the bar and the service was horrifically slow. Adding to that there were two powered speakers on stands blaring music. The audio quality wasn’t good, it was intrusive and somewhat reminded me of what it’s like to attend a party with a mobile DJ. We used the leisure facilities which were clean but basic. No sauna or steam. The neighboring Four Seasons offers a much more luxurious and exclusive experience. My advice to the hotel? Examine the detail and consider the overall experience. Figure out how to make your check in process more efficient... it can be done!! Don’t think it’s alright to charge five star prices and then insult guests with minimum spend rules for tables in your bar. Two stars given for location and view.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Terrible is an understatement. They rely purely on their view and location. The service is non existent and their facilities are just awful. On arrival, nobody to welcome you in the driveway, inside, the concierges are having a chat amongst themselves, nobody welcomed us or assist with bags. Check in was horrific. Long queues and undertrained staff. Then, came our first experience with the lifts. The wait for them each time is a joke. This happened every single time we needed to go up or down.The view from the room was nice but that was about it. Ageing furniture, carpets and cleanliness was below par. Wanted to play some music but no Bluetooth speaker. Some sad alarm clock on the bed side table where you can put your phone on (see photo attached) but wait... unless you have an iPhone 4 or earlier it won’t work as it is the old charger. Guys, Apple changed those in 2012! When you charge $900 a night, surely you can replace it with newer technology. It has been 7 years! Went out to dinner and decided to go to blu bar for a night cap. We used to live in Sydney 10 years ago and it was the place to be. Cocktails, service and atmosphere were on point. It seems it has aged as gracefully as the alarm clock. Service was terrible.... cocktails took forever and it wasn’t busy. We sat in the lounge and were told the window tables are reserved for a minimum spend. I guess the $900 for the room didn’t cut it. During the entire time we were there, that table remained unoccupied. Service in that bar was disgraceful.We bought a room with the horizon club access. Only used it for brekkie and I wish we didn’t spend the extra $. Again, the staff were clueless and the wait was way too long. We grabbed a pastry and walk away. Overall, this place is a dump. If they didn’t have the location and view, they would put the keys under the door as any other offering, product or service is nonexistent. Shangri la, you’ll never see an other dollar from me.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived and looking forward to world renowned Shangrila experience. Nice room, bathroom and bed. That’s the good part. After that the service experience and in house breakfast left much to be desired. Service staff surly and unhelpful when asked for assistance. What a shame really. If I could have done the self service option I would have but couldn’t. The restaurant mandates you order eggs, coffee from the staff which they weren’t very willing to help. Have stayed at shangrilas in other countries and this is the first time that I experienced such poor standards. After ordering in room meals, was charged additional costs that have not been refunded despite several interactions with different staff that said it would be done. Very terrible and outright unprofessional!Please stay away from this Shangri-la and not let it ruin your experience
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I decided to spend a night at the Shangri-La Hotel Sydney to celebrate my Birthday and enjoy Vivid. We booked a harbour view room for $680. For the room rate we were expecting something special but unfortunately our experience was the opposite. We arrived at the hotel at 3pm, and the reception was in chaos. We waited 30 minutes just to check in and there was no-one there to assist with bags. There is some lift maintenance happening that made matters worse but that can't be helped. I guess. After settling in our room we called reception to order some ice so that we could have a drink. We waited nearly an hour just to get some ice and a bucket. The rooms were very tired and certainly not what Id expect from a room costing $680..We decided to go to Blu bar in l36. The bar was also in a state of chaos. The bar was understaffed and eventually we were given a table. We waited 30 minutes to be served and gave up and left, deciding to get a drink outside the hotel. We went down for breakfast the next day and the same issues continued. They were clearly understaffed and we waited 20 minutes just to get a table. Breakfast was OK but very forgettable. I expect more from this group as they are supposed to be under new management. my birthday celebration and vivid experience was underwhelming to say the least. I would not recommend this hotel. Julian McDermott
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Immediately upon check-in, the feeling of Shangri-La came through. Had a king size room directly facing the Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House with a bench built into the window. Room was huge with all the bits expected from a Shangri-La. Silvano at the breakfast buffet was gracious every morning and kept his calm during the busy mornings and demanding guests. Excellent fully equipped gym, calming swimming pool (except when children were around), relaxing jacuzzi. I was greeted by name at each encounter with staff and for such a large busy hotel I was impressed. The bar on the 36th floor needs to work out flow of service. It wasn't very busy and with all the mixology and complicated cocktails, it slowed down service.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our delux king suite was fabulous with the best views from the 29th floor, large sitting room and large bathroomWell appointed, clean, comfy bed Highly recommended for couples who would like a treat in a high end hotel
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve stayed here a few times and as a hotel the rooms are amazing and best views, but the bar needs to work out how to serve people. Twice in last week sat down and waited ages for drinks, 45 minutes for cocktails last night, it was busy but not crazy, just seemed that have no clue how to work a bar and ensure people get drinks in a reasonable time. Two drinks in over two hrs, we gave up after that and left!! Not what expected after how good previous stats have been.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We paid for a better room with a nice view of the Sydney Opera house and access to the Horizon Club Lounge came with the room. The reason for this review is that the staff in the Horizon Club Lounge provided us with amazing service. Even though it was often near full, nonetheless they remembered me what I liked and disliked from one visit to the next. Thoroughly recommended :-)
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Shangri-La Sydney is in a great location away from the busy streets but close enough to walk to the harbour and the Opera House. The rooms are spacious and then service is everything you would expect from a Shangri-La hotel.It takes about 35 minutes in an Uber to get from the airport to the hotel with a bit of traffic. Check-in was quick and our bags were brought up to the room straight away.We stayed in a Premier Sydney Harbour Room for an anniversary stay. I can say with almost certainty that the views from this room over the harbour and the Opera house are some of the best views from any city hotel in the world. The room was nice and spacious with a large bathroom and a very powerful shower. We were given a complimentary bottle of Champaign for our anniversary stay.The location of the hotel is perfect, it takes about 25 minutes to walk to the botanical gardens, and about 10 minutes shorter to walk to the harbour. The street on which the hotel is located has a couple of local pubs with an amazing Japanese teppanyaki place on the corner.The hotel bar on the top floor of course had awesome views but the bar itself was a little disappointing. It is small for a start, and it takes ages to get a drink as there are literally two guys making cocktails. Good to pop up, but annoying to stay. There are enough late-night bars in the main financial district to not have to stay in the hotel anyway.There is no other bar in the hotel, which is surprising as there is usually a lobby bar in Shangri-la hotels. There is a a café in the lobby for lunchtime snacks but I felt the menu was a little basic and bland.Check out was easy and we were able to get a taxi to the airport.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the last of three hotels we booked on our Australian vacation. This was actually the hotel we were looking forward to the most. We were very disappointed. Check-in was slow, they couldn’t find our booking off of two of our names, and the credit card which I had pre-paid with...the. When they finally found it, provided no apologies, and still did not know that we had booked for 3 adults. They did not offer any options for extras at check in like breakfast or club level, which I usually purchase. I was too frustrated and tired from the flight to even bother to ask. Room was JUsT ready for us at 2:30pm, and was told that check in wasn’t supposed to be until 4pm? Not sure the purpose of irritating a guest more, when the room was actually ready.The room was dirty with stained carpets, TV in bedroom did not work, sofa was also dirty in beat up condition. Since we had 3 adults, we called for the sofa bed to be made up. We then left to explore the city and get some food.When we returned, the sofa bed had not been made still. Had to call again at 9pm. Overall, very unlike our many other experiences with Shangri-la elsewhere.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had booked a room at Horizon Club level with access to the Horizon Club, which does an excellent breakfast, a modest afternoon tea, and an excellent dinner with wine and cocktails. My wife was in course of undergoing treatment to her knees, so we used the facilities extensively. They could not have been more caring or helpful or charming. The hotel provided a solid folding wheelchair. When I had an IT problem, their top IT man spent two hours with me to try to sort it out. The bedroom had a spectacular view, as did the Horizon lounge. We could not have had a better or more pleasant opportunity to recuperate.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my wife in a Horizon Club Opera House View Room. The views from our room and the horizon club were spectacular. Our room was very well maintained with a great bathroom. The horizon club was well run and really easy to use for breakfast and evening canapés rather than needing to head downstairs to use the other hotel restaurant. While I gave this hotel a 5 rating there were a couple of things that could be improved. The lifts were quite slow at times but I understand these are being renovated so this issue should be fixed. I also found our bed mattress to be a bit hard, although it was more than offset by the view and otherwise well maintained room. It is also worth noting the hotel while very central is up a hill from the city so it is not as straight forward to get to if visiting for work but is fantastic for a holiday in Sydney.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fabulous, Fabulous is all I can say. What a view of the Sydney Opera House. The rooms are fabulous. The staff is top notch. It is very well located and not too far up the hill to the Harbor and all the goings on there.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly, I should say the room was comfortable and quiet and the views of the harbour fantastic. Staff were helpful and pleasant. I was aware that Vivid was on and that this hotel often hosts large one-off events like balls etc. But the busy-ness is notable. For example, the driveway seemed to be a log-jam and the car-park was full by 4 pm when we arrived. (Thanks for the printed sheet with directions to nearby carpark. Would be good to add what it usually costs to park there. Ours was $30 for overnight on a Saturday which is pretty good and it’s only a block away). Also, the wait for lifts was a bit disappointing and they were all crowded full. Which is surprising considering there are six of them and they move quickly when you manage to actually get inside one. People were not happy with the lift operation. Heard lots of grumbles about it. Anyway, we went for the view and that was great. But probably will be heading back to boutique next time we’re in the city, if only for a more measured pace.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located next to the Rocks which is a lovely walkable neighborhood with tons to do and lovely restaurants. Overall the hotel was nice. We didn’t have a nice view from our room but everything was clean and comfortable. Decor is a bit outdated. There is a restaurant, bar and lounge on the top floor with beautiful views.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed in other Shangri-La hotels and the Sydney one is absolutely great and lives up to every expectation. We booked a room with a view of the Opera House for the Vivid Sydney festival and it was really nice. The hotel has great facilities like temperature controlled indoor pool, functional rooms, sauna and massage stations and a very well equipped, 24 hour gym. Staff is very kind and professional, gives great advice and makes genuine efforts to delight the guests, they exceeded my expectations and shows the great care hotel management places. In-Room dining service is blazing fast and the selection is quite good. Breakfast has great options, kitchen is impeccable with orders but can be quite busy, other restaurants in the hotel seem to be in high demand.Rooms are spacious, with great distribution and well equipped, bathrooms are very good and guests are pampered with amenities of high quality.I'd would return and most certainly recommend the Shangri-La to anyone wanting a superior hotel experience.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked a Darling harbour view room via a third party website for Vivid, as I wanted to take my 5 year old and my baby. When we went to check in, I was told the front desk lady had to juggle some rooms around to get me an available room. She told me to go and sit with the baby and she would bring the key over. I did that and she proceeded to serve a long line of people, despite two or three other agents being available. I approached her and said, ‘how are you going?’ She said, ‘I’ll do it soon’. Weird.I lined up to see a different agent who gave me the room key. Went and looked at the room which had a view of Fort Street public school. Not exactly what I expected from a darling harbour view room. I went downstairs and asked to upgrade, which I could for an extra $250 for two nights, making the total for my stay $850- with no breakfast or parking. I found some of the staff quite rude. As one other person notes here on Trip Advisor, if you’re dressed down in jeans and sneakers, don’t expect any service from staff. The guys on the front door didn’t even acknowledge me when we came back to the hotel on our second day.The positives are the view, and the spa area, which was nice and hot.I am a Hilton honors member, so would go back there in a heartbeat over the Shangri-La. A disappointing stay.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary. It’s pretty pricey but the location, quality of the property and rooms, as well as the views, make it worth the dollar. Very friendly staff, they even gave us a free upgrade to the room we wanted but couldn’t book. A night we’ll always remember, especially for the view.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my first time I travel to Sydney and I choose Shangri-La because the view in the room which is I really love it. It's so amazing and thank you so much.I got bad smell in my room, then I have been changed the room in time. This is professional management. Thank you for your team.The only thing that I feel strange for me compared with many hotels I stayed especially shangri-la chain in Thailand which is the skill of well-trained staff for costumer value in the same standard.I came alone by walking without sitting in a taxi with the t-shirt, wearing jeans and sneakers without the dress and high heel shoes or expensive bag, no one asked to help me for my luggage. Well, it might be busy time but you can manage it better. The lady the red uniform asked me help for check in, this I am appreciate that. Mr.Eranja who checked me in was so nice and very professional, thank you for give me the room early checking in time. I cheer you up. Mr.Johny at the bell counter was so kind,  polite and humble as what I always feel follow your chain standard.When I check out there are many staff which are more take care of the people in the suit more rather than me which is again with the sneaker jeans and a t-shirt. What I saw, your team was immediately approached to the guests with the suit more which I feel weird because I never met this situation in 4- 5 stars hotels.I don't mind about this situation but it would be better if you can give more care the customer or anyone inside your hotel, and consider them as a guest at the same standard. It can be better. The water in the room for sale can be more clean. Its unacceptable for the dust which shows your team didt care it. *pictures*Well done, and will be back. I hope that I can see your improvement about my feedback.Thank you.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in March 2019 and had a twin room. Room was very spacious and had everything you need for a short visit. We had a room with an opera house view and it was beautiful. Short walk to the rocks which had great cafe's, restaurants and very close to the ferry terminal to catch a ferry to Manly. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have always loved staying at the Shangri-La and this time was no different. My flight was cancelled and so I booked a last minute harbour view room. This was spacious, well appointed with delight Loccitane ammenities. The bed was comfortable with comfortable pillows also.Check in was quite delayed due to a sudden arrival of a large number of guests but was handled professionally. The ambience was beautiful with a Christmas theme at the time.I has breakfast in the lobby cafe which was ok - normally when I'm in Sydney I visit local cafes and wished I had of done this on this occasion. Overall i only spent around 12 hours in the hotel but was a delightful experience and would stay there again when in Sydney.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There were some issues with this hotel, I requested rooms adjoining they said they didn't have and then I went up to the room and noticed we had a door I called down to have it opened. I had paid for a view of the Opera House but was looking at another building. I went to the roof top bar and was told I need to go to the bartender to order my drinks even though there were only a few people in the bar. No one welcomed us. I went to the restaurant for dessert one night and was told my family could not sit in the little picnic area they had set up for Easter without paying a huge surcharge. The elevators took forever and stopped on ever floor people kept piling in because they didn't want to wait for another elevator. At night I could not get the music pipped in the room to shut off I had to call maintenance, who took over an hour at 3am the music kept blasting in the bedroom! The hotel did provide complimentary breakfast as an apology which was very nice. Unfortunately this hotel is mass of and doesn't give you that welcome feeling or the want to return.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Maybe I expected too much. Hotel is okay - clean rooms - positive is lots of good size towels. Hotel looks tired - unimpressive. Reception staff were lovely. One thing which surprised me - was nice big bathroom but no soaps to go with the bath - one tiny bottle for the shower but if you took a bath in the evening you had nothing for the shower in the morning. It’s the only hotel I’ve been in that only puts a ( one shot) bottle of shower gel in the shower and doesn’t provide any for the bath. Breakfast was good - but lukewarm - staff lovely. I used the pool - some areas of the pool - changing rooms environs really could do with a good clean / paint / re-plastering - I found the condition surprising. Again the staff were absolutely lovely. I had coffee in the lobby - staff were again very nice. Overall - there must be better hotels in the city because if this is the best then pity the others. We didn’t have a good experience in the Altitude Restaurant for Brunch - see my other review. I’ve tried to not let that temper my feedback for the hotel and on re-reading it I think I have the balance right.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our room had a great view of both the Harbor Bridge and the Opera House. The bed was very comfortable and the room was spacious. We stayed in a regular room for our first stay and a Horizon room for our second stay. The Horizon room had the feel of being more recently renovated. The Horizon lounge on the 30th floor is a great experience for breakfast, afternoon tea and drinks in the evening. The lounge staff were fantastic and a credit to the hotel. Overall, we found the staff to be very attentive to the needs of the hotel guests and they was a difference maker for us. Having read the mixed reviews on Trip Advisor and particularly the comments about the long waits for elevators, i was concerned about staying at this hotel. In our experience the longest we had to wait for an elevator was 2 minutes during the peak breakfast period. It wasn't an issue for us at all. One concern I do want to mention is the breakfast buffet in Cafe Mix. The 'hot' food in the buffet was cold to lukewarm every day we were there. i did mention this to the managers. what we ended up doing was ordering food directly from the kitchen and it was always hot. Despite this concern, we still rate our overall experience as five stars. The hotel has a great staff; very nice rooms; nice restaurant and bar on the 36th floor with great harbor views; great location for the Rocks, Harbor area and CBD. Definitely recommend and we will be back.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For location you can’t beat it and the views across the harbor to the bridge and opera house are fantastic. Amenities in the bathroom are lovely and rooms are huge and clean and modern. Bed was a bit saggy, I was in there myself and kept falling into a hole in between the two mattresses, they reversed this when asked to fix it and while it was better it wasn’t the best nights sleep. Would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If I could rate it as 0 I would. I am currently sitting in my room for a long awaited relaxing night away. But the TV doesn’t work so I can’t watch a movie and I called room service only to hear that there is a $10 fee for delivery. Really??? Can’t you just incorporate it into the already massively inflated prices. I am just so disappointed in this place. WTAF??????
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed my stay here. I don't normally stay at this end of town as my work is usually on the other side but the view from the room was spectacular, the room service food I had was excellent and the room was really comfortable. Checking in was easy and friendly. I was also really impressed that there was a spare hair-tie for guests in the bathroom - I've never seen that before! I also used the gym and that was really well equipped with machines in excellent condition.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked the Shangri-La for a business trip of a couple of days. On arrival I checked out the hotel to find a breakfast room and buffet that felt more like a motel than a 5 star hotel in a major city. I was very early (6 am) and begged for an early check-in. They were not at all helpful and the hours passed by. In the end I found myself at 12:30 pm showering and dressing for my meetings in a public area of the Hotel. Just to be clear and avoid a misunderstanding: I know check in is usually in the afternoon. But no hotel in my many years of traveling for work has ever been so inflexible. Add this to the run-down property and I say steer clear of the Sydney Shangri-La if you can!
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gorgeous! Birds eye view of the Sydney harbour is a treat for your eyes to see. What a beauty Sydney you are! On the top floor of Shangri-La Hotel, there is one bar and one fine dining restaurant. Cocktail bar is delightful and got extensive range of cocktails to select from. I wouldn’t call it expensive, but prices are mid-ranged. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose the Shangri-La hotes because ir was close to the harbor. If you did not have much luggage you could walk there but it is up hill all the way. The entire hotel staff was fantastic. Ms Georgia did an exceptional job checking us in and getting us close to our travling companions. Don't miss seeing sunset at the top floor bar. It was amaizing and better than the Needle.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Allowed me to check into a room at 8m which was pretty unexpected. Stayed fr 1 night on two occasions and both times the rooms were spacious, clean, well equipped and of course with great views. well worth a drink and or dinner at Altitude. Easy to walk into the city or the rocks.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In a good location for The Rocks and Circular Quay although very steep hills around so your legs get a good workout! The staff are friendly and efficient and the reception area is bright and roomy.Our room was spacious and the bed was clean and comfortable with a turn down service if required. The bathroom was large with a big bath and decent sized shower. Toiletries were L'Occitane which was a nice, luxurious touch. Nice big indoor pool and changing rooms.Overall great hotel, would stay again and would recommend.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a lot of expectation for this line of hotels but was disappointed On the plus side, the location is great, walking distance to food, pubs and the harborIssues I haveThe room smelled lived in, I mean the pillows and thge blanket smelled like some unwashed person just slept in itThe elevators are painfully slow, I had to wait 5 minutes just to get an elevator to go up or down to/from floor 13Food was meh, nothing stood in their menu
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel makes the most of a great location. Every day we woke to the marvelous sight of the Opera House and the Bridge. The staff were friendly and competent. Alas the buffet breakfast was less then one would expect of a hotel of this caliber. Noe of the fruit was ripe and the hot foods were often stone cold.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hotel is beautiful and the service and food outstanding. We had a room with wonderful views overlooking Opera house and Circular Quay which I spent a lot of time looking at from the large windowsill. The Blu Bar was our fave each night also with incredible views that I just couldn't get enough of, and we managed to get a window seat at Altitude Restaurant, absolutely breathtaking with outstanding food. For a 5 night cash in on on my Husband's business trip, it didn't get much better than that. Very special place.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a long weekend and upgraded to a Sydney Harbour view - So glad we did, what a fantastic view..!The hotel was in a great spot, easy to get to everywhere with a short walk.We had breakfast once whilst we were there and that was OK, options form the chef to cook plus the normal self service buffet style breakfast with lots of options.Would definitely stay here again and would recommend.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for five nights at the - Shangrila-la Sydney for the sole purpose of climbing the harbour bridge. I paid extra for an opera house view and it was worth it. There was a different cruise ship docked nearly every day I was there. The staff were very helpful, the bed was comfortable and the room was clean. I have booked it through booking .com and normally I get the points towards my golden circle loyalty but upon check out I was informed that it’s no longer the case imagine 5 nights of accommodation without the points it doesn’t seem fair. I didn’t even get an email from Shangrila golden circle of the change of policy. I pointed out my expense in the restaurant and horizon club I should get it credited as points but I’m not so sure. I am now in the Philippines and this time I booked my Shangrila stay direct to get the points. Anyway my stay in Sydney was great and will be back soon as soon as my husband retires as I haven’t fully explored Sydney.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I liked the Shangri-La a lot. It has most of the features that matter to me in hotels. My room was large, clean, and comfortable. The bathroom had a terrific shower and a separate bathtub. The breakfast buffet is plentiful, tasty, and nicely served. I only ate dinner at the hotel one night, but the food was delicious. The staff is attentive and efficient. It's situated in The Rocks, which is an old, interesting and fun neighborhood. And it's walking distance from the harbor, the Opera House, the Botanical Gardens, and more. I should note that it's on a fairly steep hill, so if you have any trouble walking I suppose that could be a problem. My room was on the 9th floor and had a nice view of the harbor--but there is a highway between the hotel and the water. Next time I might try to get a room on a higher floor. I'd definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A strong 4.5/5. We stayed in a harbour view room for 5 nights and I have to say we were not disappointed in the picturesque view from our window. Absolutely stunning location and extremely handy to The Rocks, Barangaroo, Circular Quay and plenty of restaurants. I would say there was not much we were disappointed with, the hotel met our expectations, clean, well appointed rooms and quiet air conditioning made for a good sleep. I would only add that the we had one wonderful gentleman (bell hop) who paid us great attention and was friendly and efficient, the rest of the service staff probably need to interact in a more approachable and friendly manner to their visitors.
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Top marks all round. Beautiful bar with great views & lovely cocktails superb service all round from staff. Looking forward to staying again soon. All dining experiences were top notch. Pillow service was to our needs too
hotelName:
9    Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We used the hotel's main Web site to book and there is a free promo code on it giving you some benefits which is good. We checked in 4 hours early and our room was ready but maybe just because of time of year?Hotel seems nice enough, our room was on the rear of the building over looking a school field, noisy during the day but quiet at night. The gardeners decided however to cut the grass at 7.30 am and school activities start quite early so don't expect much of a lay in.Room is very compact and could use some additional shelving or storage especially in the toilet room.The king bed was massive and very comfortable though.Shower is nice and big, almost half the size of the toilet room easily big enough for two. Staff seem friendly and helpful even new staff being trained as we checked in.If you don't mind a short walk from the city and up hill this is a nice little place but not convinced for disabled/ special needs guests.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve stayed with Hotel Challis before I joined TripAdvisor, so this is my first review. It’s in the best location of Sydney, often referred to as the Parisian area.The staff are always friendly and helpful, and the rooms spacious enough and clean. It’s a comfortable and convenient stay.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly I must say that all of the staff are friendly, extremely polite and helpful. The rooms are beautifully decorated and kept spotlessly clean. The beds were very comfortable and in the room we had a fridge and tea making facilities. There was also a television and free air conditioning The bathroom was very modern and roomy. The maids do a wonderful job! The outside of the building could be called "quaint" and retained it's character well. The wifi was always available and free to use in the bedrooms, downstairs in the lounge and terrace. There are restaurants and cafes nearby. The train station is an 8 min walk away but that does not take you directly into the centre of Sydney. Instead we walked each day through the Botanical Gardens which was very pleasant. I would gladly stay here again
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel/location as it was a bit more affordable that other areas. Our room was rather small, which wasn’t too much of a problem for us, just not much space to put our large cases. It was also rather stuffy and the air con turned off upon leaving the room. We got a second key to leave in the cars holder so that it was cool when returning. The bathroom was tiny, just enough space to move around, but the shower and products were nice. We also used the laundry room, which was expensive, but we needed it!It’s about 30mins to the Harbour, down some steps then a walk through the botanical gardens, which is lovely. It was also a short walk up to the Kings Cross area and a Woolworths is just around the corner.I don’t know why, but twice our Uber drivers had trouble finding the hotel. We used the hotels airport shuttle service which was cheaper than a cab but the driver was mental! Overall a good stay in Sydney
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very charming and clean. The location is great, lots of shops and restaurants close by! A bit pricey for what it offers. But in general very good! Next to sydney's biggest attractions, walking distance.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location to stay and explore Sydney. We were visiting family so it was literally 10 minutes to the metro and we were at Central Quay. Reception staff are extremely helpful, informative and pleasant. Hotel was clean and the atmosphere was lovely. Definitely recommend.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely little hotel in quiet tree lined street. Had a charming room with a balcony - and excellent air-con which was a blessing in Sydneys heat and humidity.Perfect for a single female traveller - surrounded by some beautiful shops and scrumptious restaurants.Will definitely be back.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Front desktop and check in realtà easy and the staff was realtà helpfull givi grazie su all the informazioni about the sorrounding area.Amaizing location, in a quiet zone in a green area, close to metro station and a lot of shops and restaurant.Room, clean and confortabile with a big bathroom, really appreciated kettle and coffe/tea and Aldo the small frigo.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice clean, but smaller rooms. Good location, lots of restaurants near. Nice customer service at the reception. They have AC, wifi and TV. Nice comfy beds and quiet rooms.We knew the rooms were smaller, but still, thats the only disadvantage if you like big rooms.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good place. Clean. Central. Helpful staff and easy to book. Second time I’ve stayed and I’ll rebook again based on experience. Rooms are not big but perfect for using as a base to explore Sydney and Potts Point.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, very comfortable large bed and excellent staff. Rudi on reception is a great asset to the establishment. Lots of restaurants and good supermarket nearby. Easy walk to Kings Cross train station. Recommend and would return to Hotel Challis.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently booked a room at this hotel and found management and owners to be very unreliable, unfair and unhelpful. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone or stay there ever again. Potts Point is a great location and has many other much better options than this place.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location but not a very nice experience a) because I used a shared company credit card to book online and then they wanted to see the exact card when I checked in which obviously I didn't have so then we had to go through a whole process where it was refunded and I had to pay again on my own private card. The room was absolutely tiny - like a cupboard, which I'd expect in Hong Kong or London but not in Sydney! No irons in room and no water in room - all in all a disappointing experience.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Picked due to its excellent location - pricing was reasonable too. Front door staff were all reasonably helpful too. We had read a lot about room size from the hotel and on here, we decided we weren’t picky so it wouldn’t be much of an issue. We were unfortunately wrong. The standard room was just simply not compatible with two people and two sets of luggage. Even just opening the shower door without smacking into something required a bit of caution. We didn’t really have much room for toiletries either. The shower was a bit grubby too which didn’t help.Our window overlooked next doors property (this may have even been another hotel owned by the same group - I can’t remember). We were regularly woken by guests playing music or shouting from the other property, the window did so little to break the noise we even checked to make sure it was closed.All in all, the location was what was needed so it served its purpose but I probably wouldn’t rush back given the price of their bigger rooms vs other options in the area.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Hotel Challis at the start of December 2018 . Room was given was ok. For some reason we were given a room with wet room and disabled toilet, which wasn't ideal for us, The room amenities felt a bit too basic at this hotel.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a perfect location in Potts point along a quiet road but right in the heart of the nice restaurants, and away from kings cross. About a 15 minute walk into the city via the botanical gardens and is gorgeous. Also very close to the wharf at Woolloomooloo. Staff were generally very helpful and even sent my jacket that I left to munch next hotel in Australia. Rooms are quite small so expect that - I was surprised to find out ours was the king and not the standard double. We used the gym facilities which was a 10 minute walk to kings cross and was great to have the option of a proper gym membership. For breakfast make sure you try the Farm just a 2 minute walk away - delicious organic breakfasts. Would definitley recommend - a lovely little hotel in a perfect location.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have a chance to stay for 7 nights at Hotel Challis. The facilities are great. The location is excellent which is quiet and close to the train station and bus stop. The staffs are nice. The room is clean and quite tidy.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice boutique hotel very well located in the heart of Sydney. Within walking distance of downtown, botanical garden, Sydney Opera House, Circular Quay.2 great restaurants beside hotel and a grocery store as well as a liquor store within a 5 minutes walk.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent time staying at this 4 star boutique hotel.The location in Potts Point is ideal for access to the City which is only a 15 minute stroll.The staff were so accommodating in all ways and highly recommend this hotel for location, comfort and value.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely staff and very clean but the small double room is beyond small. It is TINY. There is no where to even hang a wet towel. Barely space around edge of bed to get to the bathroom. It is not significantly cheaper then the other rooms.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel, friendly staff, clean and confortable room, big bathroom, quiet area, good location, 10 min. by foot to Kings Cross Station and not so far from the city center and very good value for money ...
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel renovated, very nice clean look, good helpful staff.Close to Train King Cross Station, good restaurants, Park, nice walks and all services close by. Cleaner, Supermarket, wine shops, post office etc.A very good comfortable stay!
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel to stay at when in Potts Point and would definitely stay again. Easy to walk to all points of interest. Safe place to stay. Very quiet with clean rooms and helpful staff. Would stay here again
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a super easy and convenient hotel. Highly recommend, Friendly staff, good size rooms and well appointed. Great value or money. Location is the key - walk to everything. Home away from home. Have recommended numerous times
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful exterior, but the room was much smaller than expected. The stairs up to the bathroom were odd and only one person could squeeze into the bathroom at a time and there was only room for one person to walk around the bed at a time. The location was ok and we enjoyed the walk to the central quay through the park, but it required a lot of walking.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay, the staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel Challis is situated in a lovely quiet tree lined street, with a lovely veranda you can sit and enjoy the beauty of the area. This quaint hotel is situated close to many shops, restaurants and cafe`s. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Sydney.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really liked our stay.The room is small, but the bed was very comfortable. There are plenty of good nearby restaurants to eat and it's pretty close to main Sydney attractions. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to a friend :)
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Queen room was a great room for a short stay.If you were staying more than a couple of days you might start to find it a bit cramped - go for a larger room.The smaller rooms might be too tight for taller people: I have long legs and even in the Queen room it was not possible for me to sit straight on the toilet.That said, the hotel is in a beautiful heritage building located in a great area of Kings Cross/Potts Point, with at least four excellent restaurants no more than a minute's walk away. It is a minute's walk away from a bus route to the city.Our room was clean and well appointed, and the bed was comfortable.The room faced west and, even on a cloudy, spring day, it was quite hot when we arrived, and the airconditioner struggled to make much of a difference. the fridge was in a small, poorly-ventilated cupboard and got quite hot - we left the cupboard door ajar to help it.Hotel staff were friendly and helpful.You'll get a better deal if you book on their website and use the 'guests with benefits' code
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent located in Potts Point, in walking distance to all places of interest in Sydney.Very nice building in colonial style. Our room had a very small shower, no problem for us, but may be for heavy people.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in one of the smallest rooms on the 4th floor. Had everything we needed. Comfortable bed, tea and coffee facilities and a small but well equipped shower room. Room was small but we were out most of the time so it wasn't a problem. Towels changed daily and toiletries were provided. Location was good - nice quiet street.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hotel in a great location staff were super friendly and attentive and room was great thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would definitely recommended this hotel to others. The bed was like sleeping in a cloud
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean and comfortable hotel at an affordable price. Close to the city,but must be prepared to walk.I would recommend for couples who like to get out and see the city but want somewhere safe and comfortable to return to at the end of the day.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Worth a visit if your want to stay in Sydney in a central location, quiet ambience, well run and close to many decent cafes and restaurants plus HARRIS FARM!!!This hotel is very well run, offers good value for the location and quality of rooms and we have stayed here several times in recent years.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's in a nice quiet residential area just a few minutes from the action of Kings cross. About a 10 min walk to the train station though. Nice looking hotel, clean, modern looking, nice lobby. The staff is nice and helpful. The rooms are small but they looked nice. I wanted to stay longer but they were sold out. You'll be comfortable here. There was a lot of noise by kids outside of my room though. Also there was a problem with the bathroom but the staff checked on me and were willing to fix it right away. They were very accommodating about it and compensated me for the problem. Excellent service.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good value hotel with some rooms having the luxury of a balcony. Highly recommend. Clean rooms with comfortable bed. Everything at your doorstep. Restaurants, Shops all in a quiet exclusive suburb of Sydney and only 10 minute cab ride into Sydney CBD
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here twice over a two week period. I really enjoyed my stay. The hotel staff was absolutely wonderful. Most of them were very helpful. The room was a decent size. The hotel was in a nice neighborhood with nearby grocery stores, local restaurants, etc.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fresh clean rooms near naval docks. Walking distance through docks to Royal botanic gardens, Opera house and art gallery. Limited free internet access restricts ability to work in hotel room without paying extra
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed recently in a small room in the Hotel Challis (Potts Point, Sydney). Although it was small, it was very fresh and clean. The bathroom, with a toilet, sink and walk-in shower (nice rain head), was quite tiny and it would be difficult for "large people". The main room had a TV, small fridge (milk provided) and kettle. There was also a desk, two chairs and a small closet. Our room was made up daily and towels and bathroom amenities were replaced. Wifi was free (up to a specified amount) and quite good.The man at the front desk in the evening was very, very helpful and went out of his way to give us directions and other information. There is a reading room at the front of the hotel with a couple of computers. The hotel is close to restaurants, cafes and a large grocery store. It is also an easy walk (although there are lots of stairs) to the botanical gardens.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely boutique hotel in Potts point. Rooms are small but functional and comfortable. Very quiet and a host of great restaurants walking distance from the hotel. Only criticism would be that they only had shampoo in the showers. There were bars of soap but I would prefer a shower gel.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel with my partner in October 2018. We stayed for three nights as part of a small stopover on a trip to Australia. On arriving quite late at night at 9 PM after travelling for nearly 30 hours reception staff were available to assist with checking in and the process was smooth and easy. An elevator was available to upper floors which was very convenient considering we had a little luggage with us. The room was clean and tidy and very well presented. The room had a fridge also a kettle and tea and coffee making facilities. The bathroom was well stocked with conditioner, shampoo and soap. The bedroom was rather on the small side and this was the only downside. It was adequate enough for us for the three nights that we stayed if we were staying any longer I would’ve preferred something a bit larger with a bit more space. However saying that the hotel had made the room nice and presentable and made use of all of the available space. We stayed on a room only basis and there is no breakfast available however there are plenty of places nearby, like King’s Cross where you can get food for breakfast lunch and dinner as well a local supermarket. There is a great cafe which does a english breakfast for only six dollars. To summarise we both enjoyed our time here and mainly used the room as a base to see Sydney and didn’t spend a great deal of time in the room, but we would return for a short stay in the future if we needed to.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Conveniently located in town! Room condition is good, neat and clean. Walking distance to major tourists spots, cafes and train station. Recommended for travelers who are looking for convenience and value for money.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was situated in a great location in Potts Point close to shops, restaurants ans transport. Room and bathrooms where quite small however comfortable. Walking distance to botanical gardens, Woolloomooloo, Wharfs.and other great locations along the bay to Watson Bay.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Be careful and don't get fooled by the photos. The room is very small and so are the amenities inside. Location is good enough and the walking distance to Opera House is around 2 km. Overall in my opinion this hotel is not value for money.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you're after a quiet and comfortable stay only a stroll away from either city or trains, cafes, restaurants & bars, then Hotel Challis is the place for you. Beautifully renovated, comfortable and clean. Being off the main road equals quiet nights and uninterrupted sleep. Just 10 mins to Kings Cross station or 20 mins stroll to the Opera House & City via the Botanical Gardens. Would return in a flash.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The suites are large and comfortable. Kind and friendly staff. Note if you are staying for business the desk area in the suites is very small but adequate to put small laptop. Great Farmers Market at the fountain on a Saturday morning.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Incredible value for money. Rooms are small but comfortable and have everything you need. Excellent location and very quiet considering you are in the city. Great location convenient to cafes, shops and Kings Cross Station.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We staid at this lovely boutique hotel for three nights. Very friendly service, good value for money (most hotels in Sydney are very pricey), great location in walking distance to the city and close to a subway station, close to some nice cafés, quiet. Will return next time we come to Sydney.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a good stay at Hotel Challis. Yes, the room and the bathroom is slightly small. The small double room is just good enough for a single occupant and if you have a big luggage then your movement will be very much restricted. Location is very good. Walking distance to the Botanic Garden, Circular Quay, Opera House and Kings Cross rail station. Staff are helpful with information and if you need to book airport shuttle, it can be done at the Reception counter. Plenty of cafes within the vicinity of the hotel. Just a note - there is no safe box in the room. The basic room amenities like coffee/tea, hair dryer are provided.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel didn't tell us before confirming our booking that there were building works going on immediately next door which commenced at 7am and were so loud you couldn't even hear the TV in your room. Additionally the rooms are so ridiculously small that it is very difficult for 2 people to move around in them. The bathroom was so tiny it was difficult to get into the shower because the tap had to be moved to a certain position to be able to get into it.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, courteous staff and good location close to cafes and Kings Cross station, as well as walk to Woolloomoolloo. why so many characters I dont have all day to make up things about this hotel xxxxxxx
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The door was practically at the end of the bed. The service was nothing special. No kettle in the room... love a tea before bed. Rooms should be soundproofed a little better, could hear every time someone entered the building or walked down the hall.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel is located in Potts Point and a walkable distance from Woolloomooloo wharf and Kings Cross. My wife and I stayed here for four nights. The staff were very helpful and even held my big bike bag in storage for the entire length of our stay.The rooms however were very small and cramped, bordering nauseating. We were given a room in the top floor which had the sloping roof and i did bump my head quite a few times. For the price charged one would expect at least a bit more comfort.The room was cleaned daily and has a refrigerator. We did not have any meals here, and I am not sure if they do offer meals here. We weren't informed and I didn't bother asking as we had plenty of options downtown and we were there to explore that
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My Husband and I stayed here for 4 days during our recent stay in Sydney. We loved the location we could walk out of the door and find breakfast, dinner and great boutique shops. The staff were friendly and accommodating. The one complaint I would have would be the room was very small, It would be ok for a night or 2 but we were there 4 nights and it did become a bit tight.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the room did not equip with a microwave oven.staff should mention customers clearly to pass shuttle bus ticket to shuttle bus driver.room size is small, however, it is still acceptable based on such market value.
hotelName:
10    Hotel Challis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay way very enjoyable and staff exceptionally kind and helpful. The acknowledgement of our golden wedding anniversary by staff and management with the small gift very much appreciated.The location was very suitable to our needs. If any criticism it would be the breakfast being not hot enough for our liking. The hash browns being exceptionally brittle. The freshly cooked eggs were great
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had to go alone for a business trip. It was only a few days, so I couldn’t get to enjoy the city that much. Even though it was a brief time, I really liked the nice atmosphere and the vibe of this place. I will definitely go again with my family in the future.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Novotel darling square does not disappoint in the hotel reception, decor, friendly staffs, clean and large rooms. I am also obsessed with the giant lighted mirror in the ensuite. Love that!!However, we stayed in what seems to be the biggest room (I checked with front desk), it did have a chinese garden view but did not come with a bathtub. Apparently so, the rooms with bathtubs have no view, perplexed why there are no rooms with both, but thats fine. We were on level 6, and could hear every kid running and screaming along the corridor, every adult talking in the aisle, every trolley being pushed, every door opening and closing. The breakfast choice was appalingly minimal, it was not topped up regularly and seems lacklustre and cold. Our breakfast table was set for 1 1/2 people and had a missing chair, not sure what happened there. Overall, not the best novotel experience but definitely not the worst out of all.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located within walking distance to the ICC, Chinatown, amazing eateries and of course, Darling Harbour. The rooms are beautiful, high tech and most importantly, clean! Friendly and helpful hosts.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is excellent being right in Chinatown Sydney.Rooms are well appointed and the Hotel. is recently refurbished.Breakfast and dining facility is well done.The staff are very good; pleasant and helpful. We will definitely stay again.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel that is well appointed and well positioned. The staff were very friendly and the complimentary drink vouchers were a nice surprise. We were able to walk to the city for some shopping in the afternoon and then go to our vivid cruise in the evening.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What an excellent stay, this will definitely be our new hotel in Sydney! Location could not be better, right in Darling Harbour and walking distance to everything. The staff is really terrific, helped us get in early. The rooms are nice and quiet and have everything needed for business travelers. There’s a nice small gym and an indoor pool which was just perfect.Only thing that could be improved it would be breakfast. There’s just not enough seating for a full hotel, and honestly, not the best food. Especially at $30. But there are lots of good options within walking distance.Parking is at a public garage around the corner which was a little tricky to find the first time but actually quite close. They validate and add to your hotel bill, very easy.Highly recommend the pump house next-door for happy hour!
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Outstanding location. You can walk to anywhere. Great access to docks and ferry's to explore the greater Sydney area and beyond. Nice hotel with good amenities. Friendly staff and a clean environment. Very close to the convention center, museum, China Town and other family and tourist attractions.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great hotel, staff were friendly and efficient, rooms a good size, clean, well appointed and the bed was comfortable, the rooms were also soundproofed so no noise to disturb your sleep from the road outside the hotel. The hotel is in a great location close to Chinatown, Paddys Market, the ICC and Darling Harbour just short strolls away.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Honestly the renovations here are fabulous! Couldn’t fault them except for the way the shower door opens, perhaps if it opened towards the toilet and not the basin. Anyway the room was immaculately clean and very comfortable. Overall really happy the only down point was the terrible room service meal I had. There are plenty of places to eat close by so I would recommend them. If I had a choice I’d definitely stay again
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely Hotel, we stayed on the 8th floor with a view overlooking the Chinese Garden of friendship in Darling Harbour. Friendly and modern with Darling Harbour right on our doorstep and if you love Asian food China town is right there in the opposite direction. We walked everywhere, at least 12 kms a day or more. A Great place to stay
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 3 nights at this hotel on a business trip. Centrally located and modern. Pleasant common areas and good, clean and comfortable rooms with a good bed. Weaker points included a less-than-inspiring breakfast (not a single vegetable to be seen; tasteless bread; uneven preparation of eggs) and a very small gym lacking even towels (one is referred to the adjacent swimming pool, but towels there are inadequate for gym). There was also repeated misunderstanding regarding the fact that my reservation included breakfast, which was sorted only at check-out. Altogether a pleasant hotel, but I would rank it as good, not very good, if this level existed at TripAdvisor.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This modern hotel is conveniently located for some of Sydney's best attractions. Our room was satisfactory in all respects. The staff was friendly and helpful.It is a short walk to Chinatown. In the other direction, Darling Harbour offers many restaurants and other entertainment.For inexpensive clothing and souvenirs, Paddy's market is close by. Public transport is also available nearby.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed a lovely stay in a room with a beautiful view over the Chinese gardens and the city lights at night. Staff were welcoming and friendly. Bed was very comfortable and water pressure was great in the shower.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great staff service as he try to speak Thai with us , very impressive, comfortable bed, with complimentary extra bed and drinking water, service overall is great. We will recommend and come back once in Sydney.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It doesn't look like much from the outside, but the interior is pretty damn good - and the hotel is perfectly located for Darling Harbour, Chinatown and the Powerhouse Museum. Breakfast is decent and so is room service.We were given an upgrade (not bad considering we'd used points instead of cash in the first place) so we ended up with a room on the top floor facing the Chinese Garden of Friendship. That view really is something.I'd definitely stay again - and pay instead of using points!
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first time staying in a Novotel hotel. I chose this hotel as it's near to ICC where I was attending a conference. The location is right next to Chinatown and it's about a 10 min walk to World Square Shopping Centre. It's also about 10-15 min walk to the Harbour where you can see fireworks on Saturday nights. I stayed here for 5 nights at the Superior Room with buffet breakfast. Room was nice and clean. Heard that the hotel was recently renovated, which would explain why everything looks new. The buffet breakfast is the same every morning. The scrambled eggs were rather bland so you need to add salt & pepper. The food was just average but to be honest, there were days where I skipped and ate breakfast outside instead. Staff were polite and friendly. I ordered a cappuccino from the hotel bar/cafe, it was slightly pricey and nothing special. Order if you are in dire need of coffee, else you will probably be better off getting your coffee from elsewhere. After all, this is Australia. Lots of good coffee places around.Overall, this hotel is not the most exciting but it's a convenient location to ICC so I would recommend it to business travelers.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Novotel Darling Square has one of the best teams of staff I have come across anywhere in the world, and I am no novice traveller. Be aware that there are three Novotels in close proximity in the Darling Harbour area, so it’s wise to double check you are booking the one you want. This is not the one with the Darling Harbour views.Location; Unless you specifically want a harbour view, this is the best located hotel in the area. It’s a five min walk from Central Station ( every rail line passes through Central), five mins walk to everything from casual to hatted dining in Darling Harbour, Sealife Aquarium, the Day Harbour Cruise terminal, Madam Tussauds and Darling Harbour shopping district.It’s just two mins walk to The Capitol Theatre, The Sydney International Convention Centre and the massive kids waterpark / playground. Darling Harbour is well lit and well patrolled every night and is considered safe, so take the kids to see the weekly Saturday night fireworks display or walk around the waterfront for amazing night harbour views. If you want a harbour cruise for pennies, it’s also a 10 min walk to the public ferry terminal at Pyrmont Bay ( next to the Maritime museum) or Barangaroo; just catch the public ferry under the Harbour Bridge to Circular Quay, and catch the train back from there to Central Station, all using your Opal Card ( like London’s Oyster card and available from newsagents, train stations and other stores with Opal signage).Darling Square Novotel is immaculately clean, but as newish hotel, you would expect everything to be all shiny and in great condition. The indoor swimming pool was also immaculate, the gym was immaculate. You couldn’t fault it.Bathrooms are modern with a choice of traditional shower head or a rain shower. The frosted glass bathroom doors give you pause for privacy concerns when sharing a twin room with a friend, but nothing can be seen - not even an outline of what you might be doing in there, lol !!Rooms are not huge by Australian standards, but are larger than you would be finding in most international cities. There was still room for twin beds, large desk, two chairs, a side table, two bedsides, minibar / coffee station, all without having to stub your toes on anything.Where this hotel lifted from average to “wow!” was the staff. This is a modestly priced Sydney hotel and I was treated exactly the way I would like to be treated. From reception to breakfast to check out, every staff member had a beautiful balance of being friendly and interested and helpful but not to the point of being fawning or in-your-face, which I prefer. They read me perfectly. The older couple behind me at breakfast obviously did prefer OTT attentiveness, and that’s what they got, with staff scuttling everywhere to bring them coffee and special orders and longer conversations.The other thing I need to point out was this Novotel was properly staffed. There’s nothing that stops me relaxing faster than watching overworked, stressed staff. It’s not usually a problem with Accor hotels, and certainly wasn’t this visit.I would absolutely recommend this place, especially for international visitors that want a friendly location that better defines the Australian way of life, rather just another cityscape that could be anywhere in the world.I will coming back.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my wife for the weekend and had a very pleasant stay. Hotel is well located and the staff were very helpful and friendly. Attached to the hotel is the Pumphouse pub , which is a very old pub that serves a great range of local beers.The beds in the room were very comfy, the room had everything you need and the late checkout on Sunday morning was a nice tough from the staff.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spend last 2 nights of honeymoon at Novotel before flying back China. This is a 2 star hotel. Very poor standard. Breakfast terrible. Lobby restaurant is bad. Better eat in airport lounge. Better atmosphere and food. Last night in Australia, order room service and someby dressed like bikie gang brought room service. I think were getting robbed! He was from the pub next door. No uniform. Look dirty. It was shame to spend last night after 6 weeks in Australia in this dump. No good standard. 4* hotel in China 100 time better.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Formerly the Rockford, this used to be our go to hotel in Sydney. The exterior is looking a little tired amongst all the revelopments of Darling Harbour.This was our first visit since the hotel re-opened following a major renovation - and it was great as always. Service is first rate; the rooms have had a major makeover and it was a very pleasant stay.If you are driving, think about bypassing the hotel parking offer - $46 per 24 hours. We booked a $21 overnight stay (midday to 10am) online with Wilson Parking Darling Square.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Design, size and type of equipment in gym needs major improvement. Shows that the person who put the gym together has no clue about the usage and space needed for the machines. No weights and no proper space for body workout.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed for 4 nights on business. Very convenient location next to Chinatown and conveniently placed for Darling Harbour.Hotel itself is on the small side, as are the rooms but they were clean and functional. Breakfast is ok, although they had the same menu every day. Would be nice to mix it up occasionally.On the negative side, I found it a bit noisy. Even within the rooms, I could hear a lot of the water pipes and whenever neighbouring rooms opened and closed their doors, I could hear it. Overall, the stay was fine but nothing super special to mention.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly, the location for the conference centre is very good, being about 5 mins away. The little lobby bar and coffee shop is great , very friendly and coffee was excellent and I’mUber fussy about coffee.Unfortunately I found the breakfast bland and the hot food was only warm, the poached eggs I ordered tasted of vinegar Worst of all was when I arrived after 24 hr flight, they said the room wasn’t ready, although it had been booked from the previous day, a few phone calls got it sorted but....
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a time of personalisation and customer service. Of individuality and creating experiences. The Novotel excels on delivering exactly the opposite of that. It is cookie cutter, dull, boring, plain beige and as unexciting as it comes. You are a number amongst others. They have no ideas who is staying with them and they couldn’t care. They just sell you a bed from 2pm to 11am the following day. They don’t care about customer service and they don’t even try to. Then comes the bars and restaurants. The buffet breakfast is the same food you get everywhere else but badly cooked and badly presented. The lobby bar. As boring as it can get. The place is a ghost town serving badly made, cheap drinks. The pumphouse next door. So much potential but it just fails on all levels. It’s dirty, serves terrible food and it is manned by employees who clearly do not care. I kept the best (worst part) for the end. The hotel staff. Wowsers! They could not be more unhelpful if they tried. They are the perfect culture fit with that property. No life, dull and as useless as they come. We didn’t encounter a single half decent staff member. I am very picky but this had to be by far my worst experience in a hotel. How do places like this that care so little about customer service survive in these days and age? Reading the other reviews and mostly the replies of their manager, they are as dull and boring as his hotel. Novotel, you are a disgrace to hospitality.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this little unexpected gem in the middle of Darling Square, close to the ICC and many of Sydneys best attractions. Stunning rooms, beautiful bedding, stunning bathroom, very helpful staff and fantastic value for money.I was with 5 girlfriends who were booked into a hotel 100m away and had to leave due to how revolting it was, Novotel took us in and made our whole weekend go from awful to amazing.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. Nothing was a problem. The location is central and the rooms a reasonable size. We would not hesitate to stay here again! So close for my confrence to ICC
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent from the word GoI would like to make a special mention of a young lady called Melissa, she made everything perfect for my partner and 11 year old as they arrived prior to myself.The special thing being the cakes and soft drinks with balloons for the little girls Birthday (a very nice touch)
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned to the UK from Sydney having spent an initial 2 day stay, followed by a further post cruise one night stay at the Novotel DS. We were celebrating our special wedding anniversary and must thank Giovanna and all of the staff for making our stay so very special. The service provided was so personalised and we would like to especially thank Giovanna for everything she did for us. Thank you Giovanna. The hotel is very nice and located in a fairly convenient location. Fab buffet breakfast. Rooms are very stylish. When we return to Sydney, hopefully very soon, we will absolutely stay at the Novotel DS. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Smooth checkin at 5pm , allocated room 802 with views looking over the Chinese Gardens and towards Darling Harbour and the city. Room was quite spacious for my wife and me , bathroom amenities spotless and the shower had both an adjustable arm and rain head. The bed was extremely comfortable and good choice of pillows. As other reviewers have mentioned , the aircon is a bit on the noisy side , but I still slept well. Had no issues with any outside road noises. Short stroll to the restaurants along Cockle Bay thru to Barrangaroo, felt very safe. Received complimentary vouchers for drinks at the bar. Breakfast was buffet , usual mix of hot and cold , good range of pasties and an excellent Nespresso coffee machine which made a surprisingly good cappuccino. There is construction at the entrance but it was not an issue. I would stay again.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
