review_body: We had booked the hotel for 3 nights. On the first ,Morning We arrived at the hotel's restaurant for a buffet breakfast(included) at 7:30 AM. Most of the food was gone andfor fruits (I am Vegan) there was 1 rotten apple and a few leftovers of watermelon and cantaloupes. I had asked the servers for more fruits and they said they do not have any more. They had suggested i should come at 6:30 in the morning if I want to have food....Moreover- I had talked to the hotel's food manger and he promised he will have enough food next mornings. All was the same.for the next 2 morningsIn the evening we ordered minestrone soup and we got a full pasta bowl , Littleto any vegetables and very little liquid (soup) when we had asked to ad more liquid to the "soup"they took the bowl from us and returned them as they were taken- no liquid added.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights for a church conference at ICC. Smooth check in and Carolina was great at front desk! First impressions always last! Rooms are modern but small, the sink was blocked and bathroom doors weren’t wiped down properly! Beds comfy! AC worked fine. Staff friendly and professional. I would stay here again but in their bigger rooms! So handy to Darling Harbour and Haymarket.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is great being near China Town and Darling Harbor plus only a short walk from the downtown area. Outside access to the hotel was difficult during our stay due to construction of a new entrance way canopy. Once this structure is completed there will be no problem. Check in was efficient plus friendly. Double bedded rooms aren't big but they are quiet, bright and very well designed plus set up with everything required for a comfortable stay. No bath, but a great shower with bathroom fittings and amenities being to a high standard. Aside from figuring out how to operate the capsule coffee machine, breakfast was very good, reasonable choice and excellent quality. One highlight of breakfast was the staff who were not only polite, friendly but also went out of their way to assist (poached egg provision and coffee machine operation instruction). Something I wouldn't notice or comment on unless it was to the contrary, was the exceptional level of cleanliness in all areas of the property. The room itself was spotless as were the public areas, not easy, especially with a construction site literally at the front door. One draw back, but not applicable in our instance, is the chronic shortage of onsite parking. Parking aside, a very good property that I would have no hesitation in recommending.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there when attending a concert at the nearby ICC theatre. Rooms were clean and well appointed and the bathroom in particular was very good. Breakfast was good but as seems usual in Australia there is a lack of fresh fruit to choose from (except "melons"). We grow so much high quality fruit this seems a shame and a headache for those who enjoy a healthy breakfast. Overall though its a very good hotel, staff were helpful and I'd stay there again.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Awesome location. Very close to everything. Our family of 10 traveled to Sydney to attend my son's graduation which was held at the ICC. The hotel is located just adjacent to the ICC (International Convention Centre), an easy walk too to Darling Harbour, very close to popular spots for festivals and events in Sydney. So many restaurants near the area. Also, China Town is just across the hotel. Walking distance to Paddy's Marketplace.Staff are friendly and helpful. As this is the second time we stayed at the hotel, we have always felt that we are welcome. Our rooms were ready when we checked in and it was a BIG PLUS as we traveled by plane for 8 hours going to Sydney with a small kid and an infant so everyone was treated to a good rest upon our arrival. The rooms are not particularly stylish but have everything one needs. Clean and fresh. The beds are comfortable. The toilets are clean. Room was made up each day.Staff in the restaurant during breakfast are fantastic, very helpful and accommodating.Peter and Cristina were awesome. Breakfast is good!We truly enjoyed our stay here and it was well worth the price. We will definitely be back!
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have stayed at this hotel before and have always felt welcomed. The central location is what really appeals to me. China Town is across the road and Darling Harbour is a few hundred metres away.The only negative was the construction around the hotel. Not very pleasant.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived late and greeted by friendly staff .Good sized clean twin room . In the morning we went to the small gym and did some laps in the small but lovely pool. Parked near by, a little tricky to get to it but we made it Would recommend
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a pre-cruise stopover and we were delighted to be shown straight to our room when we arrived just after 8.00am after our long flights. The room was clean and had everything we needed. There is a lot of building work going on next door but it did not disturb us. Short stroll away from Tumbalong Park and Darling Harbour. Breakfast a little pricey and not so much of a choice. Busy roads outside and close to China Town but did not hear noise. Walked to The Rocks from here, not too bad at around 40 mins.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was the second stay for me at the Novotel Darling Square. I arrived early, check in took some time and the room was not ready, although I‘m a loyal member of the Le Club Accor programme. I remember that even as I was a Platinum member, which is the highest tier, I was not able to get an early check in on my first stay years ago. But they gave me a voucher for a coffee at the bar this time. The staff at reception did not inform me, that finally the room was ready, but I had to ask for it! But I have to say, that I got a very nice corner room on the seventh floor. It seems, that they made some upgrades in their hotel, which was not even finished during my stay, as there were construction works at the canopy over the entrance. The location of the hotel is next to China town and a busy road and the window was not soundproof by the way. Prices are reasonable during weekends. Nevertheless they must improve customer service in my mind!
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tried to ring for some lunch, room service phone rang out 3 times. So, tried the manager it also rang out. Finally got the front desk to order. Very limited in room dining menu and the mini bar was the smallest filled fridge I have ever seen. Recently rooms upgraded but maybe they should have upgraded the staff.Would not stay here again.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for 3 nights whilst exploring Sydney. I cannot speak more highly of this hotel. From check in to departure the staff were so helpful and friendly. The room was brilliant - it had everything you needed - even iron & board!! The location was perfect - close to Chinese Garden, Darling Harbour, hop on bus, station and the Market! I would recommend it highly for value for money - I will definitely be back!! My only criticism was that on returning from climbing the bridge at 11pm the bar was closed and although there is a mini bar in the room , there was nothing in it that I wanted! There is a lovely bar - so was quite frustrated not to be able to get a drink!
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it's location is right next to Chinatown so if thats where you want to be, it's perfect. The hotel itself is quite alright, as you'd expect a novotel to be. Food is not great so when they say ' breakfast included' don't expect much. It'll fill you up but it wont make you happy :) Room service is to be avoided if you can as well. If you need a taxi and there isnt one in the drivewat, walk out to the main street and start waving, they're all a block up the street cos there's a large Holiday Inn there.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and i stayed at this hotel for a birthday celebration. My room had wonderful view of the Chinese Gardens. Location was superb and short walk to transport, attraction, restuarants. Staff were very helpful and ittentive. I would like to particularly acknowledge Jullian at reception, Simon breakfast buffet also Frank in the bar. Staff were always keen to assist in many ways possible great service..The room was spacious, clean and bed comfortable extremely. Food was tasty and plentiful, gym and pool were superb... Would recomend to all my friends, family and work collegues.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, sits in a fantastic location. The recently renovated rooms add to the luxury experience, breakfast and overall service was amazing. Quiet hotel near Sydney’s China Town and Darling Harbour
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here in January with my 8 year old daughter. Hotel is stylish and smart and I like how it is not too big. Room was clean and comfortable. We were in a twin room (basically a double room with the beds separated), so there isn’t as much room between beds. The bathrooms are well equipped with a large shower. The pool is indoor and has a good view of the city. Maybe request a room in a higher level to get a better view. There looked to be an unfinished building opposite the hotel but no construction happening while we were there. Breakfast was additional for us but worth it as you pay for the adult and the child eats free. It’s a large buffet style with a good coffee machine. Kristina on breakfast service was just lovely and made my daughter a hot chocolate each morning.Novotels are a good chain and as a result, do get large groups of package travellers who are in and out in a rush (especially around the food). But overall this hotel is a nice size and in a great location, with an easy walk to the trains and Darling Harbour.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay at Novotel Darling Square was faultless, the friendly staff, excellent breakfast, superbly clean and comfortable rooms and great location. I am looking forward to using this venue again whenever I return to Sydney. Regards Trish and Gary O'Neil
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a strategic location, recently renewed, excellent rooms and breakfast. Few steps from Darling Harbour, Chinatown, ... Also close to Central Train Station (10 min. walk) from where you can explore the area.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very excellently located, next to Darling Harbour, the Convention Centre and China Town, and in a close walking distance to the Town Hall city centre. The hotel itself is very comfortable, modern, very clean and the rooms spacious and air-conditioned, with all facilities. The staff is very polite and efficient without being too friendly or patronizing. Would take the opportunity to mention Jeremy and Wilson for helping us have a great time. They are at the front desk and very helpful. The staff is very attentive to everyone's needs, including babies and young children, and elderly people. The hall, bar and breakfast room are very airy and well designed. Couple of areas where they can improve are....Firstly the breakfast menu remains stagnant and is very average. Secondly, the front desk staff normally are helping with the luggage themselves and do not have any porters to help. Since we were transiting between NZ and India, we had a lot of luggage which meant a lot of effort for us as well as the front desk people. However, will not cut any points for these areas since were really happy with the location and services. The pump house, which is a bar located very close to the hotel is reasonable and caters to the dining requirement of the hotel. The Gym and pool is just for Namesake and does not add anything to the experience. However, due to the location and services of comfort and recommending this hotel as a value for money hotel.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hotel. The room is modern and Cosy. My first time to stay here and will definitely come back. I can't find any fault in the room. Spotless.Only to improve the customer service aspect at the front desk. It lacks the warmth in welcoming guest.Great breakfast. Need to improve how they prepare the bacon. Wide selection and great taste.One of my favourite now among Accor hotels.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wanted to thank you Wilson who was an amazing help when I was organising a nights accommodation for my mum and dads 47th wedding anniversary at the Novotel. This was very last minute decision and he was very accommodating with my last minute requests. He went above and beyond. Thank you Wilson
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very well located, next to Darling Harbour, the Convention Centre and China Town, and in a close walking distance to the Town Hall city centre. The hotel itself is very comfortable, modern, very clean and the room spacious and air-conditioned, with all facilities. The staff is very polite and efficient without being too friendly or patronizing. The breakfast is a little expensive if you did not eat cooked food, but there is a good choice, in particular of French pastries and juices, and the staff is very attentive to everyone's needs, including babies and young children, and elderly people. The hall, bar and breakfast room are very airy and well designed. The only criticism is that your credit card is scanned for holding a bond at your arrival, and refund takes two weeks. I have seen this already in other hotels in Sydney but usually you get your bond refunded when you leave.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had booked the hotel through agoda. Agoda booking confirms that the room is for 2 adults + 2 children. To be doubly sure, we called the hotel, well in advance, to confirm. The front desk has informed us that the room is for 2 adults + 2 children and they have made necessary notes in their system. When we visited the hotel, the front desk refused to accept 2 children stating that all rooms in their hotel can accommodate only 3 persons. When I referred to the agoda website and booking, the manager in the reception refused to take note of it. He simply denied stating that they are not responsible for what is mentioned on third party site. When asked why is it not informed when we called on phone, he simply refused to take any ownership and also refused to get in touch with colleague with whom we spoke before. He is unruly and unprofessional in his approach.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed my stay here recently, it’s a great spot across the road from Chinatown and you just turn right at the front door and your in the Convention Centre Complex and Darling Harbour. A Great spot for a family stay with no road crossing from the hotel to Darling Harbour . This hotels has had a refurb and they’ve done a great job with the decor . Enjoy
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, friendly and helpful Staff, clean comfortable room. Recommend to anyone. We loved the Japanese Friendship Gardens. Close walk to Cafes, Restaurants and Shops on Darling Harbour. Overall loved our stay.
hotelName:
11    Novotel Sydney Darling Square
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 2 nights at the Adina Apartments in Coogee and found it to be excellent. Proximity to the Coogee main drag was great, and I was grateful to be able to use the in house gym. Service was excellent. And I would stay again
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Need to change bed of room number 50. It’s broken but I didn’t complain during my stays. I wish you do it so that the next guest would have a better sleep. The rest is fine. All staffs were very helpful. Happen to meet the head of the house maids Sandeep Bedi. She came to check if the room was ok and if we needed anything. We always feel like our own when ever we reach Adina hotels. Now we are moving to another place Bondi beach we are also staying with adina.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Apartment, comfy beds and very clean. Mid winter rates are really good. Location on Coogee Bay Road is perfect for an easy walk to shops and the beach. We have stayed there before and will stay there again.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a family of 5, we stayed in a two bedroom apartment for five nights. Obviously recently renovated, the apartment was beautifully furnished, clean and modern. The furnishings were tasteful and the beds really comfortable. We were impressed by the friendliness and responsiveness of the staff. Whatever request we made was attended to in super quick time. Whether needing a change in bedding configuration on arrival, or requests for towels, clothes hangers, drying rack etc, someone would arrive at the door in minutes. Impressive service! The apartments are really conveniently located in Coogee’s main shopping area, with a Woolworths Metro just across the street, or the better Maloney’s Grocer about 50m down the street. The beach is about 150m down the street with plenty of restaurants and cafes on the way. Recommend Gusto for coffee about 50m down the hill. Buses and taxis are easily accessible, although we had our car. Parking is available at the apartments for $25/day. The kids enjoyed the indoor pool for a dip after long days out. Oh, and although they don’t advertise sea views, we could see the sea from our balcony as it was in the front of the building #65. Very happy with our stay!
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this property. Very good location. A walk to the hospital. Close to shops and beach. Friendly staff and very nice rooms. Very practical living space. Everything working well and in order. Nice and quiet.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is amazing, the staff very friendly and the 2 bed apartment was perfect for our family to stay. One bedroom was a bit small but enough to fit a king size bed and we also had the living space so didn't really bother us. We will definitely stay there again. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very pleased with our studio queen room. It was recently refurbished in quality décor and the facilities within the room met all our needs. The bed was very comfy and not over-soft and the room was spotless. The reception staff made us welcome and gave all relevant information for our stay. Well done
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hi my name is winston Pereira every thing was very very satisfactory during our stay at you apartment it was no 53how ever we are over 75yrs and the room we had was not worth the money we paid only because of the water that flowed from the shower right up to the bathroom door and we had to be very careful that we did not trip over this was reported to the maintenance man as well as the manager roland this situation did not change for the duration of our stay. you make a decision as to how you wil handel this report. so we can recommend you apartments many thanks
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were clean and fresh. The bed was so comfortable. The staff were very polite and informative when giving directions for local attractions and places to eat. I would highly recommend The Adina in Coogee
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Adina apartments at Coogee were excellent the room was huge and had everything provided for your stay. it is situated right in Coogee near all the eateries and shops.Overall our stay was very enjoyable and I will definitely be staying there again
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean, very modern and very comfortable place to stay. I got 1 bedroom apartment, all provided and included. Wifi is not the fastest but works fine. My only dislikes is having to pay extra $25 for parking, but even then its still a bargain price for what you getting.Having better choice of cable would have been good, but not here to watch tv
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here one night at the end of May. It was blissful! The lobby is so relaxing, the staff were lovely, parking is easy and secure under the hotel, and the rooms are beautifully appointed. Access to the rooms is easy, there's a lift from the basement car park. The bathroom was great, with a huge rainwater shower head and lovely toiletries. The bed was super comfortable.The location is perfect with only a short stroll down the road to the beach and all the wonderful eateries and pubs in Coogee. There's a supermarket close by as well.We will definitely be back!
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great reception and moved us to accommodate an early check in (much appreciated) Although it was raining for 50% of the time we really enjoyed our time in Coogee including walking to Bondi - all facilities in the room were fantastic including a great shower and a massive bed - highly recommended
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay. Well situated in Coogee. Modern clean and very comfortable bed and pillows. Staff were very warm and friendly with a professional approach. Easy access to and from the building and parking was easy.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived after a long day and young lady at reception on the phone and didn’t acknowledge me for a couple of minutes, finally someone else came to check me in. Tiny room with AC not working, better places to stay in the area.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a perfect location for our weekend away with our friends attending the Randwick Races.Short walk to beach, pubs and resturants.We stayed in motel room which was spacious enough for 2 and our friends in an apartment. It was very quiet considering its on a main road.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came down with work colleagues and the two bedroom apartments were economic and comfortable, affording privacy, yet value for money. It is in a good location, and off street parking was excellent and easy to navigate. It was a nice surprise to have the wine on arrival too.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, very comfortable. Staff very accommodating. Close to everything, beach, restaurants and the City, Randwick Racecourse & SCG. Totally recommend for short or long stays and can't wait to return.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean rooms. Housekeeping did an excellent job every day. Beds very comfortable. Gym was reasonable - a little small but I did not share the space during my 4 day stay. Did not use the pool but it was also well maintained. Great location straight into the town, with a Metro grocery store right across the road. Just a short 150m walk down to Coogee beach. Would definately stay here again.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed staying that the Adina Hotel, because its location, the helpful staff and features of the room.The rooms were kept very tidy and the location of the hotel means there was plenty of choice when going out for dinner etc.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a fantastic stay with this hotel. Great apartment 1 bedroom was spacious, clean and comfortable. We had a really good sleep on a very comfortable bed. Location was in main street just a short walk up the hill from the beach (100m) and close to all shops and restaurants. Excellent..would definitely recommend for all trips to Coogee.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location close to cafes and shops, pleasant, friendly and helpful staff. Our one bedroom apartment was very clean and looked to have been recently refurbished. Parking is available but for a cost, which is usual in Sydney.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location. Extremely friendly and obliging front office team. Clean and modern apartment. Restaurants and cafes plus Woolworths across the road. Loving the two minute walk to Coogee Beach. I will happily come back!
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great staff, lovely clean rooms, modern facilities. Yes I would definitely stay there again. Was recommendedto me by another frequent visitor to Adina. Well positioned closeto shops and boardwalk. Very nice grounds/views from room.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The only issue is fridge had been defrosted and water was pooled all over the carpet when I first moved into room. I also had purchased ice cream which as a result melted in the bar fridge. Other than that venue is close to multiple external food venues, cafes, restaurants, Woolworths and Coogee Beach Pub.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great apartments, roomy, very clean, recently modernised and it shows. Fridge, toaster and kettle. Coffee machine. Swimming pool great just long enough. Hotel about 300 metres from beach.the bed was enormous and very comfortable. Air conditioning in room very effective, and it is controlled by you, not management. Some hotels will set that the air condition will not set lower than 19degrees.Large tv, but Australia tv is very limited compared to Britain.Large wardrobe space.I would definitely choose to stay here again if I go back to Australia.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good value for money. A well located hotel, close to eateries and a short walk to Coogee beach. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. The room was clean and comfortable .Highly recommended and will definitely stay again.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: RelaxingCoolCalmGreat dtaffExcellent staffGreat bedGreat shopsFabulous night lifeAmazing underground swimming pool25/7 front receptionNice balconiesBig roomsGood kitchen suppliedGreat for family
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Adina is incredibly comfortable and like an oasis from the bustling city streets outside. Super cosy and fantastic in warm or cool weather, we had both! Loved the pool and walking past the water fountain on the way in and out is very soothing. Great work, love the new decor!
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the apartments was excellent. We were upgraded to a 1 bedroom apartment which was lovely. Staff were very helpful with booking our taxi and holding luggage. Room was clean Would stay here again.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great service and was able to check in early from a very long drive. Fantastic location in Coogee the staff where very helpful and would highly recommend staying here. Right in the center of Coogee...
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel since I want to go to coogee beach. And it didn’t disappointed me. I was happy that only few minutes walk would arrive beach. Meanwhile, a lot of restaurants and convenience stores around. It was a great trip.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easy access, right in the heart of Coogee, lots to see and do, plenty of eateries and choices from overseas cuizene to ordinary Aussie Tucker. Walks along the beach front and around the headland was relaxing. Night life was interesting and vibrant.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location in Coogee. Centrally located and short walk to beach and local restaurants. Recently modernised. Good rooms. Good service and well priced. l use Adina on a regular basis for business. Good mix of room options depending upon length of stay and is family friendly.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed recently with a group of couples for a weekend away. Top location and well priced. Booked the rooms via the Adina website , was real easy. Walk to the beach & cafes , plus Royal Randwick is a 5 minute drive ! Stayed here previously and will be back again
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location and very generous in size. Great for a family of four. The lift was a long way from our apartment though, having access through the other side of the property would be great. Parking was always easy, even though you could tell it was a very busy time for the property.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great stay. very clean, enjoyed the privacy and ease of access to our room. location was easy for us to get to and from our events. lovely breakfast and a quick walk to the beach the next morning. thank you.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the adina for 4 very comfortable nights recently. We stayed in a two bedroom king apartment. The room has been renovated very well. It was clean and spacious enough for two couples and a baby. The adina is in a very good spot but got a hit noisy particularly on the Friday night we were there. But overall I would happily stay here again.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great apartment hotel in excellent location Room recently refurbished Nice place to stay for a few days and complete walk from Coogee to Bondi and Coogee to Maroubra.Lots of nice restaurant and bars but unfortunately no Ouzo at hotel, bars and clubs
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thanks for a great stay at lovely Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee. The newly refurbished 2-bedroom apartments are awesome, they have everything a long-stay or family needs (coffee machine was my favourite!). The housekeeping was spot on too. For anyone who wants to feel like a local, yet be just a bus ride away from the city - I recommend Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee!
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice place. Great location.Close to cafes , Coogee Bay Hotel and beach .Easy parking underneath $25 per night additional charge.Accomodation very clean.However bedding was a little uncomfortable, all up a lovely place .
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was really impressed. I booked direct through Adina. Room was very clean and everything looked great. Close to everything and very reasonable in price. It was a nice quiet room, air con worked well.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Average experience, redeeming feature being the location. It served its purpose as a place to sleep and shower but overall was average in its function to deliver respite and relaxation. Simple changes would help.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic location, good amenities and friendly staff what more could you need. Was there for 12 days business and rooms was cleaned to a high standard each day. Location wise its 2 minutes from the beach and some great places to drink and eat.Could not ask for more
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: o.k. not to bad.nice place to stay.service was good and in general everything went to plan.with shops like woolies across the road with newsagent verygood.in the evening the walk down to the hotel for dinner was o.k. close by meant no driving.not to far to walk.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for a few weeks at Christmas time and although I was woke most mornings by the sound of builders I really liked this hotel. It's modern, clean and the staff are friendly. There's no bar or restaurant in the hotel but there is a Thai restaurant right next door. Theres also a gym and swimming pool and a carpark. The hotel is situated on Coogee Bay Road up a steep hill opposite Woolworths and Dominos. The hill up to this hotel is very steep so not great for wheelchair users but everyone else it's perfect. The staff are helpful with booking taxis and helping give directions and stuff. Our room was the wheelchair accessible room and it was nice, spacious and the bathroom had a roll in shower and roll under sink. My only faults with the room was the bathroom used to flood everytime one of us had a shower and our balcony was too small. Theres a little kitchenette in the room and a big wardrobe. The rooms are newly decorated and very nice. Our room was cleaned nearly every day we stayed there. I'd definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Oasis in the middle of Coogee chaos. Very helpful staff and modern updated rooms. Excellent carpark and close to everything but quiet inside. Nice decor and comfortable furnishings. Nice bed and linen.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely place to stay for a quick weekend away.Room was nice and clean and perfect for the two us. We had the studio apartment which had everything we needed. Comfortable with modern touches. I would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for one night at the Adina Apartments and weren't disappointed.We had an extra large bed with functioning air-conditioning, a comfy mattress and a tastefully renovated bathroom.Room 15 is at the bottom back of the building so there isn't much natural light- but it was extremely quiet, which to us is more important anyway!The furnishings were well kept and the sheets / towels were clean and fresh.The service was extremely friendly and overall we had a lovely nights stay!Parking is $25/night so if you can work a deal out where that is included- you're better off rather than trying to find a street park which is excessively hard!Location is perfect!
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay in Coogee for an excellent location.No complaints except maintenance staff going into the room when we were not there. We were moving out in 2 days time after 3 weeks, so why couldn’t it wait till then. And the item that was supposedly fixed wasn’t even broken as far as we could see.Would still recommend though
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Do not stay here if you value your personal items and possessions. I accidentally left some of my clothes and swimmers in the room. Upon realising what I had done, I immediately contacted the hotel. They denied that my personal possessions had been left in the room and treated me like I was a liar (why would I lie about leaving clothes behind, seriously?). They were very unhelpful and kept trying to brush me off, at no point did they acknowledge my concerns. It was a very poor customer service experience and left a very bitter taste in my mouth. My family and I will not be returning to this hotel.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All of the staff were extremely friendly, helpful and professional. Our room had to be a handicapped room because I was using a knee walker for mobility as I broke my ankle while on vacation in Sydney, Australia. The room was perfect as we could make most of our meals with the small appliances in the kitchenette. There was a grocery store right across the street and the beach was just a couple of blocks away. I found the sidewalk immediately outside the lobby so very treacherous for me to navigate on the knee scooter that I was pretty much confined to the hotel room and lobby. All in all, it was a pleasant stay and the Thai Restaurant next door had amazing food!
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We as a family of 4 have stayed at the Adina Coogee several times and really enjoy the location on Coogee Rd with its proximity to cafe's, shops, beaches and coastal walks. The 2 bedroom 2 bathroom apartments are tastefully decorated and offer excellent facilities - it's like a home away from home. The staff are very friendly and helpful and go out of their way to make sure our stay is as enjoyable as possible.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's modern, fresh, close to shops, hotel and beach. Clean and friendly. Be very specific when you book. A basic room is very, well Basic. Spend a little extra and book a good room. Well worth it. The pool is fun as well.
hotelName:
12    Adina Apartment Hotel Coogee Sydney
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really a wonderful spot to stay in Sydney! We were lucky to stay here during "Vivid Sydney" a spectacular light show every night at Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and the Central Business District.Rooms are spacious and clean, good warm shower, facilities to make your own tea/coffee. The kitchen area is very clean, with 4 isles to cook your own meal, a lot of place to store your own food, and to use the fridges too. nice big room to have your meal, to watch a movie or to chat with other guests.The place is a bit chilly because it is built around an excellent excavation site from the first settlers in the Penal Colony Australia.Staff is very friendly indeed, 24hours available and very hospitable!!
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the YHA four years ago with mixed results, but with more miles and hostel experiences under my belt, I decided to stay again.And my second experience here was overall really nice.Hostel is in a great location of The Rocks and the view from the roof of the harbour is lovely at day or night. It's about a 10 minute walk from Circular Quay, which is a stop off the airport line.I was in a 4-bed dorm which was great size and enough space for four people comfortably (and with luggage). Having the bathroom attached was also a nice treat.Kitchen at the hostel is big and enough space, but I was here in fall/winter when it was quieter so could be busier in summer or holiday time. Kitchen is well equipped too, although none of the pans were heat resistant on the handles so you had to use multiple towels to handle hot cooking equipment.Laundry is on-site and powder is available for sale too. Breakfast and coffee is available too for purchase although I did not end up buying.Closest full grocery store is about 25 minutes walk away, smaller metro market is about 10-15. Hostel hosts a lot of activities too and was very welcoming for people to join, other than that, it's not a very social place, people mostly kept to themselves.My only real complaint from my stay was Wifi. It kicks you off regularly and was very inconsistent in working in the main common areas. Would recommend this place and stay again.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great hostel. The location is perfect. From the rooftop you can see the harbour and the opera. It is simply perfect. At hostel prices a 5* location! What more can you ask for?The rooms are friendly, clean, well maintained with en suite bath. At times groups of teenagers can be disturbing. Teachers should be reminded to take up their responsibilities.The kitchen is CLEAN! Thank you. (see my review of the YHA Canberra...) Whether a kitchen is kept clean or not does not just depend on the guests, but also on the management. Thank you for providing such a friendly and hospitable lounge and kitchen.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sydney Harbour YHA provides an outstanding experience in a fantastic Sydney location. Located a short walk to the bridge, or to the harbour, this property provides more than expected. The roof top view is icing on the cake! Staff is friendly, helpful, and accommodating.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hostel because of its location and value for money, and it surpassed our expectations. We had a private room with shower and bathroom. It was our first time staying in a hostel, and we were impressed with the cleanliness, quiet, bright and cheery atmosphere, and helpful staff. A bonus was the learning about the history right beneath the hostel and the archeological dig. Great view of harbor from the terrace.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having never stayed in a hostel before, I had no idea what I was in for! I was staying in Sydney overnight for a concert at the Opera House, and just wanted cheap overnight accommodation. At the time of booking, all the private rooms and female-only share rooms were booked out so I chose a mixed 4-share room. When I checked in, a man was already asleep on one of the beds, and I could see another of the beds was already taken by someone else. I crept in and got myself sorted, trying to be as quiet as possible. I got ready and went out, and returned after midnight. Only one person was in the room when I returned (not the person who was asleep earlier), and she was getting ready to go out. I went to bed, and was woken multiple times as the other guests came and went (they were polite and were as quiet as possible).I got up and checked out before 10am, after having a quick chat with the two guests who were also in my room when I got up. Everyone was lovely, but it was quite an interrupted night sleep.The staff were super lovely upon check in and check out. I didn't know I needed a lock for the lockers in the room, so I was happy to be able to purchase one at reception. It was a cheap Uber into the Harbour, and close to train station.Although I personally won't stay again in a share room, I would consider staying in a private room. It was clean and friendly.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: With a great roof top view, roof top area with sun chairs and happenings on YHA’s behalf, friendly staff, simple rooms, easy check in, easy checkout, soap, towels, hairdryer. I have only stayed a room for two (3) with own shower and these rooms also has TV. So- simple but very great stay pretty central.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was really pleased with this hostel. Stayed in a 4 bed mixed form with a private room. Clean with aircon. Rooftop is a winner and lots of activities to participate in if you want to. Remarkably cheap for the location. Definitely recommend
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for one night 8 Feb 19 as had a work reunion right next door at the Australian Hotel. So convenient. Ten minute walk from Wynyard station. Four bunk male room with toilet and shower. $60 the night.$8 breakfast, cereal, toast and coffee. Just wished the guy used tongs getting the bread out of packet and not his fingers!Coffee grinder needed adjustment, too course and under extracted.Great location near all touristy things at The Rocks area.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We’ve stayed at Yha hostels during almost our whole trip around in Australia. We love their chain with beautiful and well located hostels. We had the epack and pay not much for each night. The Sydney Harbour Yha was our fav one. The view was incredible and the staff so nice ! We would recommend it if you will visit Sydney.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: a must stay for anyone of all ages! whether you're on a family holiday, a backpacker or a couple, the YHA Harbour presents a great view of the Harbour and Opera House day and night. on a clear night the views are just incredible. a very easy walk in to the city and stations too! Very clean, great facilities like a bath (especially after 9 hours on canyoning in the Blue Mountains), showers, Lockers and the Big Dig historical site.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This youth hostel is very nice, especially the location and the rooftop terrace with the great view on the opera house and harbour! However, the price per night is quite expensive and therefore, the YHA could offer free Wifi everywhere, also in the rooms. On the positive side, we very much appreciated the big communal space and all the activities offered as well as the useful advice given by the reception staff. Thanks for the stay!
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When you have 5 members in your family finding affordable and acceptable accommodation can be difficult and very expensive, esp so close to Sydney Harbour. We shared a family room at the YHA and found everything to be in convenient walking distance. We stayed there prior to going on an overseas cruise, and as fantastic as the cruise was the children still talk fondly about their stay at the YHA and want to go back there again. The room had bunks and accommodated us without hassle, and having our own bathroom was a bonus too. The rooms up on the top level with the TV and Foosball was a much loved activity for the children. The kitchen was handy and it was clean. Staff were professional and always willing to assist when needed. The lift was also a handy addition as we had a child with some special needs at the time of our stay as he was not able to use stairs.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I knew the location would be great, not that it would be THAT great: it really is in the middle of the Rocks, and the rooftop has a perfect view of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. The hostel is big and also has a lot of families and older (60+) people, an atmosphere that I quite liked and thought was a plus, but may not be for everyone. The hostel regularly organises activities such as yoga and kayaking which I unfortunately wasn’t able to attend, but they looked great.Kitchen was spacious and the lounge was huge. The 4-bed dorm was a bit cramped but sufficient. Because it’s so small and the en-suite bathroom isn’t a separate room but part of the bedroom, it was sometimes hard to not wake up others. Facilities are clean.The cons: - I was a bit surprised I had to pay to be able to store my luggage prior to checking in (as I arrived before 2pm). The price also increases after a couple of hours, so I had to come back in time and not venture into the city too far.- Even though the hostel provides trip discounts, they seem to be catered to the more expensive trips. When I booked a Blue Mountains trip myself online, it was $40 cheaper than the one the reception suggested I booked with them. - There is nowhere to hang and dry your washing.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Facilities were good. Wi-Fi free in common areas. Large lockers in rooms. Yes the school kids were a little annoying in their large groups but the location and rooftop view more than make up for this.In my opinion it's worth staying here just for the location. Note to staff - be careful what you say when on the desk, there was a young lady working there with brown hair who spoke very negatively of the guests and very loudly for anyone to hear.However, there was a guy working there with blondeish hair and glasses - very kind and friendly upon arrival - I wish I knew his name
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cons:- Staff make you ask twice for the aircon to turn on - very annoying. They also set it at a hotter temp than requested- Wifi only free at kitchen/common area- Location is far from tower eye etc.- Rooftop closes at 10:30pm till sunrise- Tripple price of other backpackersPros:- Modern- Near harbour bridge and opera house- Clean & attracts good people
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were going to the ballet at Sydney Opera House so we wanted to have close accommodation. It is located in a great area close to everything you need. The bedroom was great for two of us and the staff were lovely and helped us when we needed some. They had events and free offers happening every day. I would defianately come back and stay longer. I think YHA is the best and most afforadable hostel options. We had a great stay!
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I found this to be one of the best hostels that I stayed at in Australia.I requested a bottom bunk due to a disability - and they reserved one for me which I was extremely pleased about as I would have injured myself if I had to have a top bunk. The hostel itself is lovely and clean. There's good music playing throughout the common areas and although it is played in the corridors, I could not hear this in the bedroom. The rooms also come with an en-suite which is really good - although less so when everyone wants to use the toilet or shower at the same time! It is a great location - but I made the mistake of getting off at Circular Quay and thought I'd be able to walk there... Big mistake and I ended up getting an Uber to the hostel. (Only now I realise the hostel recommend getting off at a different train station). You live and learn.I really enjoyed my time in Sydney and at this hostel. Whilst I was there the fire alarms went off which was quite scary at first - but the staff handled it well and after the fire brigade checked things over we were thankfully told it was a false alarm and safe to go back. I will definitely stay here again if I come back to Sydney.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked here for 6 nights on the website, they have pretty good deal!The more you stay, the cheaper you can get it.They also gave me a voucher for breakfast(cereal,milk,bread) it was light and pretty enough.The staffs are so kindly and active and friendly!I stayed for six female dormitory, it was clean and neat. I was really satisfied.The best thing of this hostel would be the rooftop!!! So you don’t have to go any other famous rooftop bar(like Glenmore Hotel)You can just bring your own drinking and enjoy the view of beautiful Sydney!!!I absolutely would go again!! They also can make a booking for you any tour in Sydney like as Winery tour or Blue mountains and so on. But the price is at full price so if you are looking for cheaper, find on the Internet!
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with 5 friends on Mardi Gras evening. The room was very clean, air conditioned and comfortable. The bathroom was also clean but very small! The rooftop is amazing and staff very friendly. We felt very safe walking back late at night.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: booked a double room for 2 pax with private bath last august 2018. arrived 8AM on the 1st day and they hotel offered to give us a room, despite 2pm checkin period. but since the rooms available did not have a view of opera house, they advised us to wait a bit in for others to check-out. we finally got a room at 1pm, and it has a good full view of sydney opera house! the room is clean, size is more than adequate for 2 pax. theres a 24H convenience store downstairs, a working lift, and nearby weekend market 10 mins walk from the property... note that the walk to the hotel from the train station is uphill, so any older ppl with big luggages beware. theres an activity every day in the hotel,you can also book your day trips with them. on our stay there's a sausage night (free) so we had a free light dinner. overall awesome stay and will definitely return to this hotel, and will . highly recommend this to my family and friendsthe only CON i can think of - they keep your luggage for a fee.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Sydney Harbour YHA has been the best hostel in my Australian solo trip. Clean and comfortable rooms, a very big and well equipeed kitchen, friendly staff, great location: it definitely is worth the price, a little bit higher than the other hostels. If you go on the top you have the same stunning view of the expensive hotels of the harbour!!!
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was there for six nights and love everything about this place! Location is amazing, at The Rocks, just a few minutes walk from the Circular Quay, plenty of places to eat in the surrounds. Staff was very friendly and helped me out with everything i needed. Kitchen and comun areas are very clean and tidy. They have the most amazing rooftop ever, million dollars view at a hostel budget. Rooms were confortable and had ensuite bathrooms. Definatelly the best place to stay in Sydney!!!
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a family room, double and 2 bunks. Room had tea and coffee, en suite toilet/shower, tv and lockers. Room was quiet. (208). Staff were really helpful, lost of stuff organised. Wifi in communal areas, and if you are in the front of the hostel you can access wifi from across the street. Stunning views from the roof. Prices were ridiculously cheap for central Sydney
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a fantastic stay! Loved my private room. There was a social atmosphere but it was also really quiet in my room. It was an easy walk to Circular Quay and the Opera House, weekend markets, botanical gardens and city shopping. The heritage is awe inspiring. The staff and facilities were great!
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had two family rooms, and stayed a night before, and after a cruise. This was the perfect location, and within walking distance to the Circular Quay cruise terminal. From the roof of yha you could see the ship parked out the front, and great veiws of Sydney Harbour. The walk to the cruise terminal was steep downhill, with lots of stairs. I dont think i would do the walk the other way around with the steep uphill climb, not lugging suitcases anyway. Breakfast was well priced, and you cook it all yourself in the kitchens on reception level, as well as clean up after yourself. You are also able to purchase your own food and store it in the communal kitchen, as well as cook. The room was quite roomy, and i felt had a modern touch, especially the bathroom, which was quite large. Beds were comfy, and noise not an issue. I love the history behind this place, a historical site, where the ruins of old buildings were not allowed to be destroyed, so they have built yha around the old ruins, and there are cabinents with artifacts and bits and pieces that had been found on site all around the place. We were not able to control the temperature of our room, which was quite warm. I didnt realise till our last night at yha, that they ask you to strip your beds ect, as they are all volunteers that work there, so i do wonder about the clenliness of rooms, although ours did appear very clean. We arrived at yha early, so was wanting to leave our luggage and go out for the day. For this you need to hire lockers at a cost.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Especially or the location the rooms are very reasonable. However they forgot to clean the room. Besides it was a very nice service they provide. They helped to store the bike, the breakfast was quite good and reasonable. The overall concept with providing space, storage and cooking facilities to serve your self are remarkable for lower budget traveling. The best was the roof top with view over the complete harbour area. Enjoyed very much!
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I came down to Sydney just for the night to see a show and, on my brothers recommendation, stayed here. A great decision! It’s location is very central and convenient. The cost, by Sydney CBD standards, is very good. The room was very comfortable and quiet. The staff here are very helpful and friendly. In addition, they have an overnight parking deal at a nearby secure parking station with a reasonable price tag. The cream on top, pardon the pun, is the roof top area where you can enjoy coffee, a drink or simply soak in the view. We’ll be back!!
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sydney Harbour YHA has an amazing location, set on an archaeological site on “The Rocks”. It’s in front of the Shangri-La, set above the harbour with amazing views of the Opera House. The kitchen is spacious and clean. The eating area adjacent to the kitchen has plenty of space. There is a small shaded patio area next to the kitchen, which is perfect for breakfast. There are herb pots you can help yourself to also!The rooftop area has views people would pay all kinds of crazy money for. There are sunbathing beds, tables and benches and plenty of sunlight to watch the world go by. The rooms are comfortable and fresh. We had a 6 dorm which had it’s own separate toilet and shower and sink.The only thing I would criticise, is the lack of towels, as we have stayed in few YHAs which have provided them, and also in the bathroom, there is no sanitary bin! This means you would have to walk out of the toilet holding whatever you used to put in the general bin outside. Not so great for hygiene, and also embarrassing if you’re sharing with other people. Great staff on reception. Tommy is always a delight!
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I needed to tag along with a school group who were staying, in order to support my son. The rooms were clean and they had a range of rooms suitable for families, school groups, back packers and single. The accommodation is above an archeological dig. Breakfast can be cooked at the community kitchens from reasonable cost items purchased at the reception. There are common areas and entertainment areas throughout. The roof top outdoor lounge area has magnificent views. We have already booked in again. Very cost competitive. The staff are knowledgeable, helpful and friendly.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel far exceeded my expectations. This was my first solo trip out of the country so I was way beyond nervous. The staff is super friendly and are full of knowledge about the city. They have daily activities which led to me making so life long friends from all across the globe! From wine and cheese night on the roof patio, to pub crawls and clubs, and everything in between; there is no doubt this is the perfect place for solo travelers and families alike! (I'm already planning my next holiday, see you guys soon!!!!)
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sydney Harbour YHA is an excellent example of what a good hostel in Australia should be like. All the staff were absolutely amazing and there was always someone smiling available to help with everything you needed. The rooms were nice. I stayed in a 4 Bed dormitory, complete with it’s own private bathroom, which was excellent. The common area had a great social vibe, complimented by a clean and spacious kitchen.The free walking tours that the hostel offers are also absolutely amazing. I would highly recommend this hostel for both Backpackers and families alike.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great friendly large hostel. A family room for 4 was great value for the location right on the Rocks. The roof terrace was as good as they say. Large clean kitchen. Nice touches like free pancake breakfast one morning and cheese and wine on the roof one evening. Interesting archeology too.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a few nights in winter season, hostel was really nice. I arrived early and the staff let me check in and get into my room before 2 which was great. The kitchen area is quite large, I never had a problem finding space to cook or store food. My room was clean and had its own bathroom which was much nicer than any other hostel I have stayed at. The location is perfect, 2 minutes from the harbour bridge, and not even 10 minutes walk to Circular Quay. The view from the roof terrace is stunning - definitely recommend if visiting Sydney.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m on a family room and it is clean, spacious, tasteful. The ensuite far exceeds anything we’ve been in since we started the road trip 5 days ago. (Motels). We aim to find clean and reasonable, but this place is fantastic. Value for money! Laundry facilities ($4 per load), a bath is available (bubble bath at reception) and the terrace. We stayed for the $7 burger night which was delicious. It included potato salad (delicious) and a can of drink. Outdoor heaters, comfortable deck furniture and the views! I used YHA back in the 80s and 90s and this is hotel quality. I’m glad times have changed.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was attracted by its location, the views it offered and the prices compared to hotels in the area. We stayed for eight nights. Overall, I was delighted with the experience and would recommend this place to families except for a couple of irritants.It was very easy to book online. The staff responded to any email queries within 30 minutes and were very helpful. The walk from Circular Quay involves quite a few steps as their web site warns. However, we were able to do it without too much of a problem with our 10 - 12 Kg bags and the views were worth it. We were able to store our bags as we reached too soon for check-in. The locker is not totally intuitive, but they had a staff member on hand to help us. They allowed us to use the shower too. There are a range of options for breakfast. They have combos for A$8 that includes average grocery store cereals and breads and excellent lattes (even with soy!). The staff are very friendly. You can make it a lot cheaper if you get your own ingredients from the nearby Coles and use their well-equipped kitchen and copious refrigerator space (the grocery store on the ground floor is an atrocious rip off!). There are near by fancier options! We used/combined all the options during our stay!The view from the premium room is excellent. The view from the terrace is just amazing! They have a lot of school groups and college students staying. However, we never heard loud noises. In fact, the large groups always used the stairs ensuring we never had to wait for the elevators too much! The location was wonderful for us. The bridge walk is within 3-4 minutes walk! The Observatory is within 10, botanical garden and Opera House about 15, Hyde Park about 20! Wulugul Path and the Barangaroo preserve are great for morning walk/jog. We were able to Uber to most places such as the Paddy Market, DH, or Kirribilli for $10-15 to conserve our limited energy to walk in those areas!The toilet paper is issued from a locked contraption that got jammed a few times and the night staff did not have a key for this contraption :(. However, they easily addressed it by giving us a roll! The windows don't stay shut unless you insert some wedges! I consider these minor irritants compared to the savings and the willingness of the staff to resolve the issues. Your tolerance could be different! The staff were not consistent in their ability to advice you on sightseeing. We were told on email that they could provide us with guides and maps for individual areas. However, when I asked someone at the front desk for some suggestions for the Hyde Park/Central area, I was told all they could give me was the city map and it was up to me to figure out what I wanted to see! On the other hand, other staffers were outstanding with suggestions for a rainy day or for picking the right BM tour! The bed for the third person was comfortable. Unless you plan to spend a lot of time in your room, the premium room is quite adequate for three (again, this is subjective). Clean spacious shower and a hot water supply that does not run out, and easily accessible even for those with bad knees. If your stay includes Fri-Sun, do not miss the Rocks market. We came across people from different countries of widely varying age groups. They were all very friendly. The staff were very friendly and super helpful -- when they were out of soy milk, they ran to the grocery shop and made my latte for me!!
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this hostel for 3 nights in a 6-share private bathroom dorm. The room was clean, every bed has a separate power socket for charging your phone over night, and the bathroom facilities were nice and spacious. The rooftop view over Sydney Harbour is amazing and can challenge that of the expensive hotels. The location is perfect; walking distance to the Opera house and Circular Quay and the Rocks area is very lively (lots of pubs and restaurants) and cool. The only downside is the terrible WiFi. The free WiFi is only available near the reception and I couldn't get it to properly work for me. The premium in room WiFi is super expensive (compared to phone data). This holds for all YHA and I think this should be changed as a proper internet connection is almost a necessity for travellers nowadays to communicate or search for locations and places. Get an e-night pack with YHA if you want to stay here cheaply (30 dollars a night).
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s the best hostel I ever came in. The staff members are amazing, we have spacious bedroom, kitchen is always clean as the bathrooms. Amazing rooftop also ! I definitely recommend it, and you are only 1 min walk to circular quay ! :)
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have to say I was very happy with my stay in this hostel, it has a great location in the rocks, near to the Harbour, it has a terrace with a amazing view to the opera, bridge and city center... I consider the room pretty nice, with good size lockers and good space with bathroom inside the room, the facilities are great just over a old ruins, the kitchen and breakfast are just great is you want to prepare your own meal.... until there 5 star hostel, but we realize in the room there was a lot of roaches , and bugs... god I couldn’t sleep one night more there, actually another guy had to leave the same day when he arrived. Hope you improve that, because the hostel is excellent
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very pleasant place to stay, great facilitys and staff. It also has an amazing rooftop veiw of the Sydney Opera house. The staff are very friendly and extremely helpful the rooms are clean spacious and comfy.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel location is near to all the tourist's spot. Walking distance to the ferry terminal, Sydney Opera House. They offer a free bar tour services to the oldest bar in the town by foot. A good beer must be paid by yourself.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in Sydney Harbour YHA a few years ago and had the double room (no TV) with a nice view of the opera house. This time i reserved for a double premium room for a higher price and was told we'd be given a room with view of opera house and sydney bridge. When we arrived, the room had a nice view of the opera house but not the sydney bridge so we were a bit disappointed. They explained the double premium room had other facilities such as TV so it charged more. Except for that, everything else was great, the room was clean as before, the staff was friendly and the hostel was close to all attractions. The view at the roof top was fantastic. Potatoe wedge salad was excellent, and tastier than the fish burger.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is much more than a hostel. We had a double room overlooking the harbour with amazing views at the Opera House, the room is much of a hotel’s. The common areas are great, a big, clean, spacious kitchen and eating area plus lounge area in level 1 where reception is and an amazing rooftop terrase with the best views in town, both areas with free wi-fi.Nice and helpful staff. Great location in the heart of The Rocks, close to all amenities.It is located on an archeological site and they do free tours to get to know it!
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a couple of nights here and these YHA youth hostels are just great. We had a private room, however, there are dorms available as well. The room we had also came with an ensuite so we had complete privacy. These places are a fantastic way to meet people from all over the world. They are clean, very well presented, and safe. This one is particularly different as it is built over an archeological site, known as the Big Dig. There are display cases throughout the hostel with artefacts recovered and guests have to walk through the Big Dig to get into the hostel.Not my first YHA and definitely will not be the last.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for 6 nights in a 4-bed female only dorm which had a spacious ensuite bathroom. It was really clean and had a large locker space for each person. The rooftop views of the harbour are incredible and The Rocks area is really cool, especially with the market on the weekends. Staff were really friendly and attentive. The hostel had a great feel to it and there was a wide mix of people so I had the opportunity to meet other solo female travellers and young people.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good staff, clean, good facilities, nice atmosphere with a good age mix, perfect location at a good price and to top it all off a roof Terrance with an amazing view of the opera house, what more could you want?
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Conveniently close to a train station (uphill walk with stairs, bring your wheelie bag and moderate fitness) with an awesome view of the Opera House, Harbour Bridge, cruise ships and Circular Quay, this is a stay I would highly recommend. Our room was clean, and adequate. Communal facilities were clean and convenient, and it was quiet (and so close to the action). The staff were friendly and helpful, and the roof top terrace viewing was amazing. I’m sure that the people staying in the hotels close by were paying a lot more than we did. I would highly recommend.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: YHA never disappoints and this time as well. It did not only meet but I think this is one of the best from their kitty.So what was ROCKING,- Location, near to everything that a tourist wanna see.- Entrance, it was a lovely walk in and looks like it is gonna be a heritage site underneath the complex. Simply superb.- The main area/ lobby area perfect seating and cozy with very clean and maintained kitchen with everything needed (basics) available.- Reception Staff, just amazing with so many suggestions and lot of patience towards Travelers.- Room was clean and so was the bath room and thank you for the plug point near the bed.Somethings which were SHOCKERS,- Room supplies vs Price charged- WIFI in rooms for free for 2 reasons #1 It’s Bare minimum#2 I don’t wanna Sit out and plan or search or talk (Do mention it clearly on different service provider portals that’s its chargeable and not free in rooms.)Well in all your are solo Travellers // backpackers dream
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed in this property for 6 nights while in Sydney. I'm impressed with its cleanliness all around. It's my first time to stay in a hostel. And with my most pleasant experience with this particular hostel brand, it won't be my last. The kitchen is clean, complete with all that a traveler needs to cook and prepare his own food.. Well done Sydney harbour YHA hostel. You're the best. Keep it up.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a modern and well-run YHA hostel.It was built in 2006 on a historic site (it's combined with a sort of museum), in an exceptional location with a beautiful view of the opera house and the bridge from the rooftop terrace. The neighbourhood is upscale and very expensive, so I think it's cool to drop a YHA in the middle of that.The one drawback is that there aren't any grocery stores nearby... But it's not such a big deal once you realize you can just bring groceries back at the end of the day when you head back to the hostel.The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was great - not too cramped and sufficiently modern. YHA really has worked out how to do cleaning and maintenance efficiently at scale. The whole room was cleaned by a team every day. So overall, I was delighted to find a clean, safe, pleasant and well-run base to explore Sydney from!
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the YHA before our cruise departed and the location is so convenient, a few minutes walk downhill. Our double room was so clean and tidy and we paid a little extra for a view. We also enjoyed a meal for AUD5.00 each.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights in an ensuite room following a road trip from Brisbane. The Hostel is in a fantastic location right in the heart of the very vibrant Rocks District. Rooftop terrace and our room had views of the Bridge and Opera House. Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Facilities are great and more than we expected for the price. Our room and bathroom were basic but clean and functional with even hairdryer and Tea Making kit. Taxi Rank right next door and a great selection of pubs on your doorstep. Five minute walk to the Bridge climb start point which is a brilliant experience. Short downhill walk to Circular Quay and the Ferry Port / Opera House . Its not a 4 star hotel but is in a 4 star location with reasonable rates and great staff and facilities. Would use again without hesitation.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a private room twice when we were in Sydney at the start and end of our trip. Both times were great. The rooms were basic, but clean, beds comfortable, shower with plenty of hot water and good water pressure. Staff was good and helpful when needed. The views from the roof deck were priceless!!! Both the opera house and harbor bridge. Okay opera house view can be obstructed in the day time when a cruise ship in docked in Circular Quay. But they leave by early evening. The location in the Rocks is great, just a few minute walk to Circular Quay where you can catch the harbor ferry shuttle and the subway.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was thrilled when I found this property had availability the weekend I was visiting Sydney, because the price and location cannot be beat! Unfortunately, it was one of the most frustrating stays I have ever had.Firstly, the property itself is great. It's in an ideal location, fairly modern, with excellent common area facilities. Even the guest rooms are bigger than most for private hostel rooms. The main issue with this property, is that the much touted Air Conditioning is only turned on when there are very high temperatures outside (fine, that's logical), and can only be controlled from the front desk.This resulted in multiple trips up and down the stairs to plead with the staff to turn on the Air Con. The outside temp was well above the listed requirement, and yet we had to fight with them to get it turned on.
