I was then told that it would likely turn off after several hours and need to be reset.The staff was apathetic about the whole thing. I get that most Hostel staff are usually just travelling students, but you still should give a care about your job.
hotelName:
13    Sydney Harbour YHA
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I regularly stay the The Russell as I love the charm of the place. It is also a short stroll to the Opera House, the Botanic Gardens, the Quay and of course The Rocks area, places I like to visit when in Sydney. While I usually stay in one of the rooms with a shared bathroom, if intending to stay more than a few nights, I would recommend booking a room with an ensuite as there are more facilities. The rooms with a shared bathroom are very comfortable though and you do get a jug and tea/coffee/milk. Everything is meticulously clean and well-maintained while retaining the hotel's historic past. A lovely continental style breakfast is included.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Russell Boutique Hotel is located very conveniently close to transport, circular quay train station and the Sydney explorer hop on and off bus.The rooms are very well appointed decorated with fresh flowers.The Push bar below the hotel is a nice place for a pre or after dinner drink.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was good ( although we had booked a Standard room which was ok but a little small and would book a larger room next time ) Couldn't complain about anything. Felt a warmth about the Hotel that you don't get in the larger Hotels. Breakfast was great.Will stay here again and will recommend it. Location is great too.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Russell Boutique Hotel is a great location for your night in The Rocks. Charming rooms (stayed in a superior room) and as a value for money place to stay it would be hard to beat in the location. I would recommend it in heart beat.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, excellent service. Not your corporate chain property. Very nice 4 days in this hotel helped make our Sydney stay near perfect. Staff recommended a rear room after initial booking to avoid noise for live music in the pub below. Good call.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel cannot be beat. Walking distance to many of the "key" places to visit in Sydney. The pub on the first floor (and the partner pub next door) are added pluses. We stayed in rooms with "shared baths" -- were a little cautious of this when we booked -- but it worked out perfectly. Hotel it immaculate (for an older building). Beds comfortable and excellent space in the rooms. The only bummer was walking up the stairs (there was a lift too) to our rooms (but happy to get some steps in!).
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you need a base in Sydney and/or cruising I can highly recommend the Russell. the staff are great, friendly and professional. The building in the 'real' Sydney and the price is great. Breakfast is all you need and more. You cannot beat the location.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for one night while visiting for the Vivid Light Festival. The location is amazing, you are only a short walk away from The Rocks, Circular Quay, Harbour Bridge, Botanic Gardens etc. We had an ensuite room which was very clean and comfortable. The continental breakfast is very good, a bit of a labyrinth to get to it but that's part of the charm of the hotel.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel last week for one night. The location is fantastic - close to Circular Quay and all its attractions; close to the railway line and bus terminal close to a plethora of restaurants. The staff were knowledgeable and helpful, our ensuite-room was very clean as was the bathroom. Breakfast was a step up from continental and more than adequate. Great 'old world charm'. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, comfortable, friendly staff and nice little touches like the nighttime chocs with little proverbs. Best location in Sydney plus very quiet. Had to move furniture to accommodate suitcase on the floor but that'st not a biggie when you're in such an historic hotel. Visited for Vivid 2019.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely heritage building in the heart of the Rocks. Reception staff were great - friendly and helpful. The room was small but well decorated, with quality linen, and a small but functional ensuite bathroom. No view from the room (other than a brick wall!) and no air con (though not needed on a chilly June evening). You can also relax in the sitting room or up on the rooftop, or downstairs in the bar. The continental breakfast (included in the room rate) was good too - served in the bistro next door. You are close to everything - all the tourist sights, restaurants, bars, transport etc. Good value for a hotel in the city.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having stayed before we were excited to return and we were just as pleased with our stay for 5 nights for the Vivid Expo. We were extremely comfortable in our en-suite room and the complimentary breakfast more than adequate and delicious. The convenient location is fantastic, within walking distance to all the transport and entertainment one would want. The staff are fabulous with nothing too much trouble. There is no doubt that if and when there is a future visit to Sydney we will return! Thankyou all.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment you arrive you are immersed in historical charm and there is a homely and welcoming vibe. Exceptional attention to detail to keep this property true to the era it represents. Beautifully decorated and furnished in an old-world period theme with all the comforts of modern day living, fantastically balanced. We had a wee look at some of the other rooms, all are individually and beautifully styled on-point the old-world theme. To demonstrate the lengths the management have gone to to keep the vibe real, on the mantle-piece of the fireplace, next to the vase of beautiful fresh flowers, are 3 old books, in the front of one of the books, the certificate awarding the book to a young lady back in 1940, now that is genuine attention to detail. The hotel is perfect and the location is fantastic. A short walk across the road and down a few steps and you are at Circular Quay, the transport hub for ferries and trains. A further short walk has you at the Sydney Opera House. We just cant say enough about this fantastic property and the genuinely lovely staff who looked after us. The Continental breakfasts included in the room rate are delicious and set us up for great days of site seeking and shopping, (far too much shopping....) We will most definitely be back, thank you Russell Boutique Hotel xxx
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 5 nights here, and were a bit nervous as booked 'shared bathroom'. However, this was not a problem at all and provided more privacy and no inconvenience. The staff are so friendly and helpful, the room was spacious, and to be able to walk across the park to Circular Quay was perfect. With everything at our fingertips, we also enjoyed the convenience of very reasonably priced, delicious restaurant meals. We would stay there again in a heartbeat!
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2 minute walk to Circular Quay ferries and trains. I stayed overnight for the Vivid Festival and couldn't have been happier. The later checkout time (11am) gave me plenty of time to have breakfast, shower and dry my hair. Lovely room with ensuite, cozy and comfortable bed. Maxine was the nicest lady and told me everything I needed to know. Light breakfast was just what I needed and lovely spot on the roof to sit with a coffee. The only thing I would change is a more convenient place to boil the kettle as I couldn't see a power point near the coffee table. The pub downstairs was handy and had a good choice of meals.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed one night during Vivid. The location is so close to the train station, harbour, Contemporary Art Museum, and an easy walk to the Sydney Opera House. I had a double bed room without bathroom. The room was snug, but nicely and uniquely decorated. I felt very comfortable. The bathroom was just down the hall and was clean. The continental breakfast was simple but tasty and convenient. I'd definitely stay again. :)
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just stayed the one night prior to our cruise. We had booked a room only - the bathroom was just down the hall. For one night that was no hardship, and there was no waiting at all to use the facilities. Our room was quaint, quite small as expected in such an old building, but perfectly adequate. Very pleasant and helpful reception staff. The continental breakfast was excellent.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at The Russell Hotel, The Rocks, on a stop over both down (1 night) and back (2 nights) on a recent trip. What a great Boutique Hotel in a fantastic location. The Russell was very clean and cosy. Room was a good size and bed very comfy and a great rate. Shared bathroom always very clean. Beautiful rooftop garden to soak up the morning rays.Location to public transport was great with Circular Quay only a minutes walk away. Train ride is only 25 min to the domestic airport which made things so easy.Definitely stay there again on my next visit to Sydney Town.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the pleasure of staying at Russell Hotel for a few days before sailing to Canada on Noordam. Fiona, Andrew and Gary looked after us very well during our stay. > When we checked out, our plan was to embark the ship and then return to the hotel for our luggage. Unbeknownst to us at the time was that Australian immigration would not let us disembark from the ship. So we had the ship call the hotel to ask for your assistance. > Please pass our sincere appreciation to Gary for delivering our luggage to the ship. He is our life saver. > We will highly recommend Russell Hotel to any of our friends considering a visit to beautiful Sydney, Australia. > > Thanks for making the start of our vacation so perfect. We had a wonderful cruise home.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean accommodation and central location for The Rocks, Sydney, adjacent to Circular Quay, venues and lovely shops. Substantial breakfast included, level above continental. Nice sitting room adjacent to rooms for family gatherings and spectacular rooftop garden terrace for afternoon tea.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love the old world charm of the and great service. With the Push Bar below and Fortune of War next door there is a great deal of history and atmosphere to enjoy. Centrally located in the the Rocks area, ideal place for that special getaway.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been in Sydney few times and i just regrett the fact that i did not know this place before!!!!! Luckely my sister booked during christmas holiday and she was happy and so i decided to give it a go and booked for couple days on Anzac day.Location perfect just 5 min to circular key station and wharf. The Opera House on the right side, the Harbour Bridges on the left..... The rock basically is just inside the hotel ......The hotel old style with all the amenities needed, wifi, tv, fridge etc... Breakfast pretty good, not too fancy just simple good product.Bed was clean and confy, very quiet during sleeping time.Pub at the ground floor liked it.Rooftop decent size relaxing with nice view.Staff professional and friendly.Very good price. When in Sydney i finally have a place where to stay!!!!!!5 Star hotel, i love it!!!!!!
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were very serviceminded and the price was fair. I never thought I could find anything this close to the Opera House within my budget, but I did. The only drawback was the noise from the street and nearby pub, but for this price it was worth it. Also, don't bring too large suitcases as there were many small stairs and narrow corridors, but at the same time this hotel had its own unique charm. I would definetly stay there again. The staff was very helpful and friendly. My first night ever in Sydney and the experence was great.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Russell is not a standard hotel. The building is very old and quirky, the furniture captures an old world , historical look with all the modern requirements sorted. The view is nice and open windows for natural ventilation is great if, like me, you dislike big air conditioner systems. The staff are wonderful and super helpful. The included breakfast buffet is high quality and we enjoyed lingering over a second coffee. The expense is easily justified as the locale has so much you save on cab fares. Loved our stay.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a fantastic hotel! Quaint, beautiful, central to everything, clean as a whistle and customer service was excellent.Breakfast in the morning downstairs was just a bonus as was the great little rooftop terrace to relax after a hectic day wandering the city.Couldn't recommend any higher for our needs.Will be back!
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very conveniently located, just few minutes walk to the Sydney Harbour. Room with king bed was clean and very comfortable. The shared bathroom was at easy reach with all amenities and were unoccupied each time we needed to use it. We only stayed one night and were away for most of the night, therefore are not sure if the pub downstairs was noisy. But from midnight onwards there was no sound, other than just the street noise. We had a very pleasant stay and plan to book this hotel again in our future trips to Sydney.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a gem! The staff is incredibly helpful and professional. The rooms are comfortable, attractive, and quiet. Ours had a nice view of a park across the street. We did have an air conditioner in the room. The location is excellent with lots of good restaurants and a market on the weekend. It is very close to the cruise terminal. They stored our luggage until we could check-in. The continental breakfast in the charming restaurant/bar is simple, but adequate. There was no in-room safe, but the office would put passports, etc. in theirs.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a long weekend at the Russell from Brisbane to see a show at the Sydney Opera House (so we were looking for a place within walking distance of the SOH).I chose the Russell via one of the on-line booking sites, based on TripAdvisor reviews. That worked efficiently and email communication from the Russell was good.We had a room with private facilities. Make sure you get what you want when booking - some rooms have a shared bathroom separate to the room.Our room was very nice. Quite spacious. Comfy bed. The weather was good so the absence of air-con didn’t bother us. The room had a ceiling fan and the window opened. There’s a flat screen TV, hanging space, bedside tables and good free wifi.The bathroom was an enormous wet room. The location was excellent - we caught the train from the airport to Circular Quay (you can tap on and off using a credit card without buying a transit card), and it was a 5 minute walk to the Russell. It’s one block back from harbourside. Being where it is, there’s plenty of restaurants, coffee shops and attractions (SOH, Sydney Harbour Bridge, Circular Quay ferries, the city, the Rocks, weekend markets, etc) nearby. It’s a lovely building too. There’s a pub downstairs, which is where a serve yourself breakfast is set up - coffee/tea (also available in your room), juice, cereal, yoghurt, hard boiled eggs, toast, etc.Next time I’m looking for accommodation in Sydney, I’ll look at The Russell first.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve stayed here 2x times now... and in the same room... we stayed with my large family of 4 children and 2 adults. The location was great!... my kids loved it ... make sure you check out the rooftop deck and the reading room my kids had so much fun exploring... also breakfast was included and there was something for everyone
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great room that was not adjacent to others so very happy.Not a modern hotel but its quaintness is an attraction. Continental breakfast is a plus and parking virtually next door at discounted rate is good too.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel as it was centrally located in The Rocks for our St Patrick's Day celebrations.Perfect location - short walk to The Orient and The Sydney Harbour Bridge.Less then 5 minute walk from Circular Quay station.Older style hotel but clean and comfortable (we opted for a room with ensuite)Great little pub downstairs and access to the Fortune of War Hotel next door.Great Food.Great pints of Guinness on tap.Lovely, friendly staff.Check in and out was quick and easy.Would absolutely stay again as it is such a great location.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel situated next Cicular Quay ideal for seeing all Sydney Harbour sights.All staff brilliant and helpfull.Nice continental breakfast and food in ajoining pubs also good.Not all rooms have ensuite facilities but room we had did.Rooms are clean and found beds comfortable.Only down side is the lift only covers 2 floors and there are quite a few stairs to overcome but staff will assist with luggage if required. Would definitely stay again if ever visiting Sydney again
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a small Room with en-suite & found it small & quaint. If you can’t manage stairs don’t even consider it. The en-suite was clean and tasteful. The bed very comfortable with a very quiet overhead fan. Breakfast was continental and adequate with helpful staff. We loved it and will go again.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fabulous location and staff. Photos represent accurately. Clean. Many stairs - for those with heavy luggage or mobility issues, notify the desk. There’s an elevator, but some rooms still require steps. Character and history. Rooftop patio was lovely for respite after enjoying a great adventuring all Sydney has to offer. I will return, most definitely.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Old hotel in the old Sydney neighbourhood The Rocks. Ideally located to explore this part of the city and very close to the harbour and train/subway station to find transport to other parts. The hotel seems to be spread over several old buildings and has connecting hallways with steps but there's also a small elevator. There are different types of rooms, with or without airco and with or without a private bathroom. The rooms have a classic looking interior with antique/old furniture items. The bathroom of our room was also old, but looked really vintage with the old tiles and tap, which was part of the charm for us. Prices are reasonable compared to other hotels in the area. Also, the breakfast is served in the old pub below the hotel, a nice assortment as a buffet. A special mention of the excellent service of both the employees that helped us. They kindly corresponded with us by e-mail beforehand, because we expected to arrive late. They gave us special instructions to find our way and someone was waiting for us upon arrival. Also after checking out, we could leave our luggage there for the day and they kindly offered us fresh towels and use of the showers before taking off after a warm day. Very much appreciated!
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For touring the sights of Sydney and accessing the various transport options this is the perfect hotel. It is an old hotel and the rooms are all different with their own charm. Some of the rooms could do with a little tlc to bring them up to a standard you would expect when paying more than $350 a night. The air conditioner in our room was a mobile one with a hose out of the window, and therefore very noisy. The hotel is in the busy rocks area and very convenient if coming or going on a cruise ship with just a short stroll to the terminal. They provide a lovely breakfast in the bar area on the ground floor. There is a lovely roof deck to sit on and a communial lounge with a computer for guests use. There are several flights of stairs in the building but the staff are very helpful with cases etc. Overall a lovely old hotel with plenty of character.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This amazing Little Gem of a hotel in the Sydney rocks was fantastic.We were fortunate enough to stay in room 1 right above the corner bar and the view was fantastic. All the staff were amazing including Steve the maintenance man. It has a great location to walk down to the ferry terminal, it's right next to the Contemporary Art Museum and a short walk up into the rocks to some fantastic views, restaurants and bars. It is close enough to Central Quay train station that you can get there with your suitcases without too much trouble. The breakfast in the bar was a great surprise with really good food and coffee. If you hunt around you will find the rooftop garden which is a great place to sit and sip a glass of wine. Great value for money and will be staying there again.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It has a great location to the Opera House and wharfs, which are just across the street. There is a Friday-Sunday Market down the street as well:9-3pm on F and 9-5pm on Sat & Sun. The only complaint would be that if you shower, you must have the door shut or you will pay a $1250.00 fine if the fire alarm goes off.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: fist time in Sydney, we were lucky to chose the Russell .What a location, the rocks is perfect for your base , walk out the door , Sydney harbour Bridge stands there , fantastic location.The hotel is based in the oldest part of Sydney reflect the old chic look , rooms have a great old school look .Living under two active popular pubs, part of the hotel can be lively But great fun ! The staff we fantastic! Special mention to Dan for his help and Hard work ! Fantastic.Looking forward to seeing you soon .
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a wonderful place to stay. We had a function at the Museum of Contemporary Art and The Russell Boutique Hotel is right across the road. Had a super pre drink at "The Push Bar" and off we went. A wonderful place to stay with great staff and super comfortable bed. Will stay again
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I had a great stay here. The room is lovely and clean. Small, but perfect for us as we wanted to see the city and not just sit in our room. I felt the price was fair for a city accomodation and would have no hesitation in recommending The Russell Hotel for a great short term get away to the city.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived today. Convenient location near The Rocks and Circle Quay, Room is tiny. No room to open luggage. No AC. No TV. No safe in room. Shared toilet and shower with 2 other rooms. If you make multiple trips to toilet in night this is particularly bad.Place is like a rabbit warren with multiple levels and short stairways. Bed has old flat springs and no box spring. No place in the room to hang towels which you take with you to and from the bathroom. Main entrance and reception on different levels, somewhat confusing. Overall, what one would would expect in a very cheap hotel, not one which charges as this "Boutique Hotel".
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a very charming hotel , and so well situated that everything can be done one foot .The two black points I releved was for the breakfast and the cleaning of the room. It’s good to take a drink on the rooftop at the end of the day.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well you know how it is, you spend hours on the internet looking for a hotel, but maybe are still dissapointed when you arrive. Well I was the same but I can honestly say this is one of if not the best choice I have ever made. It's basically a hotel of thirty some rooms above a pub on George Street right next to Sydney's Circular Quay for the Ferries, Opera House and Bridge. Our room had a big comfy bed , air-con and en suite shower room (but check first, rooms I believe varied) The complimentary continental breakfast was served in the pub and was a great start to the day. The staff are very friendly , thanks Gary and if like us you had come to Sydney to board a cruise the terminal is literally across the street and a two minute walk away. Put simply, without hesitation we would go back tomorrow but having just put the keys in the door after arriving home back in the UK maybe it will wait a little while.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quirky as built across 3 old properties and with charm. We chose to upgrade to a room at the front with air condition8ng given the heat. Room was large and spacious. Bathroom was fine. Breakfast is set out in the pub below and reasonable apart from the coffee which was kept warm and not so nice. Friendly receptionist. Loved the terrace and guest sitting room. Used 5he same day service for a bag of washing for $20 - good value.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we arrived the staff were okay. Sydney was having a heat wave and with no air conditioning we couldn't sleep. The next day the staff were fantastic. It had a great breakfast. There was also a lot of noise from the bar below.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for one night but wished we could have stayed longer. Such a lovely, old hotel with plenty of character. We would definitely go back again as it is in a great location if you are visiting Sydney. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Our room was large, the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was modern and clean. There is also the "Push Bar" downstairs that is a good place to spend your evening. We highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at The Russell due to its proximity to the international terminal, what I had was a truly lovely experience. Fabulous sized room, great on suite, staff were delightful and it was such good value for the location. Great food accessed from the Push Bar, spent the evening on the sitting room balcony enjoying the sights and sounds of the city with a great bottle of champagne from the bar. Believe I have found my Sydney home away from home, planning my next stay currently.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel last week and it was amazing. Friendly staff, lovely room, good food, good service and a beautiful roof terrace. Perfect location for visiting Sydney. 3 mins to circular quay and 5 mins to Sydney Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What an amazing building. They have kept all the classic details when refurbished. The staff were fantastic, the room was a joy to stay in, The Push Bar was very cool & the rooftop terrace was a good way to end the day with a glass of wine under the stars. We'll be back for sure.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Russell late last year and when booking for this visit to Sydney, had no hesitation in returning "home".Apart from its convenience to cultural attractions such as the Opera House and the Roslyn Packer Theatre, the Russell is just a short walk to Circular Quay Station - a must for an 80plus-year-old.What appeals? First, the friendliness of the staff throughout the property and then the homeliness of the rooms and decor - which, furnished as they are, do make one feel at home. Add to that a welcoming and spacious "Sitting Room" just like there always used to be in hotels of yore, so it's not hard to see why I'm a fan.My only suggestion would be to make the availability of barista coffee at breakfast, even at additional cost, better publicised by signage in "The Push".
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Russell Boutique Hotel is full of old world charm from its furniture in the rooms to the winding hallways and stairs. It also has a lovely rooftop garden. The staff were very nice and helpful. One man appeared at just the right time to help me take my bag up or down the stairs when I was arriving and then leaving. It is only a few minutes walk to Circular Quay which makes its position absolutely ideal.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was very helpful regarding suggestions for tours and eating options. The room was quiet, clean and comfortable. I also enjoyed use of the sitting area and balcony. Breakfast was excellent as well. Great location! Would happily stay here again.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the presentation of the hotel, friendliness of all staff, choices of eating options on site right through to the excellent location - loved it! Will be our go to accommodation in Sydney from now on.
hotelName:
14    The Russell Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am conflicted writing this review because if it leads to more guests at Bondi Beach House then maybe we may not be able to secure our next booking when we want to ! Be that as it may, this place that to be shared.1. You must want to stay in Bondi. 2. You are looking for an Australian beach house experience.If you tick yes to both these then look no further than the Bondi Beach House.It is short walk to the main beach front strip of Bondi and from there all of Bondi is within easy walking distance, the beach, restaurants, cafes, shops, the lot The longer majestic coastal walks , both north and south, begin and end here too.The accommodation is spotlessly clean and full of Aussie beach side character. It is not an impersonal 5 star hotel but an intimate personal home of your own for as long as you stay.All I can conclude is check out their website and book. We have been there twice within the past 6 months and will be there again. Maybe I will see you ?
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Delighted that I found Bondi Beach House. Such a lovely, quirky house which was very well equipped with everything that you could need, and such a homely feel. Impeccably clean, with very kind owners who checked in with you at every stage of your stay.Amazing location being just a 5 minute walk onto the beach. Have recommended to others and would absolutely love to come back!
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a fantastic four night stay in the outback room. Although the room is small it provided everything I needed as a solo traveler and the price for what you get can not be beat. Also, how can you beat the location, just a block or so from Bondi Beach with a number of eateries and shops all within walking distance. Since I didn't have a car I used public transportation the entire time. The 333 N Bondi bus stop was just a 2 minute walk away and provided excellent service in and out of the city as well as stops to get on the Airport rail (best to get an Opal card). Thanks to the hosts for a fabulous stay and would definitely come back here should my travels bring me back to Sydney.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bondi Beach House is an absolute treasure. The location is perfect and the decor in the rooms is lovely - the pictures really don’t do the rooms justice.Bondi was our first stop on our honeymoon trip and the owners very kindly bought us a bottle of champagne to welcome and congratulate us - such a nice touch.We would definitely stay here again. Thank you for such a great stay!
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in the Green Room a comfortable double room with a TV DVD player in the room, my only criticism is that the room was a little smaller than I was expecting. The bathroom and toilet were shared, and the shower was over the claw foot bath. The bathroom was also the laundry so could be a problem with everyone wanting to use the bathroom, toilet and laundry at the same time but this was not a problem for the two days that I was there. The house is coastal beach decor with lots of unique pieces of furniture and ornaments and I admired the lovely shiny floorboards. The breakfast is great , it is continental but included eggs, and toast jam, cereal and juice. The muesli I had was amazing full of fruit and nuts. I also loved the products in the bathroom, the body wash was heavenly, orange and patchouli. The staff were friendly and helpful. A lovely stay!
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bondi Beach house made me feel at home away from home. It’s a wonderful place with intriguing decor, all amenities you need and very friendly staff. I stayed at the Wattle room, which is small but cozy, and had all I needed. Loved the big communal dining table and the tub, definitely enjoyed a bath! The location is perfect, close to a few really nice lunch/coffee spots and a stone throw away from the beach, bondi-to-coogee walk (great for runs in the morning), the ocean pool at Icebergs and the 333 bus stop to the city and all tourist attractions. I will come back if I make it back to Sydney for sure!
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Being so far from the United States it still feels like home. The winter here is chilly in the morning and night so the portable heater next to my bed was comforting. The decorations are nice and there is a patio in the back for fresh air. The communal area was good as a backup food/beverage options. I took a two minute walk and there was a nice coffee/wine bar with a tasty lamb burger. This is also a good overlook spot with a beautiful view of the beach. A further walk and there are plenty of shops including more food options, bars, bottle shops, and places for souvenirs. The beach definitely had visitors native and tourists, but nowhere close to the pictures often posted online. Plenty of extras and attention to detail for comfort. Adjacent to the main beach road but slightly away from the hustle and bustle for some privacy.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I had 5 days in the Frangipani suite. She had stayed before and loved it. The house is so homely, fascinating décor and close to the beach, cafes etc. I thoroughly recommend Bondi Beach House, I was sorry to leave, Really enjoyed our morning cuppa with the French doors open overlooking a sunny courtyard.I can't imaging staying anywhere else in Sydney.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fenda and Donna are gracious hosts. Assisted with transportation and activities. Friendly atmosphere . Enjoyed relaxing in the back patio. Wonderful gardens. Lots of stairs. Perfect location to beach and restaurants. Buses were easy to ride and navigate.We'll recommend. Thank you
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Bondi Beach House was perfect in so many ways. We stayed in Frangipani Suite 1 and we didn't want to leave. Beautiful décor, artwork, quiet, spacious, lovely outlook. Breakfast was very good and we sat outside in the courtyard to enjoy the sun and the house cat, who is very affectionate. Bondi Beach House is very close to the Campbell Parade (southern end), beach, Bondi Icebergs pool. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We will be back.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Third time we have stayed here. Different gorgeous room each time. Old world atmosphere - old building, but funky and full of personality. Engaging, varied, often quirky artwork - I think about 9 or 10 items just in our room. Clean and fresh, relaxing and comfortable.Two minute walk to the beach. Sea view from at least one room.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely gorgeous boutique rooms. Very short walk to beach and Bondi Ice berger's pool and the Federation coast walk. The staff were so accommodating, rooms spotless, beach towels to use and they left a beautiful bottle of wine for us. Only little issue was security for room with wonky old windows.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A fantastic little "home" away. The art, the rooms, the atmosphere is just wonderful. The landlady Sue makes you feel very comfortable and welcomed. The rooms are clean, nice and has no "hotel" feeling to it. You get to borrow beach towels and the washing machines are free to use. Breakfast was nice and if felt like you were among friends having if.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for around a week over new year. Lovely bright rooms, very friendly welcome and great location for the busy Bondi Beach area. Sue and Fenda were very helpful with any problems and the informal breakfast was a nice way to start each day.Bondi is a great place for the beach and surf but lots of lovely cafes and restaurants. Make sure you try Macelerria for the best steak in town!
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would definitely say this was one of my best stays in Bondi. Such great value for a gorgeous room filled with character and love. We stayed in the Frangipani Room which opened out to the communal courtyard which we took advantage of! Staff were extremely accommodating and they gave a beautiful finishing touch of leaving a birthday card and fruit platter in the room for our arrival.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just returned from 4 nights at Bondi Beach House and had the loveliest trip! I ended up choosing Bondi Beach House to avoid the solitude of my own AirBnb and the recklessness of a hostel.Highlights:- 1 block from Bondi Beach, with easy access to as many restaurants, bars and yoga studios you could ever need. Also near the beginning of the Bondi -> Cogee coastal walk.- Beautiful outdoor patios in the front and back of the house, good natural light.- Neighborhood is quiet at night and feels safe.- Included breakfast a nice perk, as well as personal storage in the communal fridge.- No issues with the wifi, plenty of beach towels to use and DVDs to watch if you want.Considerations:- This house isn't very accessible for someone with limited mobility due to the stairs at the front of the house and up to the kitchen.- The rooms are cozy (I was in the Wattle Room single) which suited my needs but may feel limiting if you have a lot of luggage or want a big room.- Ditto to what everyone said about the water from the shared shower getting all over the floor. Didn't really bother me, but felt weird leaving the place all wet after each shower.- Shared bathroom was also not too much of an issue except when the door would accidentally close and I'd be waiting for 30 mins not wanting to bother someone (when in reality it was unoccupied). I don't believe all of the rooms that shared the upstairs bathroom were occupied curing my stay, so it may feel busier at other times.- If you're a light sleeper you should bring some good earplugs. The wooden floors cause sounds to carry and if your room is on the 2nd floor off the kitchen you can hear everyone get up to eat in the morning.All in all I had a wonderful time and would stay at BBH again!
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful place. Arrived early and they gave us coffee and internet until the room was ready. Easily accessible by train/bus from airport or downtown area. Very quiet rooms in quiet street but only 4 minutes to Bondi Beach or the Bronte cliff walk. Great restaurants nearby in this very lively area. Room was large, clean, with a comfy bed and great shower. Internet was fine in-room or in common areas. Make your own breakfasts included eggs, juices, fruit, cereals, breads, etc. Coffee was excellent and was available all day. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would recommend this place in a heartbeat.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed staying here! I stayed in the outback room which is a single and in the cottage in the garden behind the main house. The room was very quaint, clean and the perfect size for a solo traveler like myself. The shared kitchen was a great place to have breakfast and meet other travelers staying in the house, I met some great people during my stay. I will definitely return to Bondi Beach House for my next trip to Sydney!
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed initially for 5 days in the Wattle Room, which is one of the smaller rooms. Absolutely what I needed, so I booked a the same room for my final night stay before flying home to the UK. The Beach House has a relaxed vibe that I felt was like staying at a relatives house.The interior is light airy and artistically appointed. The courtyard at the rear and garden at the front are both great places to relax. Good value considering the location and property and beats being in a hotel where you don't get to chat with anyone. I liked this place and will be back.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Bondi Beach house is a fabulous place to stay. Its quiet, clean and feels really relaxed. The breakfast is a serve yourself kind of set up with a shared kitchen area. The room I stayed in was lovely, it had large patio doors out onto the front court yard and was a good contained little apartment with its own kitchen area too. The garden areas are beautiful with lots of flowers and greenary. Its a short walk to the beach but far away enough from the hustle and bustle to be out of the noisy area.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in the Wattle room this past weekend and thoroughly enjoyed it. The room itself was delightful; beautifully decorated and very cosy. On the smaller side but this suited me! The self serve breakfast was great and I loved the room storage boxes in the fridge. Such a fantastic idea. The place itself is in a fantastic location and lends itself well to exploring. The staff were all lovely and friendly, in particular Steven (sorry if thats the wrong spelling) was fabulous! Thanks for a great stay and a great first impression of Australia!
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great place! We spent five nights in the Franpanni Suite with a little kitchen area and a courtyard outside our French doors. The breakfast is self serve so even though my husband doesn't usually like staying at Bed and Breakfast places because he doesn't like to eat breakfast and interact with strangers, he didn't mind this place. There's toast, eggs to cook, cereal, juice, coffee and tea. It's the same everyday which some night mind. The bed was comfortable and there's a ton of DVDS for free and even laundry which was a godsend for us traveling for two weeks. It's in a great location. Be sure to look up all the great restaurants around the area within walking distance and don't settle on the Italan one on the corner, although good, high priced for pasta. We loved the fresh market and Bonditony's Burger Joint. Also the Coastal Walk to Bronte for a great cup of coffee at Bogey. We would totally come back here!! We had a lot of rain so it was damp but the heater did its job. Only one little suggestion is a shower curtain to keep tall people like my husband from soaking the bathroom with the shower spray.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful & Charming Boutique Hotel. 5-star accommodation with lots of details! Will always come back to this one when I'm in Sydney! Breakfast & Wifi included. Super clean and quiet. We had a perfect weekend and almost didn't want to leave :) Thanks for everything.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's been a dream of mine to go to Australia since I was a child. Even though I was able to only visit Sydney this time, I was extremely fortunate to find Bondi Beach House on Travelocity's site.I was treated to a private room (my own bungalow) which was well light and very clean. Perfect for this solo traveler!Flying in from the states I knew that I would arrived way before check in time ( flight arrived 6:30 am check in at 2 pm) so I alerted the the staff via email before I left the USA. With the ability to connect to wifi on Bondi beach (thank you Bondi Chamber of Commerce) I was able to check my email and Fenda had my room all ready and the key available ! The staff were knowledgeable and amiable. Donna and Fenda answered any questions I had and I must say the common spaces were always bright and clean. It felt like home. I would definitely recommend this to friends traveling to Sydney. I myself would stay there again in a heartbeat Thanks for a wonderful time Marty Huelsmann jr
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Once again a lovely relaxing stay in this gorgeous beach house!We enjoy the privacy & peacefulness of this comfortable accomodationIt is Like home away from home!Close to great cafes, beach & shops we will definitely be back to stay on our next trip to Sydney.Thanks Donna for you help after hoursDeb & Trev
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Found a good price for a few nights on booking.com. The B&B is amazing, I stayed in room 9 and was a solo traveler. The room was lovely and had everything you need. It was very close to Bondi beach and there was quick and easy transport links to the city center. I would highly recommend this B&B to anyone! Thanks for a great stay!
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for four nights. Really feels like home. Positives: Very peaceful and quiet yet seconds from Bondi beach itself Help yourself breakfast so no need to feel rushed in the morning Big room (we stayed in 7) - attractive decor and very beach house esque Bus stop for Sydney CBD really close One possible improvement would be to have more on offer for breakfast given the price per night and offer an alternative than just full fat milk. Another night be to make the kitchen available for cooking at other times of the day. Thanks Bondi Beach House!
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying at the Bondi Beach House feels like staying with artistic, slightly bohemian relations. The house is full of delightful furnishings and art. The other things it has going for it are location (tucked in a quiet street but very near to the beach) and a beautiful garden. Our three day stay was quite expensive compared to say AirBNB and because of this I thought the breakfast was disappointing. You help yourself to cereal and toast, which is fine but it's sliced bread and there's no yogurt, fresh coffee etc. but this is pretty nit picky and as long as you don't go expecting hotel service or budget accommodation you won't be disappointed. We are Brits and £ is weak so this might have skewed our opinion.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I, my daughter and fiancé, all stayed at centrally-located BBH for a week recently. The best part for me was the spacious kitchen-diner upstairs. The help-yourself breakfast suited us perfectly. Various lovely cereals, apples, tasty bread and eggs were provided. Also a selection of jams and spreads, orange juice, hot beverages. Whilst the self-catering aspect and communal dining room might not suit everybody, we felt it added to the informal, beach stay this B&B promotes. It is what it is. Pleasant, friendly place, lovely staff and good ambience. Try and stay in the en suite bedrooms overlooking the front of the house. They are spacious and airy.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bondi Beach House is just about perfect for us. We visited our son who lives on Bronti Beach and we stayed for two weeks with a weeks stay in Melbourne in the middle. The ladies (Fenda & Hazel) looked after our extensive cases while we travelled. The beach house is spotless and furnished with interesting pottery and pictures. Lovely to sit in the garden in the morning sun and enjoy a breakfast which is just right. Bondi Beach is one of the most famous beaches in the world but won't suit all people, for us it's an area full of life and surfing culture - you can sit and people watch all day. We are a couple in our late sixties and enjoy the cosmopolitan mix of the Bondi Community and felt very much at home and safe. Thank you Fenda, it was a joy to stay with you.Mike & Helen Davies.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very homely and beach style house in walking distance to Bondi Beach. You feel like home making your breakfast in a huge kitchen where everything is provided. Washing maschine as well as dryer is available, too.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a perfect place to stay. Very clean and comfortable. Great location, quiet road not far to walk to Bondi Beach. Big fridge with own box for your stuff. Complimentary breakfasts, bread, eggs, cereal etc. tea and coffee. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went to bondi for the sculpture by the sea.Very good connection to the beach as well as the city.Very clean and friendly. Was very Lucky to stay in my cosy outback room.Very clean fridge with own box for personal stuff.Also feel the need to mention the very good soap and shampoo with conditioner provided with rosemary and orange flavor. Warmly recommended !
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A perfect little get away for two nights. I stayed in Room #6, The Green Room, it was small with a double bed and a TV/DVD which was all we needed for our short stay. The room was clean and nicely made up. The shared bathroom also was clean and not inconvenient.Location was great, just back from the main street, so not too much noise and convenient for catching the bus to various other places and Bondi Junction. A good ride to Watsons Bay is also nice to do from here.Help yourself breakfast was great, we cooked eggs that are provided, on toast. You could also have spreads and cereals, tea and coffee and also plunger coffee!! We could have bought our own bacon and cooked that also if we so chose.I would definitely be back, if I stayed longer I would choose an ensuite room, but little #6 was perfect for us on this occasion.Thanks for your hospitality.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed with my 2 teenage boys for a Saturday night in Bondi. Room was great and made up just the way we wanted it. Really close to the beach. Lovely breaky in the morning. Couldn't fault it. We will be back again soon.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room we had was accessed via an alley up the side of the house. The only windows looked directly at a wall. Breakfast room was well equipped with basic breakfast fare as advertised. The management were amazing and helpful, I became unwell whilst staying and they could not have been more considerate and helpful. For this reason we would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gorgeous, gorgeous, gorgeous.Simply beautiful house. Excellent location. Fantastic, helpful and engaging staff. My family, wife, two daughters and one son and I stayed for three nights and we are all agreed...we'll be back. Relaxing, great value and simply the best accommodation in Sydney.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a awesome place to stay! Beautifully furnished and decorated, spacious room with own entrance an terrace (Frangipani Suite). The complimentary breakfast is a helpful and very appreciated idea! Location is great on a quiet street only only a short walk to the Beach. Thanks also for the beach towels provided!
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a fantastic weekend getaway in Bondi (despite some crazy weather) and staying at the Bondi Beach House was a real treat. Cosy, clean, helpful staff and a great breaky thrown in. Was hoping our flight would be cancelled so we could stay another night.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this place, this is my 3rd visit! Location is just perfect, home away from home. Staff are friendly, breakfast is great. The place is always so clean. The house is beautiful and relaxing with all the lovely art work, books and DVD's available.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is sort of bed and breakfast-like lodging. The rooms are clean and comfy. A few share a bathroom. Its quiet in a neighborhood setting, yet the beach and some good restaurants are a stones throw away on the corner. The beach and everything that goes with is is right across the road from the corner restaurants. Great place and Great Location !
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely stay in Queen Suite - Palm View. The place is quite with a very relaxing ambiance. If we'll get a chance to go back to Bondi, we will definitely book Bondi Beach House again. And oops before I forgot we really enjoy the free breakfast(toasted bread, jams, etc.).
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We finished a trip to Australia with 4 nights here and felt this was one of the best places we stayed at. It is very clean and quiet, despite being near the beach and the cafes & shops. Very good communal kitchen and courtyard for breakfast - also very handy to have laundry facilities there too. Helpful assistants on site much of the time too. Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a nice place within short walking distance to the beach with good free make your own breakfast with eggs, bread and a selection of teas. Too few bathrooms given the number of rooms and the kitchen is not available for use outside of breakfast hours which was really strange.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Characterful guest house, very friendly staff, relaxed atmosphere, great location just 50 Yds from Bondi Beach with all its amenities. We had a Lovely room which was well equipped and we would not hesitate to return
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: charming house , lot accommodation, room pleasant , very nice, big dinner room for all the guest, big room with all accommodation, good breakfast, charming garden and vue and terrace. the place to go.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had the most beautiful stay in this friendly and cozy B&B. I felt totally comfortable and at home and could feel the holiday vibes. You can keep to yourself or chat with others over breakfast. Perfect location. Very easy and clear pre communication. Would highly recommend to anyone.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Bondi Beach house for 5 nights in March and the staff, room and location are fabulous! We will definitely stay again and would completely recommend ! There is no air conditioning but found it comfortable, fans are also provided. Breakfast, continental style is provided, staff are friendly and accessible, also great location to beach, shopping and restaurants, Thanks ladies !
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in the Lotus Room for 6 nights whilst visiting my daughter who now lives in Bondi Beach. What a wonderful place. Spotlessly clean and very welcoming. The well stocked communal kitchen is a great idea, especially if you are staying on your own, as I was, as its a good place to chat to other guests and share experiences of where and what to do whilst staying in Sydney. The location was excellent, with easy access to Bondi Beach, shops and regular bus routes into the city centre.I would definitely stay here again if I ever come back to Bondi.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in the Frangipane suite. To be honest, the bathroom in that suite is a little hokey, and there's enough room in the suite to build it out a bit and remodel it so that you can move around a bit better. But this is a beach house, and you're here to go to the beach, and this place is a great option to high-end boring beige hotels and backpackers lodges (which seem to be the two available extremes.)The suite was quite big, lots of windows, french doors to the front deck, nice view. They have a screen available to put in the window so the other guests don't have a clear view into your room. You have to be kinda independent. You get an email telling you how to check in, there is ample food in the fridge for breakfast (there were plenty of eggs, fruit, milk and oj when I was there ... the extra eggs were on the bottom shelf of the fridge,) and equipment to cook a simple breakfast. If you want something fancy, you can buy stuff and keep it in the fridge or walk 20' to some excellent restaurants.The common spaces are big and airy, nice back yard, big frangipane tree that scents the whole place. The staff is rarely seen but helpful when they're there (they arranged my taxi to the airport.) But the real point of it is that it's a nice, clean, airy place that's close to the beach, the Iceberg pool, the coast walk, and steps from the bus that gets you into Sydney. It was perfect for my stay. The pluses definitely make me forgive the hinky bathroom (the mirror is over the toilet rather than the sink ... makes for tough shaving but, really, who needs to shave when you're on vacation at Bondi?)
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While the location can't be beat, our stay was just OK and, in my opinion, highly overpriced for the kind of accommodations we stayed in. My thoughts . . .Bedroom - Quirky 'artwork', hippy dippy style. Lots of natural light from louvered window. However, for privacy sake, kept them closed as there was another house directly next door. Small point, there were only 3 clothes hangars in a small stand-apart dresser of sorts. Thread bare and thin rugs on the floor.Bathroom - Miniature would be an understatement. The worse part was no shower curtain and no matter how you maneuvered yourself and the shower head, you always ended up with water all over the floor.Shared Kitchen - I have no problem sharing a kitchen with others, but for our entire five days there, a family of five made their way into the kitchen before everyone else and basically took over using all the eggs and most of the supplies. The O.J. was sub-par and the only fruit were apples that were, in my estimation, seconds--bruised and possibly only good for baking.The entrance towards the front door was up several steps and was constantly littered with the flowers that dropped because of the couple of days of rain during our stay. Yes, I can understand that this would happen, but it wasn't till three days into our stay that anyone even came by to clear the pathway. Very slippery.So called beach towels were thread-bare. As for caretakers, you never knew who they were. No one introduced themselves as such, and only on one day did I see someone who I took to be 'in charge', a term I use lightly.My overall feeling about this property is that you're paying for the location and not much else. They're certainly not putting all the $'s they take in to the upkeep of what could be such a memorable holiday vacation house. Unfortunately, it wasn't that for us, and I wasn't asking for much. But, when I pay a high $ rate, I expect a bit more than we experienced.
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect place , excellent services , everything is done to make you feel home ! Nothing Wrong , just want to go back as soon as possible :-) Close to the Beach and 30 minutes away from the city. Quite , clean
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed five nights in the green room with my teenage daughter who was attending a course in Sydney. The room was cosy but comfortable, with a nice bed and good linens. The shared bathroom was always clean, and also has washing and drying facilities. The communal kitchen is lovely and the continental breakfast supplies were of high quality. We took advantage of the large dvd collection each night in our room. The property is decorated in a wonderfully electictic fashion with different artworks and many lovely books to enjoy. A stones throw to the beach, dining and shopping too. The staff who run the house are very nice, a special mention to Fenda who had a smile every morning. The only word of warning in this location is an apparent serial car keyer. I had to bring my vehicle to dive my daughter to her course each day so I booked a car space which was on the street. I always took care to park in my allocated space so as not impede anyone, however on the last evening a nasty piece of work severely damaged the paintwork on my car bonnet :( The property does have cctv but without the name and address of the culprit I still have to pay my insurance excess to have the repair. Of course this is not the fault of the beach house, Fenda was genuinely upset when I told her, as there had been keying problems in the street in the past. This is just something to keep in mind if you bring your vehicle. I will absolutely visit again, without my car!
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely house, 5 min walk away from bondi beach, places to eat and bus stopA well equiped and fonctionnal communal kitchen with a good DIY breakfast (delicious muesli)Nice outdoor spaces Would defintely recommend and stay againWe stayed 6 nights in the wombat room which was downstairs with independant entrance and private bathroom (a bit small)
hotelName:
15    Bondi Beach House Accommodation
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just stayed here one night but the rooms were comfortable enough, fully stocked and well serviced. Easy check in and out by friendly receptionist. Very handy to central station and restaurant options. The price was lower for Sydney city so great value for money.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location, quiet, clean, comfortable bedding & spacious bathroom. Complimentary daily continental breakfast plus hot beverages (i.e, coffee, tea , hot chocolate available 24/7) are nice touch.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was looking for a hotel near Central that can fit in my budget, and 28 Hotel was it. It was a short walk to Central station, with plenty of cafes, restaurants, convenient stores and supermarket nearby, many open early or until late. The room was spacious, but it could do with more power outlets. The positioning of the rainfall showerhead and the water switch was a bit cumbersome, and the toilet was too near the wall, but otherwise, it was a really pleasant stay.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Saturday was my 2nd time staying here and again it was amazing. excellent value for money, right around the corner from the train station, close to my fav food spice alley and easily can get anywhere in the city. Coffee machine is an extra bonus and staff couldn't be more helpful. Will be back soon!
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Did not think it would be as nice as it was , everything you need and a great location. Friendly staff. Very close to Central and Broadway. Great price for city accommodation. Room wasn't that big but fit for purpose.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a comfortable and relaxing time. Location was really good, close to Central Station and a wide variety of eatery's close by. Staff were excellent very helpful, room was very clean and breakfast was good. Thank you 28 Hotel.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a room for 3, which had lots of space and a separate bathroom (with a door). Noisy air conditioning unit outside our door but was constant so not too bad. Takeaway breakfast is useful with all day coffee/tea machine downstairs. Very close to Central and lots of restaurants. Cafe nect door was closed on public holiday, but would have been good to try.Very comfy beds. Excellent value on Sunday nights
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place has to be the best value in Sydney. If you arrive by train, it is a short walk from Central. The coffee machine (24 hr) in the foyer makes surprisingly good cappuccinos and breakfast pastries is a nice touch. Location is great- 2 minute to Spice Alley, Woolies and quality shops. Excellent bed and great shower. Some rooms without windows, I didn't go for that !
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 28 Hotel has everything you need for a comfortable stay on a budget. Loved the little touches such as the reading light and iPad. In room dining and toothbrushes are also provided. Very clean rooms and comfortable beds. Great value!
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here during Vivid Sydney and the place is awesome.The location is only 5 mins walk to Central Station. Free morning bites and unlimited coffee! The room is clean and the bed is soooo comfy! Kudos to the staff for being so accommodating! Definitely will book here again!
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great mid-week stay at the 28 Hotel in Chippendale. Attending a conference next door at the Mecure. Parking was all arranged there by the 28 Hotel. Found the 28 Hotel staff to be very professional and friendly. The rooms were great, so quiet, and well appointed. The 28 Hotel is in an excellent location with fantastic cafes, wine bars and restaurants all a short walk away. Also saw VIVID festival which was another bonus!
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The 28 Hotel is close to Central Station and UTS. The 28 Hotel is very easy to get to from the Airport on the train. The room wass comfortable and there are hot drinks available in the foyer. Good value for money.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and well-priced hotel. Conveniently located near Central Station, Spice Alley, Chinatown, and Central Park Shopping Centre. Reception staff were very friendly, and the added extras of free breakfast, free wi-fi, free in room iPad, and $10 Opal card were fantastic. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Didn't expect that they will offer me a bigger room with window and I can use the ipad in the room. Bathroom is very clean but no curtain to cover the window.Though nothing outside the bathroom,besides the wall.Location is perfect,8 minutes far from China town and 5 minutes to central station.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wifi was fantastic! Service staff were helpful and friendly. The location was perfect! The breakfast options are slightly limited and the gym is a distance away. For the price I paid, I found it to be worth it.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was easy to find, only a 10 minute walk from central station. The room was great value for money and quite nice to stay in. There was a free coffee machine and muffins in the reception and the staff were friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the hotel was close to Central station and very convenient to do everything. And the hotel provided compliment coffee service for 24 hours and served free breakfast in the morning. In addition, there was an ipad for guest use in the room and room had enough space to stay comfortable. The lady at the reception was very kind and had nice smile and good hospitality.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located right next to Central Station making it highly convenient to get around the city. The service was good and the room were clean, compact and comfortable. The price for this value is also an added bonus. Will definitely be coming back.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: S33°53'5.9" E151°12'12.1” This hotel is a short 5 minutes’ walk from the south concourse of Sydney Central Station, between George and Lee St behind the Mercure Sydney hotel. On George St are many bars and restaurants, but Regent St is not a busy street. 57 Hotel is its sister hotel. This former Central Regent Street hotel underwent renovation in 2017. Our room 605 on the sixth floor in August and September 2018 was a twin room in the back of the hotel, with view on the platforms of Sydney Central Station. It has two comfortable beds, although a bit too short. The room had central air conditioning (windows could not be opened), television, fridge, iron and ironing board. Wi-Fi was good but not for streaming video. The bathroom had a shower and toilet. Housekeeping cleaned our room daily with new towels. The hotel offered simple breakfast in the small lobby downstairs with coffee, tea, muffins, cake and fruit. No juice. Enough to start the day. Car parking is available in the Mercure Hotel at the back of the hotel for AU$45 per day. We paid for the Max Twin room AU$162 per night in August 2018. We contacted them by e-mail and booked directly.For its central location, clean and modern room and simple breakfast, 28 Hotel offered a very competitive price in Sydney CBD. Recommended.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice compact room. Very clean room and bathroom. Great shower head!Comfy bed and pillows. Nice complimentary coffees downstairs in foyer. Free wifi. Walking distance to train central even with my 30kg baggage in tow.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of property is very googd, just 5 min walk from central station.Check-in and check out was very easy, stuff is excellent. There is no balcony in the rooms, air condition (heating mode) in our room was not working. Very dark rooms.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice and tidy Would come backgood value hotel in excellent location for public transport and access to CBD/Darling harbour. Staff friendly and helpful, complimentary coffee a nice touch (though a kettle in the room would be a great addition). bed comfortable.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed at Hotel 28 on 2 or 3 other occasions and found the staff very helpful and courteous. The location is excellent for our needs close to all forms of transport and we found Spice Alley this last visit great.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was worried it might not live up to expectations based on how cheap it was to stay there but It was better than I could have imagined. Great coffee machine, good size rooms, friendly staff. Loved it!!
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: good value hotel in excellent location for public transport and access to CBD/Darling harbour. Staff friendly and helpful, complimentary coffee a nice touch (though a kettle in the room would be a great addition). bed comfortable.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a long train ride I arrived in Sydney at Central Station after dark and made my way to 29 Hotel, walking with my small roller bag and backpack. It was an easy , short trek to the hotel and I was greeted at the door and quickly checked in. I asked for a hot water pot and it was delivered to my room quickly. The room was ... different, 2 single beds end-to-end, a desk, fridge, clothes hanging area and full bath. After figuring everything out, it was a very comfortable room, quit and easy to use. Cleaning service was consistently good and the staff was very helpful.And to top it off, there was free coffee , tea and hot chocolate available 24/7 in the lobby, great to have after a day of exploring or climbing the Sydney Harbor Bridge.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Almost our first contact with Australia has been through this hotel and the experience has been great. The girl in the counter, Pooja, helped us with all our questions in a very kind way. Aldo, when she knew we are in honey Moon, she upgraded our room form free. She recommended us ways to come Jack to the airport, places yo visit... Thanks a los, Pooja.Moreover, the hotel is well located, rooms are clean and, altough there is no breakfast, you can have coffee or tea 24 hours a day and you have something to eat from 6:30 to 10 all completely for free.Fully recommended
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was very clean, spacious and modern although the street view was somewhat dismal. The lobby is cosy with 24 hour hot beverages available self service and muffins and bagels provided for breakfast . Secure storage was provided free of charge.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great location within walking distance of the train station and several shops/restaurants. It is also relatively close to the waterfront district. Friendly desk staff.The only downside is the loud water pipes in the washroom whenever people in other rooms are showering or flush the toilet.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is great but I will have to find out what the $10 charge is that appeared on my bank statement. It's not much money but it's mine and if they charged it wrongly which I'm sure they have I want it back.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great location clean and well presented staff are very helpful.28 hotel is located near plenty of eating places not far to catch a bus if you want to go sight seeing not far from central station. They will hold your bags until your room is ready then deliver them to your room for when you get back.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I needed a clean, comfortable and safe room for the night which 28 Hotel provided. Great value for the price. I slept incredibly well and found the bed to be very comfortable. I arrived very late at night and reception was warm with polite and helpful staff. Nice hot shower in the morning. Very close to Central Station. The room was a weird poky shape and I missed not having tea/coffee facilities in the room. Other than that - great.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
