review_body: This cute hotel is excellent - very good location, excellent value and above all very friendly and helpful staff. An added bonus is the delicious coffee freely available 24/7 in the reception area. Bed was comfy and room quiet.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location at Central Station. Loved the coffee machine in the foyer free to use whenever. I had a very early train to catch in the morning and loved the Grab to Go breakfast snacks available in the foyer from 6.30am. Savoury ham and cheese muffin, blueberry muffin and apple, plus coffee which I was able to take with me to eat on the train. Excellent.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bit of a walk from Central station, but still nice affordable clean place to stay with high speed Wi-Fi and nice breakfast included in the stay. No room has a microwave, and most rooms don't even have fridge, so not recommended to stay with families, but for individual stay like I did, it was good value for money
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brilliant hotel, 5 moinute walk from Central Station which is only a 10 minute train ride from the airport using your Opal card (travel card), then 10 minutes into Circular Quay. The rooms was large and clean and the staff were lovely and friendly. The coffee machine in reception was great, it allowed for us to have lovely coffee before heading out into the city for the days adventures (they have take away cups too which means you can take it with you). There are grab and go bites too which is pastries and apples etc. which is great in Australia because not all hotels supply breakfast. Great for holidays and business travel.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I had a wonderful stay at 28 hotel. The staff are amazing. They remembered my birthday and left a card and gift in my room, so thoughtful. The hotel is clean and everything is within walking distance. Next time I’m in town I will definitely stay hotel 28.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The Hotel had all the facilities I required for my business stay. There are a couple of supermarkets nearby and lots of choices of places to eat in the area.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very good for one night stay.The rooms are tiny, beds are lumpy. However, facilities are clean, look new. Staff are very friendly and helpful.The biggest negative for us was lack of parking. We were on driving holiday and stayed 1 night in Sydney. Driving in Syndey is nightmare, but finding parking is triple nightmare.Hotel 28 has agreement with Mercury hotel parking. It will cost you $48 per night. Plus getting in and out is problematic.Having excellent coffee machine in the hotel lobby was a plus though.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a basic hotel in an excellent location near Central Station and the Central Mall. The facilities are very simple, although the bed is comfortable. I would prefer to have tea/coffee facilitites in the room but they are located at a self-self near the reception.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Travel monthly and this is one of the worst I’ve stayed in. The smallest room I’ve ever seen. No tea or coffee, got take away last night, get back to the room no cutlery, was advised plastic knife and fork available at reception. Not cheap, better rooms in Sydney for much less.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a great location close to everything we needed and more. Very comfortable beds, spacious room with all you need. Good shower and lighting, very clean and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The lobby is a great place to relax with a good coffee (provided free), and easy listening music while waiting for my transport. The light breakfast provided in the morning was a great way to start the day.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its all about location they say. This Hotel is located near Central Station and its convenient when you're travelling everyday to and fro. The room I booked was great for the price i paid. Its also located near Chinatown if you like to shop and explore amazing Asian Food. Very friendly staff. Highly recommend this hotel for its location and price.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in 28 Hotel for 3 nights for Business, location was great, close to Central Train Station, an abundance of food choices & shops close by. Service was great, staff very friendly, place very clean & nicely renovated. My particular room was not very spacious but was fine for what I required. The coffee machine & morning snacks were an amazing touch. Would definitely stay again & highly recommend.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel offers comfortable rooms, at a very competitive price in a convenient location that is close to bars, restaurants and public transport. This is the second time that I have stayed at this hotel.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great and courteous staff, I arrived 2 hours before I could check in but they could look after my bags and even gave suggestions and directions to local places to have lunch.Well layed out and clean room with one of the largest showers I have seen! Quiet room and secure 24/7 access.I liked the 24/7 coffee bar on the foyer and the free WiFi was fast and easy to access!Heaps of different types of restaurants and cafes abound within a short distance, the closest being a Nepalese restaurant basically next door. Close to Central Railway station and to railway square bus terminus, transport isn't a problem.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tips - On the way to the hotel from Central Station, I found that it’s easier for me to pull the heavy luggage along George Street than Lee Street. We arrived Sydney very earlier. The receptionist was very kind to let me check in the luggage, so we could have lunch without carrying heavy stuff around. We appreciated! We also love the coffee machine. Nice hot beverage is available 24/24.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 28 Hotel is only a few minutes walk from Central Station, the main hub for transport in Sydney. We went to a sporting event. It is any easy walk to catch buses to the stadiums in Moore Park or the trains to Olympic Park.But you can also easily get to other events such as theatre through the city circle train or easy bus rideAmazing restaurants are just around the block. There is also a computer tablet in the room from which you can order food.The rooms are comfortable but basic. Our room was petite. There is a fridge but no microwave. We stay here for a short weekend trips and it is perfect. Might not be as good for a long stay. Also we go to Sydney on a regular basis ( every 4 - 6 weeks). The room we stay in isn't important to us. But if you are a first time visitor and wanting your hotel room to be special you may want to look at other options. If you are a first time visitor and not fussed about the room this is a well priced room for the location. PS The rooms are very quiet
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our second stay here - the rooms are pretty basic, but it is the best location and value for money for inner city dining and shopping. We love the proximity to Darling Harbour and China Town. Convenient to get to, and the service is always friendly and welcoming. Will definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a large family of 6 and this hotel was in a great location, affordable and accommodated is perfectly. The staff were friendly and helpful and we had a wonderful stay. We would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2 queen beds and 3 single beds in one huge air conditioned room with a bathroom big enough for us all to dance in at once. Conveniently a 5 minute walk from central and all travel. Clean and friendly.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 28 hotel is conveniently located to central station which made it a great choice for access to events. The room was lovely and clean, and the bed was great. Shower was awesome! The super friendly and helpful staff made the stay even better. We will definitely come back.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and spacious room. Comfortable beds. Simple pastries provided for breakfast in the morning and tea/coffee for 24 hours at lobby. Walking distance to station and China town and many shops and restaurants around. Highly recommended this hotel. Will choose this hotel again when come travel Sydney again.
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very close to Central station, easy check in, room spacious but not very exciting. Quiet despite being near busy roads. Coffee available in lobby in morning, some snacks but nothing for gluten free like me which was a shame
hotelName:
16    28 Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 4N here. Check-in was swift in the small and simply decorated lobby... and not moment too soon as the front desk was soon checking-in a busload of tourists (this seems to be very popular with large tour groups). As a Plat, I was upgraded to a suite, with a large toilet and walk in wardrobe. Rooms were spotless, comfy bed, speedy wifi. Courteous staff throughout. Had a burger at the bar but patty was overcooked. Thankfully breakfast (comprising the typical 4 Points spread) was better.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My party of 7 (with 4 young kids) came in late after a rough, delayed flight. Then we had to leave at 6am the next morning. So my stay was short but I could not have been more impressed with the hotel and the staff.Henrik (not sure of spelling) was incredibly helpful in getting us situated quickly in our rooms. He was able to take care of our luggage so it could be stored and offered us welcome refreshments. Our rooms were perfect but Henrik made sure in advance by showing us floor plans. Moments after we got to the room Hayden was there to quickly set up the pull-out couches for the kids to sleep on. Really a great staff on all fronts.The hotel and rooms were fantastic. Super clean and new. Our rooms were very large for any city, let alone Sydney where they can be tiny. The bed and linens were incredibly comfortable. If I am ever back in Sydney this will be the first place I look to book
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed one night for a meeting in same hotel. Very easy to get to from airport via train and short walk from central station. Very friendly greeting at the front desk and lovely room. Spacious, clean and new. Good breakfast. Close to some local pubs and shopping. Easy train into CBD.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the smoothest hotel stays I’ve had. Very comfortable bed with great sheets and pillows, lovely staff who handled all requests swiftly and a fantastic location. Pricey but good breakfast and many other cafes in the area. Better value for money than many other Sydney options. Would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location close to Central Station.Lovely spacious rooms and comfortable bed. Fantastic ‘media hub’ option in rooms so that you can plug in your device to stream shows of your choice.Coffee machine in room and 2 bottles of water per day. Small fridge available for personal use. Much appreciated glass of bubbles upon arrival.Before check out we were going to drop our rating of hotel due to poor room cleaning on our final day (had no other issues on any other day) and Reception were fairly disinterested in our complaint. Upon checkout, however, the lady on reception was mortified at our complaint and called the manager over immediately. The manager apologised profusely, offered her business card and asked that should we return again, she would try to personally organise an upgrade. It left us feeling much happier about the one mistake. I would highly recommend this lovely hotel.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Im not much of a writer and in fact I have not been posting on Tripadvisor. I have missed writing many many reviews, however this hotel made me go back on tripadvisor and compelled to write this review. First of all I think this hotel is perfect value. Second of all its in the heart of Sydney without being congested in downtown CBD. Parking was indoor at afair price. Hotel was new. Next to malls, restaurants and a park. The whole Central Park Area is a relatively new development.One name Id like to jot down is our man than Henrich Varga, he just seems to solve our problems. We had issues with our room (was not hotels fault there was construction) Henrich made sure we were given choises of other rooms and everything was taken care of.Great hotel! In fact one of the best I have stayed. Its just an overall satisfying hotel. Trust me Ive stayed in hotels five times the price, like the one im currently staying in right now as I type this review, but different satsifaction level. Four points thank you! I will come back!
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We ere looking for a good well situated hotel in Sydney that would not break the bank. I can definatelt recommend this one. It is in the area called "Chippendale" which is central to most amenities. Good restaurants, within walking distance of Central railway station. The rooms are reasonably spacious and modern. The staff were extremely helpful.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was offered a free upgrade to the king room. The rooms are much bigger than other nearby chains I have stayed (Mercure Sydney).Lovely staff and friendly Clean rooms and linens too will stay againCentrally located a few mins walk from Central station
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 1 night before flying overseas the next day. The hotel is lovely and modern we had great customer service. The rooms are lovely and big and the bed was super comfy. In a good location and not to far to walk from central station. The only issues we had was checking out our coffees from the restaurant had not made it in the system when we were checking out and we were held up a little while they tried to sort that out, also we arrived just after 8pm and the room next door to us had room service and there tray with leftover food was sitting outside there room and when we got up to have breakfast the next morning just before 8am it was still sitting there not really a good look.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When the customer service is saying that to you, you know it can’t be a good review. My second try with this hotel, and both have been awful experiences so no more. Terrible customer service, very hard to deal with payment and booking system, missing meals, disappearing complimentary wine. And then when I’m trying to bring this up the person on the phone says ‘well, it’s your decision to book here.’I’ll be avoiding this one for all future bookings. It’s convenient, but it is NOT a worth the hassle.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located near “Broadway” and “Central Park” this Sheraton offers comfortable beds and good sized rooms. We arrived early-6 hours before check-in exhausted from 24 hours of flights. We were rescued by manager Hayden Woodbury who gave us temporary rooms. Later in the day we were upgraded to a junior suite. Unfortunately, there was construction work going on outside our room. The breakfast feast was sumptuous and the service quite good. The exercise room is small. Overall a positive experience. The staff is friendly!
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is not too far from the central station, the setting and the hotel is fairly new. There are plenty of restaurant around the area while not too busy. Wonderful place to have a quick getaway. If you have the hotel Marriott app , you can order extra amenities where available for free to your hotel room directly. For example , shave blade , too paste, extra pillow etc.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely place, lovely service BUT they shot them selves in the foot with me because my sister forgot her keycard whilst she went outside for a smoke and I had gone out and they rudely refused my sister Re entry into the building. I can understand this to a point but her name was on the booking and she felt she was treated like a criminal, had to wait at least 5 mins feeling like she wished the floor would swallow her whole until the porter took her to the room and let her in. Sorry guys but you should definitely not make a paying customer feel like that.We will stay elsewhere and not come back here for that reason.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a good time on my recent short stay in Sydney. Hotel was clean and modern. Was located on the 18th floor so quiet. Not so well known to the taxi drivers but theres always Uber. Close to restaurants (Spice Alley), a small Mall & Cinema and the Central Railway station.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We absolutely loved this hotel!It’s location is fantastic. We love to wander around Surrey Hills, which is only a short walk away. In general, it is a very well connected hotel. You can get busses to most destinations further afield such as Bondi. The City Centre is also easily walkable. In terms of facilities nearby, you’re on the doorstep of Central Park Mall, which has fashionable clothes shops. There is also a chemist, Woolworths, and plenty of eateries to grab a bite for lunch or dinner.We were upgraded to a suite room. We had originally asked for the suite upgrade but as the hotel was busy they couldn’t accommodate our request for a couple of days, but nonetheless they eventually moved us into a great room. We’d say it’s one of our favourite rooms of the places we’ve stayed (which includes the Ritz Carlton in Singapore). Okay, it’s not particularly the Ritz but it had everything we needed. A walk in wardrobe, a huge bathroom with double sinks, a sofa to watch Tv. More importantly, the room was quiet and the bed comfyness scale would be a 10/10. The only gripes against the hotel are that (1) the fried eggs at breakfast were usually cold despite being placed under the hot lamp (we noticed that when the kitchen were frying the eggs, the cooked eggs were left on the side on a plate to get cold, and by the time they reached the hot lamp, the eggs would not get hot enough), (2) the music in the breakfast room sometimes felt like you were entering a rave party or a drum n bass event (we mentioned the music to a member of staff but he said there is nothing they could do) - there were quite a few guest a little disturbed by the music.Generally, we loved this hotel. The staff are absolutely fantastic and welcoming. We would certainly stay again.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time staying here. Smack in the midst of student world. Nearby university, student accommodations and associated academia services permeated an atmosphere of youthful exuberance and vibrant energy to the area.Plenty of bohemian eateries surrounding the area, catering to the youthful population. Perfect for business‐trip stays, for sure.Rooms were clean, fresh and comfy. Friendly and efficient staff made the stay enjoyable, productive and restful.A mall just a few meters away and Woolworth grocer within similar distance.Ongoing developments can be seen being initiated within the vicinity of the area. This would further enhance to the vibrancy of the place in the not too distant future.A swath of greenery nearby, provided a welcome break to tired minds and thoughts to recharge. Courages and friendly pigeons would definitely delight if they sense you are safe to be saying "hello..." to....Four Points scored a wonderful and a gem of a location here !
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were staying overnight for business so didn't spend much time in the room. Helpful staff at check-in. Not an overly big room and decorated in shades of beige. Nothing exciting here. Comfortable bed, good shower, bathroom ok. Nice view over surrounding buildings.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is 10 minutes walk from Central station with lots of good food options nearby. Brand new hotel - very quiet with all required amenities. Very comfy bed with divine pillows! Will definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: stayed for business for 1 night rooms were good, newly furnishedgym was rather small with limited equipment and space (rather cramped)location is just next to a mall and hidden food street which had quite a few options
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice location in Chippendale new hotel, big rooms. Welcoming staff. All good by all accounts. Would have been perfect if it wasn’t for the “upgrade” - I booked a mi range room, and was told on arrival I had been upgraded ! Wahooo. - upgrades to an accessible room - handles everywhere - a sink so low I had to kneel down to wash, a toilet so high I need a ladder to mount the thing. Really this was so disappointing, I just did not have time to speak to anyone, but honestly if that’s the best upgrade you can offer - no thanks. Lost a star for that, you should have asked me if this room was ok for me, not just fob me off with it. Actually as I’m writing this it’s making me more disappointed so I’m taking another one off. Setting expectations - you failed. BTW a tip, there a loads of great independent cafes around where you can get an amazing breakfast.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent and well-priced hotel with modern design and all the amenities of higher end brands. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Best of all, it’s centrally located with easy access to public transportation and all the tourist attractions. We had a fabulous time.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Managed to get a room on short notice. Upon arrival I really liked the overall design of the hotel. On check-in the staff were friendly and professional. Also I received an unexpected gift of chocolates which was a nice surprise and the room was amazing as well, definitely would stay there again.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location! Very close to chinatown, and to central station!We walked to the opera house and took us 50minutesWoolworths, a mall, Starbucks and seven elven in less than 5 minutes walk.Very confortable rooms!Very complete and nice breakfast!
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved staying at this hotel and would highly recommend to other visitors in Sydney. From the welcome bubbles on arrival to the well trained, helpful staff who went above and beyond to ensure our comfort (even returning our panicked phone call after checking our room to find a missing mobile phone).This a new hotel, literally a few minutes walk from Central Station so very easy to find just a couple of station stops from the airport and Circular Quay. The beds and pillows were perfect, room generous and well appointed. Chippendale is quieter on the weekend. Spice Alley / Canteen A1 are literally around the corner for coffee and meals and it is only 10 minutes to Newtown. So many choices nearby!
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a cruise we booked this hotel for one night prior to our flight home, We had to leave the ship by 9am so took our luggage to the hotel just so that we could leave it there whilst looking around Sydney. The best laid plans as they say, I was taken ill a day prior so when we got to the hotel at 10am i really felt and looked like xxxt. The lady on reception was an a darling she said we could have an early check in and she would phone us when our room was ready. At 12am ( and a visit to a doctors nearby our room was ready)The whole stay was fab and ALL the staff we encountered were great , they pre booked us a taxi to the airport and that arrived exactly on time, We know where we are going to stay next time we are in Sydney , and we may be able to explore the area as it looked so interesting
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When you stay at an SPG hotel and are a loyal member you come to expect a certain standard of service. Four Points missed that memo by a mile!- called the front desk for a charger and they refused to send one. The option was to leave the phone at the reception ??!!! - front desk folks don’t even greet you when you enter the premises. I get business hotels but it’s been a while since I have seen such poor levels of training New hotel, central location but so far, poor service. Alas have to stay the rest of the week but if anyone at SPG cares to listen, will find out.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful brand new hotel close to Central station (8min walk) and spice alley (2min walk). The front desk staff is fenomenal and very friendly. The rooms are clean and spacious. Highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Frequently visit Sydney and so many hotels are appearing quite tired and in need on renovations. Plus finding a hotel that is quiet is difficult to come by in a major city. Well the Four Points ticked all my boxes, quiet, spacious rooms, new, friendly staff. This area of town has many great eateries and is only 10 minute walk from central station with convenient connections to airport.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked an overnight special with breakfast. Very stylish and modern hotel. Bit tricky to find parking...google didn’t quite get it right! Lovely staff Kapa ? On reception was extremely helpful with lots of ideas. We dined in the fab funky Spice Alley area in Kensington st. Great food and so reasonable, very casual.Our room was spacious and stylish. Breakfast very nice.The bar area is indoor and outdoor. Lovely server from Nepal, especially pleasant. Give you a generous bowl of free snacks with your drink.It’s about 20 min walk to Darling harbour. We walked back from the Quay in about 40 mins.Very impressed thanks!
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What makes a great stay? They almost nailed it. Location: 8/10It really depends on your trip's objective. This hotel is chucked in a corner that is pretty quiet yet vibrant. 7 minutes walk from Central station and within 30min walk to darling harbor and Sydney harbour. 15min walk to Chinatown. Not too bad! The neighborhood is filled with students, hence the vibrancy. Rooms: 7/10Reasonably sized for their standard room. Most switches and facilities were designed with practicality in mind. One thing to note though: they do not loan adaptors for free. They'd charge you $15 to buy one. That's pretty unwelcoming for me Service: 10/10Really top notch. Everyone's at their best! The check in was a breeze. Despite arriving at 9am, she tried her best to allocate a room that is available. A shout out to Wallace and Shailendra at the bar! Really great guys who made the stay more enjoyable. The bar is also quite a good place to chill and chat up with fellow travelers. Who needs a hostel when you have a bar here?Yang from the front desk had been very friendly too! Engaged the customers and I felt at home. Food: 7/10The breakfast selection is quite basic, but they cook up pretty good poached eggs upon request. I didn't try lunch nor dinner there though Platinum members are recognised by 2 drinks voucher per stay. Not too good compared to other properties given the absence of a lounge. Value: 6/10The property is quite pricy given it's facilities. At some time, it's even as expensive as Westin Hotel in the city. But I think the cabin crews that stays here helped to keep the occupancy up.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was very large , quiet , a nice bathroom but shower only(no bath) . Close to a new shopping mall next door and a street (Spice Lane) sunk below street level with lots of food offerings . Hotel is 4 star in that it has a restaurant and bar.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Close to good public transport, within walking distance (~20min = excuse not to go to gym) to town and nice restaurants close by (1 block) and even a Starbucks (across the courtyard). New & clean rooms with multiple USB charging points. Wardrobe doors to block corridor and bathroom entry. Bathroom small but more than adequate. Buffet breakfast better than most - and opens EVERY morning at 6:30. 24 gym (but can avoid if choose to walk) and so convenient with central station close by. But is far enough away to have a peaceful (for a major city) feel.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Being a new hotel we expected a really great experience. Unfortunately, this was not the case. We knew we would not be able to check in after our cruise ship docked in the morning but we weren't prepared for the chaos at check in at about 11am. Very crowded, very small lobby with a total of 4 check in stations and no concierge desk. Only 3 people were woking checkin. When we finally got to the front of the line and were told our rooms would be ready about 3pm. OK no problem. We were then advised we would have rooms with king size beds.We were a party of 8 with 4 rooms booked. We had requested 2 rooms with 2 queens because we were women sharing rooms but didn't plan on sharing beds and 2 kings for 2 couples. We had requested queen beds when we made the reservations in July. We were advised they never get this information in advance from hotels.com and that they wouldn't be able to accommodate our request but could give us twins. Also, they didn't have the correct names. We were advised they were oversold and very busy. Really? Off we went to sight see after checking our luggage. When 4 of us returned to check in after 3pm only 1 rooms was ready. We were told the other would be ready in 15 minutes. Again no problem. After 2 hours and still no room I called down to ask for the manager. After being put on hold and then begin disconnected we went to the front desk and asked for the manager. He arrived and said he knew we had been cut off. After a discussion about the room at about 515 we got the 2nd room. There were 3 elevators for a 16 plus story hotel and one of those elevators was out 2 of the 3 days we stayed. One of our group returned one evening atfter 6pm only to find their room had never been cleaned and my room looked like it hadn't been vacuumed in weeks. While new the hotel has had 8 months to get their stuff together. The lobby is inadequate, there should be a concierge and generally wouldn't recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a wonderful experience due to staff and new rooms. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful from the moment they said welcome to Four points Sheraton. Rooms are new, spacious and clean. I was awarded an immediate upgrade due to being Gold Elite status with SPG. My room was 1803, on the very top floor with a view of the City. There is fast internet on the hotel premises and many TV channels if you stay in your room. Four points is located a few steps away from a Starbucks, Bus and the Central Train station. There is a mall next to the hotel and incredible areas to explore or attend a tour. If you need to go anywhere far and don’t like using public transportation, Uber is the best in Sydney. Uber’s are quick to pickup, accurate, friendly and super clean cars. If you are staying longer than a day purchase an Opal card to get you around. Sunday’s are the best for taking trains, busses or ferries as the maximum charge on Sunday’s is $2.70 all day long. I would like to thank the front desk staff of Four Points for their courtesy and professionalism. Staff such as you are the reason customers return to your hotel. I recommend this hotel for any visiting tourist. You will enjoy your stay. Have fun in Sydney.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s 2 days into our stay and I can write off this hotel. The main gripe is with the service. The pulling rod is detached from the night curtain. I reported it on the first day upon check in and also requested for dental and shaving kits. We returned after several hours and nothing was fixed. The amenities came after a few calls to housekeeping. The curtain was still not fixed as of writing. General service was average and not particularly warm. Poor housekeeping. Breakfast spread was limited but probably in line with a 4* property. Location is at the city fringe but rates seems to be a premium. We still have a few days to go...
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located within walking distance to Central station and good access to buses for the city. The Central Park mall next door is very convenient for meals, coffee and a supermarket. This is a good location to be based if you prefer a quieter location to bunker down when you visit Sydney. The hotel is new and it shows. The rooms are well appointed, clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast was plentiful and the chefs cooked eggs to order. Very friendly staff and chefs at Central Quarter dining. My only gripe was that although we had a late checkout booked, due to a promotion, we had to remind them as they interrupted our stay a few times after the normal 11am checkout time.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very good hotel in Broadway within 10~15 mins' walk from Central Station. It's served by various bus routes. Walking to the CBD took less than half an hour. Very conveniently located. Central Park Mall where there are lots of shopping and dining opportunities plus a supermarket is adjacent to the hotel. Stayed there for 10 days. Affordable prices. Breakfast was included. Buffet style. The chef was very helpful and friendly. Each day they prepared freshly cooked hashbrowns upon request. Appreciated it much. Disappointingly the soft boiled eggs went overcooked sometimes. Our room was on higher floor but the view wasn't justified the additional money paid. Better save the charge for somewhere else. It is newly opened in late 2018. Everything was new and clean. However the staff wasn't very professional. They forgot to refill the coffee capsules on most of the days and even omitted to servicing the room for 1 day until asked to do so. Apart from that we still enjoyed the stay.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only 4-6 months old in he newly renovated precinct of Sydney beyond Central Station, the Central Mall area. From what was Carlton United Breweries sit through to Abercrombie this whole area is a buzz with restaurants, cheap Asian fare at Spice Alley, cinemas and eateries in Central Mall. So amazing location close to city and central station.Front desk staff a little slow with check-in despite my checking in via the Marriott App.... it still took a little time. Rooms, foyer including an outdoor seating area are wonderful. Rooms really modern and sleek design, small-ish bathroom for 2 but still adequate. Not a fan of the pillows available with a chronic neck thing...l couldn’t get the neck comfortable. Good housekeeping once a day so our 3 night stay was very comfortable.Do miss the pool and the gym has limited weights machinery choices.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2 nights at the Four Points Hotel in Sydney was great. We were near the hop on hop off station with both red and blue lines. It is also near the central station. It isn't far from the bay and attractions.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband (Mario) and I and one of our buddies (Rolando) stayed at this property November 2018. The hotel was only operating for a few months when we arrived; however, the front desk and housekeeping had everything running smoothly.We caught an Uber from SYD to the hotel (about AUD $47 for a SUV) early on Sunday morning. When we arrived at the hotel Maria at the front desk greeted us and checked us in. Maria answered all of our questions about the property and the surrounding area. She was extremely friendly and delivered the "gold standard" of a customer experience. This property is lucky to have her! Rolando also confirmed that the hotel received his request for a "featherless room" because he is allergic to down feathers, and they were able to accommodate!  After checking our bags with the bell hop, we checked our bags and started exploring Sydney. The area the hotel is in is very safe and across from the University of Sydney Technology campus and an indoor shopping mall called Central Park (Tip: There is a liquor and wine/beer store on the bottom level of the mall).Darling Harbor was only about a 15 minute walk and has plenty of options for touristy things to do and places to eat. After about two hours of exploring, we received a call from Maria saying that our rooms were ready.The rooms are very clean, comfortable, and were our oasis after touring Sydney every day. I was hesitant about this property at first, given that there weren't many reviews at the time, but after staying here, we would definitely return again. The property does have a full service bar and restaurant, but we ventured out for our meals and drinks.We pre-booked an Uber for our return trip to the airport, but unfortunately after waiting half and hour past the pick up time the driver was a no-show. Maria saw the distress we were going through and offered to help arrange transportation to the airport. Kudos to Maria made sure we were comfortable throughout our stay!PRO TIP: Since this is a new hotel, your Uber would turn at the "Adidas" exterior sign, as if going into the mall; then make a right to get to the hotel entrance.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed a total 9 days while in Sydney. We arrived 9am after a long flight and they were kind enough to accommodate my early check-in request. The rooms were new, spacious and comfortable. Super location - less than 10 minutes to Central Station (train to/from Airport), less than 2 minutes to Central Park shopping mall (Daiso, Cinema, Woolies, food court, clothing shops, restaurants), about 10-minute walk to Broadway shopping mall (Target, food court, K-mart, Coles, etc), about 15 minute walk to Paddy's Market, Chinatown and less than 20 minute walk to Fish Market. Front staff and service staff were super friendly and accommodating. Breakfast buffet had lots of choices. Close enough to CBD but without the hustle, bustle and crowds. Fantastic stay.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A new hotel opened about 6 months , staff generally very friendly & professional. Lobby is very welcoming, clean with a nice scent. Room is spacious and bed is comfortable, and most importantly, quiet. You hardly hear movements except usage of water from your neighbours.Next to hotel is a mall with lots of eateries and supermarket. 3 mins walk away is an alley full of food called Spice Alley. All decor very modern. I feel like I am in a transformed Europe. I would also like to take this opportunity to mention Mauro who handled my checkout , fast & efficient and especially Ankur, the duty manager who also helped to give options to my requests which were not being able to accede to. He could have ended with a no, but he went on to help me explore other possible solutions. That’s the spirit of a manager.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for four nights for business. Very concur that location for food and close to Woolworths supermarket. Cinema and lots of restaurants are 2 mins away. Staff were super helpful and rooms were kept to a very high standard. Very new amenities. USB charging ports so no need for adapters. Breakfast each day had a good range and was tasty.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here last few months and the service is not so good. Food taste terrible and boring also. Concierge makes you wait for so long for the room to be ready. One of the receptions talks so fast that you cannot understand her properly. But the most terrible thing I encountered is this boy-cut lady with glasses and has a retainer like metal in her teeth that did a service for my room, i cannot remember her name clearly but my god it’s the first time that someone ask me for a tip after serving my room but to show gratitude i give her tip only to find out that my room wasn’t service nicely and didn’t even bother to change the towels from my bathroom and the sheets and pillow cases from my bed how disappointing i hope this will not happened again.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel in September. I have sent loads of emails to the hotel, to the Marriott and SPG email accounts, posted on Social Media, filled out complaints forms, spoken to people on the phone and they still have not responded.Absolute worst customer service I have experienced. Surely this should not be happening after three months of back and forth - and speaking to people. They simply do not care.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for a number of nights in early December. Visiting family, I was searching for a hotel with reasonable rates and came across the new Four Points which was having introductory rates. It's new and modern, but located a bit outside the main tourist areas. Whilst the location was fine for me as I knew my way around, visitors to the city may prefer paying more for a hotel closer to the harbour.- The hotel is located about 10 minutes walk from central station. Walking at night is generally safe despite the number of bars you pass along the way. From the harbour, it would about a 30 minute walk.- The area surrounding is primarily a university area. There are plenty of eating and drinking options, as well as numerous modes of public transport nearby.- Staff at the hotel were friendly and efficient. Check in was seamless.- The hotel has only been a few months when I stayed and it showed. Rooms had all the modern facilities - plenty of usb outlets around the room.- The bathroom was clean and was of a good size. Different from some other Four Points I have stayed, this one offered travel size toiletries rather than from pump dispensers.- I had a room facing the apartment block next door. Needless to say, it was necessary to keep the curtains closed.- The one minor annoyance was the lack of a kettle in the room. It meant trying to use the coffee pod machine to heat water for a cup of tea.Overall, this was a great option for my stay in Sydney. If the price was right, I would happy to return to this hotel.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love the location and if you need/want to stay downtown The front desk was friendly and personable. I think Ankur checked us in. He gave us a few restaurant recommendations on top of all other conversations, which was so helpful. After an unsuccessful stay at a hotel further up the road (no names) we moved here for our final 3 nights and within minutes of arrival we knew we'd made the right move. Proper hotel with everything you need, Thanks again Ankur for your recommendations of where to eat and what to visit, for your helpfulness and for making our stay such a memorable one!
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this property due to it being part of the Starwood Group, plus its quite new and also in a good location. Really glad I did as it met all my requirements. Service is generally good, restaurant is nice and facilities are generally good. I suppose in summary, its a nice 4 star property, thats priced reasonably well by Sydney standards. What I liked most was the shopping and restaurants in the area, that were all a very easy stroll from the hotel. It was great to not have to go into the city, and just explore this local area which has everything you need.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Like all hotels in central Sydney, room rates are on the high side. But you get a good Four Points hotel that meets the brand’s high standards for functionality, efficiency, and cleanliness. Slightly stylish, and I liked their al fresco hang out areas at the lobby level. Even though they’re right by Broadway, the sounds of traffic and passer-bys walking past don’t feel intrusive.I was there for business nd had a rental car. Unfortunately, the hotel website doesn’t give you heads up that although their address is on Abercrombie Street, there is no drop off point on Abercrombie, nor is the car park entrance on Abercrombie. Google Maps also took us to Abercrombie. Here’s how to get to the hotel car park:1. If you’re already on Abercrombie, turn right on Broadway.2. University of Technology should now be on your left.3. Take first right onto Chippendale Way, before The Central Park Mall4. Turn right on Central Park Avenue, and the entrance to the underground car park should be on your right before the road turns left. There is an easy-to-miss sign saying that it is the hotel car park. The shutters to the parking garage will be down.5. Drive up to the intercom, and buzz the front desk to let you in. Even as a guest, you’ll need to do that each time you enter. Your room key will not work.6. Drive all the way down, following the signs to Hotel parking.7. At B2 (or whichever basement level the signs indicate), the signs become confusing. You’ll see another barrier arm. Look for the intercom on one of the pillars before the arm, and you’ll need to buzz yourself in a second time. Again, room keys don’t work.8. Once through the barrier, turn left and you should see the lifts to the lobby on your right.9. Park.Parking is expensive. $40 per night, but you can drive in and out all day with no extra charges.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not a 5 star hotel with design or facilities, i.e no valet parking or swimming pool, but if you don't need a CBD hotel, it is well located in the Central Park precinct - close to Kensington Street and spice alley, Sydney University and UTS etc. , lots of shopping , restaurants, galleries like White Rabbit.Transport is easy, close to Central Railway and bus routes; I took a bus to Queen Chow in Enmore and it was faster than driving and parking.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Four Points in Chippendale is a new and modern property offering modern and relaxing rooms and in a good location.Staff are friendly and happy to assist at all times.Buffet breakfast offers a range of choices from fruit, to Full English breakfasts.A second coffee machine would be great to see as queues build up for hot drinks.Centrally located, to Spice Alley, which offers some tasty cuisine, the Boardway shopping centre, Central Park Mall and a number of coffee shops, you really can’t go wrong.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed last night at this property as my daughter had a dance concert. I booked a rate with breakfast via Expedia. My friend was also staying and our daughters wanted to be close to each other. I sent a message to the hotel after the 3rd time sending I finally got a reply to say that we are next door excellent. We arrive at 3.45 and was told our room was not ready housekeeping was cleaning our room next door to my friend, we where asked to have a seat and we where offered some sparkling wine ok great start. After maybe 20 minutes I went to ask how much longer I was then served by the duty manager who said the guest extended so we have to move rooms. He tried to tell me they just extended Im 99% sure that in the 20 minutes we waited when the cleaner was supposed to be in the room they didnt extend. The worst thing is being lied to by staff especially managment. The solution was my friend who had already checked in move rooms or we go 2 floors up then suddenly we had a room apparently across the hallway. So our room was 1402 my friend 1407 yes the same floor but one end of the floor to the other not across the hall as promised why lie to us. The shower set up is ridiculous the hand held is at the tap level or a rain shower with limited pressure. You are given just 2 towels so if you want an extra to dry your hair or anything you have to call for more doesnt make sense have at least one spare. Breakfast was our next challenge our room came with breakfast but only for 2 my 8 year old who eats next to nothing, I very rarely have to pay when she is eating with two adults because she has next to nothing I was told I had to pay $17 I was not going to pay $18 for a bowl of cereal I asked if I could do al a carte but all I can get on that is add on so for $6 she got 5 hash browns really what a waste the girl just said 5-12 kids must pay half price I get a 10-12 year old but small kids eat next to nothing the breakfast is extremely basic and very uninspiring and no way worth the $35 they expect people to pay, go across the road and the shopping centre has a great food court and loads of options and good cafes.... Such a disappointing and underwhelming stay I would neither recommend this property or stay again. Look at some of the other options close by for im sure a much more inspiring stay
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As my return journey from regional NSW back home was cancelled, I found myself stuck in Sydney due to storms. So the hotel was a last minute choice.Well after a long day it was a relief to stay at a very comfortable hotel.First Impressions very good, reception is at the Central Park Ave end of the building. However, the ground floor layout is 24hr reception, long central foyer leading to the bar and ultimately the breakfast area fronting the street Broadway.Its modern in style but comfortable and relaxing. To sum up:-Room is a reasonable size and the bathroom is large and contemporary.Bed was at the cusp of being firm but very comfortable, the same goes for the pillows. I slept very well.Shower was at a perfectly set temperature. The usual number of towels for a king size room. Modern connections, usb near the bedhead and at the desk.Desk chair was comfortable to sit in but not so the chairs at the foot of the bed.I used the train to/fro from the airport and hotel is 500m, an easy walk from Central station.It is close to spice alley and eateries in the Central Park Mall.Overall i really enjoyed my short stay here. I'll keep it in mind from my usual hotel in Sydney.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Newly opened hotel with the wonderful Sheraton touches. The staff are very warm and welcoming and were very accommodating with storing our luggage at the start and end of our stay so that we could go and explore Sydney. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The king size bed and pillows very comfortable making for a sound nights sleep. The buffet breakfast had a wide range of food suitable for all tastes. The hotel is very well located being only a short walk from Paddy's market, Chinatown, Darling Harbour and the Central Station. There is a mall adjacent and lots of cafes and bistros nearby - check out Kensington Street and Spice Alley for great food at affordable prices.
hotelName:
17    Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second visit ... we bypassed several great venues in my tambourine and Canungra for brunch /lunch... because the meal we had had previously at central railway hotel was too tempting to repeat.... I know most will say it only a basic steak salad chips but honestly the best pub meal we have had ... the steak perfectly cooked ...flavoursome fresh salad and beer battered chips... good price ... thnx ... oh and the staff are brilliant... friendly and welcoming...!!!
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel due to the price point and photos. We were interested in a different hotel but they sold out of rooms before we decided and needed to book this place due to our budget. I am not a very picky traveler when it comes to accommodations as I tend to not be in the room very much of the time. While we felt safe in this hotel, we were not impressed with the cleanliness of the room. The room felt very dated and the carpet was super worn. While the sheets were clean, nothing else about the room felt clean. The photos made this place look better than it was in person. The staff was super helpful and friendly on check in and throughout our stay though! They even stored our bags for us when we arrived early so we could go explore before our room was ready.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very inconsiderate people in the foyer having loud conversations at 4am kept me up both nights that we were there. There is no one to manage the noise levels at night and some people have no consideration for others.Apart from that, the room was clean and well appointed. Staff were nice and the location is good.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: VERY RELAXED BUT RIGHT ON TARGET WHERE IT COUNTS clean comfortable beds large rooms and friendly service . It is conveniently located near cafes and near bus routes and a short walk to central station.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing stay at a central location in a spacious hotel. Not luxurious digs but very very comfortable. Had a room on the 2nd floor but the staff was able to help us carry our luggage up the stairs. Downhill on the way out was no problem. Very comfortable stay in a room with a small kitchen area.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: appreciate the communication done by staffs for queries.Overall our stay was comfortable.Would have been much more convenient if there was a lift as we had to carry all our luggage to the second level via stairs, which is very tiring
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is strategically located and my room is really comfortable. Any requests that I made were provided and they even gave me early check in. I have no complaints at all. Even though it's a bit pricey, but worth the facilities
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great as it's within walking distance of Central Station. The rooms are fine and the staff are lovely. Parking for a fee is offered, making a short stay much easier. Will definitely stay again.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Simply perfect! The studio was very clean and had everything we needed! Close to the city center. Water and coffee always free for the guests near the reception. Very kind staff! I'll stay here again!
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have choosen this hotel because it is near the central station and much interresting places of the city can be visit on an easy way . We stayed for a week in the hotel. Every day as we returned from our walks in and around Sydney, our room was cleaned up. So the service was 100%.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited this hotel because I attended in meetings for business. The meetings finished over 11 p.m. everyday, but I did not so tired because my room always were cleaned up, when I got back to the hotel!
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Request early check in at 0930 and ground floor room. Upon check in they gave all we need. Receiption (male, asian guy with glasses) is very professional, I like the way he treat every guest. Excellent
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very clean and comfortable, but I don't think I would stay again.There are only stairs to access the hotel and it is a bit out of the way of central SydneyIt was very quiet and the staff were excellent.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cracked tiles in the bathroom would benefit from being changed and the poor wallpaper on the wall. The room was very clean and the room was always pristine when we came back so the service was very good.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a week. The staff is very nice and helpful. Fixed a dripping AC immediately after informing them about it.Queen bed are two singles pushed together with one mattress notably higher than the other so couples might be annoyed by this.The place is quite noisy so if you need a very quite place to stay at this is not for you. I couldn’t figure out the source of the noise though...The shower‘s the biggest concern as there‘s literally zero water pressure. It’s like a watering can (the children’s toy version) . Also the water doesn’t really heat up in the shower. It was hot outside so I didn’t mind. Plus I just came from a hostel so it was fine.The place was clean. However for some reason the housekeeping tends to forget stuff from time to time. One day I didn’t get fresh towels, another time they picked up the dish cloth but forgot to provide a fresh one.Furniture felt pretty cheap.Location is good. Walking distance to haymarket. There’s a bus station right in front of the hotel.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at the hotel and the staff were friendly whilst we checked in, however it all went down hill from here. We got to our room, which was okay. A little tired but seemed clean. However after 5 minutes of sitting on the bed we found a bed bug. On further inspection of the sheets we found blood stains. We went straight back down to reception to ask for a full refund (we had paid for two nights) After explaining that we have found a bed bug the member of staff said that he wanted to move us to another room - however we did not want to risk staying somewhere which could be potentially infested with bed bugs as we were due to rent a camper van after our stay in Sydney and did not want to infest that and all our clothes.After pushing a little bit he did finally agree to give us a refund for the second night. He then proceeded to follow us up to our room and then upon inspection of the bedbugs and stains that we had found he then refunded us for the entire stay.The staff member did deal with the situation very well but we would not book to stay here again.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we really enjoyed the location and it suited our little get a way perfectly. Thanks for our enjoyable evening. Few stairs but that wasn't a problem. Parking available. priced well. great comfortable stay when you want to explore the local restaurants or go to the casino in a quick cab ride.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: clean, comfortable, older style accommodation, friendly helpful staff, cafes and supermarket nearby, located between Redfern and Central stations. Free coffee pod machine in courtyard until 3pm daily.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I left a pair of silk trousers hanging in the wardrobe when we checked out. I realised this a couple of hours later and immediately contacted the hotel to arrange collection. I was told the trousers hadn’t been found or handed in. Given I’m 100% certain I left the trousers behind, I can only assume they were not handed in by the staff. Disappointing. Would not recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was easy to find and very walkable to basic food shops and amminities.Loved the stay ..would love to be back.Close to the best kebabs in town.. Abdul's kebabs in Surrey Hills.Loved the coffee sitting outdoors and mini balcony in front.Late night check in was very easy
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fabulous place to stay.Excellent comfortable beds, clean bedding that didn't smell of cigarette smoke, clean rooms, good room configurations n choices of rooms. Kitchen is fully equipped & there are mugs instead of small cups.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was nice.Too much outside noise from the cleaner very early in the morning.I should have paid attention when making the booking because I had to pay an additional $30.00 for parking.I would try another hotel if I had to stay in that part of Sydney again.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Large room, convenient to appointments, comfortable bed. Complimentary Nespresso coffee machine and cold water dispenser in courtyard with great seating to relax out of room. Friendly staff. Close to city
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Much more than my expectation!!! Location is 10 mins from train station, but lot cafes around. It was clean, cozy, staff are nice. We came early than check in time, but, receptionist let us checked in early.Recommended !!
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not the most modern hotel in Sydney but it is clean and tidy and the location is great with transport links close by.The Woolpack Hotel is just a short walk up the street for a nice cold beer and a great bistro.The reception lady was friendly and courteous and my room was a good size with a king bed that was sublimely comfortable. One of the best ever. The room on the first floor faced Chalmers Street and has a decent sized balcony. I was concerned about traffic noise at first, but it was hardly audible and I slept right through without any disturbance.The tariff was very reasonable for a city hotel and my only gripe was the $35 paid for parking. It is a burden that us visitors from the country or interstate get slugged for whereas tourists who fly in don't. I will definitely stay here again despite the parking charge.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I got there late at night (10pm) but the reception closes at 8pm. They called earlier to confirm I was coming and left the key for me in a safe deposit box. All good, no problem.As others have said, there is no lift so if you’ve got mobility issues ask for a ground floor room. The stairs are not onerous, just 2 flights up to the top.Room was ok. A little old and needs a facelift but ok for a couple of nights. Room was nice and big with plenty of room for 3 people (even though I was there alone). Room also has a fridge, sink, microwave oven, kettle, tea & coffee if you want to do some self-catering.Bathroom was small and, again, could probably do with some renovation. Shower was good.On the downside, whilst it had free wifi it was fairly useless for anything more than slow web browsing. TV was useless too….very dark screen and I couldn’t figure out how to adjust it.As others have said, there is no restaurant there so organise breakfast before you go to bed, unless you’re prepared to get up and go out searching for something to eat. I didn’t notice any restaurants close by.Now, a big Warning…..I booked this hotel online, through their website on a Wednesday evening. On Friday morning I had a call from my bank to tell me that someone was using my credit card (not the physical card). I hadn’t used my card anywhere else in the past few days so I suspect it was stolen from their website. The bank can’t confirm either. The card needed to be cancelled which was a major pain.I reported this to the lady when I checked out (Tuesday morning) but as of now (Wed evening) I haven’t heard anything back from them. No explanation, no apology. So, be warned. You may want to book through a 3rd party like Tripadvisor to protect your credit card details.Bottom line….Hotel was ok. Price was good but you get what you pay for. Personally I wouldn’t stay there again, there are better places for slightly more money.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Another older hotel in Sydney thst does not have lifts. There is a half dozen or so steps to get to reception then depending on which floor you are on it could be four sets of stairs or so to get to your room. It is a real turn off. The young girl on reception was very helpful and helped with our bags however I did think it was going to be a OH &S problem for her sooner rather than later. Walking distance to Central Railway and Pitt street, but go to the loo before you go because you won't find a loo with Cooee. If you have luggage find somewhere else. I will say though they only charged us $50 extra to book out at midday instead of 1000. We were happy to pay
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The reception staff were very friendly and helpful - they allowed me to leave my luggage both before checking in properly and after checking out. The room itself was spacious, clean and had everything that I needed. I had thought that it may be noisy, but it wasn't and I had a good night sleep
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I liked the room, loved the firm mattress was good for my back, very popular with others who stayed, friendly and affordable close to Central Station, no issues with taxis'. Management helpful. Will stay again. Service great. There's an Entertaining Area downstairs and at Check In a comfortable seating area to sit in the sun.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff were very helpful, polite, eager to suggest eating places and special places to visit.Rooms were clean, towels replenished daily.Overall a very good stay would recommend to others, and would stay again when returning to Sydney.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I personally love this basic and quite ok hotel. It looks like an old apartment, somewhat of a heritage building. No other amenities, no anything fancy about it. You just simply check-in on a small reception area. Rooms are just fine with a kitchenette and balcony overlooking Chalmers St. The location's just a safe, walk away to the Central Railway STA. with some convenience stores and restaurants around.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 4 nights. The room was immaculately clean and nicely furnished: kitchenette had everything we needed. Staff were friendly and available to help. Two downsides were twin beds pushed together to make a double, and noise. We were at the back of the hotel next to the car park entrance and there was a lot of noise of people coming and going. Plus, the water pipes made some deafening noises when people turned on their showers etc. I'd stay again but take earplugs!
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights and the review is broken down in following aspects.1) Location - The best thing about the hotel. Very close to CBD. Though feel quite isolated in night sometimes. Supermarkets and bus/train stations are nearby. 2) Room - Okay for 2-3 days of stay. Apt interiors. Felt wash room was quite small. Private balcony was plus. Has got basics such as microwave, kettle, mini bar etc. 3) Service - Room service was prompt and things were getting replenished/replaced daily. Front desk was friendly. Check in and check outs were smooth. Housekeeping was up to mark. 4) Amenities - Quite a limited space, so nothing much to offer except a small open area where a group can sit and have coffee. Parking is paid. Wifi connectivity was good. NO ELEVATOR, a big minus. No in house restaurant. Overall a good budget friendly hotel for those who wants to stay closer to the CBD. Can be recommended for young people, who are looking for a shorter stay.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is nice and clean. More than anything staff is ready to go an extra mile to help you arrange your stay conveniently. If you come early or leaving late, baggage storage come in handy. Thanks.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a business dinner in Cleveland st and this hotel was super convenient.Not a 5 star hotel but was clean and spacious. Great value for money.Staff were friendly and are nice peopleWill have no hesitation in staying here again.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Positive experience as a whole. Apartment was comfortable and also the free coffee was a nice a plus. Had a little domestic which occured outside the hotel at 5am however this was not the hotels fault and we felt very safe within the hotel.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reception on arrival was welcoming, although not a great deal of information was supplied, other than that associated with the booking and parking. Neither was she particularly knowledgeable about facilities within the surrounding area. A compendium in the room made up for some of this deficiency.Room was of a reasonable size, with a large bed that was actually two single beds joined together. This did leave a small rise in one part between them, but not to a point of being too uncomfortable.Contained a two seater couch and coffee table, but no work bench or table from which to work at, neccesitating the need to work with the computer in lap.Small sink bench, complete with micrfowave and cutlery as well as tea/coffee facilities.Good size bathroom with good shower cubicle, but poor water pressure. Very good supply of complimentary toiletries.Absolutely excellent WiFi.Room service during the day consisted only of a changing of the towels. No replacement of coffee or milk was provided.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is near the city center, even it can be reached easily by walking. Super nice and friendly staff, as we arrived late and they still waited for me, though I couldn’t be contacted due to my flying schedule. For such an affordable price, the room is clean and comfortable.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There very Friendy clean beding clean bathrooms also the grounds very well kept.Also you can leave your luggage there until your room ready.Vicky the boss will go out of way to help you.You are close to everything
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Within walking distance of central railway. Comfy bed and room. Microwave, sink, toaster and kettle. Room was clean and staff very friendly and helpful. A coffee machine was set up from 7am to early afternoon so it was nice to be able to make a nice coffee. Convenience stores and small woollies supermarket a short walk away. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our second time here, and a real delight, 100% satisfied, as it suits our requirements, where we visit our son studying in Redfern and gives us good opportunities to eat at some great places all walking distance and also close to all good and convenient public transport
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good accommodation for tourists who find their one way. The rooms are fine with a microwave oven and a kettle, fridge and a little kitchenette. Flat screen and free wifi. Fine bathroom, sofa and bed.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights whilst visiting Sydney. Staff really friendly and knowledgeable about the local area and Sydney in general, especially when it came to travelling round the city as it was my first visit. Only thing I would say is that it could be quite noisy in a morning because of the road outside but it didn't really both me.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, staff were super helpful. The free pool pass and morning coffee was an additional bonus. Not the most modern Hotel, but everything you need. Great value for a family of 5 and would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just 8 mn walk from Central station wich is very handy to reach any destination, airport included. Lot of buses lines around too. The bedrooms are comfortable and roomy. Beds really comfy. Kitchen facilities in room very useful for breakie or light dinner. Excellent supermarket nearby, and aquatic center just in front. Good wifi connection in all parts of the hôtel. Staff efficient, discrete and pleasant, makes you feel welcome. Excellent deal. Stayed 9 nights and ´ll come back.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s very convenient to go anywhere or food nearby But they didn’t offer tooth brush. we have two people but they just give us one shower stuff !!!Most important of all the housekeeper is too bad!!!I wash my clothes and keep it on the chair.when I back home....my clean clothes are all put on the dry clothes.....and my stuff all fall down on the floor !It’s make feel terrible:(
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister and I stayed at the central railway hotel in Redfern for 12 days we had the most wonderful experience. The rooms we extremely clean and well maintained, the staff were friendly beyond belief so helpful I would highly recommend staying there. Local buses run frequently outside the hotel and the station is a short walk ideal for sightseeing around Sydney.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 20 minutes from the airport and still in the city, it is agood option for an overnight stay before travelling. The room was quite small but could accomodate up to five persons. The basic kitchen and the morning coffe were good extras. A bit overpriced for other cities, but reasonable ay Sydney.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it was an awsome experience, though i was skeptical before reaching but everything was just perfect, big spacious rooms, we were 4 and had a big room to us, pick up ground floor if you can, water and tea/coffee available, clean bedding and bathrooms, 5 mins walking to central railway station, so what else can anyone ask for. a lot of breakfast and eating options available nearby..
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great place to stay if you’re on a budget. Close to Redfern and Central stations. Staff are excellent. Rooms are basic and a bit older but great for the price. The kitchenette is a plus if you’re travelling with kids.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very enjoyable stay in Sydney. The Hotel was located very central (as the name would suggest) and the facilities were nice and clean. The staff was remarkably friendly and did everything to make sure that our stay would be perfect. Thank you!
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved it, great staff, great rooms with a great cleaning service. Having a little kitchen and bar fridge made staying there much easier.
