Went to the nearby park with my friend, cooked some meat there on the public BBQs, walked back to use the rest of the kitchen to make a healthy and filling dinner.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Three of us stayed in a 2 bedroom Unit for a night lag over from our Brisbane to Adelaide journey and were pleasantly surprised by the appointment of this Unit for the price. Albeit quite cozy (small) very neat, tidy, clean, all requirements of an overnight stay or longer as everything is there for a pleasant stay.Don't forget you only need to sleep in a clean accommodation when on holidays.Recommend this Unit to anyone to save money but have a clean experience.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As usual the accommodation was clean and comfortable and the receptionist friendly and helpful. Having a kitchenette was useful as it was possible to save on eating out. Will continue to stay here in future.
hotelName:
18    Central Railway Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed my stay here. Only a 5 minutes walk to the Business School at UTS.  Extremely convenient. The staff were super friendly and were extremely helpful. I loved the coffee & tea card which I received as a Rydges member. Breakfast was also wonderful. A nice selection. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed just one night with the reason to visit Chinatown. It is about 250 metres from Dixon st. Clean tidy and modern. Friendly and fast check in. Only down side is you have to pay for parking but you get that every where in the centre of Sydney. Will definitely be back. Very comfortable beds and great shower.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great find. Super friendly and helpful staff and the hotel is in a great position. Opposite is Paddy’s markets and Chinatown and only a short walk to Darling Harbour. Rooms were good with very comfortable beds. I will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I spent three nights here. The location was nothing but perfect. The staff where very friendly and accommodating. I've gotta give props to Scott Hartley, the general manager, for taking care of every guest as his own mate. Couldn't recommend the Ultimo enough.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located near Chinatown, just opposite the Haymarket. There are many eateries nearby, as well as a well stocked Woolworths supermarket nearby. It is in a nice restored building, with high ceiling. Pros:- The room is large and clean. The bed is comfortable.- The toilet in my room does not have a bath tub, but nice strong shower.- Décor is minimalist but tasteful.- There is some traffic noise but it did not bother me, although I am a light sleeper.- Service is very friendly and warm. Cons:- The room does not have a safe box.- Location while convenient, is a bit far from central Sydney, and a bit of a walk to Sydney Opera House. Overall, it was a comfortable 3 night stay for me. Would highly recommend this hotel for those who are looking for one in this locale
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Jazzed up around three years ago this place is playing on its inner city location well, with hints of converted warehouse with exposed beams and brickwork. Strikes he it's always been a hotel or guesthouse but maybe it had an earlier life. It is in the old trading heart of Haymarket and Chinatown. That's the point after all, it's slap bang in the heart of Chinatown. Food everywhere, fun walks down Dixon street (keep going across Goulburn Street and enjoy the modern Asian street feel with beautiful stylish kids eating and promenading. There's an issue though with huge single use plastic waste that needs dealing with urgently coz after all the Harbour is just a drain away. But the buzz is great. The hotel is right there in it and is full of character and has a boutiquey feel. We took a two single plus big queen bed room which was spacious enough for the four of us to move about and the beds were SO, SO COMFORTABLE!!! They're great. The rest of the layout was fairly basic but kinda chic. Being so in the middle of it meant there was a fair bit of street noise at night. That disturbed our sleep a bit but not really an issue. Breakfast was on offer and could be pre-booked for $10.50 pp. Slightly more if ordered on the day but very reasonable prices and a range of nice options to choose from. We didn't get our act together in time though. You can go down and eat there in the lobby or in your room. Check in and out easy. A good 24hr parking deal at $35. All around a good experience.There are room with their own terraces. I might do on of them next time.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at the Ultimo on numerous occasions. It has everything I am looking for - Great location, super clean, very comfortable beds and pillows, opening windows and most importantly amazing service from all the staff.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was comfortable, the location convenient, and the staff was amazing!!! They helped us get cabs, mail postcards, get the room to a comfortable temperature, and were just so sweet!! They showed interest in us as individuals, not just someone paying for a room.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Top Location to explore the City in all directions. nice and modern rooms in grey and white, very clean. We Lobes the Design. Not very big, but definetely not too small for a City trip. You only sleep there... We would come back any time and can recommend it to everybody!
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Centrally located to all of the venues that I needed to visit, and within walking distance to a supermarket and restaurants, the Ultimo was exactly what I was after. Check in was trouble free and I was able to access my room from midday.The room was tidy and neat. My only negative (which is minor) was that the room was positioned near an intersection and the night traffic noise was a bit disruptive for sleep.Other than that the staff were friendly and helpful and I would highly recommend staying here.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve stayed here previously. Was booked into a queen room. Check in was quick and early as my room was available straight away at 7:30am - much earlier than normal check in. The room itself was clean and comfortable. The only downside was there was no windows except for the bathroom which were frosted. But overall a very pleasing experience.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay here for one night as we had a early train to catch and it was beautiful and clean. On the small side but for one night we were more than happy. Beautiful building inside. Would happily stay here again. Staff were very friendly and the free coffee we received for booking directly with them was a nice touch.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic location and really made welcome from the moment of arrival. Had a small issue with the door lock which was fixed in double quick time (thanks Bianca).Complimentary coffee and hot chocolate went down brilliantly with our family. Could not have wished for a better start to our holiday.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 1 night while we attended Vivid. What a beautiful hotel. The location was fantastic...close to bars, restaurants and theatres. Staff were lovely and extremely helpful. Would definitely stay here again and highly recommend.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In Sydney for 2 weeks and picked a fantastic hotel in a fantastic location... Situated in Haymarket in the middle of China town, we are opposite paddy’s market, a 10 minute walk from central station and are basically surrounded by world class restaurants and street food places...hotel is great and staff couldn’t be more helpful.... wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There is so much right about this hotel - the location, the price and the look and feel, all great for a budget hotel in Sydney. However the one bad thing had such a massive effect that it tends to dull all these super great traits. It's the noise....urrrgghhh the noise! I'm talking I-had-earplugs-in type street noise and still only managed about an hours sleep. The kids can sleep through a cyclone (well the closest we have come), but even they tossed and turned through the night. I have full and utter appeciation with the fact that we were staying in the city of Sydney and that the city does not often sleep, however we stay in town alot...I mean a real lot. And aside from noisy guests walking past your room every now and then in other hotels, this was like we had our beds set up outdoors in the middle of George Street. It looks like the hotel has done what they can, but they mustn't have in reality, in saying that I don't know what the soloution is.We had breakfast in our room and it was yum. Unlike other reviews, we had a family room and it was definately spacious enough. Facilites all good, little musty smelling on arrival upstairs and in the room, but either got used to it or is went away.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was really surprised by this hotel. It was amazing. The staff were very helpful and the zodiac themes dotted throughout the hotel were cute. The room was very spacious, clean and quiet even though it was on a busy road. The location is great if looking for something quite central, light rail almost at the door. I will definitely be staying there again
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We actually stayed at Ultimo at the start and end of our Australian journey for a total of 5 nights. We found the staff incredibly helpful and friendly. They accommodated an early check-in after our long flight and also upgraded our room the second visit. The location is accessible to all that you would like to see in Sydney. The rooms were clean (albeit small), but perfect for what we needed. Beds were very comfortable and coffee was great, as others have mentioned. My one and only feedback is that the hairdryer in room seemed to have a too short cord for outlet placement. Not a deal breaker, but figured worth mentioning. A special thank you for holding on to the item I left behind after first visit. Your response was prompt and professional throughout. Ultimo was a great find!
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic accommodation in a central location, walking distance from everything you need! Staff are friendly and we got upgraded free of charge which was a bonus! Comfy beds and very clean, we also got complimentary barista coffee! The only con was that the noise from the traffic below was loud at night, but this didn’t bother us at all. Id definitely stay here again and I’ve already recommended The Ultimo to lots of friends!
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great hotel to stay at that won’t break the bank ! It’s stylish and comfortable and a short walk to the city and attractions . Was welcome by the lovely Kylie who was attentive and helpful during my time here. Members enjoy complimentary coffee which was wonderful ! They will even deliver to your room . Thank you for a great stay!
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reception staff are lovely & helpful. It was lovely to be upgraded to a bigger room but I was really disappointed that the room didn't have any of the bare brick type different features, which was why I had chosen to stay here, our room felt boxy - but after asking if they had another room our bags were promptly moved to a lovely 'bricky' room for us (unfortunately that was above a very loud karaoke bar which went on til very late the first night, but was much quieter the next nights thankfully!). Breakfast delivered to our room was a nice change and we loved the choices available - lovely & healthy. Short walk into the city or short walk to Central Station to get the train. We liked the location but it is quite a hectic area by chinatown. Overall I would recommend & would stay here again, its a great price, very clean and the staff are just lovely, but maybe put in your booking if you want a room with the pretty features (and not near/above the karaoke bar - unless you want to join in!!)
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've been lucky to stay here a couple of times. I just love the location and the adjoining places to eat, just across the road in the food court YUM! The location is so ideal for someone who loves asian cuisine as it is right in China Town. The Ultimo is also very close to the train and casual walk to Darling Harbour and even QVB and therefore shopping! In the lobby the in house coffee is perfect for that morning pick me up.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked in to The Ultimo based on reviews. I was not disappointed, it is an easy walk to most attractions and less than a kilometer to two railway stations. Light Rail is just around the corner also easily accessible. I have already booked again for August.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had our family room on 2nd floor. Its fresh and new, staffs are superb and friendly with pure smile. What i like about this hotel, the reception area is not like common hotels, feels like u r entering a coffee shop.Laundromat and snack vending machine on the 1st floor.Room is clean n simple. Smart tv with free wifi is another plus, so my son wasnt boring with local tvs. So environment friendly.Location is fantastic.Their family room has 1 queen sz bed n 2 twin beds. We are traveling with 5yo boy, so its spacious for the 3 of us.Our trips from melb-syd-per...somehow...ultimo is the highlight of our hotels
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Honestly loved this hotel so much. Was walking distance to central station that linked to everywhere and the trains were always within 5 minutes. Hotel itself was lovely, beds were comfortable, staff were lovely. Would’ve been a 5 star except the rooms aren’t particularly sound proof so could hear every conversation in the hallway which woke me up a few times during my week stay.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived very early from England and the staff were able to check us in early (10:30am) which was fantastic. The room was nice and within 10 minutes walk to Darling Harbor and the train station. Just be a bit careful what direction you walk from as was a little sketchy on some of the back streets
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I booked directly through the hotel rather than go through any booking sites. The staff are super friendly and helpful. We needed a late check in and that wasn't an issue. The room we stayed in was clean, spacious and comfortable. Convenient location, easy walk to catch a train. They stored our bags all day. We even waited an hour in the hotel lobby, charging our phones after being out all day, before catching an uber to the airport, and this wasn't an issue. Great coffee too! Reasonable rates. We would stay again.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: perfect location...perfect sleep...perfect shower...I am loving the newly renovated Ultiomo hotel ( formaly known as Aaron"s Hotel. The sleek scandi décor is refreshing.The double glazed windows are a must for a great nights sleep as were the amazing beds.Perfect location in Chinatown,close to shops,pubs and all variety of food.Will definitely stay again
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed out one night stopover at this newly renovated hotel. Easy check in and out, spacious walkways and comfortable room with king size bed. Loved that we could open the windows and the shower was really good - both rare in many hotels! Customer friendly with an upgrade to accommodate a third person in our room and a late checkout because of a fire alarm in the middle of the night! No complaints - I’d stay again ... no worries!
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for one night prior to leaving Sydney. My room was on the 1st floor (above the ground floor) and was fairly small but I knew this ahead of time. Ultimo sent an email prior to my stay asking if I wanted to upgrade as I was in one of the smaller rooms. The location is great. It's within walking distance to Central Station, near a Starbucks, and across from a mall. The street is fairly busy. As I was trying to sleep a garbage truck pulled up alongside my room. The noise was annoying but temporary. The room had double panes in an effort to combat the noise. Besides for this, I slept well and woke up well rested for my long flight the next morning. There was something odd on the floor - stairs (about 4 steps). It may be in issue for some with luggage. Luckily, I didn't have to deal with the stairs to get to my room.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best thing about this hotel is it's loft style look and it's location. The staff is friendly, but I don't get the astrology thing--seems like a hokey gimmick.The room is ok but there is no space to put anything--no drawers, shelves, or cupboard of any kind. Just some hanging rack from IKEA that fits maybe 10 shirts and a small surface in front of the TV. Maybe it's not a place meant for families, but this lack of storage was a huge problem for my family of 4 with a toddler and baby who like to pull things (like a heavy iron) from the low shelves. The bathroom was nice, but the floor was not angled properly and water did not make its way to the floor drain. The water also gets incredibly hot--like near boiling. I also find it odd that a hotel just had 1 small elevator. It creates a lot of waiting around.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have always stayed in Circular Quay when I was in Sydney and decided to stay at the other end the CBD this time. Our room was not big (probably around 16 square metres) but had everything we needed. The king bed and pillows were comfortable and the room was clean. The location was excellent - it's next to the Market City (Paddy's Market), 7 minutes walk to the Central Station and 2 minutes walk to China Town.Good water pressure / temperature in the shower room, friendly staff members and nice hotel decor. Easy check-in and check-out process. It could be a bit noisy before 12pm (especially on a Saturday night) and after 7am as the hotel was right next to the shopping/popular China town. However you can always grab a box of ear plugs.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay at the Ultimo as an overnighter before and after a cruise. It was only a short walk from central. Staff were helpful and friendly with all requests. A great location close to Paddy's Market, China town and a nice stroll over to the Darling Harbour area.We would definitely consider staying here on further visits to Sydney.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had arrived early in the hotel and I had asked the gentleman in the front desk if we can do an early check-in since it’s very early still he had informed me that they can notify me once the room is available. We had stored our luggage’s first and went our way to explore the city.It’s nice that it’s close to everything market city, china town, Darling Harbour & train stations.After exploring & enjoying the harbour & playground at the Chinese friendship garden we did not notice that it’s almost lunch time... since we want to freshen up before eating we decided to head back to The Ultimo & they informed us that the room is ready. It was spacious with 2 king size beds, welcome champagne drinks & chocolates coz it’s my birthday on the 18th The only downside is that there’s not much storage in the room & bathroom but I think it’s ok since most of the time we just put our clothes in the luggage & hang the clothes will wear for the day in the hangers they provided The room was kept clean everyday & staff are all nice. Definitely recommending The Ultimo to our friends & staying with them on future visits to Sydney.Thank you The Ultimo Hotel & Staffs!!!
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Ultimo was a great spot for us for three days in Sydney's CBD. Clean, comfortable, quiet and light family room, with enough space for two adults and two teenage boys... We were a bit worried that the room may be too small but we managed perfectly. This place is in a great spot, has been beautifully renovated and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend it. Will definitely stay again if we're back in Sydney.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked here not because I wanted this hotel but because it was one of very few hotels left with availability in Sydney for my recent stay. Location is pretty average for Sydney City (bottom end of Chinatown and a bit grotty). The hotel itself was much nicer than I expected. Friendly reception staff, the room was a decent size, the look of the distressed brick was good, the bed was comfortable, room modern and up to date. The first night was quiet, the second was a lot noisier (outside?). Recommend requesting higher floor (it is not a high rise) It would be nice to have a safe in the room, but alas too trendy for a cupboard, you can have a rack instead. Sorry but you can toss the stuff about being an astrology hotel. Rubbish. . One recommendation - move the towel rack from directly above the toilet, as when you pull a towel off, other towels fall into the toilet. Not a good design! Overall I would definitely stay again
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We checked into one very comfortable room when we received a phone call from tthe desk. A very thoughtful, caring staff member noticed that my husband had difficulty moving and the first room we were booked into had a number of little stairs scattered throughout. Even getting to the lift would have meant going up and down a few stairs. She suggested that we moved into a room without any steps anywhere near or in it. It also had grab rails for the toilet etc, just perfect for his needs. It made for a very comfortable stay. Thank you for your consideration, it meant a lot.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We can not fault The Ultimo from the time we walked in the door to checkout. The beds were so comfortable, location great, rooms were spotless. Easy access to light rail. Staff very helpful. We will definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is perfectly located across the road from Paddy’s Market - a short walk from beautiful Darling Harbour. The light rail is just a couple minutes walk away, and Central Station also really close.Being in Chinatown meant some lovely dining options just a short walk away.The room was comfortable - I had only booked a small room as I was travelling by myself. However it still felt spacious. Nice bathroom setup due to the renovated building with a shower and toilet/basin in separate little rooms. The staff however made the difference. From my first arrival they were polite, friendly and helpful.I was offered free coffee/tea each morning as I had booked direct with the hotel which was greatly appreciated (they make a great latte).Look forward to returning again when next in Sydney.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in a good spot within easy walking distance of the train station and Darling Harbour. It’s location was the main reason I choose to stay there. I received a warm welcome when I checked in and also had a room upgrade and as it was late I got some great advice on where I could get something quick to eat. The room was very spacious, clean and comfortable. Check out is 11am and they have a secure room to store luggage if you need to depart later than this. One thing to note is that if you are a light sleeper there is a bit of traffic (both foot and vehicles) and with single pain glass windows it doesn’t quite block out the noise, but this didn’t bother me at all. The only slight frustration I had with my stay was that the key card to my room keep on failing and it was replaced three or four times of my two night stay.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here whilst I was in Sydney for a couple of nights. It was in a great location in China town and a 5 minute walk from the central train station. Our room was very spacious and clean, the hotel has been restored to a very good standard.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On arrival the staff were friendly and welcoming! This continued throughout the stay regardless of which staff were on the front desk. I was part of a large group helping to organise a conference. The hotel staff were very helpful in providing ‘take away’ breakfast when we had to be at the venue early. Coffee at the front desk was also a lovely touch.Overall the hotel is in a great location especially for the ICC and the rooms were clean and spacious. A fantastic choice for business trip or vaccation in Syney.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic location & not too expensive. Right in Haymarket & within a short walking distance to Paddy’s Markets, Chinatown & Central Railway Station. The room was spotlessly clean & all the staff I meet were very friendly & helpful. On my next trip to Sydney, I will stay there again.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is very handy to Central Station and easy access to China Town, Darling Harbour and Cockle Bay. The receptionists were very friendly and helpful.The room was clean and nicely decorated, but very small. We were only staying one night - if we had suitcases there would not have been enough room to move. Our friends had a family room, if you're staying more than one night it would be worth paying extra for the extra space.Our room looked directly onto the balcony of a pub across the road so we had to keep the blinds shut, and we could hear noise from the pub until midnight.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Ultimo with my husband for four nights. This hotel is in a great location close to both the train and Darling Harbour The hotel is really clean and well presented The staff are lovely and helpful Our room a king size was big and clean But most of all it was quiet and you could sleep Would definitely use again
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern clean rooms. Comfortable beds. Good location. Room sizes are small with not a lot of room for baggage or hanging clothing. Perfect for overnight business trip. Good reception/work area with plenty of room and desk spaces for working.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely clean hotel. Receptionists were able to assist us with bars and restaurants. It was pouring with rain and the receptionist provided us with an umbrella. Great location. Would definitely visit again
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic hotel in the heart of the CBD. Easy transport in the area and walking distance to most attractions etcThe front desk staff are great to deal with and nothing is a problem they all go above and beyond. Numerous room options from singles to families and value for the price. We use this hotel a lot for our business and can’t recommend them enough
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is right in the middle of Chinatown and only a few minutes walk from Darling Harbour and all of the restaurants, bars and museums on the waterfront. Rooms were very comfortable with super comfy beds and crisp bed linen.Staff were extremely helpful and sorted out a couple of issues we had in a very professional and thoughtful way. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s always tough being away from my family when I’m travelling for business but I was blown away by the thoughtfulness and helpfulness of the staff and the room layout. It made my business trip to Sydney so much easier. And did I mention they have their own coffee shop???
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at the Ultimo was just right. Nearby (5 minutes walk) to the central station, in Chinatown, nearby convenience stores, eating places, 10 minute walk to the ICC and Darling Harbour. Room was air conditioned, clean, nice bathroom (shower, no bath) there is a guest laundry room, very helpful to have access to that! The front desk is staffed 24 hours, very friendly and helpful team on there. WiFi was good and included.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came Sydney just 2 people , but I had a good price for Family room.My room very big clean comfortable but have a little bit noisy from outside and upstair. The hotel not far from the city center, you can walk around 15-20 minutes to Darling habour , Thaitown or Somewhere arond CBD if you like to walk. So I thought The Ultima hotel is the best boutique hotel in Sydney.
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have nothing but nice things to say about this hotel. The staff was extremely accommodating. The location is fantastic and the rooms are clean and comfortable! I can’t wait to stay here again!! Loved everything about our stay. The horoscopes they gave us were a plus!!
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel has been updated looks great, Rooms are clean and comfortable ,beds are very comfortable.. Great location right near Chinatown, the markets and a short stroll to the Capital Theatre, Staff were fantastic it is nice to see happy staff
hotelName:
19    The Ultimo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am reasonably accustomed to Hiltons appearing to have smaller-than-average rooms for a hotel chain of its status. The rooms at West Hotel didn't let me down with a tiny space, tiny hanging space for clothes, tiny desk and tiny bathroom all complimented by tiny (and uncomfortable) casual sitting options. Views out of the window were glimpses of Darling Harbour intruded upon by the architectural external facade on the windows.My check-in staff member was gruff and clearly had not remembered simple things at training like eye contact, smiling, using the guests name, and challenging interactions such as 'please' and 'thank you'. Really, really wants to make you walk out and go elsewhere.This hotel does NOT have on-site parking to be aware.Bar staff and the breakfast staff were one bright spot on what was a very disappointing experience.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The West hotel is well located, being at the bridge end of central Sydney, which makes getting to most spots of interest a doable proposition. While most large chain hotels are usually mean spirated and notoriously stingy, tending to nickle and dime customers for everything, the West Hotel were surprisingly generous. The rooms are well appointed and have amenities such as a chromecast on the TV as well as integrated in-room bluetooth speakers. The addition of a pod esspresso machine and complimentary meusili bars/popcorn also sweetens the deal somewhat. Add to this cheerful, chatty and helpful staff and there is a lot to like.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good business hotel in CBD area towards Darlinghurst, all brand new.Views are pretty much ‘city’ which means onto the street and into the building on the other side.Check in was very efficient and there was an early check-in available when I arrived at 8am in the morning. They needed about 30min to get my room ready and within 5 min walk you are at Darlinghurst harbour and can pick up some fresh coffee. They mentioned they would put my luggage in my room, however on my return and getting my key, I found out when I arrived in my room, my luggage was still somewhere in storage.Have not tried any of their facilities (restaurant, fitness) as it was a quick 2 day business trip but it is a good hotel for a business stay.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second stay at this property.Same as the first stay, the staff were great, the service was efficient, the room service was delicious and the rooms were spotless.I arrived early and was able to check in to two the two rooms which we had booked.The hotel is in a convenient location, with an easy (self) parking option over the road. There is a $40 flat rate for weekend stays if you pay directly at the parking station (Wilsons).Great value in the CBD. Will stay again.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very close and easy walk to Barangaroo and Darling Harbour. Staff were very friendly and helpful, check-in and check-out quick and smooth. Restaurant and bar seemed popular and busy, although we didn't try them this trip. Stand out for me was how quiet the room was - very busy road below yet we couldn't hear a single car, not even a vague hum from the traffic, and absolutely no noise from guests passing in the corridor either. Finally, a truly quiet room!
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for a few days in April for a combined work/tourism trip.There's no executive lounge, but as a higher level member they'll give you some drink vouchers you can use in the bar. The rooms are not huge, but comfortable enough and very modern and in good shape. The bar/breakfast room layout is attractive and the breakfast is great.The hotel doesn't have it's own parking, but partners with a garage right across the street. Ask the hotel receptionist for how to proceed.The best thing by far about this hotel is the location - you can walk to a lot of the key attractions and you're very close to a ferry terminal that'll take you to Manly beach and other locations you might want to see. The hotel is also a short walk away from the closest metro station.Will definitely stay here the next time I come to Sydney.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great experience w/ clean and shockingly quiet rooms. Fantastic breakfast w/ unique and fun Australian twist, great service from all the staff-- and perfectly located to jump on buses, ferries or walk throughout Darling Harbor and Barangaroo.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed three nights while solo in Sydney and picked the West because of its location close to Barangaroo and its modern and stylish look.The staff are really excellent - friendly and efficient. My requests for room service and an iPhone charger were met quickly and accurately. I was always greeted with a smile and kind word as I moved in and out of the hotel and the housekeeping staff always did a fabulous job.My main issue was with the room itself. They look fabulous with really funky carpet and stylish bed linens, but the rooms are very small and have very little storage. My large suitcase did not fit on the luggage rack, so I had to put it on the only armchair and ottoman and because there is no wardrobe, I had to live out of my suitcase rather than putting everything away, like I usually do.The bed was very comfortable, but the only bedding supplied was the bottom sheet on the mattress and a quilt. No top sheet, no blankets in the (non-existent) wardrobe, that's it. Even with my aircon turned down to 18 degrees I was still hot and didn't sleep very well. The hard, lumpy pillows were very uncomfortable too, and probably didn't help. Feathers are not always a luxury option! I didn't ask if housekeeping could provide me with other bedding. Perhaps if I had a top sheet and blanket might have been forthcoming.The bathroom was lovely with stylish fittings and a rain shower which was high enough for my tall stature. I would have liked to be able to turn the pressure up, though, but the tap didn't allow for this. Nice toiletries, though.The hotel is close to Barangaroo, so your lunch and dinner options are plentiful. But be warned, very few eateries are open for breakfast, and most of the ones that do serve breakfast don't open early (at least not on a Sunday). There are few options for weekend breakfasts around the hotel - it's predominantly office buildings and any cafes are closed on weekends - so you might find your only option for breakfast is the hotel restaurant, unless you're prepared for a long walk.This hotel didn't really suit my needs for a 3-day stay and I think I'll choose something a bit closer to the centre of the CBD next time.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overnight stay June long weekend as part of viewing the Vivid festival. Standard room on 5th floor with a glimpse of Darling Harbour. Nice rooms with comfortable bed. Smallest refrigerator known to man… Turndown service for wife only…. great staff throughout the hotel.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very conveniently located less than 5 min walk from Wynyard station from where you can get around easily. The rooms are beautifully designed and very well maintained. The best part is the food. Sooo delicious (and I’m French :) ). Room service, dinner and breakfast all were fantastic. Staff is very friendly as well and helpful. Will be back for sure. Thanks !!
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A nice clean room,very polite awesome staff from the concierge who you couldn't get past without him greeting you and offering his assistance to the receptionist to the wait staff who always were on there toes and smiling at you all amazing. 1st day arrived we ate at the restaurant dinner was different and amazing. Well explained by Gian Luca. The morning Barista Peter very welcoming and proffesional talking to us like he new us good way to start the day.thank you very much for an amazing birthday weekend we'll definitely come back and recommend the hotel.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was quite new and modern. Very clean. The location was absolutely perfect as we were going on a Vivid dinner harbour cruise and it was right around the corner. We stupidly went down to breakfast and there were 3 options: a continental breakfast $30, continental plus something from the menu $39, or just something from the menu. We ordered the 'full' $39 breakfast. But our meals were terrible - the eggs benedict was on burnt english muffins, the sauce was congealed and clearly not freshly made and there was only a small dollop on each egg. I ordered smashed avo with feta and pomegrante seeds with poached eggs. I couldn't eat it - the avo was tasteless and there was no feta. The latte was an extra $5 and was tiny.Then they had the hide to charge a surcharge for paying with a credit card!! I only found out when I got the email receipt later that day. No one mentioned it at the time, and really, who pays their hotel bill with cash? We should have walked back to Darling Harbour and eaten. Just a massive rip off.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you're after a nice boutique hotel which is a change from the larger main brands, then this is a good choice. Conveniently located next to Darling Harbour. Good in house restaurant for breakfast and dinner. Walking distance to many restaurant options.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stylish hotel in an excellent location, close to Darling Harbour and the main attractions (Harbour Bridge, Opera) are also in 10 min walking distance. The rooms are bit small but clean. The internet also working fine. The full breakfast is really nice, and if you are a Diamond member it is complimentary, otherwise 36 AUD. Staff is nice too. Parking bit difficult and expensive in the area. Recommended hotel.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were extremely impressed with this hotel. We had an early appointment in Sydney so decided to stay the night before & were lucky enough to choose this hotel.The staff were very friendly & accommodating, the room was great with a very comfortable bed & pillowsThe buffet breakfast was delicious & plentiful & the homemade granola was to die for. I didn't order a latte or cappuccino as the coffee that was served at breakfast was perfectThe location of this hotel is fabulous being within walking distance to so many thingsWe would definitely stay here again having so many positive things going for it
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel by Hilton, small but enjoyable. Thank you for a lovely stay, it was short and memorable. Great breakfast buffet and table service. Receptionist was quick handling check out. Housekeeping is friendly. We get what we need. Close to Barangaroo. Quick ferry ride to Sydney Opera House.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easy city location with a happy hour till 7pm on a Friday night. Solo guitarist performance as entertainment along with bar snack options at reasonable prices. Happy hour wine glasses are smaller than the standard wine glasses they have though so not necessarily a ‘deal’.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is a modern business style hotel within easy walking distance to the CBD & Darling Harbour. I had a King Banksia Plus room which was very clean however on the small side with no cupboards to hang your clothes therefore not suitable for couples or an extended stay. Free WIFI plus plenty of USB points. The staff and service was great and breakfast was included however had to pay for specific coffee which I didn’t mind.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We sent two nights at this hotel and were very impressed. Room was very comfortable, and service great. Check in and out was efficient and all staff very friendly. The location is perfect, easy walk to the city and Darling Harbour & Barangaroo. It is a hotel that you would go back to when you are in the area.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left I was completely disappointed with West Hotel.At check in they couldn’t find my reservation and weren’t bothered to look for it even though we were staying in a suite. No apologies given. We were here to celebrate our wedding anniversary but I had neglected to alert them of this fact but I figured when asked why were staying I’d let them know. Of course they weren’t interested enough to ask.The room is small for a suite, though it looks pleasant enough. Except for the scratches all over the floor, the door that doesn’t close properly between the rooms, noisy aircon, no lighting to do your make up or a backlight to shave, the bath was tiny and synthetic, towels were not soft and fluffy, the pillows were all big and long, the light in the lounge room was crooked, and you could only watch normal TV if u didn’t pay for internet which is ridiculous for a suite(your already paying for a premium room).We could hear the neighbours doors opening and shutting all night.The bed was comfortable and loved the music throughout the suite but that’s it.Even breakfast was horrible, burnt toast with two poached eggs with a piece of mushroom and a piece of tomato and no butter offered.Once seated we waited for at least 5mins if not longer for someone to come and serve us. Eventually I gave up and went to the bar to order coffees as I was sick off waiting.When the waitress eventually came over I was told off for ordering my coffee and not waiting.Checkout was very impersonal.Would never recommend to anyone or stay there again.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I first arrived for a 5 night stay and saw the room I thought I’d never be able to stay here that many nights. It was super small (Max 2 people) so went down and asked about cancellation policy or larger room. It had a two nigh policy so moving hotels didn’t make much sense and they had larger rooms for an additional $400 a night. I sucked it up and decided to stay. It worked out fine. Very convenient to Darling Harbor (5 min walk) and about 15 mins to Circular Quay/Opera/Bridge. Breakfast was ok, as I did menu instead of continental. Customer Service lacking a bit throughout hotel but I survived and you will too. Not sure if I’d come back. Definitely not if it wasn’t a Hilton as Im part of honors program
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hotel with the best professional team.I have stayed for few nights with my family I enjoyed my stay as everyone was helpful. Housekeeping service was excellent as our room was always well apointed.Thanks to the ck co concierge who help us with our tours.Definitely will be back
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, nice clean rooms, excellent customer service. The Full Breakfast was great too. We could not fault it except, don't go if you want few out your room window. We enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is such a great concept. From the moment we stepped in the staff was so helpful. Concierges were all great and their recommendations were wonderful. You are a 15-20 minute walk from everything. The breakfast buffet was incredible, great selection of everything and again the staff was so nice. this is our second stay in a Hilton curio hotel and they are our favorite now! rooms extremely clean and modern. Very quiet.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, a fabulous "hidden gem". Close to bars, restaurants, shops, ideal affordable getaway for 2. Quiet location, secure parking over the road. Can walk to everything. Modern, new and stylish throughout
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel clearly was an ambitious project for Hilton, emphasizing sleek modern design in an excellent location for a target audience of high-end business folks traveling light for short stays. Amenities, including a stylish, very appealing bar and restaurant, and the friendly, efficient, well-informed staff, add a lot to the experience of being here. That said, the hotel works less well for those here on longer trips traveling with family members and more luggage. It comes down to this: there is space to stash the contents of an overnight bag or smallish suitcase, and that's about it. Here, below, is a detailed "look" at our room. Skip and SCROLL DOWN TO "BOTTOM LINE" if you prefer a quick read. There's a small table to enjoy room service or an in-room make-it-yourself coffee/tea, but it has only one chair. You can pick up and move the little ottoman that goes with a modestly plush side chair by the bed, so that two people can squeeze in. But it's cramped. In fact, the eye-popping design of this room makes the most of quite a limited amount of space. Our room, a "king deluxe plus" on the 5th floor, was pretty small for the two of us. It was lovely to look at, except for the clutter that resulted from the lack of drawers, shelves and closet space, and the fact that we seemed constantly to be bumping into each other when going about our normal business. The bath, being roomier with a wonderful walk-in shower, was a plus. So was the very helpful staff, who brought an extra luggage rack and more hangers to add to the 4 that were there. Even so, we ended up cramming one of our wheeled suitcases under the night table in an effort to get it out of view and out of the way. Back to the room, there is a single wardrobe-type piece of furniture that looks to have space for clothing and personal effects. But it doesn't. Of the two drawers, one has the safe in it. There is a low side compartment that would do well with shelves for folded clothes, but it houses the refrigerator. The floor-to-ceiling compartment has 2 sections. Behind a door in one section, you'll find the ironing board, the iron, and a fuse pack, plus two small, narrow shelves, one too high for me to reach; the other, larger section of the wardrobe DOES NOT OPEN at all, clearly containing some equipment needed for the room. In open view as part of the wardrobe unit, is a small built-in luggage rack with maybe a 10-inch hanging rack jutting out from the wall, and above that, again quite high up, is a narrow metal rack. With only one shallow drawer, and two narrow shelves behind the wardrobe door, the bulk of your clothing and personal effects are in open view all the time. One night table has a small open storage area. The other is just a table top, with no drawer. So personal items are in view on the table tops, making a room designed to be sleek and modern look cluttered. BOTTOM LINE: I mention all these details to be helpful if you are two people, on a longer trip, seeking a multi-night stay here at the Curio Collection by Hilton. We were in-country for 10 days. We each had a small wheeled bag and a backpack. We stayed here 3 days, enjoyed ourselves in this great location between Darling Harbor, with its waterside cafes plus the aquarium and the wildlife center on one side, and the best of the central business district on the other. But with so little space to stash our stuff, we were ready to move on to somewhere more spacious, and more accommodating in terms of drawers, shelves, and closets. We would gladly stay here again for a night or two, with just backpacks or overnight bags. In the right circumstances, this is a wonderful place.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very nice hotel. Our room was very comfortable, tastefully decorated and clean. The bed was comfy, had a great night sleep. Our room was on the second floor, if I had of known this on booking or check in I would have paid for a higher room. Our room was an internal room, no window to outside our view was of the restaurant, therefore I felt I couldn’t open the curtains and felt a little claustrophobic and dark.I recommend this hotel, the location is good close to Darling Harbour and Wynyard Station. I would stay again just in a higher level room with a window.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel certainly has beautiful looking rooms. Everything is new and it is very clean. My bed was very comfortable. No issues with service. However, the rooms are not really functional. There is a very small area to hang up clothes and if you have dresses it’s really not possible to hang them up. For business travellers - there is really no dedicated work space. I would suggest this hotel is simply not suited to business travellers.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely clean hotel with good breakfast great bed and close to Darling Harbour which is great would recommend this hotel highly staff very helpful no view of the harbour from my room but could see the fireworks on Saturday night which was lovely the television stations were not great that would be the only thing
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve been HHonors member for many many years then Gold then Diamond...Been on the road in Asia for the past week and being a diamond member made so much easier in Tokyo in Taiwan and in S.korea ... in every place mentioned we stayed 1 or 2 nights and we were treated like Diamond ...I didn’t expect anything less in Sydney hilton curio collection...where we are going to spend 5 (yes 5 nights)...well ...not exactly what happened ...I paid an additional night for 2 rooms to get the certainty of having my room ready upon arrival early morning...made sure that was the case with the diamond center call.and later by direct message with the hotel front office manager Nathan...So all good ...(you think??)...Rooms were tiny ...if you have more than 2 pants and 2 shirts there is nowhere to hang them...Normally and voluntarily hilton always upgrade me without questions(not here)...and nobody seem to really care....I think staff ( and i have told them that i would review it on trip Advisor)...needs more understanding of real customer service ...but hey who am i to judge...i just have to take my business somewhere else’s insdtad of spending thousand of dollars a year at hilton to keep my status (yes its acquired by spending and staying...not because of a credit card platinum or so benefits)...The highlight so far was the safe falling on my foot ( i am ok nothing major happened) when i pulled the drawer where the safe is installed...meaning someone can walk away with the safe and your belongings no problem )see picture ....So the safe is not safe ( for you ...when it falls Fromm where it shouldn’t and your belongings since its not bolted )2nd major safety issue (and that’s only a Personnal opinion )Is that the key card to unlock the elevators works to go to any floor you want no just the assigned one of your room Ive been promised an upgrade for tomorrow ( my review to be continued)Btw I’ve read some review on trip advisor from former customers...5th6th7thor 8th floor...(8th being the last floor)doesn’t change anything as the hotel doesn’t have a real view of the bay what’s good is that everything is super clean and brand new Ec
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 2 nights before getting on a cruise. Our room was ready when we arrived in the morning which was great! They also have a shower/rest room off the lobby for getting cleaned up and staying awake for the time change. Bar is nice and we had coffee in the restaurant too. Helpful staff and nicely appointed smaller rooms.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is perfect, service very good. Liked the breakfast, too. The bed is comfy, nice shower room. Difficult to find a fault; perhaps the lack of storage which is OK for a short business trip but not so good for a longer tourist stay.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is modern and well appointed. Ditto for my room. Very clean and super quiet which was great. I paid extra for the King Waratah Premium which I’m not convinced was worth the $. Quite a small room and bathroom. Breakfast and mini bar snacks included in cost which is a nice touch. I did not like the location, tucked at the end of town with the freeway as the outlook. Still easy to get around the city though. Staff were polite and happy to help. I probably wouldn’t stay again but that is not a criticism of the hotel, it’s a preference for a more interesting location.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent two nights at the West Hotel. It was centrally located within walking distance of Darling Harbour. It was a boutique like hotel in the Hilton family. The staff were very accommodating and friendly and helpful. Our room was adequate size the amenities were very comfortable. There was a restaurant and bar downstairs. We had breakfast each morning at a beautiful buffet in the restaurant downstairs. It was a restful place to stay after traveling so many hours from US. We would not hesitate to stay there again.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tiny ultra modern hotel room at this five star hotel in the Central Business District. One suitcase holder for a double room. One suitcase on the floor. A space to hang up three or four items hanging over coffee maker .A three block walk to waterfront eateries.,otherwise be prepared for sticker shock in the on site restaurant. Never again.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was very small, but upscale finishes and a modern decor made it feel open. The comfortable room was quiet with good Wifi, easy to use climate controls, and great water temperature and pressure in the bathroom. There is no closet and limited space to store clothing; this could be problematic if you're spending more than a weekend here.The hotel is in a great location; it was less than a 5 minute walk to the King St. Wharf and less than a 20 minute walk to the Botanical Gardens...and another 5 minutes to the Opera House.The hotel is about a 25 minute Uber ride to/from the airport.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We did the cruise from Melbourne to Sydney with family so decided to stay in Sydney overnight before flying home to Perth. I picked this hotel because it looked interesting and I was spot on. We got to the hotel earlier than I anticipated 7.30am so I certainly did not think a room would be ready. They did not have a room ready but they did have a vacant room which they got ready for us and stored our bags (and our friends bags who were spending a couple more hours in sydney before they flew home) so we went out for coffee and the room was ready about 9. We had room on third floor - not big but certainly interesting - bed good - bathroom good - toileteries good - breakfast good. Staff were really friendly and lovely - location was fabulous - close to Darling Harbour and King Street Wharf and plenty of restaurants around.If you want a glossy hotel dont go for this hotel but if you want a boutique type of hotel in a great location and with great staff definitely give this hotel a try.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good price and being diamond, breakfast was free, also got the drink vouchers which is nice to have couple of drinks,Darling harbor was just stone throw away and wynyard station was very near for transportation
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: funky hotel but a decent location. the room was quite small but I really enjoyed the bathroom. The bed was comfy and the wall outlets were wonderful, but the small chair and desk were quite terrible. I also had a view of a highway, which I guess isn't the worst?
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was very nice, clean and modernly furnished. Everything was clean, orderly and just what we needed for our 4 day stay. The front desk staff were very helpful. The restaurant also had a nice selection of food for breakfast, lunch and dinner - and a good wine election!
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Generally a very good hotel in a great location for all the spots in and around Darling harbour. Walkable with luggage from Wynyard subway. In room snacks that are free are a nice touch. Good bar area. Recommended - great price / value
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 會員等級：Hilton Gold入住時間：2018年底至2019年初飯店人員素質：普通偏差跟我的伴侶在2018年底來到雪梨跨年，提前跟飯店人員用電子信件聯絡了兩個事項一：抵達時的treats upon arrival. 這個第二天才出現房間裡，並且是在我們在外用完晚餐後回到沒有開著冷氣的房中。二：給我伴侶的新年禮物，請他們在我不在時放在房內並附上一張卡片。這在某天早上清晨八點我們都來在睡覺時按了好幾次門鈴送來了，沒有卡片。I think the communication between staffs and shifts were not up to Hilton standard yet.As Hilton gold member, the complimentary breakfast could only have access to the cold section, and thus no scrambled egg, bacon, hashbrown, and TOASTER! Need to pay extra for the hot section and another extra $6 for barista coffee. Charges were not extraordinarily expensive, but quality cannot be compared to any brunch in SYD. I might still return for a future visit, as the room was comfy, clean, and has the location that I need.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived morning of Feb 3rd from a very long flight from the United States. We were greeted nicely and offered an upgrade to a higher floor...3rd level. This does not mean a room that is larger or nicer but a higher level. We faced the street and overall it was fine. I consider this a boutique hotel which is smaller and more intimate. No lobby or executive level. Everyone was always kind and professional. The rooms seem to be the source of contention for most...there is hardly room to put your bags as we had 2 huge ones...no closet. We managed however it was tight. Otherwise rooms ok, bed nice and bathroom small but amenities were good. Water & snacks offered daily. The location is great to get around Sydney prior to our cruise. We enjoyed time on the Harbour boats and the hop on hop off buses. It's a beautiful area and so much to explore in this magnificent city! Breakfast was nice with hot & cold selections every morning...also fresh juice. Modern and clean. We are Diamond level and received the buffet daily. We were never offered drink vouchers, disappointing as many others commented they received them. We enjoyed the restaurant in the hotel. Food was very good as was presentation and service. This was our first time staying in a Curio Collection Hotel. We were pleased overall and felt we would stay again but would prefer a larger room with closet.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here over Australia Day for 1 night & enjoyed the location of this hotel as it was near the trendy restaurants & ferries of Barangaroo.My husband is a diamond HH member & we received an upgrade to a higher floor of the small hotel. The hotel is modern but comfortable with a pleasant bar & restaurant. The rooms are small, but they tend to be in Sydney.We had breakfast which was very good, not a large selection but more than adequate. Coffee, however, came at an additional charge.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice rooms. Modern if not very special. Not totally sure what this hotel wants to be.That said - nice bathroom. Nice bed. Snacks in room. Charger outlets by bed. Staff helpful. Very nice restaurant in lobby - which does a great breakfast.Not the easiest place to get a cab from. Not a lot right around it - but close to harbor area. Sure will be there again when the Sydney Hilton is booked or too expensive. Not far from each other.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Chosen it for the first time as part of the Hilton Group. No regrets. Nice and stylish Hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. If you arrive by car, car park just across the street. Rooms well equipped with everything you need. Small, but acceptable. Breakfast offers all different choices. You could reach tourist spots like The Rocks & Opera House by foot, but Taxi or Uber is recommended. Airport could be reached within half an hour, but only early morning or late evening. For the time being Sydney is one big reconstruction area, plan some more time. Will come again.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So this hotel seems to act very different than others like in Dubai, Milano, Turin, Paris etc. Here you have to pay for a cappucino, sausage etc breakfast (10 AUD). Stayed in this hotel as a HH Gold Member. I have the experience from my other 40 stays, that a gold member never had to come up with any additional cost or anything for coffee or anything like that. As I can read here, some other members got a voucher due to no executive lounge - I didnt got that either. The hotel itself is very modern and I like the style. Staff was friendly and just followed the management rules, so I do not blame them for anything, they did their best.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here over the weekend for 2 nights. When the lady at the front desk (Alice) found out it was our anniversary she had a a gift from the kitchen sent up to the room with a personal hand written card. Followed by a message to wish us a great stay. Fantastic service from all staff included those at the bar. Would highly recommend. Great location with only 10 -15 minute walk to Sydney sights and a short stroll to darling harbour. Will certainly be booking here next time we are in sydney
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly and welcoming staff. Room upgraded in advance as Hilton Diamond member and was even available when I arrived off a long-haul flight at 8am, which was just amazing to have!Rooms a little on the small side but well appointed. Lovely design, excellent built-in Bluetooth speakers in the ceiling. Breakfast staff all very friendly and welcoming - was a bit surprised there was an extra charge for pineapple juice, though no extra charge for poached eggs. Spread generally decent, nice sourdough. Plenty of newspapers available to read over breakkie.Location good, Wynyard nearest station. Easy walking distance to Darling Harbour.Would definitely stay here again and have no hesitation in recommending it.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The West was just the tonic we needed as we moved from the Beach to the City! The staff were very helpful, particularly Mikaela from Reception who even kindly printed off our train tickets and had them delivered! We liked our conveniently-situated room (315) with its proximity to the Elevators. Housekeeping did a good job and we appreciated the delivery of extra slippers, calming teas and hand towels! The 2nd Floor gymnasium is good for working off stress, too!
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The West Sydney Hotel was outstanding. Centrally located to Darling Harbor and the downtown shopping district. The concierge was very helpful. The restaurant was very good as well as room service. A great stay and I highly recommend.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I arrived in Sydney exhausted after a 10 hour flight. I can always count on a Hilton property to provide a comfortable bed, great shower and amazing attention to detail. That’s exactly what we found at West Hotel.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. My husband and I stayed for one week while on vacation. The location is excellent -right around the corner from the ferry, shopping and restaurants. The hotel is very nice and the staff is amazing. They were very attentive in every thing we needed. They set up a tour for us, gave us detailed directions on maps and always had umbrellas ready in case we needed them. I loved the cappuccino machine in the room!!! The only complaint I would have is that there is not a lot of storage for clothing, but you can make do. Definitely say here if you are planning a trip to Sydney.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What really made the whole experience much more pleasant was the lovely young lady Claire down at the service desk who accommodated to our every needs, she was excellent. The room and bathroom were very nice clean and the tv being so large was an added bonus.
hotelName:
20    West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A clean, modern and well situated apartment with beautiful city views. We had a car, so cannot comment on distances from public transport. A supermarket is available within a 2 min walk and staff appear capable and friendly.Whilst needed a room key to access the lift, and then your room can be painful, it offers a degree of safety that is a positive for females travelling on their own.
hotelName:
21    Meriton Suites Waterloo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This stay far exceeded our expectation. Reception staff we so helpful and friendly, giving local info and helpful tips. The suite was absolutely lovely and so spacious. Housekeeping responded immediately to any of our requests and our suite was cleaned every day. Fab views over the golf course and cricket ground. Lovely walk through Surrey Hills and Botanical Gardens to the waterfront. 5 nights didn’t feel long enough, but having a home from home certainly made our stay in Sydney easy and memorable.
hotelName:
21    Meriton Suites Waterloo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed with the Meriton Suites Waterloo for two weeks while in Sydney on business. The room was beautiful and comfortable and the staff were extremely helpful.There were a lot of small things that made the visit that much nicer. It was a home away from home and I absolutely recommend it!
hotelName:
21    Meriton Suites Waterloo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: slightly tired room. large bedroom size as advertised on website not true. multiple lifts and walk to get to our room from reception. noisy on weekends with partying group in adjacent rooms. cleaners stingy with replacing used coffee capsules. unusual smell on our floor and room. wondered if window left open to remove this smell from room. cleaning staff hit up and down buttons to call lift. inconvenient; lift stops and they do not enter. pool closed.
hotelName:
21    Meriton Suites Waterloo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Meriton was exceptional. The service from the staff, the immaculate suite and the price was what made our stay a wonderful one. We walked to an event at Moore Park in the rain which was an easy walk. We will stay here again.
hotelName:
21    Meriton Suites Waterloo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Position, Fabulous Staff, Beautiful rooms Definately will stay here again.The self contained two bedroom unit was very spacious & the amenities were fantastic. The kitchen had everything in it to cook meals, but with all the fine dining around in this area probably didn't have too.Thank you again
hotelName:
21    Meriton Suites Waterloo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartmemt was clean, very spacious foor a family of 4 and equipped with all amenities needed including washer and dryer. A nearby grocery store enabled us to save on meals which is otherwise is expensive in Australia. Underground parking was available but a little pricy. Location is good beimg a short 10 minutes from downtown.
hotelName:
21    Meriton Suites Waterloo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived way earlier than our check in time, we were very lucky the room was ready. We had six people, so we had a three bedroom apartment. It was huge. 3 king beds, 2 and 1/2 baths. Very spacious. Staff were attentive, amenities were replenished on a daily basis. The staff were pleasant and always available for any questions. I would highly recommend these suites. We took an oper (spelling) almost everywhere. Public transport was easily accessible. It was nice to have a full kitchen. The dishwasher did not work, however the staff offered to wash the dishes for us! We declined the offer, saying we could handle it! Also nice to have a washer dryer on hand. We were there for 4 days.

review_body: Apartment was spacious and quiet, however, service was average. We had to ask multiple times for the beds to be split into singles (as booked) and for the second bedroom and bathroom to be unlocked. The spa and gym were unavailable due to renovations, however, this was never explained when we booked.
hotelName:
21    Meriton Suites Waterloo

Overall if you're visiting Sydney and are looking for good accommodation that's value for money, I would have to recommend the Meriton Suites.

review_body: I was astounded at the size of this apartment given its price. I did certainly not expect a separate study, a laundry and a large balcony at that price. The lounge/dining/kitchen area is also very spacious. Although the room overlooked the busy Eastern Distributor, double glazing in the bedroom cut out almost all of that noise. On the upside, facing east, my room (on level 12) had a spectacular view of Moore Park. I recommended this accomodation to many colleagues attending the conference I had flown in for, and would certainly consider this place in the future. Nearby restaurants, cafes and supermarkets are all in easy walking distance (less than 5 minutes)..
hotelName:
21    Meriton Suites Waterloo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We never look forward to visiting Sydney, but the Meriton suites in Waterloo is a haven for a city-wearied traveller.The well equiped units are high-end comfortable and very reasonable. The staff are exceptional, the beds are devine, and everything about our experience here will have us coming back whenever we have to visit the city.
hotelName:
21    Meriton Suites Waterloo

review_body: Very comfortable two bedroom, two bathroom apartment with plenty of amenities for being self contained. Main bedroom is downstairs whilst second bedroom and cooking/leisure activities area is upstairs. This may not suit some older people. Main bedroom with king bed is a little short on space on one side of bed, however beds are very comfortable. A little more information at check-in on use and access to and from car parking would be welcome. Overall, very happy with stay but Meriton Bondi are more to our liking.
hotelName:
21    Meriton Suites Waterloo

review_body: Friends are always asking me,where do u go every wkend?And I tell them every time,Meritons. It's like my second home.the staff are like family members.The apartments are spacious and comfortable. Always spotless clean.I tend to stay at meritons Waterloo most of the time and the staff are workout a doubt the most professional and friendly people I hav ever met. They will go that little extra to cater to your needs.When a hotel has lovely staff like Brooke and Danielle to check you in ,you know you onto a winner.Never a fuss,Or a problem but always with a smile.These are the sort of people that make Meritons the only place to stay.Thanx guys.Rob

review_body: Was travelling for work, after a long day in the office and battling Sydney traffic, was greeted by a very Danielle at the front desk. Danielle has outstanding Customer Service and went above and beyond to accommodate my needs. Great Customer Service was also delivered by maintenance guy on duty, my verandah wasn't closing and he came up swiftly to attend to it The mixer tap in the bathroom upstairs was damaged but only a minor issue. In general, rooms are clean. Great location.Only issue worth mentioning is street suites, don't select it if your a light sleeper - they are on street level and facing the freeway so traffic is quite loud. If your a heavy sleeper it's economical choice. Would come back to stay again for sure.
hotelName:
21    Meriton Suites Waterloo

hotelName:
21    Meriton Suites Waterloo

hotelName:
21    Meriton Suites Waterloo

review_body: We usually stay at the Meriton Suites in Zetland, but when we needed a late booking one night stay found the Waterloo Meriton to be quite a lot cheaper for the one night, so we decided to give it a try. We were warmly greeted by very friendly check in staff who came up to our room with my credit card that I had managed to leave at the front desk! Our room was on two levels, we had booked a one bedroom but were put in a two bed. It was very spacious, clean and comfortable. The location is great, being waking distance to Bourke St, close to buses to the city and beaches with a good supermarket less than 200m away. We will keep an eye out for deals here and definitely stay again.
hotelName:
