review_body: After an 11 hour drive from Brisbane we arrived right on check in time at the hotel.The staff having their hands full with an irrational, irate, rude woman were sure to reassure us they won't be too long in servicing us. We were privelledged enough to be served by Danielle. To see a genuine smile beam from her face to greet us in what can only be described as a clusterf*** of a situation was actually really refreshing.Not only was she poised, she was genuinely interested in us and our trip, the personal touches she made to our conversation proved she truly loves her job and the people she is checking in. We got to our room and unfortunately we weren't happy, after reaching out to Danielle she went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable in our new room. I can't express how amazing the staff are at this hotel: friendly, welcoming and fun to deal with.Thank you Danielle and the staff at Meriton Waterloo.Jay & Guy
hotelName:
21    Meriton Suites Waterloo

Needless to say we did not walk to the theatre as we spent too much time eating and enjoying Waterloo! Daniella at reception was the best and we shared heaps of travel stories. The rooms were great and a lovelly outllook over the golf course.I will use this as my goto hotel now when staying in the city and needing an overnight beforee an early morning flight as the airport is a short Uber ride.... Overnight parking is cheap at $20.. Shhhh!

22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights, we enjoyed our stay. The staff on reception were friendly and very helpful.We declined the first room we were given because of dusty curtains. To be fair a cleaner came to the room immediately but we preferred to change rooms, which we did. Our standard room was comfortable, but unremarkable, a little on the grey/beige side of life. The room was quite smallThe apartments are well positioned for the train station and bus station.
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 6 nights. we live in penthouse, city view.The hotel is close to Central station. Next to Donut shop. And the China Town is in opposite sides The room is tidy. And the staff also is nice. But l think the hotel is quite old. The equipment and facilities also is old.
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall it was nice and very good experience. We will definitely book again in our next vacation and will recommend to all our friends and relatives. The location was perfect for all we need such as transportation, restaurants and tourist attractions.
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is smack bang in the city, and with a loft option I was keen to try it. However, service from the front desk varied from excellent to not believing me when I told them my keycard wasn't working - which resulted in 4 to 5 trips up and down the elevator - not thrilled. The TVs in the room were quite dated too - don't expect to be able to use a Chromecast or anything to view Netflix on a larger screen.
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I checked in Adina apartment hotel for 2 bedroom apartment with a shock on 19 April 2019.The rooms are old with broken lights, dirty carpet, broken hanger hood in bathroom. The housekeeping was dirty and you can find traces of dust all over the furniture. We stayed there for 3 nights and one of the day the housekeeping did not even clean up the room after 230pm. My husband even get bed bug bites over his chest the day before we leave. There were no slippers or robes provided in room. We have to wear our own socks to prevent stepping on the dirty carpet. No laundry detergent given with the washer and dryer. I stayed there in Jan 2018 and it was a new and well maintained 2 bedroom apartment given to me. The hotel housekeeping was great then.It is truly a bad experience we have with the hotel compared to one year ago.
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central in a 2-bedroom apartment (there were 4 of us, family) a week ago. The actual apartment was very pleasant and well equipped for our needs, but it was our interaction with the staff at reception that prompted this review. We asked about renting one of their meeting rooms for a surprise afternoon tea 80th birthday celebration and not only did they provide the Royal Mail room, but also cups, saucers, plates, a selection of teas and hot water, etc. We brought food items in. The staff were so kind and helpful. I have no hesitation in highly recommending this hotel. The location was perfect for our needs and the nearby shops at Haymarket were a bonus. Next time I need to stay in Sydney I will definitely return to the Adina. It's just a short train trip away from Circular Quay and the CBD. And their prices are very reasonable. Well done!
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Adina apartment was just like home from home had everything you could need also had a good view and was very central right next to the central train station and lots of buses only 20 mins from the airport.
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 4 nights in April. Travel agent booked room. Good access to transport. Practically attached to Central Station. Room quiet, AC good, beds good. No coffee maker or press - that would have been nice, but certainly not a deal-breaker. Chinatown just 2 blocks away. Shopping and several restaurants also just 2 blocks.
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were 4 ladies on a shopping & musicals trip to Sydney. The Adina Central was fantastic! Big apartment, 2 bathrooms, great price and wonderful location. Just out the door there were cafes and just down the road is a Woolworths. We would all stay there again.
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location, spacious rooms, very quiet rooms. TV in bedroom didn't work but everything else was fine.Could be improved by having a restaurant on the premises but close to many eateries.Close to trains and bus stop as well as walking distance to TAFE, UTS and city cetre.
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Adina Sydney Central are very spacious apartments in a great location with good service. A great place with a family. I was so surprised how quiet it was considering it is on top of Central Station. Very convenient.
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the quirky heritage features of the Adina Central hotel - especially the grand Hobbit-like/round windows of apartment 35. The staff on Adina's 24 hour reception desk were friendly and knowledgeable. The Adina Central is in an old post office building. It's three minutes walk from Central Station and close to food stores and great local restaurants and bars. If you come in by train the location is unbeatable and (regardless of your means of travel) provides a great base to stay in and explore Sydney. The soundproofing is excellent and you can train, bus, Uber or taxi to many locations. You can also walk the old Goods Line from Central to the Powerhouse Museum and Darling Harbour. The bathroom is a little crowded. The bathtub, with its overhead shower, is tricky to get into. Rather than a bath/shower it would have been more accessible as a standalone shower. Regardless of this, we highly recommend it to friends, colleagues and interested travellors.
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartments were very good, There was 7 of us, with 2 apartments required. they were exactly what we asked for. Good amenities, comfortable beds. Location was excellent, service on reception was fantastic . "Bella" on reception was great, very helpful. Having parking facilities was good too.
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location,restuarants galore or cook for yourself. well appointed kitchen & laundry for a longer stay, great value we certainly will have a second visit not to far away,,we will recommend the Adina Central to our friends
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I thought the hotel would be noisy from the busy traffic - but it was very quite, the staff delivered excellent customer service, the rooms were very clean. Overall good location and perfect for a 1 or 2 night stay
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: so close to transportation and sights in Sydney. felt safe and lots of places to eat. Lots of activity with students coming and going to universities in area. Central station is wonderful and gets you wherever you want to go. We had room with a full kitchen and living room and it worked wonderfully
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Taxi from airport charged me 49 AUD while Uber just cost me half.great location next to the central station. very much near the china town and east access to asian food.the latest popular spice alley is within 10 minutes walk.
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Adina Central is the perfect location from which to move around Sydney easily. Great staff- provided a very personalised service, and clean and comfortable facilities. This is the third time we have stayed at this hotel.
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Adjacent to our transport Central Railway. Very conveniently located to access all forms of public transport to anywhere in the Sydney CBD and metropolitan areas.Good spacious rooms well serviced. Good value for money.
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location on George Street, a short walk to City Center. Very close to public transport, buses, trains etc. Accomodation modern, comfortable and quiet. Would be very happy to stay there next time in Sydney.
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Travelling on my own I was so impressed with the helpful and friendly staff. They even went out of their way to surprise me on my birthday. This was so appreciated. Also, the location was superb. So easy to catch trains, buses and light rail. Very quiet and relaxing in my room too.
hotelName:
22    Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well located, easy to reach and everything within reach, right on the beach. Stayed in a room with my 2 children that was made into a triple room, perfect. Kitchenette was very useful as we were in Sydney for 3 days for my children to attend a course - so we could cook in room instead of eating out, which helped with our budgeting. Would definitely stay here again. Lots of noise during the day but this was because they were refurbishing the bathrooms on the floor above - unlucky for me (but it has to be done at sometime) and lucky for you in future if you stay on floor 4, you will have new bathrooms.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here whilst visiting family in Sydney. Very nice apartment close to everything we needed. Apartment was a ocean view which was excellent. Unit was clean and tidy and everything worked as it should. Would happily stay here again.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location, faultless amenities and great value for money. Staff were very friendly and everything you need is at your doorstep. Would highly recommend and will definitely be returning next trip to Sydney.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying there was like a trip down memory lane visiting a work area from 45 years ago. Seeing how Coogee has changed over this time. The Coogee Sands was here then and is still here today is a testament to its service.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is right on the beach, the staff are very helpful. The rooms are clean, modern and beds are comfy. Lovely sundeck on the roof with views towards the beach. There is plenty of places to eat nearby and free undercover parking.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great room on level 6 with water views. Planning to return for a holiday as its in a great location on the beach and nearby numerous restaurants and cafes. Rooms are large and well equipped with a good kitchenette. Complimentary car parking was appreciated too
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a pleasure to arrive at the Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments after being on the road for work. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful and our room was very clean and comfortable. The hotel is right next to Coogee beach with a variety of cafes and restaurants. It was lovely to wake up and enjoy a walk along the beach path. Our only regret is to that we didn’t stay longer.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Will stay here again if i'm in the area. Staff bend over backwards to accommodate guests. Orgainsed early check in for us so out room was ready when we arrived before lunch time. Also a late check out was available. We could leave the car in the car park untill our late flight.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay. lots to do close by and plenty of restaurants for every palate. Close to beach, yoga, walking trails, swimming, music and cultural venues. Bus access to rest of City. Would recommend for any trip
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Coogee Sands is close our boys who live in Sydney .With time being short , this location , its easy access , value for money and friendly service keep us returning there time after time . Access to the city , the beach , restaurants and other entertainment is also a feature .
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great time! M50 bus takes you into the city. The place is across the street from the beach, and shops and cafes are walking distance! Can’t wait to go back!! Family friendly and great staff who were helpful.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Coogee Sands is in a wonderful location. The best time to stay is mid week. Check the hotel website before any other websites as you have more time before you need to pay and can alter your booking if you need to.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Coogee Sands is just a stroll to the beach, the shops and some great walks.The staff were really friendly, the room bright and modern with an awesome view.Great value for money and a wonderful location.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was excellent with great views of the ocean and the park. Customer service was outstanding. The beds were comfy, everything sparkling clean. The balcony was huge and gave us extra space with the kids. Highly recommend
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No fuss no bother booking direct with the hotel.Enjoyed everything about this place - location, easy access, great parking, really nice room - got an upgrade!Public transport within meters of the hotel.Beautiful view of the beach.Great coffee & food all around us.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brilliant location, good sized and well configured rooms - not cluttered (stayed in courtyard studio) - very quiet aircon units - staff very friendly and welcoming - minor wear and tear issues in bathroom to be expected-, great value overall relative to others in Coogee - my second stay and I would come back without hesitation
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m a regular guest at this hotel and I have always found the staff extremely helpful, the amenities quite satisfactory, the beds and pillows very comfortable, shower pressure excellent and the location is absolutely A1 with the ocean and the coogee pavilion just next door.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel with everything at arms reach. We arrived around 9.30am on a Friday morning and because I'd booked direct with the hotel (flying in from Adelaide)had a function next door at 1pm on the same day. Our room was ready for an early check-in rather than at 2pm. Thank you Coogee Sands - fantastic. Great staff, room with our own court yard the beach is right at your doorstep, fantastic views from the hotels rooftop with chairs and BBQ, Coogee Pavilion next door, eateries on the street leave, shopping district, bus transport to Bondi Junction and then train into the CBD. Make sure you have get a Opal card. Great walk from Coogee to Bondi Beach along the coast, fantastic views. It's a MUST stay.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice, staff were great. Location was great just a shame it’s a bit close to the bar next door. We had a good room though and it was away from most of the noise. Would recommend this to a friend. G
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent all around. Thanks Coogee Sands for a lovely clean room and friendly service. Great location, close to everything and undercover parking was great given we had driven from the country......................................................................................................................................................................................
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location with hotel opposite beach. Walking distance to a number of cafes, retail stores and restaurants. Parking under hotel is cramped however paid parking opposite hotel for larger vehicles..
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On check in I was greeted by Darren who was super friendly and made me really welcome. The rooms are a really good size and are clean and have everything you could want including a kitchenette. The location is magic and the beach is right there out front.Really enjoyed my stay.Thanks
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel staff were so friendly and upgraded us to a water front apartment it was Amazing! The Staff friendly and the hotel is self was clean and we would highly reccomend. I will be back 100%. I would give it an 11/10 if I could!
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the location, so close to the beach and cafes. Beach towels at reception was a great extra. The nightclub next door was noisy but we would of gone for a dance if we didn't have the kids. Pavilion cafe next door was great for breakfast.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at a few places in Coogee now and Coogee Sands is the best so far. Good value for money, nice large clean rooms, GREAT location, close to the beach, start on the iconic walk/run track to Bondi. Plenty of great quality eateries nearby. I have already booked my next stay.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Like being on the beach? Like friendly staff who are helpful? Like an ocean view for a reasonable price? The Coogee Sands is for you. I always stay here when I come to Coogee (fairly often) on site parking is available without extra charge and you are right next door to great pizza and around the corner great coffee!
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Coogee Sands Hotel and Apartments is a nice hotel for sightseeing and relaxing, because it is located next to the beach and has a very good traffic connection to the city. So it is very useful if you spend some days in Sydney.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Even though only a quick stay, our room was clean and comfortable with a view of Coogee Beach. Service provided by the staff at check in and check out was quick and efficient. Great location, right next to lots of eating places. Check out the Coogee Pavilion next door for great food and service.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A bit on the pricey side but awesome location. The rooms are very clean and the staff is extremely nice. We asked for a late checkout and were provided one with no questions asked. The onsite parking is an awesome perk.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everytime we visit Sydney we choose Coogee Sands. We love the location. The staff go over and above for us every time. The rooms are spotless and very comfortable. The location is great. The perfect getaway.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great proximity to Coogee beach, room clean and well appointed. close to Sydney attractions. And local shopping and restaurants. Catered for our family of four comfortably. Staff were friendly and helpful
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly, welcoming staff and an excellent location right next to the beach. Has secure, underground parking with lift access to upper levels. Shared family room was basic, functional and clean and commensurate with the price per night plus there is a nice view from the balcony, although the palm trees on the foreshore obscure the beach view somewhat. Regular buses around the corner and traffic was fairly light considering how close it is to the CBD (20 minute drive off-peak). Would suit couples, families and the restaurant-bar next door was frequented by a 20-30 something crowd on Friday and Sat nights. Not far from the airport and the beach was clean and the area was safe. Would stay at Coogee Sands again, no problem.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location for families, the only place I know that doesn’t charge you extra for parking. ( Under covered parking)Only meters to the beach, with lots or near by restaurants.Buses galore if you need to travel.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The bed was absolutely amazing to sleep in. Perfect size room. Housekeeping Team very friendly and efficient. Front of House Team have good knowledge of local areas and very helpful when it comes to bus services. Tip: ask for the wifi password.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in Deluxe Ocean View Terrace. Perfect location, beautiful view. Balcony is massive, there were 7 of of us staying in different rooms and we all met on there. Bed was comfy. Room was nice and quiet at night. Nothing to fault.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We always choose to stay at the Coogee Sands when we travel to Sydney from Honolulu to visit friends and family. It has the perfect location to suit everyones needs, i.e. if you are looking for a place to stay that is next to the beach, steps away from cafes, restaurants, bars and take aways. The buses which will take you just about anywhere are also located a couple of minutes walk from the hotel.The Front Desk staff are always friendly and helpful and housekeeping does a great job at keeping the rooms clean and fresh. The rooms themselves are a good size and have a kitchenette which comes in handy if you choose to eat in.We would highly recommend to anyone who is looking to visit Sydney to choose the Coogee Sands.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, convenient parking, nice room, pretty clean, good value overall. Trip advisor won't allow short reviews so i am writing this line down to meet the minimum 200 characters in order to submit.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The affordable rooms were perfect for our family, the rooftop bbq area was a great facility and right next door you have a brilliant cafe/restaurant with loads of kids activities. I think the car parking available was also a big plus as it’s a very busy area.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Sands for a few days as a short family get away. Perfect location, reasonably priced and very clean rooms. The option to grab some beach towels and sand toys was a hit with the kids. Will definitely be booking here again.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: These rooms were very noisy and the bed uncomfortable (bruises). Most staff were polite and professional but not all. Off street secure parking is great. Stairs to some rooms are inconvenient for families with small kids
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great time together as a family, top location next to a beautiful beach, coastal walks and other beaches nearby. Great family hotel. Had a roof top sundeck with BBQ which gives you an option of cooking your own meals whilst looking over the beach and the Coogee Pavillion.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location next to the beach and the Coogee Pavilion (great breakfast there after a morning swim). Quiet rooms with good beds. Very clean, great service at front desk. Usually got parked at the hotel too.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Location to beach, cafes, walks. Staff very friendly and rooms were clean with good facilities. Rooftop bbq and sundeck was a great area for our families to catch up together for meals and drinks.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay here at the Coogee Sands, a return trip to one of our fave areas and accommodation. The staff always look after us here, which makes our holiday seamless and relaxed. Such a pleasure to enjoy an early morning swim and coffee....thank you Coogee Dands.....9/10.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff where fantastic and friendly appartment was in a great location not to busy public transport was was near by which was great as my husband was in hospital the staff worked with me and my daughter with our room as we did not know how long we had to stay for would come back again to a holiday
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay was great. Perfect location for the beach and also getting to Randwick races which is why we where in Sydney. Staff where very friendly and helpful and the room was clean and confortable. Would stay again.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a place that I would highly recommend to anyone! The rooms aren't new but it really doesn't matter as they are very clean and the position is fantastic! The best part of the whole place though is the reception service. They are friendly, helpful, nothing is too much trouble.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was an amazing beautiful place had a great view and very clean bed was comfy and very easy to get anywhere around Coogee and if you wanted to go anywhere else around Sydney because the buses are right there
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is second to none. You have the beach like right there, 20-30m from the front foyer. What more do you need.. The hotel is clean, has everything you need including a car space (included in price (well according to my booking) which can be limited in Coogee Bay. Next time in Sydney, definitely staying here again..
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the location, Friendly staff, would most certainly stay again when next in Coogee...everything was clean and comfortable, couldn't hear much noise even though there is a happening establishment right next door
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved staying here! Very nicely appointed room, excellent hotel location with incomparable access to beach and fabulous cafes. I’ve stayed at all of the other hotels in Coogee over the last 2 months and this is by far the best.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Plenty of eating options within an easy walk. Free onsite parking. 1 minute walk to to the beach. Friendly staff. Easy booking on line. Spacious room although the bathroom was rather small. Kitchenette.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location with great friendly staff. Close to the beautiful beach. Great place to be. Parking is at the Hotel and plenty of parking next to the Hotel, beach and nice Coffee shops. Great Restaurant with a view.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Straight away they offered us a free upgrade for my girlfriends 21st. Got a free bottle of champagne and chocolates also. Location is right beside the beach. Parking is available. Food outlets around the hotel. Amazing views on the rooftop and a bbq as well.
hotelName:
23    Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the hotel with a view of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House and it did not disappoint. The room itself was lovely and quite enjoyable while we were there with good wifi access and speeds. We loved the neighborhood it was in as well. Not necessarily a downside, but it is a bit detached from downtown, with a maybe 20-30 minute walk to Circular Quay and a 5-10 walk to nearest train station to head that way. Good base for exploring Sydney and views are amazing. They were also more than happy to keep our luggage since we got in super early in the morning and weren't leaving until later on the day we left Sydney.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s a little further out that I would have liked to have stayed, in terms of public transport. But much prefer this area to central or the bit between. Sort of kings cross area. Bus stop just around the corner and train station just down the road.Nice walk round the back and out to darling harbour eventually.Clean, tidy, welcoming and handy. Complimentary paper Friday morning and they can arrange the airport shuttle for you $16. One gripe - booked with a harbour view. Which I got but not what it suggested in the pictures when I booked. Still very very pretty
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It could even be 11 years. We come to Sydney once a year from Queensland for a holiday to visit the Opera , Museums and Music venues and Restaurants.It is always a pleasure to stay here.The locations is just the best!It is quiet and immaculate clean. The staff are superb. Some of them have been here since we started coming. Already looking for next years visit.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located close to kings cross station and across from the hotel is a supermarket and a bus stop. The staff were really nice and the location was great! Only 30 min walk from the opera house but you can take a bus or a train. On this street is also two hop on hop off stops wich was really convenient and loads of restaurants.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well after my wife was flown from Wagga to Sydney for a heart op i had to drive the 5 1/2 hours -driving up i riang a few hotels and the Macleay gave me a super price along with parking as my wife was at ST Vincents Hospital.The staff at the counter were first class and the rooms were great.Great spotfood Woolies bottle shops and a nice 15-20 min walk from the hospital.Bouns the free entry to a local gym was used.If looking for a great hotel clean rooms quiet go no further
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Macleay is an aparthotel, with rooms that allow guests to self cater, or one can take meals in the hotel. We stayed there for a couple of nights. The hotel is in the Potts Point district of Sydney. It's a short walk from Kings Cross railway station. What more could you ask for? It's smart, clean, quiet, very comfortable. There are a number of street cafe's close by to get a good breakfast or lunch, and a good Woolworth's metro supermarket across the road if you are self catering.The staff are great, polite and very helpful. We were able to walk from the hotel, across to the cathedral and park, and then on to the City Centre. This gives you a different view of Sydney. A good start to our holiday. The Macleay is definitely on our list to stay on our next visit to Sydney.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for accommodations in Sydney, I would highly suggest the Macleay Hotel. The room was very clean and the neighborhood is full of local charm. We loved that the bus stops right in front making travel around the city super easy!
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beware - some rooms may have the lovely view shown on the website, but our "Harbor View Triple" looked only into the building next door. This would be a routine disappointment but we paid $4k for the New Year package and the hotel confirmed our request (made in May!) for a bridge view room.Manager was away our entire stay, and front desk was no help.View of fireworks from the rooftop is good, but crowded. Show up early.Hotel is not close to any of the usual tourist sites.Hotel overall is old & worn. Bathroom original and unimproved. This place was the low point of our trip.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I recently travelled to Sydney to take a 12 Night cruise to New Zealand and chose to stay at the Macleay Hotel 2 nights both pre and post cruise. This hotel was competitively priced, clean and great location for our needs. Front Desk staff were excellent and very helpful.We really appreciated being able to check into our room early and our post cruise room on the sixth floor had a lovely view. There is a kitchenette with complementary coffee and tea. Across the street from the hotel is a super market that also sells beer and wine. There are a few restaurants and bars in the area.The washroom was modern, had a nice shower and toiletries. Beds were comfortable and complementary WiFi worked reasonably well. There is also an outdoor pool and BBQ area.We love to walk and from the hotel we walked to the Royal Botanical Gardens (a must see), Opera House, Overseas Cruise Terminal and the "Rocks". You may want to consider purchasing an Opal public transit card and use it to ride unlimited times on the trains, buses and ferry's. We took a ferry to Manly Beach which was lovely. Daily cost with an Opal card is $15.80 maximum and $2.70 on Sunday's. You can re-load the card. The only exception is the trip to the airport. One Way fare from the airport is $18.70 (Adult Fare).We decided on taking public transit (train) to and from the Airport. This decision was made after reviewing the high cost for taxi's and poor on-line reviews for the airport shuttle services. The location of the hotel made travel by train easy. Take the T8 from the Sydney Airport to Central Station and transfer to the T4 to Kings Cross. The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from Kings Cross. We should have taken the train to the Overseas Cruise Terminal (get off at Circular Quay Station) to board our cruise ship Instead we waived down a taxi (13 Cabs) across the street from our Hotel. I figured the cost would not be expensive as we only had a short trip of about 4 km. In our opinion the cab driver took us a much longer route through heavy traffic. We didn't know that the taxi meter runs on time instead of distance.Our cab driver was unsympathetic and while sitting still in traffic watching the meter keep going up I finally said enough when the meter reached $25. I paid the driver and we walked the remaining short distance to the ship.He never even got out of his cab to help us with our luggage merely popped open the trunk. The Train fare would have been $2.20 each.We did take the train to our hotel on return from our cruise. I now have a better understanding why people are turning to Uber. I might add that this taxi driver is not representative of the lovely helpful Australian people we encountered during our trip. Sydney is a beautiful city with an abundance of things to do and see. The Macleay Hotel was situated suitable for our needs at a competitive price, clean with an excellent staff. I would recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Macleay is a no fuss hotel. Checking in was a breeze; they allowed me to check in even if I came a bit early. This is a mid range hotel that will satisfy all basics. What sets it apart is its location; it's safe to walk around, it's walkable to a lot of sights in Sydney and its right in front of a supermarket, some restos, wine stores and shops. I highly recommend this hotel and never had any complaints during my stay.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel located in a great location, well equipped that you have all facilities and utensils in studio room for your own cooking. Gym is located out of hotel and just a five minute walk. Friendly & helpful staff.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for work and the staff were excellent - friendly, helpful and when I had wifi issues they were quick to respond and explain about their 'hotspots' and to let them know if I had any more problems. Wifi does need to be more consistent.Housekeeping was also excellent and air con was a god-send with Sydney humidity!
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed her for a couple of nights. Decent enough. Smaller side for a room. Friendly staff Opposite is a supermarket which was handy Short walk from the station Half hour walk to Sydney opera house Quaint little road Swimming pool is small. Very small.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my husband for 5 nights in Dec 2018. We arrived at approx. 10pm after 25+ hours travelling from the UK. The check-in was thankfully very quick. We popped over to Woolworths (grocery store) over the road straight away to get a snack and water. The hotel is located in a very good location, 15 minute walk to the Sydney harbour and at the bottom of a busy road of restaurants, cafes and bars. Being at the bottom of the road it was nice and quiet. We found the bed and pillows comfy, bathroom a good size with really good shower. Daily newspaper delivered although we hadn't requested it. The kitchen area was a bit shabby but we didn't use it. Wifi was pretty good for the first 4 nights of our stay and then we received a letter under the door to say they'd changed the wifi to a faster service so it should be improved. It did the opposite and we had a lot of trouble trying to get online on the last day.Pool area was nice, only 4 or so loungers but never full up. You can see the harbour view from it. There were BBQ facilities but we didn't use. We also didn't access the roof to check out the view which I wish we had done, you need to get a key card from reception to be able to do this I believe.Mini bar expensive in the room but with the shop opposite the hotel no need to use it. We didn't book a harbour view room so we had the view of the next door building, it provides zero privacy if you have your blinds up! The blinds were not black out so pretty light in the room early in the morning.All in all it was a good hotel. I think it was good value for money for central Sydney so expect it to be pretty basic and you'll be fine! I would probably stay here again if I visited and my budget was similar. Tip for Sydney - all day travel on a Sunday with an Opal card is max $2.70 so plan as much of your travelling around on this day if you can!
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family wanted to see the famous Sydney harbor fireworks, and we were convinced after few research that Macleay Hotel was the best. It cost $1000/night with min 4 nights. ..and the service is horrible. Hotel is old, I could smell mold in some areas, view from the room is spectacular, and roof top for fireworks is fantastic. But thats about it. Other than the young chinese looking guy at the reception, the other guys at the reception is downright rude. We had to complain and got bit agitated after our room were not cleaned for 2 days. We told them in the morning that we would be out until 1 pm, please clean the room...after 2 days of complain, on the third day they were cleaned on time. If I summarise the amount of money spent on the hotel, we could have spent it on a very nice restaurant by the harbor for NYE. Macleay did have spectacular view of the harbor, about 40 or so people were up on the roof...and they provided ..a bottle of wine..and a bottle of champagne ..pathetic.. not coming back there ever again.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We paid $1000 AUD per night, minimum 4 nights, for this hotel because of the reported fireworks view. That's for a hotel that typically goes for $200 or so AUD per night. You'd think for that price, they'd really do it up for New Year's Eve. No. For the 9PM fireworks, they had champagne (until it ran out) or soda, glow sticks and sparklers. Same for the midnight fireworks. The roof is not handicapped accessible. And, they would not allow tripods for cameras. We had to have a letter authorizing us to be on the roof, and had to go to the desk to get that. Not a big deal, but for so much money, why not put the letter along with some 2019 glasses, hats, maybe noise makers, on each bed? Thousands paid for a place to stand and watch 30 minutes of fireworks. While the view was excellent, a two night minimum at that price would have been reasonable. We could have done a luxury hotel and boat in the harbour for the same or less money. Then there was the service. One of the desk clerks was flat out rude. Another couldn't answer a question about where to get coffee. Our friends were two days without toilet paper in their room, though they repeatedly asked. We asked for additional towels that never came. No coffee maker, just instant packets. No room service other than what you could get yourself for 1/2 the price for breakfast across the street (yes, that's where they get their room service food.) And, after all that, we had taken 2 waters from the fridge before seeing the listing that said they were $5 each, and they billed us for those. And, lastly, considering they're catering to so many foreign clients, their bill does not state whether the prices are in AUD. I would not go back. This is a budget hotel charging luxury hotel pricing for NYE. It's obvious they know they'll fill the hotel without repeat business, putting customer service as a low priority.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was not disappointed I loved my stay. Excellent and helpful staff, clean rooms and easy for my grandmother to move around with her walker. Quiet location compared other areas of Sydney, perfect for family stay. Couldn't afford a Harbour view but could see the reflection of The Bridge in the neighbouring apartments window.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easy check in, clean and comfortable rooms. Simple, no frills, in a good area, a quick stroll to the Botanical Gardens cutting down the stars and by the marina. There is a grocery right across the street and its right down the street from my favorite restaurant, The Apollo.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a number of year’s, we revisited this hotel for the first time recently and for the life of us couldn’t figure out why it took us so long to go back. There’s little not to like about this hotel - it has a sensational view from almost every room, rooms are refurbished, clean and really well equipped, there’s parking on site (at a bargain price for Sydney), a pool, a bbq and staff that feel like they actually care about the place that they work. In other words, the place has a soul, something you don’t often feel with large hotel chains. All this, plus a great location at a really competitive price make it well worth the visit.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a good hotel, the beds are big, they provide complete kitchen equipment (you can even cook) and it's out of the noisy areas of Sydney. They don't serve free breakfast but there's a nearby Metro Supermarket where you can buy good food that you can just heat using the microwave at your room. It is not in the most central part but all of Sydney's attractions is just within a 3 kilometer walk.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent hotel. The staff are so friendly, helpful and welcoming. The full sized window views to the Opera House and Harbour Bridge amazing. The towels & free toiletries are replenished every day, beds are made and a free newspaper delivered each morning. The rooms are clean and adequate. The location is excellent - just a few minutes walk to the one stop station into the city. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ideally situated in Potts Point a stone's throw from lively Kings Cross, the Maclean is friendly and clean. Large picturesque windows which open (and lock!) aircon and smart white bedlinen atop a super comfy bed. Bathroom is a tad small but spotlessly clean with a powerful shower. Would highly recommend and definitely my choice for my next visit to Sydney.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gore has had a refurb so all ok. Room was close to the lift which was noisy and a/c was to noisy to turn on. Beds were cheap. Not worth the money. But for parking we were charged extra for what was advised as we had two cars so that left a sour taste in the mouth.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I have just spent a week at The Macleay in Potts Point. The hotel itself is very reasonably priced and excellent value. In addition to the ensuite bathroom we had a small but well equipped kitchenette that was more than adequate for preparing breakfast and the occasional hot meal. Our room had a view of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge, two Sydney icons. However it is the Hotel’s location that is its most valuable feature. Not only is it surrounded by the restaurants and cafes of Kings Cross but it is in easy walking distance of the Art Gallery of NSW, the Botanic Gardens and Circular Quay. If you prefer to avoid walking the railway station is five minutes away.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful location just a short walk to Kings Cross station and with a bus stop outside the hotel for a bus that goes to Central station. The room was comfortable, clean and quiet with a great view of the harbour and a decent kitchenette. There's a supermarket across the road too. Very handy. Great staff as well.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: nice hotel for staying with family and friends.....good located hotel and very nice view...rooms were nice and swimming pool was awesome .....staff was too friendly and always ready for help....we really enjoyed our trip....thanks .....
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a week recently.Excellant location. Several good coffee shops within strolling distance.We loved being able to walk through the Botanical Gardens in the morning to the CBD.Pleasant staff and spotlessly clean.Will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel is brilliant! On Macleay St close to all the amenities, shops, restaurants and even an ATM right next door. Perfect for a weekend away. The guy on the concierge was so lovely. After discovering the room I was in didn't have views of the Harbour bridge and Opera House (apparently Harbour views does not necessarily guarantee this when you book through booking.com), he was quick to move me to the next available room with the most spectacular views! Definitely recommend staying here for a short trip to Sydney.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Other than having to wait several hours to check in, it was great. We are able to store our luggage in a room next to the front desk. Then, we just stomped around the area for about 4 hours. Room was nice. Very small but functional kitchenette with supplies. Housekeeping even did our dishes we left in the sink! Cute bathroom. I loved the shower. Shower controls a bit touchy to get the right water temperature, but fine. Bed small for us. We are accustomed to king bed, but did us well. Bed comfortable tho. Two chairs for small eating table. Desk with no chair. They had a DVD player to borrow along with some copies of DVD's to borrow in addition to original DVD's. A grocery store across the street. We were able to get an Opal (public transportation card) in the grocery store. There is also a bank next door. Front desk helpful, especially the gentleman that checked us in. There is no concierge as such, but front desk able to give info on things to do, places to go, how to get there, etc. Can be a bit of a walk (about 10 minutes) to Kings (train) station. Not really that long of a walk, but when you have foot problems anyway and know it will be a long day on your feet, it does seem like a long walk. Large activity brochure selection in business center. Two computers in business area just next to front door. We had a wonderful view of Circular Quay from room 703. Only complaint would be that it seemed a bit noisy in the morning. Not sure if it was other guests or housekeeping. Would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The view is the best you could get in Sydney, anywhere! It's amazing. Our room (911) was small, but included a kitchen which is fantastic to have, and we looked out to the harbour one way (full view of Opera House and Harbour Bridge) and out to the heads the other. Would be good if wardrobe included shelving for clothes, as just all hanging space, as we were there for a week and I don't like living out of a suitcase.The staff are friendly and helpful, and you are across the road from a supermarket, and deli and restaurants and cafe's are everywhere. There are stairs down the end of Challis Avenue that take you to Woolloomooloo, and you can then easily walk to the Botanical Gardens and the opera house. Beautiful walk.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is in a great location, staff were lovely. The rooms although rather small were clean and tidy and it had a nice pool area that got lots of sun. Only downside is that for 3 nights stay we have to pay over $100 for parking in the hotel carpark! You would think as a guest it would be much cheaper.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not the most modern - but pretty damn good, and spotlessly clean. Great location. Friendly staff. 24h reception. Great views. An easy walk from Kings Cross Station, but away from all that ‘the cross’ has to offer - and that’s been seriously cleaned up anyway over the last few years. Lovely walk down the steepish hill to Elizabeth Bay (or take the steps like the locals do - ask where they are as they are hidden). Cafes abound in the area. Recommended.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I found the Macleay Hotel to be very clean and every thing that we expected. The service was courteous and the staff showed a willingness to help. Regular hotel service is excellent. Good facilities. Had a very relaxing and a great stay at this hotel. Highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was perfect, The gym they are connected with was a most pleasant surprise. Staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. Rooms were adequate for the price paid. Internet was very slow but I hear Australia is known to be slower with internet speed. Overall would stay again as first choice
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you can overlook the dated decor, you will be pleased by the amount of space, the view, the good location with plenty of wonderful eating out (and eating in) options in walking distance. I've paid a lot more for a lot less, accommodation wise, in Sydney!
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great staff. Very friendly and accommodating. The rooms may be a little older but has everything you need and very clean. First floor has large balconies and wow!! What a great spot. Restaurants everywhere. Had a great stay. Definitely recommend.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was a bit dated but the location and the view is amazing. Potts Point is a buzzing village, an easy & pleasant walk to the CBD with plenty of dining options nearby. We will come back for sure. Staff are very friendly.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Great location, fabulous views and easy walking distance to CBD. The room was cosy and suited our needs for our 5 night stay. All Staff that we dealt with were friendly and happy to help with local transport suggestions.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When attention is not the only thing !. We stayed at the Macleay Hotel on August 5 and 17 all three of my family, and the truth is that the rooms need a good update. They are small for three, they need a greater cleanliness and above all a modernization of the furniture, not only for the old but for the deteriorated, even so we would be housed in this hotel for the attention of its staff, which is sometimes the most important .
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was unable to stay in a hotel that had such unhygienic issues.I found a a lot of long hairs, when me and my partner have short hair, as well as pubic hairs! There was also food crumbs and stains all over the dresser, and table in the room. The pillow also had what looked like eaither vomit or food on it.The GM also came to the room and said to my face it's just one hair, as she was shaking the hairs off the blanket and sheets. I asked her to stop trying to get rid of the evidence because I already had taken photos of it all.As for the pillow she said it was wool. There is no wool in the bedding or room. She then tried to wipe that off too, which wouldn't go away because it was on the pillow pretty good. She then tried to scratch it off with her nails.I was offended that the GM would even try to prove me wrong with such clear evidence. I was offended that she tried to get rid of evidence while talking to me. She said that her reviews online were nothing but positive and that I must be wrong. I explained that's why I chose to stay at Macleay Hotel. I wont forget the angry eyes of the GM and condescending voice.SHAME on you Macleay! Book else where, it's more convenient else where, cheaper, and cleaner!This was the worst mistake ever to book this hotel, especially after an 11hr flight. I thought asking for a refund for a room that I had not slept at was not asking much. Instead of getting a full refund like promised, the decided to give me some. I was only there for 10 mins..... sad that cover up artists like this are in business.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't think of anything that wasn't good with my stay here. I'd opted for the harbour view and that was worth the extra. Staff were pleasant and helpful. The hotel has no restaurant but as they said there are plenty of local places to get breakfast. Plus with a fridge and kitchen facilities you could get a few odds and ends to keep in the room. Room was comfortable and fairly large. All round a very pleasant stay and I'd definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. I loved the view of the Harbour Bridge, especially as there were fireworks while I stayed. Hotel is close to restaurants, walking distance to St Vincents Hospital and King Cross Train Station and very handy having a kitchenette.Staff were helpful. There was a small bath under the shower of the room I was in which would be perfect for families but could be an issue for an elderly person having to step up and down from shower. Best to ask when booking if this would be an issue for you.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay ... very convenient. .. 5 minute walk to Kings Cross Station.Numerous place to eat to suit all budgets.Woolworths opposite for convenience.Very friendly, helpful staff.Highly recommend
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our 4 day stay at The Macleay. After traveling all night we were able to get into our room upon arrival. The room was adequate with a kitchenette and the view was super (we had a harbour view). The staff was very accommodating and we were across the street from a restaurant where we had breakfast daily. We were walking distance from many great dinner restaurants and next door to a bank (ATM). The area surrounding was very nice and upscale. I highly recommend The Macleay.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed here many times as it is very close to family. Having a kitchenette is convenient and there are many other dining options close by. The staff are always friendly and helpful. It's also quiet and comfortable.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great place to stay, very central and good in every respect.Convenient to the city and gallaries.The staff friendly and efficient and the view from our room of the harbor was hard to beat. We will definitky stay there again
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's location very close to bus stop and train station. Many good restaurant too and opera house is just in walk distance. It's easy to get everywhere.. staff was very friendly and helpfull... easy to get to airport by shuttle bus.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our expectations were far exceeded. We phoned to ask at 10am if we could drop our bags early as we were on an early flight. Instead of luggage storage we were told we had been upgraded to a harbour view room (beautiful view!) and our room was ready now! Everything was clean and exactly what we needed. Housekeeping spoke to us every morning to see if we would like clean towels or milk etc the ladies were very efficient and had great customer service. All the men on front desk (we met 4 over the weekwnd) were helpful with maps and train timetables etc as it was our first time in Sydney. We really enjoyed our stay and would thoroughly recommend. It was a short walk to the opera house and we used trains just a couple of blocks up at kings cross to get to circular quay and the ferries and also our to Bondi and Coogee beach. They also stores our bags for the day on our departing day so we could continue sightseeing despite checking out. Thanks so much see you next time!
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Only complaint about room is that the shower is small and you had to be careful that the water didn't run over the shower edge on to the main washroom floor. Very clean room. Good location. Few steps to the bus stop.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were nervous about the reviews which we had read about Potts Point, but this hotel is located in a great area and is nice and central. Close to underground station and within walking distance of the botanical gardens, Opera House and Harbour Bridge. The room had everything that you need and there is a supermarket across the road. Try the small deli/bakery next door to the supermarket too. Great sandwiches. There are plenty of great restaurants around. The staff are very friendly and full of great advice on sightseeing. Ask for the key to the roof. There's a beautiful view of the Sydney lights at night, but behave yourself up there!
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very hard to fault this property especially since the room renovation updates over the last year or so. The views for Vivid were an added bonus after long days on the road working. The location is excellent in the heart of everything or close the door and get a decent nights sleep.Staff are usually long term at this property and you will see the same faces time and time again which is important in maintaining good standards at an accommodation property.The room rates for that sort of view elsewhere are often double, however are located in very different neighbourhoods.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a Harbour View room & mentioned at the time of booking that we were coming across to Sydney hoping to see something of the Vivid festival from our room, but - even though we were on the 7th floor - we could not see the Bridge or Opera House (or anything of Vivid for that matter), so quite disappointing in that respect. In fact, we looked out onto a neighbouring building. Perhaps the views are only available from the 2 higher floors and being allocated a room on one of these floors is something of a lottery. That aside, the hotel was fine, albeit with rooms on the small side.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of 4 stayed in a harbour view triple with an extra bed. The view was amazing- harbour bridge and opera house with the added bonus of the 'Vivid Sydney' lights! There were 4 adults so the room was cosy- but the extra bed folded up easily during the day to give more room. The room was basic but clean and comfortable.The small kitchenette was very handy and there is a supermarket across the street. The reception staff were friendly and helpful, providing maps, advice and luggage storage after checkout. The location was perfect for us. The walk to circular quay is less than 30 minutes and very scenic. Kings Cross station is less than 10 mins walk and there are plenty of shops, cafes and restaurants nearby. We would definitely stay at The Macleay again :)
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I did not expect but was assigned with a room with a huge (180 degree) window. Through it I could see two landmark buildings surreally: the Opera House and the Bridge. Definitely the best view!In addition, the hotel is located conveniently, close to restaurants, public transportation, supermarkets, and the Botanic Garden.I would definitely rebook this hotel if I revisit Sydney.
hotelName:
24    Macleay Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, just located between Central and Museum station, very convenience. Clean and tidy room, will recommend my friends to book Veriu Central for their Sydney trip! And the price is reasonable :-)
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel delivers service and style with many quirky extras. Music throughout the hotel, including the lift, sets a really funky vibe. The staff welcome you personally. The rooms are spotlessly clean and very sophisticated.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights and find the room very comfy for one. The room was clean and hot shower was abundant in winter. The room has good amenities like water kettle, coffee machine, and hairdryer too. The WiFi strength was rather weak so it was good for messaging and email but not for watching Netflix or YouTube. Generally, it has a great location to all attractions.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked 3 nights in your hotel for 439$ which is 146$ per night to get : - mosquito in the bathroom and in our towels- one break windows which freeze the room during the night - the power of the shower was poor we had to stayed 30minutes to be clean (we already complained about this and the staff said it’s was normal) - no room service when my partner asked for a toast at 6:30am the staff told him to get out of the hotel and to buy something outside which it’s not acceptable for a « 4 stars hotel »- a full mini bar was expected like its describe on the website (was empty)- no shelves for our bagages - the housekipping didn’t change the bin and left 3 days of towels in the bathroom - only one small lift for an entire hotel of 4 floor.. no words..All this issues are not acceptable for the price we payed. We’re very disappointed of the rate of the hotel. DON’T GO THERE they treat you like a proper tourist and when you ask for a compensation the manager tell you he doesn’t care .... nor words
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: location is great with many eating options around and easy to either walk or get public transport into the city CBD. Would be good value if the rooms were better insulated for sound. Perhaps look elswhere if a quiet sleep is important.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although this accommodation was organised I will return with my partner, due to comfort, location and value. Thankyou keep up the great effort, all staff experienced were lovely and polite, this makes a real difference =)
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pick the place base on the picture, but the room dose not look like the pictures they advertise, the place was quite small the service was not very good, the price is not worth it, but location was not too bad.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel - great location and lobby/ bar. Loved the dumpling house attached but my god this rooms are small. Not only small but there’s nowhere to put anything. No shelves/ drawers/ wardrobes. The double beds are pushed up against the wall in all three rooms I saw so only ok if you are a Solo traveller. And the one lift is tiny and you wait a long time for it with luggage. If you are travelling on your own and travelling light, then this is suitable, otherwise not
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check on the room size before booking - the room we had was really only a one person room - double bed up against the wall - and then a small space to the other wall - it was that small - my feet were a foot off the floor when sitting on the edge of the bed - room size was uncomfortable for 2 people - on the upside the location is great.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at 8am in the morning and were told that our room was ready. However we would have to pay an extra 20 dollars to check into it early. If the room was ready then I would have liked to have thought that the hotel reception would have allowed us to check in without payment especially after a 23 hour flight. I refused to pay and went off to explore Sydney before checking in at 14:00. The hotel was clean and decoration was modern. The bar staff were friendly. However the room was very small and it was quite difficult to manoeuvre especially with two suitcases.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ridiculously small room. No place to put your stuff. Literally nothing for storage. You can hear everything that’s going on in the hallway and outside. No breakfast facilities but a coffee machine. You have to go all the way down to the front desk to use the microwave. The daily cleaning service was poor for the price we paid for the room. The only thing we were satisfied with was the location. Wouldn’t recommend unless there’s a promotion like a half price.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I already stayed at Veriu in Ultimo and I like their concept so I chose Veriu Central because I need to be close to Surry Hills. Nice staff, easy check-in. I like the lobby foyer and the big window on the main road. If rooms were a bit bigger, it would have been fantastic: room space could be big enough but no wardrobe, only a few hangers in a narrow space and the bed occupies most of the even spacious room.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at Veriu was absolutely wonderful. We dare you to find a nice group of customer service staff at a hotel - they were lovely and smiley and did everything they could to help. They also have free still and sparkling water at the front desk which is a really nice touch. The rooms were nice. They were advertised as small, so we expected that when we arrived, but it was nice to see the amount of attention to detail that went into the rooms. You could see how much thought they had put into the rooms in an effort to make use of as much of the room as possible, despite the size (things like making the bed higher so that it can fit suitcases underneath - I've never seen this anywhere, it's such a good idea!). The availability of room service was great too, with a full Deliveroo menu in the room with a selection from a range of close by restaurants. The shower was BEAUTIFUL, and the bed was sooo comfy - we really considered never leaving the room for our entire stay! All in all, a beautiful stay that we really couldn't recommend enough!
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was greeted with a friendly and professional woman and was made welcome. The room was nice and clean. The shower was nice and hot. The bed was very comfortable. The facilities were good. The location was exceptional. There was little noise considering the location of the room and property. Great coffee at their cafe. Nil complaints.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Welcoming staff and nice reception area. Not clear on the website that the gym is not on site. Cramped room. Noise from air conditioning unit outside room meant slightly poorer sleep than I'd expect for price
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room clean and quiet with no street noise and very little building noise. The cafe that provides breakfast did an excellent job. Lounge bar area comfortable and inviting, great place to meet up before going out.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location. Work and a conference was a short walk away. I also easily walked to Darling Harbour and other attractions. Although the bathroom was very compact, my single room was much bigger than expected. Overall a great stay.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great for short business trips. Love the scent of the hotel upon entering the lobby. Front office staff were friendly and very accommodating even if room was not yet ready for occupancy. Check in and check out went very smoothly.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel location was convenient to travel connections, Hotel was close to downtown Sydney and Darling Harbour. Facilities clean and sufficient. Staff were helpful and friendly. Price was competitive. I like the Euro vibe in the foyer lounge.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed my three night stay at the Veriu Central.Pros:Great location near Central Station, lots of restaurants in the area. Within walking distance to Darling Harbour, Sydney Westfield and multi-plex cinema.Cosy, inviting, pleasant lobby that doubles as the bar.Happy hour every night (or maybe just weeknights?) in the lobby bar from 5-7, with select $5 beer and wine.Friendly, helpful staff - both at the front desk and the bar.Complimentary self-serve water in the lobby - both still and sparkling. This is a real deal breaker for me - to have either water available in the lobby, or complimentary bottled water in the room.Modern decor in the rooms and bathrooms - they look recently renovated, with a lovely blue and grey colour scheme.Plenty of power points in the room, including by the bed side table.Chinese restaurant attached to the hotel had a fun decor, delicious dumplings and great service.Basic breakfast available for purchase in the lobby - coffee, pastries, muffins, etc.There was a fridge in the room.Cons:As other reviewers have mentioned - these rooms are tiny! I upgraded to the next room up - and it was still tiny! The tinyness is a bit of a theme - with a tiny bathroom, tiny hallways, tiny elevator...There is only one elevator - so sometimes a few minutes wait.There is no counter space at all in the bathroom - and very little anywhere in the room. There wasn't even enough counter space to leave my toothbrush and toothpaste in the bathroom! There is very little hanging space for clothes - and no suitcase stand.The TV is to the side of the bed, instead of at the foot of the bed - awkward to watch.There was no bedside lamp or light switch next to the bed - so if you're reading in bed, you have to get up and go turn off the light. From the actual rooms, I would have probably given this hotel 3*, but the pleasant lobby bar and the complimentary water in the lobby, plus the friendly staff, have elevated it to 4* for me.They can't change the size of the rooms, but I would suggest that it would be fairly simple to add bedside lamps and a suitcase stand. A bit of counter space in the bathroom would also be nice.The Veriu tends to be one of the more reasonably priced 4* hotels in the CBD. While I really like trying out different hotels, I would be happy to stay here again.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staffs are really nice during check-in & check-out. There is free water at the reception desk. I like the type of the room and they also provide microwave which is really convenience. Overall is good except the noise from the street but it wasn't a problem for me at night. On the other hand, you will be waked up in the morning due the the noise outside.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment you walk through that front door till you depart, you will enjoy this well appointed hotel. Excellent rooms with the most comfortable bed one can experience, this hotel is well positioned in the cbd with many eateries, shops and access to public transport. I highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good value for money. Would stay again, if it was for a business trip! Location is great and if you like Japanese food the restaurant opposite is really good! Had the rooms been abit bigger I would’ve rated higher.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel staff were great. Nice and cozy lobby. Room is small and most of them are not on lift level. Need to go through a small doorway and about 6 flights for steps. Not ideal if you have big and heavy luggage.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel with charming decor and great bathroom amenities (soaps are amazing), friendly staff who are always happy to assist and help, the hotel is in a great location close to everything. Would recommend to anyone who wants to be on the CBD fringe
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There is good location in Sydney. I could walk anywhere, shopping, coffee shop, washing laundry, chains town. I like their music, interior, staff service, coffee was great. Thank you. I will be back soon!
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was given a room which was small than a pigeon hole. I was asked to bring the kettle down for drinking water, seriously - is it a back packer accommodation when they charged me 275$ a night. No space to hang clothes and very little moving space..you literally walk into the toilets getting of the bed. Expensive linen and window screen doesn’t make a place great. Would suggest - Check your room if you’re happy before paying.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
