review_body: The rooms next to the street are super noisy - no soundproofing at all. On top of this, the workmen started trackworks at 3.30 am just under my window so there was no hope of any sleep even with earplugs. I asked the staff why didn't they warn the clients about it (because they knew) and they just said that there would have not been enough room in the other side of the hotel. She offered a cup of coffee as a compensation of my sleepless night. Also - there was only tea in the room, no coffee at all. Very small rooms.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall hotel was good, few minor improvements which should be addressed ie assistance with the bags as well as the hot water issue in the shower. I was a bit surprised that there was no option for room service (meal type) as well
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great and convenient spot to hit up both the town and greater limits of Sydney. Close by to Chinatown as well as Central the hotel is 'centrally' (pun intended) located. The chic little hotel boasts smaller room sizes with character and flair; with the service offering on par with any other 3 star hotel.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little hotel. Nice cosy lobby and bar. The rooms are on the small side but it does mention this, they make up for the small rooms with nice simplistic decor and great location. Great place to stay while Sydney.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not at all like the pictures on the website. Basically its a pub hotel that is trying to be upmarket.Flight of stairs then 2 double doors to get into the shoe box of a room. Never staying here again.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Walking distance to plenty of great places as well as closely located to public transport. The bed was lush and I can’t fault the cleanliness of the room. The lobby is quirky and fun and the staff were friendly and helpful
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One thing I must say, the staff are lovely, friendly and helpful. Hotel room however was VERY small and has next to no storage for clothes and shoes, enough room for suitcases under the bed though. The hotel is probably one of the cheapest in such a good location, therefore you get what you pay for. The bed is tiny without a proper duvet sheet, therefore found that we were sleeping with only the bare duvet and mattress by the end of the night. The room was air conditioned, with a fridge and coffee making facilities, restocked everyday, which was great. WiFi connection is poor and had to use my mobile data most of the time at the hotel. The hotel advertises that it offers Netflix but this does not work as the internet connection is not strong enough. We even had a maintenance guy in our room to connect us to the right network and it still didn’t work after that. I know you don’t go on holiday to watch Netflix but if you have had a full on day exploring, it’s nice to chill and use if the hotel offers it. The shower was good and powerful, but again bathroom was small and there was mould on the sealing above the shower. Complementary wash products were available too. Overall great stay in Sydney and the hotel served its purpose and great location with friendly staff. Just wish room was bigger, proper sheets on the bed and wish the WiFi was better for phones and Netflix.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In my stay there was mould everywhere in the main room and bathroom, the room itself was tiny lacking any kind of amenities beyond a coffee maker and safe of all things (no sink, bin, etc.) stuck in a wardrobe which had the door ripped off. There were stains and chipping paint all over the walls, there was a chunk missing from the bottom of the bathroom door as well as from one of the windows and the only positive was getting out was easy because it's in the middle of the city.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, lovely staff, fab location and a really cool space for a short or longterm stay... I would recommend highly..Paul is exceptional as are all the reception teams.. Really well appointed and chic.. Very cool for Sydney and reasonably priced .
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here the day I landed in Sydney after coming from Ireland and it was just what I needed. Friendly staff, quiet room and most importantly, a super comfy bed. Would stay again and recommend for the sleep deprived traveller.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If carrying heavy luggage, it will be difficult to move a few steps upward or downward before reaching the lift. The room is too compact without a chair and table to write or read. However, the location is convenient.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Veriu hotel is not only well located but also it has a very friendly staff. I arrived around 10am and I didn't have to wait to have my room (I really appreciate this). Although the room is a bit small, for one person (that was my case) I think is enough. Also found the room really cozy. I'd definitely stay again in this hotel.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overnight stay in a king room. We were dining at Nel (nextdoor) so thought it would be a convenient option. As expected smallish room however quite clean and comfortable overall. Basic tv channels with the option of Netflix 
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was small but bed and pillows were excellent . Centrally located. They have great coffee shop at the lobby, its its get busy , all those Business travellers staying there for the whole day. Will definitely come back.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Close to Central station and Chinatown area.Room I had was small and so was the toilet area.Really excellent mattress and pillows.I was allowed check in at 2pm.Modern lounge and my room smell really nice and fresh.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Prior arrival, I was provided exceptional customer service on the phone and the staffs are really patient and nice, and upon arrival, had a quick and smooth check in. The ground floor bar, restaurant looks nice and cozy, although we didnt try it, but bascially look the same as the pics promoted. Room is tidy and clean, bed is quite comfortable to sleep in. Would be really suitable for young couples, backpackers, friends
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The interior rooms are rather claustrophobic. There should be a notice upon booking about the type of room you are about to book. No option for breakfast. Rooms rather small. They were clean but the hotel has a rather old and dirty look.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Despite busy location very quiet peaceful sleep. Comfortable queen bed but not much room around it.Very small rooms not sure where luggage would go if you had more than one bag per couple. Perhaps luggage storage? Very good location.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is right in the center of Sydney close to the train station with quiet, but small rooms. The area is close to restaurants and theaters. Whilst there are two busy roads either side the rooms were quiet and afforded a good night's sleep.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small room, no view, but we weren't there for that. Room was clean and tidy, comfortable and it gave us somewhere to shower and sleep. It was central to the parts of Sydney we were interested in, parking was expensive.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a frequent traveler, I am always on the lookout for a unique place which offers something different. I believe Veriu provides that in abundance. This was one of the few places that I have stayed that seemed that it had character. I could be coming back from a long and tiring day at work and stepping in the hotel would lift my mood and spirit. Love the little area downstairs. Although I did not make use of it as much as possible, it is an excellent idea. It is close to central train station and bus stops which take you directly into the city. Even the Kebab shop across the road was quite good. Would love to book again and stay at this wonderful location.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is centrally located, walking distance to main metro stations, to surry hills, to oxford street, darlinghurst and even to CBD.The lobby/reception area is lovely, as you can chill, have a coffee or a drink in the trendy bar.Rooms are a bit small, yet very well equipped and with a great design, "you don't need anything more"
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in a great location making walking or trains easy to explore Sydney. We loved our stay and agree with others that the staff are very helpful and friendly. Our room was small, but with access to storage under the beds we could hide our suitcases. We also rolled the bed away from the wall at night to allow access from both sides. Lobby space was great when a downpour limited our adventures for the day. There were comfortable seats and cubes for charging devices and the cookies are also great and free water service was a plus.Breakfast at Basket Brothers was wonderful.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 4 nights, employees are very nice and helpful. Room service is ok even though you never know what to expect (new clean towels on the first towo nights and then nothing on the last two ones...?). Location is perfect and great bar/ great choice of drinks. Perfect for a short stay in Sydney. The bad thing would just be the fact that there is no parking (or there is one but 35$ a night is just too expensive I’m afraid!). Pretty good overall.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is ideally located, close to Sydney Central Station and close to Darling Harbour, Opera House and other attractions, very comfortable, if somewhat small rooms. Nice cozy bar area to sit and have a drink or coffee, would definitely consider it again.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful breakfast with a lot of option to choose. Room was clean and size was okay. Free coffee was wonderful after long day. Free water at reception desk. I loved decor of this hotel. WIFI was speed. Thank you so much for wonderful stay.
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had the most amazing time. I was looked after from the moment I checked in. I was treated like a local and set up shop at the bar where I was treated to lovely coffees ,cocktails and juices. Ask for Marc and get a hilarious conversation the bar is open 24/7 so if you can't sleep there's ALWAYS someone to talk to. Loved it! ❤️
hotelName:
25    Veriu Central
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a charming little hotel in historic inner city Surry Hills, about a half hour walk from the central CBD area.The building itself is a former convent which has been tastefully renovated with loving attention to detail. The design aesthetic is kind of contemporary art deco and it's all very attractive.Our room, a King Master, was a reasonable size, cosy, well-appointed and comfortable. The marble bathroom was lovely, with a great rainfall shower and fragrant Molton Brown toiletries. There was absolutely no street noise, which allowed for a good night's sleep. Always a bonus!Hotel rates include a very good continental breakfast: juice, muesli, granola, yoghurt, fresh berries etc. Another great feature which we made use of was the honesty bar, which has a decent selection of spirits, wines, beers and snacks.Overall, staff were pleasant and helpful, the room was lovely, and the public areas comfortable and appealing. I would certainly recommend staying at the Little Albion.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Another "Mr & Mrs Smith" listing delivers again!!. Stand-out staff who were a lovely team with loads of customer service skills: genuinely welcoming & friendly, helpful, oodles of common sense, intelligent!.The open bar / snack bar / sweetie shop / trendy café design had great drinks, excellent tea, quality coffee, best brand snacks, cool design, huge variety, very inviting, trendy and innovative. We enjoyed catching up with guests in the hotel rather than going out in the cold - it was if you were in a lounge / Babington house club.Interiors throughout were great, smart design and everything considered. Rooms might be thought of as on the small side but the great design made it feel spacious. We had loft 404, and it was very comfortable. Great location city wise, parking down the street. We rarely return to the same hotel, however we would definitely be happy to return to The Little Albion. The entire stay was fabulous.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this stylish guesthouse, the attention to detail is amazing. Comfortable beds, very friendly welcoming staff, beautifully furnished rooms! Love the honesty mini bar, the breakfast was delicious, would most definitely recommend to friends and family (in fact already have) we’ll be back :)
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Little Albion is a rarity in Sydney, so different from the big, impersonal hotels. First big plus is that it's so close to Central station, in the swanky suburb of Surry Hills that is known for its cafes and restaurants (and also a colorful past, as the artwork in this hotel will tell you). Secondly, the warm and helpful staff that will make you settle in quite easily. And third, of course, is the design of this hotel, which has that minimalist chic feel.The room does a great job in making me feel "ensconced" - the size is not that large, but beautifully designed and furnished. It has an open plan, though, so it's more suited to couples rather than workmates. I particularly loved the bath and the Molton Brown amenities. A simple breakfast is served on the ground floor, where there's also the self-serve "minibar" with premium snacks and drinks. Tried the excellent pre-mixed cocktail ("imported" from The Everleigh, no less). There's no restaurant in this hotel, but the staff will help you to order food from nearby eateries if you want to dine in. However, it's also worth exploring the area yourself as Surry Hills is home to some of Sydney's best food experiences.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic stay at this superb boutique hotel. Well appointed rooms, helpful staff and excellent facilities. Our dog Benny thoroughly enjoyed the neighbourhood too. Breakfast included, which was basic but more than adequate. The ‘honour bar’ is a fabulous idea with the pleasure of taking your drinks to enjoy at the rooftop garden. Perfect sundown experience.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We traveled from the US and as usual landed in Sydney early. Upon our arrival at Little Albion the staff were very accommodating offering us coffee, baked goods, yogurt and more coffee (which was excellent). They allowed us to stash our luggage until the rooms were ready. So we took a walk around the neighborhood. It was very safe. In fact all of Sydney was very safe to walk around. Our rooms were very well equipped, clean, good beds and we were lucky enough to a have a good view. There is also a rooftop sitting area as well as a small courtyard. If we were to return we would stay here again.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sydney is a city full of impersonal, overpriced hotels. The Little Albion is the opposite -- the cheerful and genuinely helpful concierge/front desk staff welcomed me by showing me the honesty bar and how the hotel works -- and then brought up a bottle of fresh milk to the room for tea and coffee. It really reminded me of the Firmdale hotels in London which are so welcoming and hospitable. Being able to fix youself a drink and a snack at the end of the day in a comfortable lounge just takes the edge off the big-city business travel marathon. I had an entry-level room and it was delightful. Restrained furnishings and just enough colour to make it welcoming. The top-end toiletries, tea, coffee and cookies are a lovely touch. Location is strolling distance from the CBD and there are plenty of good cafes close by. I had an excellent Japanese meal at Gogyo, a block away, which styles itself as Hakata ramen, but has delicious Japanese side dishes as well.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel itself was quite nice and not unreasonably priced for the location ($185). There was construction (jack hammers, drills, banging, chainsaws) until late in the night. A brick wall right outside my room amplified the sound. The windows were not close to soundproof - there was a significant gap at the bottom. Mosquitoes came through these for a large part of the night too. Overall, not a pleasant night’s stay.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We tried little Albion for a staycation and were very disappointed. This is not a hotel but more a b&b (without the great breakfast) our room was bitterly disappointing at $450 for the night! Seriously?!?We asked if we could be moved but we’re yold not possible. The bar wasn’t really a bar. The breakfast was just croissant and a juice and their room service menu is UBER eats! Anyone can have UBER eats anytime. What’s the point of going to a hotel for that? Overall, this place is a con. Expensive room with minimal service and no facilities. Hospitality at its worst. Would NEVER consider staying there again.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful Art Deco style boutique hotel.The bathroom has stylish gold tap wear and marble tiles. Jewel toned luxe side chairs.King size beds with 4 big fluffy pillows.USB power outlets.Complimentary breakfast! The almond croissants were moorish.Free coffee! Rooftop access with a pretty view of the city.This hotel is walking distance to restaurants, bars, transport and the neighbourhood is pretty. Such a nice place to stay in Sydney.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here a few nights in Sydney before moving to the Hyatt Regency in CBD, have to say the little Albion is far superior. We were kindly upgraded upon check in which was very nice & I was very grateful as I believe the original room I booked (crashpad) would have been too small and I had considered upgrading myself anyway. The staff were all very friendly and had a great laid back, unpretentious attitude, much more welcoming I think. The bed was also super comfy! Wish I had taken down the details of the mattress and pillows. slept like a baby! We also loved the option of having Uber eats delivered, as the hotel didn’t have an i house kitchen I believe. We did this one night and ate on the rooftop, was lovely! Also a great location very close to lots of places to eat / drink and very near to central station, a massive plus.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This boutique hotel really is one of Sydney’s hidden gems. Staying here felt like I was in a Wes Anderson film. Lovely front of house staff, charming decor and comfortable and well appointed rooms. A lot of effort has been put in to this hotel and it shows. Thanks for a memorable stay !
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 4 nights at this wonderful small boutique hotel. It was MARVELLOUS. From the time we entered the lobby till the time we checked out it was gracious and welcoming. The room was wonderful. Bed was super comfortable (we took a photo of the brand to buy one at home!) and spotlessly clean. Breakfast and facilities were outstanding also. Couldn’t recommend highly enough.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can’t overstate how lovely it was to stay at Little Albion. The staff were so friendly and welcoming, the room was beautiful, and the location is to die for. Highly recommend taking a bottle of wine up to the roof for some evening drinks. I’ll definitely be coming back.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tucked away in a little side road this 'guest house' is perfect! It certainly ticks all the boxes: friendly, helpful staff, great albeit simple breakfasts, convenient location etc. Full of lovely touches - a 24 hour coffee and tea station, a honesty bar, fresh fruit, roof terrace, bottled water in the fridge, quality toiletries. Rooms are quite small but perfectly formed!
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m not into big commercial hotels, I only like beautiful boutique hotels and the Little Albion was perfect. The staff were overly helpful and gave 100% at all times. The hotel interior and rooms are beautiful, the little Molton Brown toiletries and small (but very sufficient) added breakfast gave it that extra touch (muesli, toast, spreads, croissants and fruit). Be sure to sit on the rooftop at some stage during your stay it’s very relaxing. Highly recommend!
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We choose the biggest room as we were there for a week. It was lovely! Spotless, staff fabulous, accommodating, respectful and on it! Room has all the upscale details we love from massive soaking tub to killer party shower. Area is fabulous too - great walking to fabulous restaurants like Nomad, Billy's, Reuben Coffee House (the hotel has free breakfast, but we did discover the grilled poached pears on rye with ricotta at Reuben and that kind of took over). Easy uber to anywhere. Easy walk to downtown shopping, fun shops on Crowne. We had never been to Sydney before so glad we stumbled upon this gem on TripAdvisor. Not one negative thing to say. Gold star. And we're fussy! (There is an honor bar in the lobby - no mini bar in room but was a fridge, no loss.)
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This boutique hotel is a good find in the heart of surrey hills. With a beautiful feel and an edgy design. It’s the baby brother of the QT. It’s also dog friendly which was a good plus to us. Sure to be our regular when we return to Sydney.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such an amazing hidden Gem! I love finding little boutique hotels to stay at when traveliing for work. This place ticked all my boxes. Location - amazing, walking distance to great food, coffee, wine or even clubsService - The reason i love boutique places is that i feel the service is always so much more personal, i got to know a few of the staff during my stay and they all consistently impressedStyle - Gorgeous rooms, cosy but perfectly fine, styling was beautiful and you can tell someone has put a lit of effort into the overall look and feel. The finishes are amazing and a very high quality.Facilities - All inclusive for a business trip, reception lounge area was great for relaxing and the rooftop and cafe area are great.Overall it would have to be one of the best experiences I have had on a business trip in Sydney and will 100% be staying again. Thanks heaps to all the staff :)
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic location, lovely rooms and staff, highly recommend. A great boutique hotel, will definitely stay here again. Nestled in amongst the top cafes and restaurants of Surry Hills, great price point too
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We needed to be close by in Surry Hills, so tried this very good boutique hotel. We loved the ambiance, decor, photographs, design, breakfast room and the service. Expensive due to the location, but good.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Now its very rare that i use names in my reviews as i generally don't get introduced to who i'm dealing with in most hotels that is unless i can read the small name badges usually adorning staff.Let me introduce you to Wendy and her team.The Albion brings back proper old world respectful service instead of the starchy performances given by more upmarket and exclusive hotels of Sydney. We were genuinely greeted like old friends and felt at home straight away.The Little Albion has all you want as a couple and goes the extra level if your looking for a romantic break in the middle of Sydney but want to feel special as if you were the only people there.The room was amazing, modern, warm, and romantic.Ivan greeted us at the door and checked us in. Now this was one of those rare moments that rise this establishment head over heels above all other hotels. A staff member that truly provides that personal touch to make you feel special and welcomed without the scripted bland greeting you get elsewhere.That's not saying that the other staff were not upto Ivans level. I apologise for not getting the other staff member names and throwing in a mention here but the lady at check in and the gentleman at breakfast were excellent.Well done one and all and keep up the good work and you will be number one on my list for a CDB booking from now on. I have a funny feeling though as you get your name out there more and more it will be difficult to find a spare room.Lastly the price. Well all you lovely folk who love to splash your hard earned money on the upmarket hotels nearby go right ahead, but i'm liking been treated like a king without the price-tag so i will be back.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of 3 spent a lovely weekend at Little Albion Guest House. This is a beautiful relaxing spot in the heart of Surry Hills which is magnificent weekend retreat or a super handy spot to stay if you are working locally.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Professional, friendly service. Wendy was very welcoming and couldn't do enough for usl. Rooms are small (as advertised) but are beautifully furnished, clean and the attention to detail was top rate. Lovely continental breakfast with "real" espresso coffee, fresh croissants and locally sourced jams.On top of all of this, the location is perfect. Will be back and highly recommend.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Little Albion Guest house is a refreshing delight with the most beautiful detailed design. Unable to fault this comfortable, detail orientated accommodation. Truly wonderful comfort in the linen, towels, amazing breakfast offering unique quality tastes and such a warm welcoming from Wendy. We enjoyed the rooftop that overlooks the roof tops of Surry Hills, a walk to dinner were fine food is easy to find and a relax in the communal areas where glass surrounds and the sun shines in. A true relax was had in our king bed with a swivel tv and well thought out lighting. Really excellent, we will be back.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gorgeous design and what I loved most were the little touches of luxury like the extra large and lush bath mat, molton brown toilettries, rustic mugs for tea and coffee and the artwork around the building - love the individually designed curtains and upholstery and really comfortable bed. Breakfast was a cute offering and felt like a home away from home - guest house means what it says with Wendy as the host - you feel like a long lost friend insider her home, but the best thing here is you have someone to clean up after you :) Great team and nothing was too difficult - Thanks for a wonderful stay and hope to come again soon - would for sure recommend to people wanting an authentic local Sydney experience without the tourists all around...amazing local restaurants nearby and it feels like a very cultured neighbourhood!
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Little Albion Guesthouse was the perfect place for our Sydney getaway. Tucked away from what is the hustle and bustle of Surry Hills yet so close to everything. (Crown Street and Central Station less than a 5 min walk) Driving we assumed parking would be a nightmare and very costly, however, Little Albion offers discounted overnight parking at the Rydges which is close by. We found amble on street ticketed parking for the night for around $12.From the moment we arrived we felt at home. The entire guesthouse was beautifully designed, and the hosts very attentive.Our stay began with a lovely cup of tea in the sunken lounge and once we were ready we were shown to our room (206). Along the way our host explained the Honour Bar, Rooftop and Lite breakfast offering - more on this later. Upon entering our room we were asked for our milk preference options were Full Cream, Lite, Soy or Almond which was promptly brought to our room. This was just one of the small touches that made the stay. We also loved the Molton Brown amenities, luxurious robes and wonderful large pillows.Before heading out for dinner we enjoyed a few drinks in the well stocked and reasonably priced Honour Bar - the cocktail station was a great addition! While we already had plans for breakfast and didn't get a chance to enjoy the Lite Breakfast it looked incredible, especially the housemade muesli and selection of breads we will certainly try on our next visit.Thank you to all the hosts at Little Albion for making our stay a memorable one, we cannot wait to visit again.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s just like walking into your dream city house. So cool that you can book the whole place on Airbnb. Loved the lift and the view from the roof. I had a classic room with a nice reading ledge against the window.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Little Albion and had such a great stay. It's hidden on Little Albion Street and then you enter an amazing building with lots of history and the interiors are very modern and new. Service is so friendly and personal, they even bring your choice of milk to your room! Seeing as I drink soy, that was a good touch that you don't get at most hotels. The room was spacious enough to relax in, beds very comfortable and great shower. Honour bar with an honesty system, good idea and felt at home having a drink before going out for dinner. Definitely a place I will recommend to anyone for a quiet luxurious getaway so near the city and hidden in the midst of where locals like to hang out.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had the pleasure of staying at this boutique hotel last night. Situated in the centre of the restaurant area of Surry Hills.... we went to a function down the street and decided to stay the evening as we would have a few drinks. Was extremely surprised that the property was new and very quant. The beds were so comfy with my favourite big pillows. The breakfast was super good ... loved the homemade muesli and the beautiful array of artisan breads and coffee. Being central to the city and the sporting area ... found it a convenient location. The staff were amazingly friendly and so accommodating.... would stay again. Thank you all for making it a memorable short visit
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for their opening night and wow what a first night. Extremely friendly team of hosts, whole guest house is well appointed with custom made furnishings and artwork. Great selection in their Honour Bar, one of the best hotel bathrooms I’ve stayed in including Molton Brown toiletries. Bed was fantastic too as was the lite breakfast selection. Would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great spot to enjoy Surry Hills and it's surroundings. It has a real boutique hotel feeling about it with great design, hosts calling you by your name and giving advices on what to do. The bed was amazing! Will come back!
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent a night in this charming property. Very conveniently located just a short walk from Central Station.Every thing about the room was beautiful, and the bedding and towels were so comfy. The bath had a stargazing window which let me see the lights of the city as I relaxed. I will defiantly be coming back next time I am in Sydney.
hotelName:
26    Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Bouti...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely little boutique style hotel! No on site parking, which was difficult when we had so many bags, but was cheaper overnight parking available via the hotel in a secure undercover car park which we where great full for as there was a terrible hailstone storm the evening we where in Sydney!  Also no lift and lugging our bags up 3 flights was super hard! But that was my own fault for not checking!The rooms however where super spacious and comfortable; despite a leak in our room the hotel where super accommodating and moved us promptly to another room! Perfect for what we needed bar the lack of a lift and good value for money!
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for four nights before embarking on cruise. Hotel is small and there is no elevator. Rooms are as small as a cruise cabin. It is clean. Great pillows. The housekeeping is excellent places to eat are literally at the hotel front door.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A little gem right in the heart of Potts Point and perfect for the stay we required. Tastefully decorated and great value for money. No parking so take a train to Kings Cross and meander down the famous streets and it is very close to the Macleay St Bistro
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I already mentioned previously about your little gift packs. I thought they were a cute touch particularly for overseas travellers. People don't expect gifts for nothing no matter how small. You seem to have stopped them.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A charming, fresh small hotel in an ideal location. We spent two days at the Art Gallery of New South Wales, only a 20 minute stroll away. We ate dinner at the Fish Shop opposite the hotel and were spoiled for choice for breakfast.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A quick trip to Sydney. Location was central to where we had to be. Also plenty of places to eat, drink and enjoy. Lovely park close by with a market on Sunday. Easy to get around. Would stay here again.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A good sized room with all the requirements. Window you can open!!! Looks gorgeous and I felt really at home. Comfortable bed. For those who don't like stairs, FYI there is no lift. The bathroom is very small. No problem for me, but perhaps also something to consider.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had to take my luggage up the stairs, two flights of steep, narrow stairs, as there is no lift and there is no staff to assist.The bathroom smelt musty and mouldy. It only had a tiny shelf to put things on and if you needed to get rid of toothpaste in your mouth you had to be careful when lifting your head not to knock your head.There is no wardrobe available, so I was ended up not unpacking anything for 3 days I was there.I returned to my room on the Saturday night (about 10pm after a full day at work from 7.00am when I left the room) to find that the housekeeping staff hadn't bothered to replenish coffee supplies so I had one sachet of coffee for the next day, and if I hadn't left a note I'm certain there would have been none when I returned the next night. Unfortunately there is more than 2 times the amount of tea to coffee (max 3 sachets). I could not ring down to request more as the office is closed and there is no way of contacting anyone (unless you want to go downstairs in your night clothes to find the contact number at the booking desk area (which I was not prepared to do at now 11pm).I feel that they should have a register in each room of where guests can call someone at night, also that there should be staff to assist guests with their luggage.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Already done review for an earlier stay in your hotel. Location is quite nice and lots of cafes, eateries, convenience stores, supermarkets, etc., close by. Nice, safe environment and a nearby Police Station.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location staff went out of there way to help us with anything.Walking distance to Botanical gardens and Opera house.Heaps of different restaurants to pick from all walking distance.Woolworths shopping centre 2min walk.Plus laundry services also close
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Magnolia Room at the Maisonette offers travellers a relaxing room to stay at very reasonable rates. The Hotel is well located to restaurants and casual delis / cafes nearby. The room decor is stylish, retro chic, offering all a traveller needs.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had 3 days to spend in Sydney after a cruise and discovered that the Maisonette was perfect for our needs. We wanted to have the budget value and hotel feel and we found it here. It was just like our stateroom on the cruise ship but with lots of windows with shutters instead of our veranda. The same sort of space and facilities (compact but very clean). The location was perfect for us with a walk to the Botanic Gardens and to Kings Cross station for all else. We hope to return soon!
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great. It's cheaper than most other offerings in Sydney but not having an elevator reduces what you can charge. It's very much a budget hotel where the 'desk' is not staffed all the time and you're dealing with the receptionist behind a glassed enclosure (a bit like being at Customs). The rooms are tired and ours smelt bad. If you're going to be out the whole time then this is not a bad option.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent value for money, with basic but comfortable facilities in an amazing location. There is no lift, so be prepared to carry your luggage up the very narrow staircase! The reception closes at night, but they can arrange a late check-in if necessary. Always very polite staff.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel is great value for Sydney. It in a great location with a fantastic cafe across the road and surrounded by good albeit not cheap restaurants. It is close to wooloomaloo and a lovely walk from the opera house, Art Gallery and circular quay. It is compact, comfortable and clean for a short stay for 1 or 2 people.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In Potts Point. This was the second time I have stayed at the Maisonette over the past number of years. It is an older but renovated hotel located in the heart of Potts Point, a 10-15 minute walk from King’s Cross station. There is everything you need in the neighborhood including supermarkets, banks, restaurants etc. The hotel is located on a very nice tree lined street and on the quiet side vs being directly on Darlinghurst Avenue. The hotel has no elevator. I was traveling solo but still booked a triple room because it was the same price as a double. It would have been tight for 3 people. All the beds were twin and very comfortable. Furnishings were fine and very pleasant. Bath was average and a bit small. Staff was very nice and since my international flight arrived early in the morning, they arranged to have my room cleaned up earlier than 1400 which was very much appreciated! All in all the Maisonette is a comfortable 3 star hotel and good value and would stay there again.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our friend had booked this hotel for 4 nights. It was different from any hotel I have every stayed at. I liked the single beds and there was 3 of everything. The bathroom was very small without counter space for 3 people. I would also say it’s mildly noisy, but it is so close to restaurants, grocery stores, and there’s a convenience store right on the corner. There’s a blow dryer, kettle, and a fridge which is nice. I didn’t love the bed, but everyone has different comfort levels. All staff we encountered were very friendly. There is also no elevator and you’ll have to do at least one flight with your luggage. Decor was super cute!
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gorgeous little hotel, in a prime position in Potts Point, Sydney. Im in a gorgeous little clean single room, shared bathroom, perfect for stopovers, central to everything. Great customer service, everything you need in walking distance. Walk to the end of challis street and across the road for a view of centrepoint, harbour bridge and navy ships (if you like ships).
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location with loads of great amenities near by. Rooms are great but shared bathrooms could use a little face lift. Staff were super friendly and helpful and the hotel also has baggage storage after check out.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So my favorite color is blue...and the decoration with color and objects here exactly answer my taste. Though the drawbacks are a 10 minute-walk from station and no elevator. Other things are awesome..It's not far from both airport and the city center.You got plenty of supermarkets and places to eat. The street is alive both day and night...so it's really safe. A king room is very cozy and I was happy even listening to music in my room. The place is kinda good mixture of old fashioned style with modern taste.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I think they should work on the cleanliness of their rooms. My was dusty a little bit, fridge wasn't as clean as I would have liked it, the towel was placed on a shelf on a blanked. I did not like that since I do not know how long that blanked was on that shelf. I believe it's much better to leave clean towels on a clean bed sheetsHowever, if you are looking for a cheap room just to sleep in, it's just ok. The location is very good. It takes you around 20-30 min of nice walk through botanical gardens to get to the Opera house.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was OK. Slightly noisy in the morning (there is cafe very close).The coffee and cream was not made up during my stay. Location is veruy good - it is close to Kings Cross station. The room was clean.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love staying at the Maisonette, the room is beautiful, the location perfect, quiet, but handy to everything Sydney has to offer and the staff are lovely. It does not have a fancy restaurant, gym or pool, but what it does have is a real family feeling, where you feel appreciated and looked after, which I feel is more valuable. It's a home from home.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The maisonette is adorably cute! If like me you're at the age where you don't want to share a room with strangers but don't want to pay massive amounts for a private room then the maisonette is perfect! The room was clean and comfy, although if you are taller than average you may not fit in the bed however for average height me it was perfect. The staff friendly and helpful. The location was great, just out of Kings Cross but close enough to walk and then leave it all behind. The whole experience of staying there was fantastic!
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at The Maisonette for almost a week. The staff was friendly and for the most part, very helpful. They require that you pay for the entire stay upon check in....I won't do that again until I make sure that the room was acceptable. I had reserved a "Magnolia Room" which is more expensive but is advertised to have an updated bathroom. Upon check in I was given a room with a bath that clearly had not been updated, had only a shower curtain, and pipes that leaked when the water was turned on in the sink. I went down to the reception area and the lady very politely told me that the room was indeed a "Magnolia Room". She said that since I had requested a "quiet room" that they gave me this room. I showed her my confirmation for the "Magnolia Room", pictures on their website, and my correspondence with the hotel prior to my arrival. She said that they could move us to a different room, but we would have to pay extra for housekeeping to move the twin beds back in to a king configuration in the old room. Mind you, we had only been in the room all of about ten minutes maximum when I went down to talk to her. I advised her that that was completely unacceptable and that we wanted the room type that I had reserved. She finally said that she would look in to it and let us know later. My friend and I went sightseeing and later received an email that they would let us move and did not charge us for extra housekeeping. The new room was much larger, did have the updated bathroom, and looked out upon Challis Avenue.The room and bathroom seemed to be very clean. However, towards the end of our stay, we started noticing roaches in the bathroom. Since reception is open only certain hours and we left very early in the morning for a day trip to the Blue Mountains, I emailed the hotel and told them about the roaches. They responded once they opened up reception, apologized, and left some roach spray. We got back to the hotel that evening (again, after reception closed) and sprayed the roach spray. The next morning, I once again saw a couple of roaches in the bathroom (apparently they were coming out from under the door frame). The location is pretty good (about a 10 minute walk to King's Cross Station and close to a Woolworth's grocery store and restaurants) and the price was good. The wifi worked well in our second room. It was nice having a small refrigerator for drinks. But, after the experience that we had, I would not stay at this hotel again if I ever go back to Sydney.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was good value for location. The bathroom could've done with a shower screen. It was homey yet uncomfortable, perhaps due to strange, unsettling wall art and bathroom quirks. The room was a bit dated but a bit contemporary, might be more suited for a hipster.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upon arriving in the room, I noticed it was uncomfortably stuffy and warm. I asked if I could adjust the temperature of the room and was told this is not allowed since it would affect the temperature in other rooms. That night I was so uncomfortable that I only slept three hours.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel in a very pleasant neighbourhood, good facilities, water and snacks on arrival were a nice touch, as well as the information provided about the area and the adaptor which was readily available.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would recommend to anybody and would come back here without a doubt. Location is impressively good, all surround by nice restaurants in a superb vibe. Rooms are small but have all what is needed and with excellent taste. Excellent value for the price paid. we were so happy to have stayed here.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice neighbourhood within walking distance of Circular Quay. No elevator. Small room with very small bathroom. Friendly staff. Several small restaurants nearby but we found them expensive. Nice little seaside park a short walk away.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Simple clean and good value. In a good location relative to opera house with loads of good eating places. Also handy for the big bus tour which has a stop close by. The staff are helpful and friendly.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in Potts Point and about 10 minutes walk from Kings Cross station. The hotel is excellent value for money in this area. The staff are very helpful and there are cafes next door and Woolworths up the road. Also very quiet area - so a great night's sleep!
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is situated in such a lovely street of Potts Point. The rooms are clean and have just what you need for a night away from home. I didn’t hear a thing all night - it was very quiet, no street noise.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Budget accommodation close to the central hub. Clean and tidy and within walking distance to all Central Business District facilities and all Sydney has to offer. Close to public transport and offers an airport shuttle facility
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small but very clean and cozy room. Easy to walk to city center. Very near of everything.Good cafeteria just next to hotel. Food store was very near as well.If you get noisy neighbours, it could be broblem. Street was very quiet thow.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenient location, clean, and efficient staff. Close to the action.! We were there for rugby 7’s and it’s walking distance to the Allianz stadium with great coffee shops on route. Easy walking distance to the harbour too
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a TINY boutique hotel in downtown Sydney, very close to many major attractions. It is VERY tiny. It is squeezed in between a couple of restaurants on a seemingly quiet street, and if you're not careful, you'll miss the front door. The lobby is so small, there is room for one chair. The front desk is not staffed 24/7, which could be an issue for some. We had a room that had 2 twin beds, which is what I requested, as I was traveling with my son. There was no closet in the room, only a very small open shelving unit with a hanging bar. The bathroom was so small. No counter space, just a sink attached to the wall. There was no tub or even a shower stall. Just a shower head on one side of the bathroom with a drain in the floor, and a shower curtain separating the shower from the toilet. Needless to say, the ENTIRE bathroom got wet when you showered! The room had one towel per person, and when I asked for an additional towel, I was told there would be a charge for that! There was no tissue paper (Kleenex), only toilet paper. The TV was hung high on the wall, at an awkward angle. There were 2 windows, but no view--looked out on another building a few feet away. There was a fair amount of noise early in the morning from the restaurant next door as well. Lastly, no elevator. We were on the second floor, so had to lug our stuff up 2 flights of narrow marble stairs. This is probably not a great place for families--too small and nothing to keep kids occupied. There is no food service at this hotel, but we did have pizza delivered on night! The location, however, is great. It is within walking distance of the Opera House and Botanic Gardens, and the Harbor. Burt far enough away from the noise & traffic to make you feel as though you are away from it all a bit.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is in a good location in Potts Point, close to Kings Cross Station. We were able to walk to a lot of good eating places for breakfast and evening meals. The Hotel was quaint, tidy and a comfortable place to stay. We are a family of six and we had two rooms to accommodate us all. The area had a good vibe. Thought it may have been noisy with eating place below but this was not the case at all. Unfortunately it did not have a lift for luggage or a place to leave your luggage.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love the location and atmosphere . Rooms are small but cosy and comfortable, excellent natural light, we stayed in the magnolia room which overlooked Challis Ave, can be noisy but not uncomfortable, bearing in mind the hotel is in a restaurant and cafe locale. plenty of food choice and a supermarket close by, also easy to walk into the city through the magnificent Botanical Gardens, and also to Circular Quay. Bus and train close by, we are return stayers and would come back again for convenience and the atmosphere of the Potts Point community.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Service and housekeeping both shocking. Reception was unattended when I arrived approx midday, and I was kept waiting close to 15 minutes, until a staff member appeared to check me in. On top of that the staff member was extremely rude to me, when I asked if there was anybody that could assist with my luggage. She was under the impression that it is illegal for Hotel staff to assist guests with their luggage, and if she had helped, me said told me that she would be fired. The housekeeping was sloppy at best, and my room was never vacuumed during my week long stay at the Maisonette
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a decent place to stay and offers rooms at a price that is competitive with other accommodations in that part of Sydney. It is near the Sydney CBD area. Also near are the Royal Botanic Gardens of Sydney and the Opera house. Nice place for walkers, runners. There is a shared bathroom that is clean.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in a single room. It was spacious and had a small fridge, desk, air conditioner and a sink which made this easier as I shared the bathroom with a few other people. On the other side the room was very dark and although it was cleaned every they I did saw a few cochroaches around in both the room and the bathroom. The location is perfect as it is very close to a super market and in order to get to the city centre you cross the botanical gardens. Overall for a Hotel y Sydeny price is decent if you are travelling by yourself.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Potts Point is a great place to stay. Comfortable hotel, great location. As I said, the staff is superb. The lack of an elevator was somewhat of a problem. I walk with a cane. Stairs are narrow and steep. Required three trips to move luggage.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and comfortable with a neatly packaged snack as a welcome gift. Great location. But a loud American taking calls in the foyer at 5AM woke me and no doubt other guests. No good nights sleep for me.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The website of The Maisonette promised a nice location with good rooms. The reality was disappointing. We we got a small room without possibilities (table, chair) to leave our things. The floor of the bathroom became completely wet after each shower. Positive was that the air conditioning was good and silent.Also the communication was disappointing. When we asked the lady at the desk for an extra chair we were snarled that they couldn't do anything for us because the hotel was full.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was small but very clean and comfortable, with a shared bathroom/shower. There was some noise from the restaurant downstairs, but I sleep with earplugs and it did not bother me. In a pleasant residential neighborhood with many cafes, shops, etc. 10 minute walk to train and 20-30 minute walk to Botanical Gardens, Opera House, Central Sydney area. A great option if you want cheaper lodging but more privacy/cleanliness than a hostel.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay as always. Clean and comfortable room. Great that there is a sink to use now as well as some guest soaps. Would recommend staying there to anyone for price and location. Can't beat it. Great
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although the location is superb for Potts Point cafes, restaurants and bars and strolling to Elizabeth Bay, The Maisonette tests visitors. Reception staff are abrupt, a little cold and certainly offered minimal help. The addition of a damages deposit came out of left field is disrespectful. Then there are the stairs to our third floor room.....difficult with suitcases. The Magnolia room is tiny with no wardrobe and only enough room for one person to walk around the foot of the bed. We have now stayed at four different Sydney Lodges and this one disappoints.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is really clean and family ambient. Perfect location to visit the full city. Many restaurants and pubs in the area. Reception was close when we reached and none answered the phone to help with the key, but finally we managed to gain it.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is in a great spot, within walking distance to circular quay. Close to cafes, restaurants, and a supermarket. Rooms are small but clean, staff were friendly. It's not a luxury hotel but it's great value, especially considering the location
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff, good communication after booking, neat clean room, easy to find location - all added up to an enjoyable stay. Close to bus, easy walk to train, close to restaurants and shops - a good location. I did see some guests struggle with heavy suitcases on the stairs but it is clearly stated there is no lift.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Potts Point was a good neighbourhood for us and the maisonette was in the middle of everything. The rooms are well appointed even if a little cramped. I loved the European feel. There is off site parking available, great internet, no lobby or common areas - if that is important to you (wasn’t to us)
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a well-placed spot. Right across from an amazing café and within pleasant walking distance of the city. The room (Magnolia room) was clean and of an appropriate size for the area and price. I would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good stay and perfect location for visit the city! Wi-if work well..they is what we need for our stay! Special thanks for the baby bed without charge. For breakfast is a few good cafe around the hotel.
hotelName:
27    The Maisonette
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our group of nine stayed here for one night, Two rooms for multiple guests.. Rooms were well set out and bedding was comfortable. Breakfast was supplied and in refrigerator a light Continental breakfast supplied. Front desk staff were easy to talk to and gave advice without hesitation. A short ten minute walk and in shopping area. Directly opposite Anzac Memorial and park. Great for photos or just a visit. Museum underground station is 3 minutes walk away . Purchase Opal Cards for travel. Prices are very cheap. Can get to Cruise terminal very quickly.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a balcony room over looking Hyde Park. Beautiful appartment with excellent beds. Close to restaurants and shops. Enjoyed our stay with breakfast included. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Highly recommend for family wanting to spend time in the city. Has onsite and offsite parking.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location-bus stop outside goes to bondi, underground at the end of the street to the airport. Three 7/11 stores in the block to buy essentials. Basic breakfast included which is great to get you started. Walking to all attractions is easy. Five of us in one room but plenty of space. Underground Car park but need to reserve. Lovely staff-great value
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a 4-star hotel and is understandably not luxurious. It does, however, provide the basic things travelers need. A simple breakfast (consisting of bread, cereal, yoghurt, coffee and juice) is provided for each day, and bathroom supplies are replenished whenever necessary. As mentioned, it’s nothing fancy, but the location is quite good. The area, which is across a big park, is pleasant. It’s also easy to get to restaurants and places of interest from here, and there are convenience stores nearby. During our stay, the persons at the front desk were helpful, giving us tips we needed and even leaving the front desk once to hail a cab for us.One thing that turned us off during our stay here was the housekeeping service. The day after we checked in, we were quite tired so we stayed in during the morning. A little before 1pm, I got a call from a lady who apparently was the person assigned to service our room. She told me that she was done cleaning the other rooms on our floor, and that our room was the last room that needed to be serviced. I asked her if she could come in 10 or 20 minutes as we would already be out by that time. She told me in a very rude, demanding tone that she needed to clean our room already and that if we didn’t allow her to clean it then, she would leave and would no longer come back. I asked if it would be okay if they work in the room while we were there and she said that that would be fine. She came in with a younger lady who she appeared to be training. The older lady entered our room without saying a word to any of us, and proceeded to give orders in a very brash manner to the trainee about how to fix the beds. She then went to the sink to wash the few dishes that were in it. She did this with a lot of noise, as though she was slamming the plates and utensils. When she was done, she went to the landline to call someone who presumably was another member of the housekeeping staff. She spoke to the other person in a very loud and irritated tone, not at all mindful that there were guests in the room. After that, she went back to the trainee to tell her what to do in the bathroom. She was obviously quite annoyed with the younger lady and even verbally insulted her (saying things like “You don’t use your brain!”) in our presence. When they were done, she just exited the room while murmuring something and without saying anything to any of us. It was the younger lady who greeted me when they entered, and it was she who also said a meek but very polite goodbye as they were leaving.I realize that this isn’t a 5-star hotel, and we adjusted our expectations while we were there. However, I don’t think it’s unreasonable to expect basic courtesy from members of the staff of any establishment providing accommodations to paying guests. I understand that the staff needs to stick to a schedule which is precisely why I allowed them to service the room while we were there, and why we all kept quiet and tried to stay out of their way so they could easily finish what needed to be done. However, the way this lady spoke to me was impertinent and offensive. To the trainee, her remarks were disparaging and hurtful. Even if the scope of the daily housekeeping services of this hotel is limited to fixing the beds, changing the towels, and collecting the trash (other chores beyond that, they no longer do), I still think that a respectful attitude toward guests and toward their fellow staff members is something that should be expected of every employee of the hotel.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located right beside the exit at museum, it is just a cross the street, the room is spacious, clean and comfortable, the sofas and small kitchen is a plus point, si i don't have to drink from the sink in the toilet instead from the kitchen sink since in Sydney tap water is drinkable, however the room is dated and not the same as what we were shown during booking, the breakfast is below standard, they just gave a couple of bread, fruit salads, milk, cereals and orange juice, it is not filling and doesn't really live up to the standard of the hotel with such prices
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were on a joint 70th birthday celebration trip and chose this hotel as a treat as its description was impressive. The hotel was comfortable with adequate facilities and facing Hyde Park, but it was expensive for what it offered and certainly not impressive. Breakfast was very basic and the view of the park is its only selling point. More suited to business users.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely big room, immaculately clean. Excellent staff. Quiet and comfortable. Overlooking Hyde park, right in Sydney CBD. Free WiFi. Light breakfast provided. Laundry and parking available. Really great experience. I recommend this hotel to anybody visiting Sydney.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in the Central district of Sydney, right in front of the Hyde park. The train station is 2 min walk, the train itself will take you to the airport in 15 min, the fastest I've ever experienced. It's 15 min walk to the Darling Harbour and a nice 20-30 min walk to the Circular quay with the world famous harbour and the one and only Sydney Opera House. 5 min walk to the Australian museum (right across the park) and 10 min to Botanic gardens. All the walks take you through either broad busy streets with many shops or the park, so they are quite pleasant. Also, 5 min walk to the World Square with its shops and pick-up place for many day-trips (if that's your thing). A bus to the Bondi beach stops right across from the hotel.The hotel is quite old, you can feel it both in the lobby and in the room, but it was ok, more like historic heritage. The room was huge. It was actually meant for 3 people (1 double bed and 1 single bed), but for a single use it was more than enough. It also had a relax corner (sofa, two armchairs, small table) and kitchenette corner (sink, fridge, dishes, microwave, kitchen table with chairs). Even though a hotel is situated on a very busy street, the noise wasn't a problem.This hotel doesn't offer traditional breakfast, but they put in a fridge a light breakfast every day - orange juice, milk, crisps, bread with spread. You can always buy something in the nearest Coles supermarket or pick one of many restaurants and cafes. The bathroom was ok. The staff had some newcomers, who were still learning, but overall no problems. They even had a newspaper delivered each morning. Not that I knew much about Australian news, but still it was nice. Overall nice experience, very good location and amazing, incredible and breathtaking Sydney.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Managed to book a single nights stay here prior to a cruise, we had three adults in our party and the Hyde Park hotel upgraded us to a 3 bed suite. hotel is getting a tad tired and in need of a facelift but for the price, it was OK but quite noisy with what appeared to be from the plumbing in the bathroom which had a loud "whining Noise". It is very centrally located and an easy 2 minute walk to the train station to get to Circular Quay. a tip for people flying into Sydney airport, don't get a taxi as we were ripped of to the tune of $80 to get from the airport into the city, we should have got the train for half the price
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Flew in to Sydney prior to our cruise. Our travel agent suggested this little gem. Lovely room overlooking Hyde Park. Small balcony and I find in hotels this is a plus. Nice to not be captive in a room. We were over looking the Memorial so it was also captivating at night. Convenient to city, train station and other facilities. I called in advance as we traveled in early and needed to store luggage. This was no problem to them but when we arrived our room was already available. Upon check out we stored our luggage prior to our boarding time. They happily called us a cab and assisted with our luggage. Friendly, clean, continental breakfast included which was sufficient. Toast, cereal, juice and fruit. Can’t ask for much more. Definitely on the go to list.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are traveling with family the very spacious 2 bedroom units are ideal. Great location handy to Museum Train Station and Town Hall Train station and waling distance to Darling Harbour, City and Circular Quay. The Museum Station goes direct to the airport - it is just aroudn the corner so you don't even have to cross the road. Two separtate bedrooms plus a large lounge and separate kitchen make it an ideal place to stay. The views from the 12th floor were great overlooking Hyde Park. Staff very helpful and great prompt service. The apartment is actually nicer than it looks in the photos. Definitely, recommend if you would like a spacious apartment int he heart of the city.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First stay at Hyde Park Inn - parking needs to be booked and you are allocated a car spot as you enter the hotel car park .Checkin was simple and straightforward. Need to leave your car key with reception at time of checking in.We had booked a Deluxe Studio room , huge room with a queen and a single bed . So easily accommodate 3 people. Had a little kitchenette with a two burner hop , microwave, basic cooking utensils , crockery and cutlery enough for three people. Of course a toaster and kettle and a continental breakfast supplied. A dining table with two chairs , two armchairs and a ottoman. A DVD player. A balcony and plenty of light overlooking Elizabeth Street to Hyde park and views as far as North Head . We were on level 15 the top of the hotel.Beds were very comfortable. Bathroom had lots of light , clean and well maintained.Double glazed balcony door and kitchenette windows made sleeping easy and the room nice and quiet with balcony door closed.Staff were friendly . Their were some issues with not enough essentials for the continental breakfast , but this was sorted out quickly.Complimentary WI FI for up to 4 devices. The hotel is well located to Pitt street Mall , Oxford St and even Capitol theatre . Great hotel opposite Hyde Park and in Sydney CBD.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed a couple of days on one of the upper floors facing Hyde Park. Traffic noise was not an issue. We had a small balcony. Our room had a kitchenette and breakfast nook. All the staff were friendly and helpful. The location is on one of the streets bordering Hyde Park. A shopping mall is near including a big supermarket and liquor store. Multiple restaurants are a short walk away. We liked this hotel a lot and would stay there again,
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had an overnight stay with a family of 5. I was very impressed with the service. From the time I booked my accommodation n spoke to the staff until the time we checked out, was great service. It was in a great location n walking distance to most restaurants, shopping n sites. The apartment was spacious to my surprise with a beautiful view overlooking Hyde Park. Would definitely recommend this place to visit n stay at. Will be back.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked into a deluxe studio for a 3 day weekend after getting of a cruise. It happened to be Sydneys Mardis Gras, and the hotel was perfectly positioned for not only the train station (Museum) for getting off the ship but also to enjoy the weekends events. Were given apartment 102 which was on the 10th floor and included a balcony big enough to get 2 0r 3 chairs on it and looked right across the park at the War Memorial. Although we were able to see the participants gathering before the parade and some of the floats getting ready to go up Oxford Street we couldn't see the parade from the apartment but it was an easy walk to Oxford street to watch the parade proper.The parade was great but for the fact that most people in the front rows appeared to be standing on boxes and blocked the view of those behind so we went back to the hotel and watched the people from the balcony.The Hotel reception was efficient and polite - the one hic cup we had was that the TV developed a fault but was fixed immediately by the hotels service team.The apartment was well stocked with appliances including an iron and ironing board, dvd player, and the kitchen included a microwave. The hotel which some would consider to be slightly dated has obviously been refitted and was in pretty good condition with modern colours and interiors.The soundproofing in the room was excellent, with the balcony doors open it was a little noisy but noticeable difference when shut, unit included aircon.Would have no hesitation in booking in again especially considering it was in the same price range that I normally pay for a hotel.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Internet is limited to 2G per stay, minimum breakfast contains 1 portion of cereals, 0.3l milk, 110ml Orange juice, 4 slices of toast and a very small bowl of industrial fruitsalad. Rooms are quite worn out and cleaning superficial. We would not recommend it at all.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: - Strategically located: (we practically just walked to most attractions!); - Few steps to a train station; - Room was spacious for our family of five (5);- Breakfast was adequate to start the day; & - Courteous & helpful staff. We greatly enjoyed our stay in HPI! We’ll definitely come back
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed four nights and were very happy. The hotel is in an excellent location, close to shops, restaurants and there are buses and trains at the door to many areas. Free parking was extremely tight but greatly appreciated. The room was spacious with plenty of storage space and it was great to have the tiny balcony looking right onto Hyde Park. The double glazing kept the traffic noise down at night.The two beds were comfortable and, although we only had breakfast once, the kitchenette would have been useful if needed. The supplied breakfast was very basic but "Bahista", a few doors down the street, had great coffee and good food. Our only complaint was in regard to the daily room servicing. The room was initially very clean but was not kept to that standard. Surfaces not wiped, beds just pulled up, wet towels not replaced (it was much too humid for them to dry in 24 hours). In general though we were very happy with our stay. It isn't a luxury hotel but offers all necessary room facilities and is good value.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We originally booked here because we noticed it had free parking, but upon arrival we decided we didn't need the parking facility anymore as there wasn't any point having a car for the later half of the trip. But neverless the reception was great and helped us locate where we needed to drive to get the car back and also helped us to find the closest garage to fill up. So that was most helpful! The location is great close to all the places we need to go, museum metro turned out to be a good one for us as it was close to all the places we needed to go. The accommodation was good too, very spacious and was happy we got a proper bed for our toddler rather than your usual sofa bed as the extra bed. I would also like to point out the bathroom was very well equipped, normally with a lot of hotel bathrooms, there not enough hooks to hang stuff... something so basic, many hotels don't have... but this was really good, even had a place you could hang your washing, if needs be... so was very impressed... The location was also great for asian food, so much choice really, spoilt for choice! In general we were happy with our stay and although as a personal choice i would preferred a hot breakfast, what they provided was good enough.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
