review_body: This hotel was in a great location. Metres away from Hyde Park and the Anzac memorial. Close proximity to bus stops and the train stop. A short walk to the Westfield shopping centre and other shops. Great restaurants in walking distance. Neighbouring pharmacy and 711 convenience stores. The room was comfortable. A basic but convenient breakfast was supplied each day .... with bread for toast, cereals, orange juices and fruit. Room was clean and comfortable. Washing machines available if needed and parking available for those with a car. Staff were friendly and were helpful in organising our transfer to the airport. Would definitely recommend this hotel for its convenience.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hyde park inn was a great place to stay pre cruise trip. Very clean, staff very helpful. Great location across the street from museum station, so very handy getting from airport to there. Easy access to everything.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 8 months pregnant and had to go out the car window after parking the car... Called the front desk and the lady sniggered when i asked if i would have to sleep in the car given i wouldnt be able to get out of the car. Insanely small car spaces. Would not recommend bringing a car to this hotel. Staff showed no compassion or inclination to assist.A holden cruze hatchback is not a big car either.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent quiet accomodation in Sydney's CBD, close to bus / rail. Convenient free parking.The rooms are clean and comfy, the beds are fabulous. The smiling staff are helpful and courteous. Absolutely recommend this place.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the staff at reception are arrogant and very unproffessionalall staff need training or replacement, at present they should not be working in this fieldi would firmly say replace with staff that can at least treat customers with respect
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in a deluxe studio apartment on the 12th floor as part of our Australian trip.Fantastic room with small balcony and kitchenette. There is a free of charge laundry area in the basement. Location very convenient with the Museum metro almost opposite the hotel. Would definitely stay again
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pleasant, helpful staff and a large room with sitting area, and dining table as well as a desk. Tea/coffee provided, as well as good continental breakfast provisions provided daily. We found the location great, opposite Hyde Park and close to Museum station, especially as we attended the Armistice service at the War Memorial. Dinner next door at Mazzaro's was excellent.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is great and it has free carpark facility but check out time is too early. Breakfast was provided in the room however the toaster looked like it hasn't been cleaned in a long while.I would recommend if you need a place to stay which is convenient. The rooms were slighlty dated.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. Good secure off street parking. Kindly we were able to get into our room early and store our bags. We got an upgrade to a bigger room. Room was great. Plenty of room and very comfortable.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location. Our room overlooked Hyde Park and the city. A bit noisy from the busy road but tolerable. Room was clean and was cleaned daily.Front office service needs to be improved. No smiles/greetings to guests.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my family for a week. I found this hotel in a perfect position, close all the shops, restaurants and a short walk from Circular Quay. Rooms were spacious but they could do better with the cleaning. Breakfast is supplied, (Toast, cereal, fruit Salad and juice) this makes ithe mornings more laid back no rushing to try and get to a restaurant. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This accommodation turned out to be the perfect location for the start of the City 2 Surf. Accommodation was clean. My only issue was with it being a back room & there was no natural light in the room. We were told it was a back room, though. All we needed was there & we would definitely stay back there again. It's very central for everything. In fact, it was more central for things than I expected. Thank you.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a 2 bedroom self contained apartment, big enough for us all and friends to join us as well. Very comfortable beds, spacious living. Very close to trains and buses to wherever we wanted. we had functions at Darling Harbour, easy to walk to.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So much better then we expected for the price will definitely be staying here again Rooms were exactly like the pictures and had everything we needed ie iron extra blankets and good lighting. The room didn't have a safe which was the only let down.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No so clean and tidy in the daily clean up jobs. Overall impression of the staff, they are lack of smile or I would say they are not too approachable. Positive things - 1) free car parking space though tiny; 2) simple breakfast.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nicely appointed rooms, cleaning was a little hit and miss, everything in the room that was needed. Parking a bonus, although we had to park off site as very low ceiling in under ground car park. Friendly helpful staff and just accross the road from Museum Station. Nice view of park from the small balcony. Only negative is that the floors under dining chairs are tiles and very noisy when people above drag the chairs. Need fely tips on chairs.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just spent 3 nights at Hyde Park Inn. Close to all attractions if you don’t mind a walk. Very limited parking available therefore we had to park elsewhere and this was organised by the hotel. The room was clean with a small kitchenette and ensuite in the Deluxe Room. Opposite Hyde Park which is gorgeous for a walk. A continental breakfast was supplied in our room rate.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with a few friends for a girls trip. Our room was very clean, spacious, and had a small kitchenette area. The staff at the front desk were helpful and answered all of our questions about what to do and where to go. We had a breakfast provided for us in the room (a few pieces of white toast, a small orange juice per person, and cereal/milk). It was simple but enough that we didn't have to go out for breakfast. Tip - there's a coffee shop right next door with great coffee and other breakfast options if you need it. Also, the taxi was about $50 from the airport but we found Uber to be a much cheaper option and readily available.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked an executive suite here becuase the rate was so reasonable (less than A$150 per night) and for that we have a lovely room with a balcony overlooking Hyde Park, a kitchenette with all the necessaries, basic breakfast, free WIFI and free parking!All we needed as a base to 'do' Sydney - its not five star but it is excellent value for money and very pleasant staff.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I stayed here for three days. The location was excellent, central to everything we had planned. There’s a nice little continental breakfast that the hotel leaves for you every day (there is a small kitchenette in your room). The beds were very comfortable. The staff were gracious and helpful. Would absolutely stay here again.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 1 night for a concert in the city. The staff were friendly and helpful right from the time if booking til departure. The room was clean, recently updated and well equipped. We would definitely consider staying here again.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Hyde Park Inn for the night just recently. It doesn’t have a big street front but I liked that. The staff were helpful and courteous. Had a lovely meal from the restaurant next door which I was grateful for after a super long day. It was a room service delivery as there is no dining room. Breakfast is on the house in the form of cereal, milk, bread, OJ, butter & spreads, in your refrigerator. There is also a toaster, jug, cutlery, plates and a microwave. The bed was comfy, the shower welcoming and the paper in the morning a fab treat. The unit was clean. Just a side note for smokers, no balcony. Location was great and and there was 2 convenience stores, restaurants, coffee shops and transport in close proximity.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic stay. Clean and comfortable. Only downfall was couldn't keep a window open for fresh air as people smoking on the balcony above. blah!Great location and friendly accommodating staff. Have stayed twice now.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, apartment room. small breakfast included . central location for other restaurants and walking distance to 80% of City destinations. Staff were pleasant, very clean and well laid out room, instant hot shower(wonderful) plenty vanity space in bathroom, comfortable bed. Very good price.Train station across the road. very convenient for central station,(one stop) we went to blue mountains as well by train.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed three nights in a Deluxe studio room which was big, bright and comfortable. The balcony overlooked Hyde Park and it felt like being in New York. Ample breakfast provisions were provided and also the kitchenette. Proximity to train and bus was great, the hotel is located in the perfect position for visiting Sydney. Free laundry facilities were available and appreciated. Staff friendly and helpful. Would recommend.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We took the train from the airport straight to the museum station and when we exited the station, the hotel was directly opposite the museum station! This was really convenient! We had a triple room - a single and a queen bed. It proved to be really comfortable as the room size was spacious with a couch and a smallish coffee table for breaky. The bed was a bit soft for my liking but otherwise, the room was really clean. The little kitchenette was ideal for making simple tea/coffee and provided breakfast - toast and cereal with orange juice, milk and a fruit cocktail. We opened the windows for the first day when we slept and it was pretty noisy. From the second day, we kept the windows closed at night and turned on the aircon instead. The daily housekeeping was great and the room was cleaned well. I would certainly consider staying here again for its convenient location.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hyde Park Inn in Sydney was recommended to me by friends so my wife and I made a recent reservation to try it for ourselves. We requested a quiet, high room as we are light sleepers, especially when staying in a city. Upon arrival we were assigned a room on the 13th floor (out of a maximum of 15 floors) so we thought that we would not be too affected by any noise. WRONG!!The noise from chairs being dragged over floor tiles from the room above us and the rooms next door, continued late into the night and we hardly got any sleep. Thinking it could be a “one off” and the noisy clients may check out the next day, we did not complain. Unfortunately, the next night was the same. No sleep!! I complained the next morning to the reception staff and suggested to the duty manager that a simple remedy would be to fix self adhesive felt pads to the chair legs. After advising me that there were no available rooms on the top floor for us to move to, he said that he would investigate my complaint and advise his maintenance man to carry out my suggestion of the felt pads. There was no change that night and for the remainder of our 5 night stay. We had to resort to wearing ear plugs throughout the night which only marginally reduced the noise. We returned home today and are both looking forward to a decent night’s sleep at last. Such a waste of money to spend on a holiday when we could not get any rest. We will definitely not be staying at this hotel again until we are guaranteed this noise problem is fixed.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In terms of presentation the Hyde Park Inn is average, however, it has so many positives that you can't go past it. I chose the hotel for it's access to public transport. It is situated near Museum Station, with access around the corner in Liverpool Street, or by elevator on the corner of Liverpool and Elizabeth Street. Opal transport cards can be purchased from the 711 on your way to the train station. The local rail service gave direct access to the city, Circular Quay (Sydney Harbour Bridge, Opera House and ferries) and the airports. It's a 12 minute trip to the domestic and 15 minutes to the International airport. The bus to Bondi Beach leaves outside the station in Liverpool Street. The main shopping area of the city is a 10 minute walk or 1 train station journey. Free parking is provided by the hotel. Our room was spacious and included a small balcony and a lovely park view. Interestingly, they advertise more expensive rooms with a view of the park, however, all rooms have a view of the park. The windows are double glazed and although the website warned of noisy construction work, there was very little noise in the room. Breakfast is provided. I've seen some complaints about the breakfast, however, this is something that is not usually included in an Australian hotel's tariff and we found it more than adequate. Each person was left a small orange juice, fruit compote, small carton of fresh milk, tea and instant coffee, 2 slices of bread, small selection of spreads and a cereal. The room has a kettle, toaster, microwave and hotplate with a small selection of kitchen implements. The room was clean, comfortable and has been modernised in an inexpensive way. There is an excellent selection of cafes, bars and casual eating options and a supermarket at World Square on the corner of Liverpool and Pitt Streets. A daily internet allowance is included.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Selection was based on location and parking. Our stay was excellent value based on criteria and the staff were very friendly and courteous. The sleep was comfortable. The bathroom layout and fixtures need updating as it was just a shower curtain and no skirting, water encroached on the remaining toilet and sink areas. All in all, would stay here again.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I had an early morning appointment in the CBD and picked the Hyde Park Inn as it was within a short walk of Martin Place and very affordable. I was a little concerned as I had spent a weekend there almost 30 years ago when in Sydney on business and I found it to be just average. Time has been good to the HPI. The rooms were small but very neat, clean and comfortable. A big bonus was they have free parking underneath the hotel and in Sydney that adds close to $40 in value. Their free breakfast is cereal, juice and bread for toast in the frig. Not bad if you are in a hurry and don't have time to chase down breakfast. The hotel is a short walk to Chinatown and the CBD. All in all a great value in the heart of the city.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Apart from the convenient location, the hotel was very disappointing. No lobby to speak of, indifferent staff, the smallest, windowless (and consequently stuffy and airless) bedroom, although well appointed. The "included in the price" (AUD220) breakfast consisted of slices of white bread, orange juice mini cartons, and coffee and tea sachets usually complementary in most hotels worldwide, and in our case, no space to consume it. Ignore the lure of the included breakfast mention when comparing with other hotel prices, especially if you are staying several nights.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved HP Inn. It's perfectly placed in the center of Sydney. You've got Chinatown to the right, and business district to the left. A short walk down to Oxford gets you to Surry Hills area. And the metro stations are all over. We walked from hotel to just about everywhere, including University of Sydney one day, to the Royal Botanical gardens the next. We used the Circular Quay as our primary metro stop to exit to ferry and visit places like Taronga Zoo and Manly beach. The hotel itself is very nicely located between a couple of big chain hotels. The lobby is small, but the rooms are big. We had a family suite and it was very affordable. The beds all slept comfortably. The light breakfast provided held us over until lunch everyday. And, the bathoom was good size too. We also had a balcony overlooking the Hyde park and that was a extra added touch. I will say there was dust on the TV stand and top of the headboards on the bed. You had to continually reconnect to wi-fi as there was a throttle built in, that had to be reset after hitting a certain amount of download data. But, I could have cared less about these two things given all of the other positives. The service was overall excellent, and that's very refreshing for a family coming to Sydney the first time. The front desk was knowledgeable and made check in/out very quick too. Thanks so much for making our trip awesome.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First, kudos to the hotel for letting us store our heavy luggage here for two days prior to our booked stay. We disembarked from our cruise ship and took an uber straight here and asked if we could leave our bags two days early because we wanted to travel light to the Blue Mountains. They didn't bat an eye and took our bags and even had the bags in our room when we did check in two days later. Great customer service for this alone!we had a nice hotel room with small kitchenette and a view of Hyde Park. Free wi-fi. Continental breakfast was provided the night before in our refrigerator, but it wasn't enough so I had breakfast at nearby cafes. This has an outstanding Hyde Park location and it was convenient for visiting museums and the Museum Train Station is across the street. The 380 bus to Bondi was nearby also. We recommend this hotel and would stay here again.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family (2 adults and a teenager) stayed here for 3 nights over Mardi Gras weekend and we had room 405. We couldn’t be happier with our stay. Reception staff were very friendly on arrival and departure. They happily stored our luggage til our room was ready (we arrived early in the day to make the most of our trip so didn’t expect the room to be ready at this time). The room was spacious and clean, the beds comfortable and it was very quiet. After a huge night for Mardi Gras we all slept til 10am it was so quiet. The breakfast was replenished daily as needed and was what we expected having read the reviews. The room was serviced daily and the housekeeping staff always did a great job. The kitchenette was basic but had enough to get by. Museum station was directly across the road and it was an easy walk to Darling Harbour, Oxford Street, City Centre, Chinatown, basically every where. We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel well situated and not far to the Harbour area. Room was clean and spacious, the only disappointment was the continental breakfast. Think I would have preferred room only, breakfast was in the fridge bread wrapped in clingfilm, small pots of fruit salad, jam, butter and choice of cereal, not the most appetising of breakfasts. But the room probably made up for this.
hotelName:
28    Hyde Park Inn
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a 4-night stay in a one-bedroom Hideaway Suite. The apartment was clean, spacious, modern and well-appointed. The kitchen is good for self-catering (e.g full size fridge/freezer) and there was a 4-seat dining table and comfortable lounge chairs. The bed was very comfortable and there were large flat panel TVs in the lounge and bedroom. The windows could be opened for natural ventilation (which we like), and there was also full air-conditioning. A washing machine and clothes dryer were provided. We found the location of the hotel excellent – supermarket, shops and restaurants are all close by, and it is walking distance to Central Station and to Darling Harbour, yet the hotel is in a quiet street. There are plenty of public transport options within a short walk and we found the hotel a great base from which to explore Sydney. The only minor negative we encountered was a noisy bathroom extractor fan. We would definitely choose to stay at this hotel again – it is quality accommodation in an excellent location.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the hotel during the weekend and it was a wonderful experience. All the staff were very helpfull, the room was huge and comfortable, full equipped with kitchen stuff, the location is also excellent, just 5 minutes walking from the Broadway Shopping Centre and close to Central Station. The accommodation's value is worth it and reasonable, considering that Sydney is a very expensive city. I'll totally recomend the hotel!
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 100m from the hotel you can get a 10min bus straight into down town were you can easily get around by foot with lots to see and do.The best place to eat by far was on the same street as the hotel an very nice Lebanese restaurant only 20 m away, great home made food and friendly staff, unfortunately they only open from 7am - 4pm so dinner was usually down town, avoid the main tourist restaurants traps on circular quay, family felt sick for a hole day after spending a small fortune at an Italian restaurant. Would recommend if you have little kids to stop at the Tumbalong park near darling harbour, it’s free and the kids had great fun.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was looking for somewhere reasonably priced but still comfortable and of a good standard. A relatively hard task in Sydney! Veriu was perfect - young, funky and of a high standard, I would stay again in a heartbeat.The Studio was large for Sydney and everything was new and felt fresh. It was a short walk to Chippendale restaurants and the staff were great. Would definitely recommend it.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms here are modern, practical and have everything you need. Plush pillows, super hot showers, dishwashers, coffee machines, tv that is easy to work out (!), and super friendly staff downstairs. There’s a huge shopping centre just around the corner and easy walking distance to public transport. I also loved the quirky advice and explanations on all their signs.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would recommend this to anyone wanting to stay in a peaceful area with a short walk into the CBD. The hotel offered home comforts with excellent hotel standard of service. A very clean and modern place.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 3 nights. The first night while flicking through the channels the TV completely locked up and wouldn’t turn off! Someone came to look at it, when they couldn’t fix it either we were given the keys to another room on the same floor, but told to leave our luggage where it was and we could move back the next day. I’m not sure why we couldn’t just stay in the second room, but anyway, both rooms were excellent. There was a shopping centre around the corner, so with all the upheaval we bought something to cook ourselves, and our room had all the facilities not only to cook but also a washer and dryer, which is always welcome during a long holiday.The hotel wasn’t far from Central Station, and Darling Harbour was quite close, too. We asked at reception about the Hop on Hop off bus, but the very helpful receptionist said don’t bother, use the Opal train ticket, there is a cap of $2.70 on a Sunday. This great bit of advice saved us lots of money and we managed to see a lot for a bargain price. Thanks for the tip! I think the cap is only around $15 on a weekday though, so even a day in the Blue Mountains by train was a bargain. I’d definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location and the rooms were well designed and decorated. Didn't feel like a hotel!Modern design and service eg using Deliveroo as room service and Netflix on the TV. The tea BTW was amazing!!!!!
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was beyond our expectationsThe room, the location, the staff...Very clean, comfortable, private, Sufficient facilities (kitchen, laundry, drier...) make you feel like homeWill definitely come back
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would have rated excellent if not for the housekeeping. There was a cigarette bud left on the balcony when I checked in. I dropped a tong and a menu on the floor, which were left that way without cleaning for the entire six nights’ stay. I asked for the floor cleaning on the second day, but no change. I left a $5 tip the third day to see if anything would change, but nothing. Hair was left in the shower booth as it is. A used cup with orange juice leftover was left the way it is. It got to a level where I started to get worried about the overall hygiene during my stay. Other than that, I liked everything else about the hotel, good location, quite, nice interior, washer/dryer, etc. I would though likely not come back unless assured about the change in housekeeping service.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of Veiru Broadway is excellent. Hotel was clean, modern, and unique. Lobby offers great drinks and a nice vibe to relax and recharge. I quite enjoyed my stay. I wish the staff couple have been a little more friendlier.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Strategic location near Broadway Mall, Central Station & Central Park. Love the industrial chic design throughout the hotel lobby & rooms. Spacious and clean rooms, great king size bed. Customer service was poor. Upon arrival I was dragging in 3 luggages alone while visibly pregnant. Receptionists were not busy, but no one bothered to assist. Also there is no staff at all before 7 AM, so our departure was a bit of a pain. Overall it felt like a service apartment rather than a boutique hotel.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Veriu for 5 nights. All staff was well-trained and made us fell like home. Incredible welcome drinks. This property is in one of the nicest neighbourhood that made us fell safe. Room was perfectly arranged. All furniture and kitchen utensils were well-equipped.Thank you all for the great memory, Will go back soon
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This apartment was in a convenient location near the shopping centre and was near to a bus stop and a short walk from Central station and it's transport links. The apartment was modern and spacious but the bathroom did suffer from not draining properly after showers.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Veriu Broadway for a week with our twin one-year-olds. It was really excellent. Great location with good access to public transport and walking distance to the CBD. We had a one bedroom apartment with full kitchen and laundry facilities. It was chic, functional, quiet and very spacious. It was also priced really well.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recommended as the style and fragrance are my favourite. Convenient for who want to cook at home. Overall it is a stylish hotel but still needs some improvements in details. Maybe I will come back with my friends next time soon :)
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are extremely lovely at Veriu and were so welcoming. I had mentioned that it was my partner's birthday so they left us a a bottle of wine in the room along with a personalised card. We also got upgraded to the loft apartment which I could not recommend more! The apartments are all modern and beautiful and have everything you need for a comfortable stay - laundry with washer and dryer, full kitchen and even a nescafe coffee pod machine! The tv's have netflix on them which is even better! The loft was one of the cutest rooms I've ever stayed in at a hotel. The location is also excellent. I highly recommend Veriu!
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, great room options and facilities for a longer stay. Good location. Lovely room - Double bedroom, bathroom with walk-in shower, kitchen with washing machine and tumble dryer and lounge with sofa bed for our 9 year old.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location boutique hotel with new age designed. Every room is different and uniquely designed. Reception staff service is excellent. The hotel is few minutes walk to broadway shopping centre but situated at a quiet lane.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Veriu for three nights and we enjoyed our stay there. It was clean, spacious and was well equipped. Our room had everything we needed: full equipped kitchen with a coffee machine as well.It was located close to the shopping mall Broadway Sydney, very convenient. The hotel staff was also very helpful and friendly.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice room, friendly staff, very helpful on check in and check out. Nice little bar although coffee service can be a bit slow at times in the morning. Walking distance to the ICC so good location for conferences.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was ok. It’s more a service apartment type of accommodation though as they don’t offer any other services than the rooms and a small coffee shop. They however claim to be a 4* property but I am not sure what they base this on. Our main problem was the weekend we stayed, we came back late and our key card did not work to let us back into the building. There are no staff members overnight working there at all! Which 4* hotel does not have somebody working overnight? What happens if there’s a fire in the place. Surely, that’s not safe. We called the number provided but nobody picked up. It was 1am and we were tired and just back from a wedding. After 25 minutes, miraculously, an other couple were going into the hotel and luckily our key worked inside and we could go to our room. I am shocked that a 4* hotel can get away with that. I wouldn’t stay there ever again. Nor would I recommend the Veriu brand.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I attended a conference at ICC and found it to be a pleasant walk to Darling Harbour. The building has an industrial feel with very modern bathroom and kitchen. Beds were comfortable and the street was quiet. The staff were very friendly. We enjoyed our complementary coffees. Broadway Shopping Centre is very close and buses on Broadway are 4 minutes walk away. We will return!
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very pleasant stay with good wi-fi and excellent space in room,very good shower and bathroom facilities-good tc and wardrobe space-very tastefully decorated-nice area at reception for coffee and pastries etc and chilled water on tap
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great hotel! We loved our spacious room with kitchen, balcony and fold-out couch. Lovely lobby and lounge downstairs, with a free welcome drink when you arrive. Located on a quiet street but within walking distance of many restaurants, etc.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Warm welcome with efficient check in. Well appointed loft apartment with everything in excellent working order. Very comfy beds. Quiet location. Excellent shopping centre next door for food, gifts, cinema.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s my 2nd time stay here, we booked loft room this time and it was so spacious.The cleanliness is perfect, the design is lit!We spent a rainy day in the hotel, just chilled at the lobby grabbed our happy hour drinks. It was really cozy.As well the coffee in the morning was as great as last time, the barista boy was nice and cute, all the staffs were friendly and helpful.Will def come back again!
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best hotels so far! (seriously!) Our room was beautifully presented and the balcony was just stunning; the pictures online do the room little justice . (we booked the loft) The customer service level and care of the staff was beyond amazing... We'd arrived an hour early and were greeted by two amazing staff members (Simone and another young lady that I regrettably forget the name of). We took a seat in their trendy reception /cafe/bar for only 5minutes before being given our room early. Both of the girls were friendly, approachable and knew exactly what they were doing which made the process simple and easy. I was celebrating my birthday there that weekend and was surprised by a knock on the door followed by a bottle of wine and even a personal card from the staff.I couldn't of asked for a better place to spend my birthday.Thank you so much to everyone there.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came to have a mini reunion with some friends and had the best time at this hotel! We were welcomed with wine and chocolates on arrival in the room. The rooms are so spacious and clean, with the most comfortable bed!We also found the staff to be really friendly and knowledgable about the area! They were able to give us an extended late check out and the barista coffee is the best!
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I found Veriu on Broadway by chance and I’m really glad that I did! Rooms are huge and well appointed, and every single staff member was friendly and welcoming. It was also very well priced. It’s my new favourite spot for Sydney visits!
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A perfectly lovely place to stay. It was large, clean, comfortable, the roomhad a good layout and every amenity. The kitchen was well-equipped, and the staff very helpful. There’s a supermarket nearby and the central train station isabout a 15-minute walk away.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 2 nights and used the hotel as a base to explore Sydney. Easy access to CBD, Darling Harbour, Rocks, etc. Room and facilities were excellent, loved the free bike hire and staff were amazing, particularly Sanna who recommended a spa for a massage and, when we couldn’t immediately find it, walked us there. Overall, superb, will definitely come back
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay at Veriu Broadway.Up in Sydney for a girls weekend we chose to stay at Veriu as close to powerhouse museum and offered separate bedrooms to living area. Great hotel in a great location, close to shopping and good places to eat.All the staff were very friendly.Would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We liked the room, spacious, clean and well furnished. The kitchen area is good and the hotel provide fresh milk and coffee capsules for the Nespresso machine. Big balcony was nice, the AC worked well. Nice size bathroom and good shower. Bathroom amenities were renewed daily. Washing machine and tumble drier proved surprisingly useful. Good location and easy to get into the city, either walking or by bus or train. The crazy fish market is a 15 min walk away and well worth a visit for lunch! Glad we chose this place.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the space and the modern furnishings and decor. Was perfect for our purposes which was to settle our daughter at college. Excellent location- very easy access to great food, home stores, banks, etc. Staff were excellent and very friendly. Always a great vibe about the coffee place down stairs. Only complaint are the pillows - they were the only blight in what was otherwise a perfect stay.

review_body: My Partner and I have been returning for stays at this hotel over the last several years because it meets our need for a quiet and sophisticated retreat within the business and noise of Sydney, yet accessible to great amenities minutes from the front door

review_body: Excellent location, all staff were outstanding; responsive and friendly. Spacious well equipped rooms with comfortable beds. Our family thoroughly enjoyed our stay and I would highly recommend the Veriu.

review_body: A lovely hotel very close to shops and restaurants. The staff were friendly, helpful and accommodating. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The tea making facilities was a plus including milk in the refrigerator. I would definitely recommend.

review_body: Location is good, nice coffee shop around corner, staff friendly. Unfortunately saw cockroaches everyday in my room, second time a half dead(but still alive) one lying on shower floor! I have to grab it with a tissue to flush it down the toilet and use hot water to wash the floor before I take shower! Disgusted and not acceptable for a boutique hotel!

review_body: Awesome room - industrial style with heaps of space, comfortable bed, clean and well serviced. Great amenities for light meals, washing clothes, wifi. Only downside is the offsite parking, but it isn't too far away with heaps of parking on hand.

review_body: A really unique hotel, original and charming. We stayed as a family of 5 and found plenty of space. The staff was charming and helpful. A good walk from the subway station but reasonable. Convenient shopping center with restaurants nearby.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My mother and I really enjoyed our stay at Veriu Broadway from 26 Jan 2019 to 02 Feb 2019.The location was really convenient, about 15 minutes walk to the Central train station. If we didn't feel like walking so much, there were also plenty of connecting buses from Broadway (4 mins walk from the hotel) to the Central train station.The staff were generally friendly and helpful. A special mention for Phoenix, who welcomed us so warmly on our first day and made the check-in process so easy. He patiently answered all our questions and gave us very clear directions to the Central train station.The room had excellent amenities and was very comfortable. It came with a gas hob, dishwasher, good-sized fridge and freezer, washing machine and dryer.We looked forward to going back for a good night's rest after exploring Sydney each day. Highly recommended.

review_body: Loved this hotel - everything works - easy to get around the City - the hotel has fine bikes for free nice bar and super Coffee - small kitchen in the room - nice balkony - washing mashine and dryer in the room

review_body: Great room, excellent bed, sunny balcony, and chilled vibe. Friendly and professional staff. Central location with good transport connections and vibrant feel to the neighbourhood. A great alternative to a stuffy hotel.

review_body: Veriu Broadway is a cool boutique accommodation.The design and interiors are modern and simple.The balcony area in our room was awesome.Great location- near Broadway Shopping Centre, Kensington Street, UTS, Central Station.Will stay again.

review_body: Staff couldn't have been more helpful when we stayed with our 8 month old son, providing a cot and high chair in our room. The rooms were excellent, far exceeding our expectations. Just what we were looking for with a baby.

review_body: We stayed in the Contemporary Loft Suite which was spacious and comfortable for 3 adults. Nice bar/cafe area downstairs and easy walk to University of Sydney, UTS, Glebe or city. Parking available at Broadway, 5 minutes walk to hotel.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we arrived the sofa has been made into a bed, so 5 persons could stay in the apprtment, but that is too much for the small bathroom, kitchen with only twe chairs! But we were ontly with the two of us, so we transformed the bed into a sofa again and used only the bed upstairs. Nice terras! The appartment was on the 5th floor, right under the beautifull steel roof. No problem with the temperature, because of two airco split units. The personell is very friendly and the hotal has, instead of a anonymous lounche, a cosy bar for coffee, breakfast or other drinks.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the warm welcome in the early AM to our fabulous room, Veriu was the BEST!!! ALL staff made us feel so welcomed and like their new best friends. They had excellent sightseeing recommendations, transportation tips, restuarant ideas, and were very responsive to a few room amenity requests. We really enjoyed the quality coffee bar, on site nibbles, and GREAT happy hour. Our room was very spacious, contemporary in decor, and the location was excellent for us. Central Station was close enough to walk to and we walked all over Sydney from Veriu. (Sydney Harbor, Darling Harbor, The Rocks, Opera House, Botanical Gardens, King Street and more!!) Rory, Sanna, Simone, and Chloe were all so professional and helpful. Loved "their glad you're here-can do" attitudes!!
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Close to $2k for 4 nights was way too expensive for what we received. It showed very little value for hard earned money. This place is a hybrid between a bed and breakfast and an Airbnb but not getting either right. Service is limited and poor. Coffee was disgusting there. Manning was skeleton. Not sure if it was because of the festive season or because they just don’t really care about service. In a nutshell, don’t bother.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was looking for an apartment for my young family and I to stay for 3 nights close to the Powerhouse museum as my 6yr old is a huge Star Wars fan and we were going to the exhibition at the museum.Veriu was perfectly located only a 10min walk to the museum and also a couple of mins walk to Broadway Shopping Centre which came in handy when stocking up on groceries to prepare some meals in the apartment.Plus a lot of great cafes and Spice Alley within 5-10min walk so there are a lot of options nearby.We booked a 1 bedroom hideaway suite which was spacious with a comfy king bed, sofa bed and full kitchen.Also you get a free coffee coupon included with your stay to use in the lobby. Hubby who loves his coffee thought the coffees they served up were decent.Would definitely stay here again! Great value for money considering how big the apartment was and the location.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can’t say enough about this place. I’ve been raving to all my friends back home about how great this hotel is. We had an absolutely massive apartment over New Years. It’s an industrial style place and looks just as beautiful as the pictures online. The receptionists were all so helpful, they had maps of all the places you could go for the fireworks, they really helped us out. We enjoyed their happy hour before we went out each night and we also got a complimentary wine when we arrived. Would absolutely recommend and have been!!!
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely magnificent property and rooms situated in a beautiful, quiet location. 10 minute, easy walk from station. Close to great eateries like Merchants of Ultimo at Broadway Shopping Centre. Also short walk from the excellent Spice Alley -an outdoor collection of asian eateries. The staff at Veriu go above and beyond to make the stay a great and memorable one. Special thanks to Sana for always taking an interest in our plans and the kids and offering lots of suggestions and location maps to help get us around.We loved all the apartment amenities like the dishwasher and washing machine. Our lovely apartment had a big, long balcony and great view of Sydney including the Westfield Tower.Thank you for the best, most enjoyable stay possible.
hotelName:
29    Veriu Broadway
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at Variu Broadway went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed our time in Sydney. Helping with bikes and route maps, recommending an affordable spot to view the fireworks, providing a tea kettle and umbrellas and many other gracious helps. The room was spacious and ideal for our needs. The property is well located for using Sydney’s transit.
